locations.title: Prince Alfred Park Public Pool
locations.address: ÓÉà105 Chalmers St, Surry Hills NSW 2010

showerReviews.reviewText:
The day I went for a dip l, there was a some kind of celebration. Free entry with free gelato til 2pm. The open air swimming pool is massive (for a very affordable community pool). The lanes and space are enough to accommodate passionate swimmers of all sizes and speeds.

Folks relaxing under the cover, kids enjoying themselves in the shallow safe play area, skilled speedy swimmers in the fast lanes, and a couple classes with caring instructors. A community pool full of activities and life!

Come join the pool of swimmers and love of life üòÑ
showerReviews.author: Justin Everywhere

showerReviews.reviewText: We swam several times a week at this 50m clean, well shaded public pool! Great bathrooms, showers, clean change rooms, and large grassed surroundings with loungers and chairs under bright yellow sun unbrellas right next to Central train station! Friendly staff!

showerReviews.reviewText: Friendly staff and an awesome location right next to Central and just outside the CBD with free lockers and hot showers. There‚Äôs plenty of umbrellas for shade and an expansive grassy area to relax poolside. It‚Äôs an easy walk from Central or Redfern Station. 50m pool split across 9 lanes with the standard slow, medium and fast lane options. There is also squad training on offer as well as learn to swim classes. The pool can be split with a divider to be 25m, and lanes can be booked in the 25 or 50m lengths for events and parties. As at 2021, it‚Äôs $6.90 for an adult entry, which is good value considering the location.
showerReviews.author: Aaron Bicknell

showerReviews.reviewText: I loved visiting Andrew (Boy) Charlton Pool and would highly recommend swimming here. The pool has recently undergone a significant and substantial renovation. It is very modern, clean and well resourced. There are a range of different seating and sunbaking areas and facilities. The swimming options in the pool are very well organised and cater for the abilities of all using it. Signage is clear. The pool is very well patrolled by numerous life guards. The view from the pool is spectacular too.
showerReviews.author: Map Roy

showerReviews.reviewText: Excellent long course pool. The view is great and the facilities are clean. It‚Äôs a salt water pool, which is refreshing, but can be an adjustment if you‚Äôre not used to it. This pool is also popular, so be prepared to share a lane. If you‚Äôre an American, get ready to enjoy clockwise circle swimming. There is also a shallow splash pool for small kids. They also sell swimwear, googles, and some other equipment, so don‚Äôt fret if you don‚Äôt remember something.

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the best public pool locations in Sydney and the facilities are üíØ
The outdoor 50m pool has lanes to suit every level of swimmer - slow to fast. It‚Äôs a saltwater pool so no chlorine smell which is nice, water depth from 1.2m-2m. There 20m leisure pool has shading and is perfect for chilling in the 1m depth.
The bleachers offer a great view of the pools and also Garden Island and the harbour.
The onsite cafe is a good place to chill after some laps. Change rooms are great - plenty of bench space and showers. Casual entry is $7.40
Street parking along Mea Macquarie‚Äôs Road is $9 per hour. Busses also run alone the road and the Domain car park is a short walk away

showerReviews.reviewText:
The beginner swim classes are a bit hit or miss. Amy is a patient and helpful teacher who explains things clearly and makes learning much easier, and she really helped reduce my fear as a beginner.

Another instructor (whom I won‚Äôt name here) was more confusing and gave less individual attention, so the experience really depends on which teacher you get.

I also noticed a cockroach near the pool, and the change room did not seem clean, which raised concerns about hygiene.
showerReviews.author: Miss Tofu

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cook + Phillip Park Pool is a standout aquatic destination located in the heart of Sydney, offering a unique blend of relaxation, recreation, and fitness for both locals and visitors. This vibrant urban oasis is renowned for its stunning architecture and well-maintained facilities, making it the perfect spot for individuals and families seeking a refreshing escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Indoor and Outdoor Pools:
The facility boasts a large indoor 25-meter lap pool, ideal for swimming enthusiasts, as well as a delightful outdoor leisure pool, complete with a spacious sunbathing area. This combination allows visitors to enjoy swimming year-round, regardless of the weather.

Family-Friendly Amenities:
With a shallow kids' pool and fun water features, Cook + Phillip Park Pool is a fantastic place for families. Parents can relax while children splash about in a safe and enjoyable environment.

Fitness Facilities:
The center includes a well-equipped gym and fitness classes, offering a comprehensive approach to health and wellness. Whether you're looking to maintain your fitness routine or start a new one, there are plenty of options available.

Convenient Location:
Situated within the picturesque Cook + Phillip Park, the pool provides an urban retreat surrounded by lush greenery and vibrant gardens, making it an ideal spot for a day out in the city.

Accessibility:
The facility is designed to be inclusive and accessible to all visitors, ensuring everyone can enjoy the benefits of swimming and leisure activities.

Exciting Information:
Regularly scheduled swimming lessons, aqua aerobics classes, and community events make Cook + Phillip Park Pool a lively hub for activity. Be sure to check the calendar for special events, family swim days, and themed activities that provide additional fun throughout the year!

Professional Description:
Experience the ultimate urban retreat at Cook + Phillip Park Pool, located in the heart of Sydney! This unique destination features both indoor and outdoor swimming pools, catering to everyone from lap swimmers to families looking to enjoy a sunny day by the water. With state-of-the-art fitness facilities and a variety of fitness classes, Cook + Phillip Park Pool provides a holistic approach to wellness for all ages. Set amidst the scenic Cook + Phillip Park, you‚Äôll find a beautiful setting that invites relaxation and leisure. Join us for swimming lessons, family-friendly events, and community activities that create a vibrant atmosphere for all visitors. Dive into fun and fitness today at Cook + Phillip Park Pool‚Äîyour oasis in the city awaits!

Whether you're a local or just visiting, Cook + Phillip Park Pool is the perfect destination to soak up some sun, stay active, and create lasting memories with family and friends!
showerReviews.author: shamsan alammari

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic 50m pool in the middle of the city. Nice and clean and not too busy. Lanes are nicely separated into slow, medium and fast. Locker rooms are clean. Rental lockers are available, A$2 for a small one, A$3 for a big one. Tokens can be bought at the front desk. One time entry price was A$8.
showerReviews.author: Jonathan Lo

showerReviews.reviewText: Good place to visit when the sea conditions are not the best for the outdoor swim. Casual entry fee is $8.80 . We used 50 metre pool, water was cool, refreshing but good for laps swimming. It was Sunday lunch time so not many people around which was perfect for us. There is also hydrotherapy, kids pool with slide, rapid river and wave pool but we haven‚Äôt tried on this occasion. Change rooms were ok, reasonably clean considering that it is a public facility and cleanness depends lot of times on the visitors. There are lockers but they operate on coins. That is something that can be upgraded as I don‚Äôt think that many people carry around coins these days. I certainly don‚Äôt. We had our belongings with us on the poolside seats as most of the people. At the reception they have some basics like goggles, swim caps etc just in case you forgot at home
showerReviews.author: nat ber

Be forewarned: The water in the big pool is quite cold! Took me a while to get used to. It is more of a public gym (with a soccer field, weights and group classes) than of a swimming pool so I found a AU$ 8.5 not worth the facilities.

The upside is that they have a lot of lanes so you don‚Äôt need to share a lane with too many ppl.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We visited on a rainy Monday afternoon.
The location next to Hyde park is great and in walking distance to our hotel.
Apparently it opened 25 years ago and today it's clear that there are maintenance item on the list.
It was a rainy day and there's loads of water dripping from the roof and the entire place was rather cold.
With my 6yo we didn't come for swimming laps but more for the leisure pool area. The wave pool isn't working, and neither was the rapid river run.
Hanging out near the kids slide I started questioning the cleanliness - there's loads scale buildup everywhere alomg the edges and dripping water jets. Also the glass balustrades were given the last clean weeks ago. The highlight certainly was the cockroach my daughter found dead in the water which I helped to dispose.

With kids it's okay to get wet for a couple hours if the wave and river pool were working... looks like we still paid full price.
showerReviews.author: Bernhard Pr√ºller

showerReviews.reviewText: I enrolled at the center for its adult beginner swimming lessons but disappointed with the way my instructor teach as i feel she does not know how to teach adults. The basics was not taught properly as expected. She just lets us swim for 30mins without teaching us the proper kicking, arm movements for freestyle and breathing techniques. The only good point was its location but i feel like its a waste of money if you are considering adult beginner swimminh class here.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I usually go swimming at Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre in Ultimo. Unfortunately, I wasn‚Äôt notified in any way that the 50-meter pool would be closed for two weeks. When I showed up as usual, I was simply told I could either suspend my membership (which requires two weeks‚Äô notice ‚Äî something impossible without prior warning) or use the nearest alternative pool, which is this one.

I ended up coming here twice during the week, but unfortunately, the experience hasn‚Äôt been great:
‚Ä¢	The showers are very dark
‚Ä¢	There‚Äôs often no hot water
‚Ä¢	The soap dispensers are either empty or missing

I hope there will be more attention to maintenance and, above all, better communication with members ‚Äî out of respect for those who pay their membership regularly.
showerReviews.author: Ilenia

locations.title: Sydney Olympic Park Aquatic Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà9 Olympic Blvd, Sydney Olympic Park NSW 2127

showerReviews.reviewText:
Impressive and majestic Olympic structure! I was really impressed! It has an interesting offer and a middle ground between relaxation and sport.
Perhaps the 50m pool used for free swimming is a little too heated for serious swimming, but still acceptable given the context, perhaps during the week it is less heated.
The spa and sonar section is beautiful.
The Australian style changing rooms with only two closed showers leaves a little to be desired, but in the end for a minority of Italian tastes it can be fine (in Italy you first take off your shoes and then enter the changing room and pool).

Have fun!
showerReviews.author: Tiberio B

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice outdoor pool with friendly localz. Yesterday was code brown that meant pool down, in all my time that was the first time that happened, except no tangible refund. I took swimming up slowly but here it is easy to spend a day. Small gym with bare essentials. More a place for cardio enthusiasts than anything else. Memberships available and affordable.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm writing this review with a heavy heart. Victoria Park Pool has long been one of my favourite public pools in Sydney, which is saying something given the many great options.

However...recent changes to the pools heating system have been a disaster and left many regular pool users (including myself) in dismay.

The main 50m pool is now regularly over 28-29 degrees Celsius, which is very uncomfortable for normal recreational use and borderline dangerous for those using it for serious swim / squad training. I personally come out of the pool sweating profusely and red faced after swimming my usual 2-3kms. My heart rate is elevated beyond my normal training range and performance reduced.

My online research of leading swim associations (e.g. USA Swimming) is that public training pools should not exceed 27 degrees, but ideally be closer to 24 - 26 degrees. Higher pool temperatures above these levels can lead to dehydration, overheating and other health risks.

I'm not alone in this feeling, many regular users have shared similar distress with me at how hot the pool is. It‚Äôs now easily the hottest pool in Sydney (IMV).

I've tried to raise this with the Victoria Park centre management staff many times, but there are no signs they are taking this seriously - which is disappointing. None I've spoken to sound interested or appear to see this as a real issue.

In summer, our community needs relief from the heat and a safe place to swim/train. Please listen to our feedback and take some action.
showerReviews.author: Chris Hurst

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre is a fantastic facility that caters to swimmers of all ages. With multiple pools available, it‚Äôs great for lap swimming, casual dips, or joining one of the many activities they run for both seniors and young children. The lap swimming in particular is excellent‚Äîwell-organised and enjoyable.

The staff are friendly and approachable, and the lifeguards are very attentive. I was especially impressed by one guard who kept patrolling the pool area diligently‚Äîit really gave me confidence that safety is taken seriously here.

Facilities like the toilets are generally acceptable and kept reasonably clean. At certain times of the day the pool can get a little crowded, but it‚Äôs never overwhelming, and overall the atmosphere remains welcoming and comfortable.

A well-managed, community-friendly aquatic centre‚Äîhighly recommended whether you‚Äôre training, bringing kids, or just looking to stay active.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Have been a member here for a couple of months, overall it‚Äôs been a pretty good experience. The sauna and steam room are honestly what keep me coming back, they‚Äôre super relaxing, especially after a long swim. I really hope they stay well-maintained because they‚Äôre definitely the best part of this gym.

The 50-meter pool itself feels great to swim in, and the temperature is always comfortable. The water quality isn‚Äôt the cleanest I‚Äôve ever seen, sometimes you can spot a bandaid or a bit of debris floating around, but it‚Äôs still acceptable overall.

However I do want to mention this gigantic cockroach I saw today on the ceiling of the women‚Äôs changing room (quite disturbing). I understand it‚Äôs getting hot now, which makes it easier for them to appear, but I still think a changing room should be clean and feel safe to use. I really hope the staff can do a proper pest control inspection soon, it would make a big difference.

(By the way, recently I saw a mother bring her son, who looked around nine, into the women‚Äôs changing room. He was already old enough and kept staring at other women inside, which was really inappropriate. I think it‚Äôs better to have a family changing room instead and leave the women's changing room to women.)
showerReviews.author: Katherine Kong

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm generally not a fan of indoor, heated pools however, my friend suggested we try Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre (ITAC) for a swim, and I'm glad we did! The venue exceeded my expectations.

The centre was very easy to get to with it being well located in the city. It is very clean and well maintained. There are many lifeguards patrolling each of the pools, ensuring the safety of each of their patrons.

There are three pools within ITAC- the 50m pool, leisure pool, and program pool. We hopped in and out of the 50m pool and leisure pool. We found the leisure pool to be really relaxing!

You can easily spend many hours here. There is a cafe and an outdoor area with tables and chairs where you can bring your own picnic to eat.

Swimming here was a fun and enjoyable experience and one that I would recommend!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Love ‚ù§Ô∏è Bronte Beach Baths Enclosed swimming pool as well as natural swimming area with shallow water suitable for children as well as adults, toilet and shower facilities are also available. The beach and the surrounding area is very nice. The bogey hole sometimes might be a bit rough depending on the the conditions!!! I still remember the great times I had here as a child. Great spot for üë™ families ,today the water was dirty and conditions rough.üèñÔ∏è Review of Bronte Beach & Construction Update
‚ÄãBronte Beach remains one of Sydney's most beautiful and cherished coastal spots, but the atmosphere has been significantly impacted by two major events: the collapse of a section of the northern cliff face and the ongoing redevelopment of the Surf Life Saving Club (SLSC).
‚Äãüåä The North Cliff Collapse: What Happened
‚ÄãThe northern end of Bronte Beach has been the site of a dramatic natural event that now requires major remediation work.
‚ÄãThe Incident: On or around Friday, August 1, 2025, a section of the sandstone cliff on the north side, reportedly about 20 meters long and 6 meters wide, collapsed onto the beach below.
‚ÄãThe Cause: Initial investigations and geological expert opinions strongly suggest the collapse was due to a combination of factors:
‚ÄãHeavy Rainfall: Continuous and heavy rain in the weeks leading up to the incident is thought to have saturated the sandstone, weakening the rock and increasing pressure until it gave way.
‚ÄãNatural Erosion: Sandstone cliffs are naturally prone to fracturing and erosion from wind and wave action over time, which was likely accelerated by the water.
‚ÄãThe Damage: The massive rockfall damaged a stormwater drain (or culvert) and a safety rail located beneath the cliff face. It also took out part of a frequently used staircase for beach access.
‚ÄãSafety Note: Fortunately, no injuries were reported, likely because the heavy rain meant fewer people were in the immediate area at the time. The site is currently an exclusion zone as a geotechnical assessment is reviewed to guide safe remediation works.
‚ÄãüèóÔ∏è Construction & Redevelopment Review
‚ÄãSeparate from the cliff remediation, the historic Bronte Surf Life Saving Club and Community Facilities are undergoing a significant upgrade.
showerReviews.author: John karmas

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bronte Baths is an open-air, ocean pool carved into he sandstone cliff at the southern end of the Bronte Beach. It is a very Australian thing to have a pool built alongside the beach and there are about 100 along the NSW coast. As far as ocean pools go, it‚Äôs this is one of the most scenic. It is slightly elevated so it looks across the ocean and down upon the beach. The towering sandstone cliffs and rock formations are a dramatic backdrop.
Built in the 1880s at a time when it was considered highly risky for men and women to mix, the baths were highly regulated. Swimming was only allow between daylight hours of 10am - 4pm. Goodness knows what might happen in the dark. Gentlemen could bathe 7 days a week but ladies were forbidden on Sundays and public holidays. Today entry is free, but when it was new, entry was fourpence (adults) and tuppence (children).
The baths are perfect for smaller children or for those who are are inexperienced swimmers. It offers a safer swimming space, where you can still swim in ocean water but are protected from tricky rips, shifting currents and rough surf.
Barrier at one end divides the serious swimming section where lanes are marked out for laps, from the area where you can just have a splash around.
The surrounding rock platform is a good area to set up your towels and sit in the sun.
NOTE: Don‚Äôt leave without walking the very short distance up the path past the Baths to the end of the headland. It has absolutely beautiful ocean views and striking sandstone formations.
showerReviews.author: Harsha Anjanappa

showerReviews.reviewText:

It is a very Australian thing to have a pool built alongside the beach and there are about 100 along the NSW coast. As far as ocean pools go, it‚Äôs this is one of the most scenic. It is slightly elevated so it looks across the ocean and down upon the beach. The towering sandstone cliffs and rock formations are a dramatic backdrop.
Built in the 1880s at a time when it was considered highly risky for men and women to mix, the baths were highly regulated. Swimming was only allow between daylight hours of 10am - 4pm. Goodness knows what might happen in the dark. Gentlemen could bathe 7 days a week but ladies were forbidden on Sundays and public holidays. Today entry is free, but when it was new, entry was fourpence (adults) and tuppence (children).
The baths are perfect for smaller children or for those who are are inexperienced swimmers. It offers a safer swimming space, where you can still swim in ocean water but are protected from tricky rips, shifting currents and rough surf.
Barrier at one end divides the serious swimming section where lanes are marked out for laps, from the area where you can just have a splash around.
The surrounding rock platform is a good area to set up your towels and sit in the sun.
NOTE: Don‚Äôt leave without walking the very short distance up the path past the Baths to the end of the headland. It has absolutely beautiful ocean views and striking sandstone formations.
showerReviews.author: Harsha Anjanappa

Almost drowned here today. I visited around 3pm and was swimming in the outdoor pool‚Äôs slow lane. When I reached the middle of the lane, my goggles came off and I started panicking. I was swallowing a lot of water and struggling to stay above surface, kept raising my hands trying to get the lifeguard‚Äôs attention, but no one came to help me until I swam back to the edge by myself and was completely exhausted. The lifeguard finally noticed me at that time and asked if I needed help and pulled me out of the pool - which was nice, but only after I nearly drowned.

This was my first time here. The front desk staff were very friendly and the lifeguard seemed nice enough, but I will never come back.

Please don‚Äôt bother calling me about this review - I won‚Äôt answer

showerReviews.reviewText:
There‚Äôs been a 50 metre pool here at Lane Cove since 1961, but the flash new Lane Cove Aquatic Leisure Centre bears no trace of the original at all.

There have been so many upgrades: the biggest in 1998 and 2014 that added all the indoor pools, water play areas, spa, sauna, steam room and most importantly accessibility; culminating in the 2020 replacement of the Olympic pool with the shiny new one we experienced today for the first time.

All those facilities don‚Äôt come cheap. Adult entry is $9.70, but the quality of all the architecture, design and fitout is definitely superior to most. We particularly liked the row of outdoor sun showers complete with a wooden bench to keep your towel dry.

Fortunately some of the original grassed area and trees have been retained, making it a pleasant place in the middle of an increasingly built-up Lane Cove.

Its Achilles Heel is an all-too familiar one: seven of the lanes were dedicated to lappies, with only one left over for everyone else. We‚Äôre so over this trend. Here of all places it seemed particularly inappropriate, as most of the people attending on a Sunday were families and kids, who would‚Äôve had much more fun with some more room to move and play and, you know, recreate.
showerReviews.author: Jackie McMillan

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you have any additional needs or disability (neurological, sensory, etc) - consider swimming at a different facility. This facility does NOT care about additional needs of adult swimmers and does NOT provide any reasonable adjustments to make them safe.
The water in all the pools is filthy and cold, the facilities like showers and toilets are run down and seem to always have rust and broken parts. Upstairs showers have no water pressure (for years now), the ground level showers frequently have no hot water and the staff don't bother to even put signs up. The outside pool showers have very hot water and time out after about a minute - enough to wash one leg, perhaps?
Disabled bathrooms are usually occupied (for 15-30 mins at a time) by families with kids who think it's a convenient place to wash the whole family... The staff do not monitor this and do not enforce anything.
Staff ignore patrons who flout the lane rules, allowing fast swimmers in the slow and walking lanes, children in any lanes, while they are just playing and not swimming (something they can be doing in the dedicated kids' pool).
I have had a great experience in two other North Shore pools in the last 16 months, with management and staff looking out for me and assisting me while I swim. I had special signs made which alerted other patrons that a person with low vision is swimming and to be aware and careful. Staff put on the signs by the pool as soon as I arrive.
Additionally, and very alarmingly, this facility allows a disabled adult male who performs lewd acts in the water, in full view of other adults and minors, to attend. Anyone wearing goggles or mask underwater can see him stimulating himself. I have reported it to the Police but it was swiftly dismissed and covered up, due to "lack of evidence" as "CCTV doesn't show any crime being committed". Well, waddayaknow, CCTV is not under the water, is it? How a facility can get away with allowing this kind of crime around kids is totally incredible. I have mentioned this to a few local families and they are horrified.
This facility is owned by LC Council but run by an incompetent and indifferent BlueFit. It really needs to be run by someone else. If I could give zero stars, I would.
showerReviews.author: hannah horowitz

locations.title: Watsons Bay Baths

showerReviews.reviewText:
Watsons Bay Baths is a fantastic spot for families with young kids, offering a safe and enjoyable swimming experience. The highlight for parents is the netted swimming zone, which provides peace of mind while children splash around in the calm, shallow waters. The area is clean, well-maintained, and perfect for kids who are just learning to swim or want to play in the water.

The facilities are also excellent, with showers and changing rooms available, making it convenient for families to freshen up after a swim. The baths are located near cafes , with free street parking available and grassy picnic areas, so you can easily grab a bite or relax while enjoying the stunning views of the Sydney Harbour. Overall, Watsons Bay Baths is a must-visit for a fun, family-friendly day out!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great üëç for those who want to swim üèä‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è in a enclosed  swimming pool! The water was clean üëå just beautiful. Watsons Bay Baths, Sydney
‚ÄãThe Watsons Bay Baths are a true Sydney gem, offering a historic and scenic harbour swimming experience that is popular with locals and visitors alike. If you're looking for a refreshing dip with stunning views, this tidal enclosure is an excellent choice.
‚Äã‚ú® Key Highlights
‚ÄãLocation and View: Situated right on Sydney Harbour, the view is spectacular. You can enjoy glimpses of the Harbour Bridge and the city skyline while you swim. The whole area has a beautiful, old-fashioned, friendly feel.
‚ÄãFacilities: The baths are a large, netted harbour enclosure that has been recently renovated.
‚ÄãSwimming Area: The enclosure is sizable, with a swimming area measuring approximately 50m x 45m. There is an outer pool of about 50m x 14m, which is often laned for serious lap swimmers.
‚ÄãPontoons: Two floating pontoons are available for sunbathing, turning during laps, or just pausing to enjoy the water.
‚ÄãAccessibility: A standout feature is the excellent accessibility, including an all-ability water access ramp and two fully immersible wheelchairs (MLAK key access required for wheelchairs and lockers). This makes it a fantastic resource for people with mobility issues.
‚ÄãVibe: It offers a great mix‚Äîyou'll see serious swimmers doing laps alongside people simply relaxing and sunbathing on the pontoons. Being a tidal pool, the water is clean harbour water, and it's securely shark-netted.
‚ÄãSurrounding Amenities: Nearby facilities include:
‚ÄãChange rooms and a freshwater shower.
‚ÄãA Tea Gardens area with a shaded outdoor kiosk (check opening times).
‚ÄãCafes and picnic areas are available nearby in Watsons Bay.
‚Äã‚ö†Ô∏è A Few Things to Note
‚ÄãTidal Variation: Like many harbour baths, the area has significant tidal variations. At high tide, the small beach area may be almost non-existent.
‚ÄãDepth: The swimming area is deep, especially in the laned section (around 3m or so), meaning you can't easily stand for a breather, making it better for confident swimmers.
‚ÄãPopularity: While it might not be as busy as Bondi Beach, it is a well-loved spot and can get busy, especially on weekends and in summer.
‚Äã‚≠ê Verdict
‚ÄãThe Watsons Bay Baths are a must-visit for anyone who loves swimming in Sydney's stunning harbour. The combination of its historical charm, great swimming facilities (including the 50m stretch), and the commitment to all-ability access makes it one of the city's finest public baths.
showerReviews.author: John karmas

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great üëç for those who want to swim üèä‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è in a enclosed  swimming pool! The water was clean üëå just beautiful. Watsons Bay Baths, Sydney
‚ÄãThe Watsons Bay Baths are a true Sydney gem, offering a historic and scenic harbour swimming experience that is popular with locals and visitors alike. If you're looking for a refreshing dip with stunning views, this tidal enclosure is an excellent choice.
‚Äã‚ú® Key Highlights
‚ÄãLocation and View: Situated right on Sydney Harbour, the view is spectacular. You can enjoy glimpses of the Harbour Bridge and the city skyline while you swim. The whole area has a beautiful, old-fashioned, friendly feel.
‚ÄãFacilities: The baths are a large, netted harbour enclosure that has been recently renovated.
‚ÄãSwimming Area: The enclosure is sizable, with a swimming area measuring approximately 50m x 45m. There is an outer pool of about 50m x 14m, which is often laned for serious lap swimmers.
‚ÄãPontoons: Two floating pontoons are available for sunbathing, turning during laps, or just pausing to enjoy the water.
‚ÄãAccessibility: A standout feature is the excellent accessibility, including an all-ability water access ramp and two fully immersible wheelchairs (MLAK key access required for wheelchairs and lockers). This makes it a fantastic resource for people with mobility issues.
‚ÄãVibe: It offers a great mix‚Äîyou'll see serious swimmers doing laps alongside people simply relaxing and sunbathing on the pontoons. Being a tidal pool, the water is clean harbour water, and it's securely shark-netted.
‚ÄãSurrounding Amenities: Nearby facilities include:
‚ÄãChange rooms and a freshwater shower.
‚ÄãA Tea Gardens area with a shaded outdoor kiosk (check opening times).
‚ÄãCafes and picnic areas are available nearby in Watsons Bay.
‚Äã‚ö†Ô∏è A Few Things to Note
‚ÄãTidal Variation: Like many harbour baths, the area has significant tidal variations. At high tide, the small beach area may be almost non-existent.
‚ÄãDepth: The swimming area is deep, especially in the laned section (around 3m or so), meaning you can't easily stand for a breather, making it better for confident swimmers.
‚ÄãPopularity: While it might not be as busy as Bondi Beach, it is a well-loved spot and can get busy, especially on weekends and in summer.
‚Äã‚≠ê Verdict
‚ÄãThe Watsons Bay Baths are a must-visit for anyone who loves swimming in Sydney's stunning harbour. The combination of its historical charm, great swimming facilities (including the 50m stretch), and the commitment to all-ability access makes it one of the city's finest public baths.
showerReviews.author: John karmas

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am only commenting on the swimming facilities.
After months of closure and  who knows how much money spent, I found the upgrade to the pools disappointing.
I only use the pool facility with my grandson of 3.
The pools are almost entirely unavailable for public use. To pay $7 and have a meagre portion of a half lane available for a child to swim in is a rip off.
I was at the pool with my 3 year old grandson. I want to SWIM with him, so the shallow paddling pool is of no use. The shallow swimming pool was 99% occupied by swim school as was 50% of the larger pool. The other 50% taken up by elderly walkers who scowl at young kids being in the lane. I have attached a picture of the quarter lane available for public use by toddler swimmers.
The outdoor area was not upgraded at all. It is still fully exposed to the elements making it mostly unusable
The showers have no way of  regulating the water temperature, which is too hot for kids.
Very disappointing. Compared to Cockburn Ark that charges half the price, it is dismal.

locations.title: Sydney Uni Sport
locations.address: ÓÉàCnr Codrington St and, Darlington Ln, Darlington NSW 2008

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great facilities and fantastic 50m pool with clean, cool water. However, the pool, toilets and showers are not accessible. 5 star facilities with 1 star accessibility. Hence, the rating.

If you are in a wheelchair or have prominent mobility impairments, you won't be able to get to the pool, toilets or showers. No lifts, no ramps.

Very strange, because students with physical disabilities do exist in Sydney Uni and there are plenty of people with disabilities in the local community too. But none of them can swim in Sydney Uni pool. You just can't get in and can't get out, unless someone carries you.

Its 2025, maybe it's time to upgrade? So it's truly all inclusive and not just pretty words in Sydney Uni promotional materials.

P.S. Since I could not reply to the response from the owner... Here it is as an addition to my initial review.

I swim at Sydney Uni pool regularly. There is no wheelchair access whatsoever to the pool. There are stairs to get to the pool and there is a ladder to get out of the pool. There are no wheelchair ramps to access toilets and showers from the pool. Accessing showers is only possible via stairs. No ramps and no lifts whatsoever in the pool itself - photos prove that.

Whoever responded to my comment clearly has no clue about accessibility of their own facilities :) Dear sir or madam, please be informed that climbing stairs in a wheelchair is impossible, just like it's impossible for such a person to get out of the pool independently via ladder. Please educate yourself about your facilities and about the meaning of accessibility.
showerReviews.author: Maria Vlezko

showerReviews.reviewText:
Although this is a university gym, it is also open to the public, so the service and hygiene standards should meet a professional level.

It would be great to offer more promotions, and the membership should be more flexible‚Äîfor example, a minimum of two weeks and the option to pause anytime.

Given the facility is used by many people, it would be helpful to provide disinfectant wipes for hygiene. Unfortunately, the whole environment are not always clean, and the pool has a very strong chlorine smell, which can be overwhelming. It doesn‚Äôt feel very clean either. A better approach would be to clean more frequently, as too much chlorine can lead to health risks like chlorine poisoning.

Compared to other university gyms, such as the one at the University of Sydney, the overall experience here still has room for improvement.

I truly hope these suggestions will be considered to improve the experience for both students and the public.
showerReviews.author: Jessie Wang

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would like to provide some constructive feedback regarding cleaning practices around the pool.

On several occasions, I observed water-jet cleaning of the pool surrounds taking place while the pool was in use. This raised concerns for me about the possibility of runoff from surrounding surfaces entering the pool water, including dirt or other residues.

My understanding is that such cleaning is usually scheduled outside swimming hours or managed in a way that prevents runoff into the pool. I hope this feedback is helpful and can be reviewed to further maintain water quality standards at the facility.
showerReviews.author: Yousef Mohammadi

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been to heaps of Snaps and this is the worst one by far. They clearly rely on the location to secure contracts.

Equipment is kinda old, not a lot of options either. Everything is dirty, there are barely any disinfectants supplied to clean machines when you are done, no signage to encourage people to wipe down machines either. The standards are the lowest I have seen in any Snap.

And the clientele don‚Äôt seem to understand the most basic of gym etiquette - weights left all over the place, mats piled in walkways, people dropping weights without care, nothing put back where it belongs or wiped with a towel when they are done.ü§Æ

I‚Äôll head back to Newtown Snap, thanks

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been to heaps of Snaps and this is the worst one by far. They clearly rely on the location to secure contracts.

Equipment is kinda old, not a lot of options either. Everything is dirty, there are barely any disinfectants supplied to clean machines when you are done, no signage to encourage people to wipe down machines either. The standards are the lowest I have seen in any Snap.

And the clientele don‚Äôt seem to understand the most basic of gym etiquette - weights left all over the place, mats piled in walkways, people dropping weights without care, nothing put back where it belongs or wiped with a towel when they are done.ü§Æ

I‚Äôll head back to Newtown Snap, thanks
showerReviews.author: N Wolf

showerReviews.reviewText:
It is with great displeasure that I write this review.

I have been attending Clarence Street Snap Fitness and the space lacks cleanliness and is sadly filthy. Gym is meant to bring health and positive aspects to our life.

I was a previous member at Snap fitness in Perth, where the situation was very different and have moved to Sydney in the last 2 weeks. The Clarence Street location was the most convenient for me to attend.

I tried to the manager (whom is hardly ever at the reception desk and only found exercising) as to work with improvements for a filthy environment is unacceptable.

The gym has no soaps in most of the toilet sinks, stations where wipes are located is super dirty around‚Ä¶ the other day there was not a single alcohol gel bottle filled to be used. Dust is everywhere especially weight sections. This week the stair climber equipment has a spider web right in front, with a spider hanging there.

The manager asked me to send him an e-mail yesterday, which I did. I wrote and included pictures as to the matter.  I wasn¬¥t comfortable with the fact that I had already spoken and no one else was in copy as to address the issue. The manager replied to my e-mail on the same day, informing those actions would be taken, but on the following day I was surprised with an unexpected incident today towards me.

Today, I was surprised with a rude approach from one member, which and opted not to reply and continued with my music and exercise. I didn¬¥t respond and wished the man ‚Äúall the best‚Äù when we left the gym at the same time. Latter that day the same manager sent me an e-mail filled with lies as if I was the one with inappropriate behavior in the gym, when I was the one who received an unexpected attitude when returning the man¬¥s towel.  The manager wrote that I had inappropriate behavior at the gym, to members and staff members. That I was no longer welcome at the gym. This is a lie and didn¬¥t occurred at all!!

I am surprises and shocked with these two incidents which apparently might be connected‚Ä¶ I felt so unsafe today. I was the only women and was mistreated and later received an email filled with lies. I only wanted to use one of the 3 benches, which 2 were being used and the third was occupied by his towel. I decided to wait and do another exercise. While I was doing a rep of 4x18, the man that left his towel at the beach only came once. Once I was finished, I literally went to him and ask if I could use the equipment. He said yes. Which was great. I had music on my ears and grab his towel to give it back to him. OMG! That guy, freaked out, he was so arrogant, saying he could grab the towel himself and that I was rude to touch his towel. He kept speaking rudely towards me (I felt harassed). That was just awful! I felt so mistreated by the tone of his voice and the way he kept speaking to me. I said I didn‚Äôt hear him and didn‚Äôt know it was rude to give the towel back to him. Afterward I only said: ‚Äúyou‚Äôre a very rude man, and I‚Äôm glad I‚Äôm not listening to you, as I have headphones on‚Äù. It was awful, really. I felt terrible and didn‚Äôt feel safe at all.

I am very surprised with this entire situation and neve had similar experience. I find this experience at this gym unacceptable.

All the best

Julianna
showerReviews.author: Julianna Campos

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is an update following the incident in which my cash was stolen from the digital locker. I was told later that the similar incidents happened to other members recentIy as well. Now I have this serous question towards the FF management, ‚Äúwhat exactly have you done after the report‚Äù?  I would at least post a notice acknowledging members what had happened and avoid the incidents happening again. Cash can be re-earned, but what about a ring, a watch or other valuables. The management‚Äôs negligence makes me so angry. I would give 0 star if I can.

Original post: I have all my cash stolen from my wallet today from the gym locker!
The thief was so kind that he didn‚Äôt took the whole wallet. I am unsure why gym using this keypad lock for the lockers? Your four digits password could be seen and there goes your valuables.  Management should bring back the original locking system that you use your membership card to open and close the locker. This is a serious step back in terms of security.

I won‚Äôt cancel my membership because this gym has a great location. But I suggest you not to carry any valuables if you go there, I won‚Äôt recommend my friends to come to this gym either.

A serious warning from my own experience.
showerReviews.author: Clyde Jin

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been to several franchised gyms across Sydney and agree with many other reviews that SOMA is outstanding. Equipment always appears clean and well maintained, unlike many other gyms I‚Äôve been too that have rusty cables or seat pads peeling. There‚Äôs enough space between machines so it‚Äôs not too crowded. The atmosphere and ambience is definitely one of its pluses ‚Äì it‚Äôs quiet and relaxing, dim but not dark ‚Äì as its name ‚Äòhealth and wellness club‚Äô suggests. I particularly like the sauna and bath facility as personally it really makes a big difference to post-workout comfort. Even the hairdryer is nice to use. Fob is provided for after-hours access. Parking is not easy as with any location in Sydney CBD but close enough to Martin Pl metro.

locations.title: Fitness First George Street Platinum

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing for a ‚ÄúPlatinum‚Äù gym. The wet area has a horrible smell that makes it almost unusable, and the communal sauna and steam room are constantly out of service.

Many of the showers are broken or in terrible condition, and even the water fountain and bins are completely rusted.

It honestly feels like the facilities are being neglected, which is unacceptable given the high membership fees.

As members, we expect at least a minimum standard of quality and proper maintenance.

The wet areas, which should be one of the main attractions of a Platinum club, are instead often unavailable or in such poor condition that they cannot be used. This defeats the purpose of paying for a premium membership.

The only positive aspect is the staff, who are always friendly, professional, and willing to help.

Unfortunately, management urgently needs to invest in fixing these issues, because members deserve far better than what is currently offered.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing for a ‚ÄúPlatinum‚Äù gym. The wet area has a horrible smell that makes it almost unusable, and the communal sauna and steam room are constantly out of service.

Many of the showers are broken or in terrible condition, and even the water fountain and bins are completely rusted.

It honestly feels like the facilities are being neglected, which is unacceptable given the high membership fees.

As members, we expect at least a minimum standard of quality and proper maintenance.

The wet areas, which should be one of the main attractions of a Platinum club, are instead often unavailable or in such poor condition that they cannot be used. This defeats the purpose of paying for a premium membership.

The only positive aspect is the staff, who are always friendly, professional, and willing to help.

Unfortunately, management urgently needs to invest in fixing these issues, because members deserve far better than what is currently offered.

locations.title: Fitness First Kings Cross Platinum
locations.address: ÓÉàKingsgate Building, 82, Level 8/94 Darlinghurst Rd, Potts Point NSW 2011

showerReviews.reviewText:
The overall smell of the gym is not great, and the steam room is constantly out of service.

Out of the 8 showers available, 6 were broken for almost three weeks not long ago, this is unacceptable, especially during peak hours when there are easily over 100‚Äì150 people using it. Of course, not everyone showers, but a large percentage do, and the lack of functioning showers creates an unpleasant and frustrating experience.

On top of that, the hair dryers have been in terrible condition for months with no signs of repair or replacement. The standard of maintenance is far below what should be expected. Members are paying for quality and availability, yet the wet areas and basic amenities are often unavailable or in such poor condition that they cannot be used.

The positive side is that the staff are always friendly and helpful, and the gym floor and equipment are generally well maintained with regular servicing. Unfortunately, this does not make up for the ongoing neglect of the facilities.

Management needs to urgently address these issues and provide members with the standard we are paying for.
showerReviews.author: Kharrit

showerReviews.reviewText: Update. So the incompetent management at this gym *closes the mens showers completely for 3 days* to regrout tiles. In a competently managed gym the showers would be regrouted in sequence so that some always remained open. Not at this gym. Of course this is when the steam room has already been out of action for weeks. Clearly the stupidity of FF & the appalling management of Newtown Fitness First knows no bounds.  Perhaps the worst maintained FF gym in the entirety of Sydney. Disgusting actually. Just a sample of lockers, toilets out of order. Plus their claim that the gym is 24hrs is a total sham. Friday afternoon at 5pm & saunas are locked because no staff rostered & gym users are expected to enter & exit the gym via filthy fire stairs. And they actively advise against using lockers when reception is unstaffed (which is most of the time) so good luck with your wallet, keys & any valuables! Save your money & go elsewhere. Almost any gym in Newtown is better than this dump.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôm disappointed that the sauna and steam room close as early as 4pm on Fridays, 12pm on weekends, and not much later on other weekdays. While the gym is open 24/7, these facilities aren‚Äôt, which was unexpected. Compared to other Fitness First gyms in the Eastern Suburbs, Newtown is the only one with such limited staffed hours for the sauna and steam room. It‚Äôs a bit frustrating, misleading and doesn‚Äôt quite align with what I expected, given their promise to provide innovative, accessible fitness solutions.

Update: Thanks for getting back to me. While I appreciate the response, it doesn‚Äôt fully address the core issue. Saying ‚Äúwe‚Äôll pass it on‚Äù doesn‚Äôt really help members who pay full price but only have limited access to key facilities like the sauna and steam room.

At this membership level, recovery amenities shouldn‚Äôt be limited to narrow staffed hours - especially when they‚Äôre part of what‚Äôs advertised. Suggesting members visit other clubs feels like shifting the problem rather than solving it.

I‚Äôm simply asking for fair access to the facilities included in my membership. The current setup doesn‚Äôt reflect great value, and I hope this feedback leads to meaningful improvements.
showerReviews.author: Rebecca Kidd

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you‚Äôre looking for a ‚Äúpremium‚Äù gym that feels more like a gym equipment garage sale, Fitness First PLATINUM Crows Nest is the place. NOTHING about this gym feels premium/platinum.

The bathrooms consistently stink and are littered with tissue paper. Finding weights? Good luck. They're either missing or scattered around the floor in random corners. And the staff? Completely indifferent. You‚Äôll feel like a headless chicken roaming around.

Sure, the gym offers group classes and a swimming pool, but that alone doesn‚Äôt qualify it as premium. A clean, well-maintained space should be the bare minimum.

Anytime Fitness in St Leonards(besides being just at the train station) does a much better job: it‚Äôs clean & organised.

Either lift your standards or drop the word ‚Äúpremium‚Äù from your branding.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member for 7 years. Ongoing maintenance has been poor (months-long sauna issues, dirty showers), but what pushed me to write this review was being told today that I must download their app to enter the gym.

I only train for about 30 minutes. AN APP IS UNNECESSARY. The app also asks for precise location data, which is intrusive when the gym already has my personal details.

If they take months to fix basic things like showers, I have little confidence they would handle member data properly in the event of a breach.

For anyone else: you can refuse. I told the receptionist I wouldn‚Äôt download the app and they allowed entry using just my phone number.
I encourage others to do the same if you‚Äôre not comfortable handing over your personal data to a gym corporation.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been going to this gym for over 10 years, so time to update my review from 7 years ago.

Great gym. Even better with refresh that looks about 90% complete now. Range of facilities and classes diverse enough for all, with plenty of Personal Trainers if interested in upping your game or keeping you committed.

Almost all the equipment has been replaced (new machines), with flooring, lighting, lockers etc makeover in last month with a bit more work to go. So if you have visited before but not in the last month check it out.

Staff and trainers are all friendly.

Since others are calling out their recommended Trainers, I'll recommend Jason. Great motivator. Love the regularly changing programs tailored to match your specific goals. He's the one in front of the mirror (where PTs love to hang).
Also shout out to super effervescent and friendly Eva.
showerReviews.author: Matt M

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am new to this gym. I used to go to the Pitt Street Fitness First, so I thought the two gyms operated the same way. I went to the gym tonight for a swim. I left the swimming pool area at 7:00 pm and assumed the female change room was still open, as it is at Pitt Street Fitness First.

However, a gym staff member named Ryan came into the female change room and started yelling at me and other customers, saying that the gym was closed. I asked him to please be polite and explained that I would leave as soon as possible, but he continued to yell at me multiple times.

I also explained to him that I am new to this gym and was not aware of the change room closing time. I suggested that the gym should clearly display the closing time on the female change room door so that members won‚Äôt get confused in the future. Despite this, he kept yelling at me and another customer. His behaviour was aggressive and unnecessary.

I left immediately after I understood the timetable, but I was in such a rush that I lost my bikini in the gym. At first, I thought only certain areas, such as the swimming pool, would close earlier‚Äînot the entire gym. I was also confused because I thought this was a 24-hour gym.

His abusive behaviour was absolutely unacceptable. A staff member should never treat customers this way. I cried on my way home because of how he made me feel. üò≠
showerReviews.author: Mia Liang

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pretty good gym and very convenient if you work in the city. Good equipment, not too busy.

Would be ideal if another chest fly / rear deal fly machine was added. This machine is used up all of the time (as expected as it‚Äôs in most peoples workout)  which is pretty frustrating. Also it would be great if the passcodes could work on all of the lockers as I‚Äôve noticed on a few it doesn‚Äôt work.

Other than that, a solid gym and I‚Äôd recommend!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been going to the Hyde Park branch for years since Wynyard closed üò≠. The location is so convenient to go before or after work.
It is well equipped, however some more additional other workout machines would be nice such as Abductor and seat leg curls machines. However there's always alternative exercises to do.
This is not the fault of the gym but I really wish other gym-goers were more tidy and clean, I always find stack machine attachments and weight plates scattered on the floor, not placed back in the box and not unracking plates from machines. And they also need to keep the toilets/showers clean.
Nevertheless, this gym has become my second home üòÖ
showerReviews.author: Shin Pech

showerReviews.reviewText: The only pro about this gym is that it‚Äôs usually not crowded during after work hours. Probably due to the fact that it‚Äôs in the basement of an inconspicuous building. My gym buddy and I came here every week for months and would get headaches from being on the lower floor as the ventilation is abysmal. It always has a musty smell and the change rooms and bathrooms are so small and cramped. The toilets also often had skid marks and clumped up toilet paper which is just disgusting. There are fans which provide some semblance of fresh air but it‚Äôs just recirculating nasty air. We‚Äôve noticed odd looking spots on the walls which could be mould but again, if the mould doesn‚Äôt affect you, the lack of oxygen definitely will. The layout of the bottom level is also terrible. The squat racks, hip-thrust and squat machine are placed so close together that it‚Äôs incredibly awkward to grab weights and set up. The left squat rack is also so close to the wall which makes it difficult to do anything. Also there is zero signal in this gym. I hope they will renovate or fix some things (the renovation posters have been up for ages) as it‚Äôs in a convenient location but there are better gyms in a close vicinity.
showerReviews.author: coco li

They also need frequent toilet cleaners to work on weekends too as they are often gross and clogged, they are a profitable enough business to hire daily cleaners.

Also, it is unnaceptable to have the lockers not working for so longer under the excuse of  "there are too many complaints about them not working"  just fix em up.

locations.title: Anytime Fitness Haymarket
locations.address: ÓÉàLower Ground, Floor, 725/731 George St, Haymarket NSW 2000

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing experience as a paying member.

I have been a member of Anytime Fitness, but my recent experience has left me shocked and frustrated. I was training dance moves in an almost empty gym during a quiet time (weekday noon, 12‚Äì1 PM), and was unexpectedly asked to leave by a staff member. The reason? I was ‚Äúdisturbing others.‚Äù However, the gym was nearly empty, and there was plenty of space around me. I fail to understand how my quiet solo training could possibly disturb anyone.

Nowhere in the membership contract does it state that dancing or movement training is prohibited. As a paying member, I believe I have the same right to train as everyone else, whether it‚Äôs weights, cardio, or dance-based workouts. This kind of treatment felt unfair and discriminatory.

On top of that, the gym is not well-maintained. The floors are dirty, and overall hygiene is substandard ‚Äî especially disappointing for a fitness facility.

This incident has left me extremely dissatisfied. I expected a welcoming and inclusive training environment, not to be judged or kicked out for how I choose to move my body. I sincerely hope the management reconsiders how they treat their members and enforces rules based on fairness, not personal bias.
showerReviews.author: Lynne Li

locations.title: Anytime Fitness Kingsford

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gym is spacious and has most machines however upper management of anytime is horrendous.

Over my whole time here there has been no process about kicking ppl out for not using towels. But recently they have begun to do so without warning, approaching people mid set and kicking them out only if they accept to buy a ‚Äò$10 anytime fitness towel‚Äô

Within the two years I‚Äôve been here they‚Äôve also upped their prices twice.

Last but not least a lot of these 5 star reviews are here due to the staff approaching members mid-sessions and asking for it (explaining the lack of detail on many of these reviews). I have removed my 5 star review and altered it to this one to better reflect the customer service of this gym.

Whilst this gym does have nice equipment and is in a good location, the way they treat their members is truely horrific
showerReviews.author: Kyle Harrington

showerReviews.reviewText:
This one sucks. Dunno what half the reviewers here are vaping (dont doubt the reviewer below that complains of vapers in the gym) or getting in free merch for reviews. Standards are low.

Downstairs: 1 disabled toilet, the floor usually smells bad and air flow/air con weak. Dank is a good word. Often packed with groups of male uni students.. I dont mind the boys, but totally understand why the 1 star reviews seem to be mostly female.

Upstairs: a dirty unisex bathroom with half the toilets/cubicles seemingly permanently out of order - nowhere to really get changed, or get clean. A busy gym floor with older equipment, sometimes also out of order.

They recently put their prices up - I called them to ask why and they brought the fee increase forward a month ! Predatory contract behaviour... even though I've never signed a contract with Kingsford theyre trying to get me to sign up for a price increase? I only come here to work out with a mate, and I'm choosing to cancel even though the kensington gym 2 min up the road is brand new and much better. Good thing they did increase the membership fees here though, as I actually made an effort to find a cheaper gym.. only a matter of time before the uni students work out that a rival 24/7 gym just behind the kingsford anytime is 40% cheaper with no lock in contract.
showerReviews.author: Chris Selvaraj

locations.title: Anytime Fitness Newtown

showerReviews.reviewText: It's a good gym overall. The showers are clean, and the water remains warm even at night. The fitness equipment is reasonable. There's a sofa and two chairs for people to rest, which is a good idea, but they are not clean‚Äîactually a bit filthy and have a bad smell. Perhaps changing them to wooden or plastic chairs would be a better choice? Additionally, there are no hair dryers, and there isn't even a power point to plug in and use your own hair dryer at the table. It's not very convenient. While there is a power point in the bathroom, wouldn't it be a better idea to place one next to the table outside the shower so other members can access it when needed?
showerReviews.author: Yang Z

It has a great youthful vibe!
It‚Äôs easy to find on King street. Let‚Äôs face it , what isn‚Äôt on King street in Newtown! :)

Not the clubs fault but members should not ‚Äúreserve ‚Äú a piece of equipment by placing their towel on it and leave the equipment idle. I checked back a few times but ran out of time in the end.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Anytime Fitness is the best chain support it. Each gym has its perks. Nice hot shower so good when you're stressed or after a hard workout . I personally am a big supporter of this chain. Always keep your phone
And keys with you. The
Cameras are here but it's not an absolute guarantee. I'd have a purple car regardless!!

Real name Aaron Jeffrey Twigg. I might be on the sign up desk at night studying or the like. Talk to them outside about how great this chain is.

I am with Darwin currently. The have two branches up there now. Remember keep your most valuable items keys and phone in sight at all stages don't leave them in the pigeon holes. Try to have a protect bag to keep them together and clear of dropped weights. I'd take it on the foot rather than on the keys or phone. New desk position, some centres the desk is more visible and they can see me and think I work here. If they tap I talk to them outside. It's not a guarantee the cameras. They will make themselves look at bit unrecognisable and use your phone or car so far and then dump it eg phone in bin or into a river.

Nice drink. Real protein and water. Yes but the amin.o drink technically is a fraud you'll get more protein from a carrot. Cunning Amin.o is a fraud. That's basically a fiz drink really

showerReviews.reviewText: Joined on a no lock contract at $28 per week. Personal Trainers are really nice. Never correspond via email as you won't get a reply. Not many classes to choose from and no booking system so you just have to turn up and hope for the best that you will get a space although classes are very fun. Towels are included depending on your membership which is convenient. If you go at busy periods of the day you will be waiting on certain machines. Overall experience was never that great for the price.
showerReviews.author: B Ferguson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros: Big gym, two floors, heated pool, staff are nice.
Cons:
- Place is really run down.
- Change rooms have the look and feel of Healthland back in 2000 (for those been around that long).
- Desperate need of a renovation. I am sure it was lovely when it was exclusive back in the 90's.
- Towels are an extra cost.
- The Personal Trainers look like they are on heat (trying to make eye contact with you so they can hit you up for training). I know that's how you get your business,. It just feels like being in a night club and constantly been eyed out by someone you don't like. All been there right?

All in all, its not a bad place. Review the options in the surrounding areas before signing up.
showerReviews.author: Jason William (CiderInsider)

Best to come in winter and ignore the nasty bathroom.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Staff are lovely and welcoming but the facilities are awful. Bathroom needs upgrade: shower soap stinks, soap holders falling off wall and showers feel slimey and dirty. Equipment sometimes works sometimes not. Also during their get ready for summer recruiting drives there is no room to move.
Best to come in winter and ignore the nasty bathroom.
showerReviews.author: Wakki Bash

showerReviews.reviewText:
Like working out in a garage. Had a 5 day free trial. Was made to pay $3 for each of my towels. What healthclub doesn't give free towels these days? You want me to sweat all over your machines and not wipe, OK. Way to really entice my membership here Goodlife!
You're working out in shadows or you have a strong spotlight in your eyes when lifting. 2 treadmills downstairs, 8 more upstairs where the extremely loud workout class is. I've seen better equipment at a 3 star hotel. No hot girls work out here.

Men's locker room is decent in size and cleanliness.
showerReviews.author: Jason Lane

It feels as if the management gives zero care to the experience.

showerReviews.reviewText:
As for hotel guests, the gym is ok. As for signup members for gym workout, it's rather small and the facility has insufficient and limited machine/ equipment range. 1 squat rack, 1 Smith machine, 1 bench press seat (having empty space next for extra one but left empty) 2 power racks. No plate loaded machines, only limited range of pin loaded machines. No leg curl/extension machine.
Pool area is not accessible from men's locker so access/use would be awkward/inconvenient. It has rather unproportionally big space for studio exercise. Gym has cardio equipment which should be in cardio / studio area. Cardio machines are equipped with simpler touch screen. Pool area has 2 nicer shower cubicles than locker room. HP says they have steam but men's area only has sauna (dry). For me, it is insufficient for good weight training.
showerReviews.author: Htc Htl

showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff and instructors are friendly and welcoming. The gym is fairly clean and amenities are good. Equipment are good but floor space is very limited.

I had to cancel my membership because the gym is so busy it‚Äôs almost unusable. Good luck finding a barbel at peak hours. And you may have to line up for shower. Earlier in 2024/2025 it didn‚Äôt used to be like this, so not sure what changed.

showerReviews.reviewText: This is the newest Virgin Active gym in Sydney and the second gym in their Collection gyms. It is a bit more expensive at $45-60 per week depending on how long you sign up for. Everything is brand new and the club was beautifully made. As I walk through the hallways I feel like I am walking through a hotel. The new technology at this gym include the self cleaning boxing gloves and cycle shoes. The machine sprays antibacterial spray in them. This gym is best if you will make use of the classes. There's boxing, The Grid (circuit class), cycling, reformer pilates, and yoga. The trainers are nice and helpful. The gym equipmemt and machines are on levels 2 and 3 and there aren't that many so if you are going for weights and equipment, go to the Pitt St club. The showers are really nice and towels are included. They also have dyson hairdryers and GHD hair straighteners. They offer blow dry services on Thursday and Friday nights
showerReviews.author: Helen W

showerReviews.reviewText:
I don‚Äôt appreciate the fact that no one removes the hair in the female showers. Too busy for premium gym. Especially the coworking area during afternoons. Toilets are not cleaned regularly and once had toilet paper missing so I  had to run to other toilet while no one sees me. Not premium. No free passes for friends. That also does not feel premium. Once I went to spa at 9:40pm and one of the staff said I have 5 minutes to enjoy, but then I was approached by other staff member and he basically asked me to leave now. Does not feel premium also, because I was watching the time and would have left gym on time.

Here are some pictures of the gym few days after I first wrote review. Looks even worse. There was no toilet paper in several toilet cabins.

If you are as squeamish as me I don‚Äôt recommend this place.

locations.title: Virgin Active Wynyard (Margaret Street) Gym

showerReviews.reviewText:
I used to like this gym as the equipments are new, the place is well maintained, towel service (at extra $5pw cost), Dyson hair dryer, etc.
However, the last few weeks have been extremely stressful in this gym. I get there at 7am and need to be in work by 8.30am.
I've been struggling to find free equipment, by the time I finish my workout the bathroom is ridiculously packed, unable to use the hair dryers or find a place to place my bag as all seats are taken in the dressing room, loads of the hair dryers are not working (they seem like they are but they turn off after a minute using it). In summary, I'm leaving for a much cheaper and lower quality gym in which I'm able to get in and do my workout in peace without panicking with how busy the changing room will be or delay my workout because there's no equipment available - no luxury or towel service, but a much happier morning for me.
showerReviews.author: Camila

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been training with Holly at Virgin Active Wynyard for 4 months and it's been an amazing journey! She's helped me lose weight, build and tone muscle, make good choices with food, keep me accountable, but most importantly, find confidence in myself and love for my body! She's extremely knowledgable and skilled, but also empathetic.. pushing you whilst understanding and embracing your needs or fears. Even though my 12-week transformation challenge has finished, I'll continue training with her for a long time to come.
Also, the gym itself is beautiful - clean, spacious, amazing amenities, kind and considerate coaches/staff. I've tried a few big gyms and Virgin Active takes the cake for sure.
showerReviews.author: Maddie Koczanowski

showerReviews.reviewText:
I used to rate this gym as a solid 5 star. I have been a member of Virgin Active (Pitt St in the city) for well over 10 years. The Frenchs Forest gym is close to home so I am there often.

Unfortunately, I have to rate it lower now. Mainly due to the very tired mens' locker rooms. At least 50% of the key code locks don't work. The fittings are tired. The toilets and showers are just as tired and are smelly and appear dirty. I now try to avoid showering after a workout at the gym and prefer to go home in my sweaty gear and shower there.

For the money we pay, the mens' locker room is nowhere near acceptable. The rest of the gym (equipment etc) is 5 star.

locations.title: Virgin Active Barangaroo

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the more expensive version of the Virgin gym with pricing that's set at the executive level.  As usual, the staff were very good but I felt incredibly restricted in where I could go.

They don't have a lot of variety in their classes here (compared to Pitt Street) and to be fair, they don't have a lot of space either.

There weren't many people there. In fact during the whole time that I was getting changed, there were only three people in the room. Unfortunately, the changing room is so small that I had to move three times for the other people.

Also on changing rooms, it's great to have a choice of shower heads (really) and conditioner and usb chargers in your lockers but there were no toilets. Only one in the foyer that people seemed to be lining up for.

The boxing class I did was good and it's correctly called a "focus class" because there's very little interaction between people and no talking at all.

If you're an executive who can afford the gym and you don't like people, this is the place for you.  Personally I found it a little too restrained and clinical.

After your workout, you get a complimentary towel and a choice of oddly shaped and oddly packaged smoothies.  The avocado one is pictured. It tasted much better than it looked.
showerReviews.author: Gavin Bollard

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Yes, this gym has no weights area that can be used outside PT sessions. Yes it is small. But the classes and facilities are top notch. The boxing class is the best you'll do at a gym (individual bags so you are working the whole class) and Burn is the ultimate strength and conditioning class, it always pushes you in both cardio and weights and never gets boring. I can't personally sacrifice doing either of those classes for a cycle class but I'm told they are also amazing.

The coaches are full of personality, passionate, encouraging and professional at all times. As a result every person attending these classes gives their all. This is where the magic lies. I have never been to a class where the standard is so consistently high. It's inspiring and you find yourself pushing harder than you thought possible just because of the people around you.

There are other gyms with more showers and range of classes but they just don't have the magic of this gym. I have been coming for a few months and find myself missing it on the days I can't go. If you find yourself wanting something else you can always go to another Virgin Active for the pool, weights or other classes. But don't be surprised if you find yourself addicted to this gym instead!
showerReviews.author: Louise Selwood

locations.title: F45 Training Chatswood

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really enjoying F45 Chatswood with Jamie at the helm of a team of friendly, encouraging coaches. What stands out is Jamie's clear explanations of how to correctly do specific exercises to ensure the right muscles are engaged.
What I always appreciate is how flexible Jamie is to cater to a range of fitness needs and easily adapts an exercise to suit if you have an injury or coming back after a holiday break.
As a whole, the atmosphere is very welcoming with very friendly members,  open to chat and inclusive of everyone. Very easy to feel like you are part of the group and makes the sessions all that more enjoyable - more so when it is a harder workout.
Location is central Chatswood with free parking available underneath the gym - very practical, or free street parking before 8:30 am. There are also changing room/shower facilities, which I personally have not used, but have seen other members leave refreshed and ready for work. Great place, recommend it if you want to get fit be it cardio, strength, overall wellbeing!

locations.title: Camp Cove Beach

showerReviews.reviewText: Camp Cove is a beautiful hidden beach near Watsons Bay, perfect for swimming, relaxing, and enjoying the calm waters of Sydney Harbour. The beach is small and peaceful, which makes it great for families and anyone looking for a quiet escape from the busy city. The water is usually calm and clear, ideal for snorkeling and paddling. There is also a small kiosk where you can grab snacks and drinks, which adds to the convenience. The views across the harbour are stunning, and the sunsets here are truly magical. It‚Äôs also close to Hornby Lighthouse and other walking tracks, so you can combine a visit to several scenic spots in one trip. Overall, Camp Cove is one of Sydney‚Äôs best little beaches ‚Äì charming, relaxing, and full of natural beauty.‚Äù
showerReviews.author: Rasha Dwieb

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a beach with a wonderful view of the Sydney skyline! My only complaint is the sand had quite a few sticks in it when we were there. So not a lot of fun to walk on. Perhaps there was a recent storm? That‚Äôs the only thing that‚Äôs keeping us from being a five star review.

There is a little stand where you can purchase towels and a few drinks. It really is a fabulous beach. The sticks were the only bummer.

Also, my husband was not exactly dressed for the beach! He looked like Johnny Cash in all black. ;) We were giggling at him. I wish I brought a suit because I really would have swam. But I dipped my feet in, and the water temp was a little chilly, which was perfectly refreshing on a warm day.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Manly Beach: Sydney's Perfect Seaside Escape
‚ÄãRating: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê (5/5 Stars)
‚ÄãManly Beach, often dubbed "seven miles from Sydney, a thousand miles from care," truly lives up to its reputation as a stunning, relaxed coastal retreat. It offers the classic Australian beach experience with a vibrant, friendly atmosphere that makes it a fantastic day trip or holiday destination.
‚ÄãüèñÔ∏è The Beach & Vibe
‚ÄãThe main beach is a magnificent stretch of golden sand, backed by a picturesque promenade lined with iconic Norfolk Pine trees. It runs for about 1.5km, offering plenty of space for everyone.
‚ÄãSurfing: Manly is famous for its waves and was the site of the first World Surfing Championship. It's an excellent spot for all levels, with surf schools offering lessons for beginners.
‚ÄãSwimming: The beach is fully patrolled, and for those who prefer calmer water, the sheltered Manly Cove is right on the harbour side, perfect for families.
‚ÄãAtmosphere: It strikes a great balance‚Äîlively and energetic without the sometimes overwhelming crowds of Bondi. It feels distinctly relaxed, like a true beach resort town.
‚Äãüö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Things to Do (Beyond the Sand)
‚ÄãManly offers far more than just swimming and sunbathing:
‚ÄãThe Corso: This pedestrian mall connects the ferry wharf to the ocean beach, bustling with surf shops, cafes, ice cream spots, and markets on the weekends.
‚ÄãManly to Shelly Beach Walk: This short, beautiful coastal walk takes you past the historic Fairy Bower Pool to the sheltered Shelly Beach, which is a fantastic spot for snorkeling and scuba diving due to its protected marine reserve status.
‚ÄãCoastal Walks: For more adventure, you can tackle the breathtaking Manly to Spit Bridge Scenic Walkway or explore the historic sites and stunning views from North Head Sanctuary.
‚ÄãüçΩÔ∏è Food and Drink
‚ÄãManly's dining scene is excellent, ranging from casual beachfront fish and chips to upscale restaurants:
‚ÄãWaterfront Dining: Spots like The Pantry Manly or those along Manly Wharf offer fantastic views while you eat.
‚ÄãDiverse Cuisine: You'll find everything from Italian (like Hugos or Busta) and Mexican (Chica Bonita) to classic Australian pubs and seafood.
‚ÄãCoffee & Gelato: The Corso and surrounding streets are filled with amazing cafes and, of course, essential gelato shops.
‚Äãüõ•Ô∏è Getting There
‚ÄãThe journey is an experience in itself! Taking the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay is the best way to arrive, providing incredible views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. It only takes about 30 minutes.
‚Äã‚ú® Final Verdict
‚ÄãManly Beach is the quintessential Sydney beach experience. It combines a world-class surfing beach with calm harbour-side coves, stunning walks, and a vibrant dining precinct, all easily accessible via a beautiful ferry ride. If you have time for only one beach in Sydney, many locals would tell you to choose Manly.
showerReviews.author: John karmas
