locations.title: Brighton-Le-Sands Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brighton-Le-Sands Beach is an absolute hidden gem and deserves every bit of its five stars! If you're looking for a stunning stretch of sand without the crazy crowds of Bondi or Manly, this is your place.
‚ÄãGorgeous Scenery and Calm Waters: The sand is beautifully soft and the waters of Botany Bay are wonderfully calm, making it perfect for families, a relaxing swim, or a gentle paddle. The netted swimming area offers an extra layer of peace of mind.
‚ÄãVibrant "Little Greece by the Bay": The atmosphere is fantastic. The Grand Parade is lined with superb cafes and restaurants, especially the vibrant Greek eateries that give the area its nickname. It's an ideal spot to grab a coffee, a delicious meal, or a gelato right by the water.
‚ÄãUnique Plane Spotting Experience: A truly unique feature is the proximity to Sydney Airport. Watching the planes descend right over the bay adds a cool, dramatic backdrop to your beach day that you won't find anywhere else in Sydney.
‚ÄãFantastic Foreshore: The beach is complemented by Cook Park, which offers excellent walking/cycling paths, picnic areas, and playgrounds. Whether you're jogging, cycling, or just strolling, the foreshore is immaculately maintained.
‚ÄãA perfect blend of relaxed beach life, great food, and unique views. Don't hesitate‚ÄîBrighton-Le-Sands is a must-visit!
showerReviews.author: Steven Mickman

showerReviews.reviewText:
A very nice beach that is close to many of Sydney's suburbs, hidden from th ee other famous beach locations, it offers the visitor a great spot to unwind and watch aircraft take off and land at Sydney's airport.
The sand is nice and there is an area for swimming that is enclosed with shark nets.
There are many shops and restaurants nearby with some good food options present.
The only issue that I noted was the strong smell of aircraft fuel on windy days, otherwise it's a nice, peaceful and not so overcrowded beach to visit and spend a few hours at. Enjoy :)
showerReviews.author: Orhan Sheriff

showerReviews.reviewText:
Perfect!  Really multicultural place.
Overall impression is that it's really excellent for a beach in the middle of the city.   I would call it "bustling" rather than serene, but convenience of food, parking etc is all the relaxation you need.
However, the council should invest more into cleaning toilets,  picking up rubbish and installing water fountain.  ( minus 1 star) .

* Closest beach when you're driving from Canberra.
Water:
- Calm,  good for swimming
- Reasonably clean by Sydney standards
- Was not too hot or cold
- No rocks, blue bottles or other nasties underfoot.
Beach:
* Cleanliness 4/5. Few bits of garbage near walkway.
*Shady spots to sit next to the road or walkway so you don't get sunburnt.
* Large expanse of white sand, perfect distance to shoreline. ( not too far away either.)
*Safety 4.5/5: well lit, reasonably safe.
* Parking: 4/5: we parked on the road running parallel to beach, very easy access.
* Shops and restaurants: plenty nearby. All the conveniences of a city area.
* Noise levels: high.  Lots of ppl, planes and road traffic.
* Bathrooms and showers: 3/5. Usable, but ick.  Would benefit from installing more water fountains and more frequent cleaning of toilets.  Should also get locals involved in cleaning and maintenance.
* View: 4/5.

Don't come here looking for
* boujie instagram pic
* quiet getaway to reconnect with nature
* private getaway with lover.
If you're crazy busy,  short on time,  young kids in tow, don't have time to plan or pack,  then Brighton is the place for you.
showerReviews.author: saggit eightyfour

locations.title: Forty Baskets Beach

showerReviews.reviewText: Another fabulous inner Sydney Harbour picnic and safe swimming spot.
showerReviews.author: Jim Fisher

showerReviews.reviewText: Another fabulous inner Sydney Harbour picnic and safe swimming spot.
showerReviews.author: Jim Fisher

showerReviews.reviewText:
Forty Baskets Beach is usually a secluded little beach in Balgowlah with a netted tidal pool in the middle, but on a hot Invasion Day morning it was far busier than usual.

Before colonisation it was used by original custodians the Gai-marigal people and there is a midden deposit under the grassy area at the back of the beach. According to historic sources, this midden even yielded skeletons, the last of which were removed in the 1970s. I read that they ended up in museums. Typical.

The name? It commemorates an epic fishing catch hauled in there in the late 19th Century, which was used to feed a group of soldiers who were detained in the nearby Quarantine Station after returning from the war in Sudan.

The echoes of the history of British settler colonialism linger here in other forms too, from the trees that were poisoned by some of the residents to improve their view, to today‚Äôs land grabs of public space by rows of blue and white cool cabanas. Sydney‚Äôs obsession with real estate writ small.

It‚Äôs a tough day to feel positive about anything much, but we could tell that on any other day we would have thought this was a pretty place with all the things: outdoor showers, change room BBQs and free parking on the adjacent streets.

The crowd were mostly local white families, interspersed with Fijian and other Pasifikan First Nations families who were having great fun. Seeing the latter enjoying their day in and around the pool made us smile despite everything.
showerReviews.author: Jackie McMillan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quiet little beach located off Beatty Street in Balgowlah Heights. Great spot to rest or have a picnic if you are doing the Spit to Manly walk. Seat's and tables, enclosed pool, free electric bbq's, toilets and change room's available nearby. Safe spot for families with kid's, and there's some swings too. Fresh water available from bubbler's, if you wish to purchase coffee,drinks or food, the Forty Beans Cafe in Lower Beach St. (on the way to Manly)is the closest, being a lesuirely 15 minute walk away.

locations.title: Little Bay Beach
locations.address: ÓÉà4R Coast Hospital Rd, Little Bay NSW 2036

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pieces of material containing asbestos (mainly fibrous cement sheeting) have been found regularly at Little Bay Beach since an initial report in August 2020. Randwick City Council is continuing to inspect and remove visible material and is also developing options for longer term remediation. Find out more about¬†Council's asbestos management at Little Bay Beach.
Features
Little Bay Beach is one of Sydney's undiscovered jewels. A 'secret' beach popular with locals, it's well protected from large coastal swells making it perfect for swimming and snorkelling. Its golden sands are popular with families while the rock ledges to the north and south are well-known, but sometimes dangerous, fishing spots.
Access to the secluded beach is via a steep timber staircase. Take Pine Avenue off Anzac Parade and there is parking on the street. A caf√© is located in the Prince Henry Centre towards the top of the beach near the chapel.
Public toilets and change rooms are located on the timber staircase about halfway down to the beach.
The beach is not patrolled by Randwick City Lifeguards or Surf Lifesavers.
Dogs, alcohol and glass bottles are not permitted on the beach area..
showerReviews.author: John karmas

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow.. what a nice place to chill and enjoy the nature. Its a little beach but better than big beach. The small beach is just at the low land with the white sand and rocky cliff at the side. When looked from the high ground the beach together with the ocean fits perfectly  in the frame. Also, the high grasslands are parks, fountains, rocky cliffs... u never get tired to walk around enjoying the diversity in the place. On review, I saw good place to see sunset. But, I went in the morning n the sunrise is spectacular. U won't  regret the early morning wake. Trust me. Well, its good for nature photography, swimming, snorkelling i suppose, jogging absolutely,  relaxing, dating particularly, many more.. Since its a beautiful  place.the  place may be crowded in the mid day n problem to get parking spot. I went early morning at 5 , so no problem.

Update... well it's sad that we cannot walk on the grasslands, where we can see great view of beach and the sunrise. Usually the grassland is for playing golf. I went there couple of times , they play golf early morning.  It is written in the pathway NO PEDESTRIANS on the grassland side .. we can walk straight to the beach only.
showerReviews.author: B. R Shrestha

showerReviews.reviewText: Whenever I am in the eastern suburbs I always head to Clovelly Surf Life Saving Club -üòÅbecause they always have a free car park! ( which in comparison to Bondi is a paid car park). During the day the surf life saving club patrols the area making it very safe for everyone enjoying the sea. It is always adequately maintained whenever I go there doesn't seem to be any rubbish left around... the people sunbathing swimming are all very personable and relaxed which is probably due to the cool Vibe of being so close to the sea and the good salt air. The public facilities are also very good, there are shower change rooms toilets which are always clean when I go there and there is a cafe with reasonably priced food on offer and wine and alcohol which are not overpriced. This beach caters for all ages, nationalities shapes and sizes. Due to the location,  ease and free parking the facilities the Vibe the crowd I give the Clovelly Surf Life Saving Club a  5 out of 5.

locations.address: ÓÉàHuston Parade, North Curl Curl NSW 2099

showerReviews.reviewText:
On a perfectly sunny spring day, I visited North Curl Curl Beach, and it was absolutely wonderful! The inviting atmosphere of the beach was hard to resist, so I ended up swimming in the waves, enjoying the refreshing embrace of the ocean. The water was invigorating, making it an ideal day for a swim. After some fun in the surf, I took a nice, short coastal walk along the scenic path that offers stunning views of the coastline. The tranquil sounds of the waves crashing against the rocks were incredibly soothing. Additionally, I discovered a rock pool that was pleasingly clean and perfect for a quick dip. It was a delightful way to relax and connect with nature.
Another highlight was the well-maintained facilities at the beach. The toilets and showers were in great condition, providing a sense of comfort and convenience for visitors. Overall, my day at North Curl Curl Beach was a refreshing escape from the daily grind, and I left feeling rejuvenated. I will definitely plan to come back again next time! Whether you're looking to swim, walk, or simply enjoy the sun, North Curl Curl has something wonderful to offer for everyone. Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: Kyra Vizco

locations.title: Coogee Surf Life Saving Club
locations.address: ÓÉàCarr St &, Beach St, Coogee NSW 2034

showerReviews.reviewText:
Coogee Surf Life Saving Club blends oceanfront charm with real community spirit. Step inside and you are met with salt air through open windows, boards stacked neatly in the corner and volunteers in red and yellow drifting through between patrols. The upstairs room looks straight out to the bay, which makes it an easy place to catch your breath after a swim or to meet friends before sunset. Drinks are fairly priced, the food menu sticks to comforting classics, and staff keep things moving even when the beach is heaving. Grab a table by the balcony if you can. Watching the water change colour while a southerly rolls in is reason enough to linger for a second round.

What stands out most is how welcoming and capable the lifesaving team feels. Patrols set the flags early, shift them as the banks move and happily explain conditions to anyone who asks. On busy afternoons you see them checking on kids with foamies near the shorebreak, offering advice without the lecture. That quiet competence gives real confidence if you are swimming with visitors or little ones. Sundays bring families in for Nippers, the change rooms are tidy, and the whole place has a grounded, local energy that is hard to fake. Training information is easy to find for anyone thinking about a Bronze Medallion, and there is always a fundraising raffle or two helping keep gear up to date.

A couple of notes help. Bring photo ID to sign in as a guest, throw on dry clothes before heading upstairs, and arrive early on prime beach days when seats disappear quickly. If you are chasing a relaxed drink with a front row view and want to support the people who keep this stretch of coast safe, the club is a top pick. You leave with sandy feet, a full glass of sea air and a quiet appreciation for the crew who watch the flags.
showerReviews.author: Le Hoang Giap

locations.title: Long Reef Surf Life Saving Club

showerReviews.reviewText:
AVOID Long Reef SLSC for your wedding or event!

We had the unfortunate experience of booking Long Reef SLSC for our wedding, and it was an absolute disaster. The venue failed to provide basic essentials, such as gas and hot water in the kitchen, which left us unable to cook or clean during our event. Instead, we were forced to use a BBQ located downstairs and outside, our caterer spent the whole evening running up and down the stairs to cater for 60 guests for a three course meal,which was far from acceptable for a wedding.

Despite raising these serious issues with the management, they failed to offer a proper apology or take responsibility for the situation and only replied after 2 emails with their response coming in weeks after the event. When we cited the force majeure clause in the contract, they dismissed it, claiming the issue wasn‚Äôt relevant.

To add insult to injury, we‚Äôve had to fight for a refund. While the Club offered a minimal reduction in the hire fee as a ‚Äúgesture of goodwill,‚Äù it does not come close to compensating for the major disruptions, stress, and financial impact caused.

We were left disappointed and out of pocket, and the complete lack of professionalism and accountability shown by the Club is unacceptable. I strongly advise against booking this venue for any important occasion.
showerReviews.author: Hoani Tainui

locations.title: Manly Life Saving Club
locations.address: ÓÉàAshburner St &, S Steyne, Manly NSW 2095

showerReviews.reviewText:
Manly Life Saving Club brings the whole beach together in the best way. Step off the Corso, cross the promenade and you are at the heart of it all: red and yellow flags planted in neat lines, rescue boards stacked by the shed, radios clicking while patrols scan the banks. The clubhouse itself sits right on the sand with a front row view, so you feel part of the action even before you swim. Volunteers are welcoming and practical. Ask about the rips and you will get a clear read of the conditions, not a lecture, which is priceless if you are new to the beach or bringing visitors.

In the water the flagged zone is where the day stays easy. Sandbars move around here, so the patrol shifts the flags to the safest pocket and keeps everyone looped in with calm calls from the tower. Small days bring a playful shorebreak that is perfect for body surfing. When the swell stands up, confident swimmers still have fun under watchful eyes while families often wander south toward Fairy Bower and Shelly for gentler laps and good snorkel prospects. On weekends you will often catch Nippers running relays and foam boards across the sand, a reminder that this club is as much about teaching ocean sense as it is about rescues. IRB drills and board training add a bit of theatre without getting in the way.

Outside the flags, the simple comforts are covered. Showers and taps line the promenade, change rooms are close, and a short stroll puts you among caf√©s for a post swim flat white. If the clubhouse is open to guests, bring photo ID and throw on a dry shirt before heading upstairs, the balcony outlook is hard to beat. The ferry makes arrival stress free and the walk from the wharf takes minutes. Early mornings give you soft light and space, late afternoons turn the bay to gold. Pack a hat, water and reef safe sunscreen, thank a lifesaver on the way out, and you will understand why this stretch of sand feels so well looked after.
showerReviews.author: Le Hoang Giap

showerReviews.reviewText:
Manly Life Saving Club brings the whole beach together in the best way. Step off the Corso, cross the promenade and you are at the heart of it all: red and yellow flags planted in neat lines, rescue boards stacked by the shed, radios clicking while patrols scan the banks. The clubhouse itself sits right on the sand with a front row view, so you feel part of the action even before you swim. Volunteers are welcoming and practical. Ask about the rips and you will get a clear read of the conditions, not a lecture, which is priceless if you are new to the beach or bringing visitors.

In the water the flagged zone is where the day stays easy. Sandbars move around here, so the patrol shifts the flags to the safest pocket and keeps everyone looped in with calm calls from the tower. Small days bring a playful shorebreak that is perfect for body surfing. When the swell stands up, confident swimmers still have fun under watchful eyes while families often wander south toward Fairy Bower and Shelly for gentler laps and good snorkel prospects. On weekends you will often catch Nippers running relays and foam boards across the sand, a reminder that this club is as much about teaching ocean sense as it is about rescues. IRB drills and board training add a bit of theatre without getting in the way.

Outside the flags, the simple comforts are covered. Showers and taps line the promenade, change rooms are close, and a short stroll puts you among caf√©s for a post swim flat white. If the clubhouse is open to guests, bring photo ID and throw on a dry shirt before heading upstairs, the balcony outlook is hard to beat. The ferry makes arrival stress free and the walk from the wharf takes minutes. Early mornings give you soft light and space, late afternoons turn the bay to gold. Pack a hat, water and reef safe sunscreen, thank a lifesaver on the way out, and you will understand why this stretch of sand feels so well looked after.
showerReviews.author: Le Hoang Giap

showerReviews.reviewText: My teenager son felt ill after swimming in the cold ocean water and ended up fainting. Cold shock to his body. The amazing surf life saving team looked after my son before the ambulance or I arrive. They were friendly and  provide the best care they could. I was kept inform by Desmond who was clear in communication and professionalism. Really fantastic staff!

showerReviews.reviewText: Founded in 1911 Manly Life Saving Club is known as one of Australia's oldest Life Saving Clubs. My father came here for a large Life Saving Competition back in the 50's. The club sits in the Southern corner (Sth Steyne) of the beach and you cant miss it. The club has over  2,000 members, goes out of its way to educate the nippers and make sure that the beach is safe for swimming year round. The club has toilets and a little coffee shop and on top has a great room for functions. #letsguide  #manlylsc #manlybeach #sydney Australia

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is my review for camping in a van

Pros:
Location is great, nice coastal vibe, walk across to the beach or walk to the local shops along lake.

Reception Wendy was friendly & patient

Bunny rabbits, ducks, kookaburras

The automatic hot water tap was a nice touch in the kitchens, saves time waiting for a plastic kettle to boil

Kitchens nice

Cons:
At 1st a nice beach view spot sounds like a good idea, but then I realised that it comes with the road that separates the beach to the camp spot, so I was overwhelmed by the sound of cars non stop, people walking past & also looking right at my open van, no shade.
Not very peaceful.

Construction was also underway at the beach, so you could hear all the machinery moving sand around

Shaded spots in the park look very close together

Showers were the worst! ‚òπÔ∏è A small head on the wall that you can't adjust or move around. A simple shower head replacement could fix it

Pricey
showerReviews.author: Maia Love

showerReviews.reviewText:
Park is very nice kids love the waterslide and pool and the putt putt golf ,while we love the security of the park being fully fenced .
The main amenities block has had trouble with there septic system for the last two years in a row very bad smell and toilets have blocked occasionaly .
The amenities do need a good scrub lots of mould.
One of the main swings at the park remain broken although it was a very easy fix.
Lots of taps constantly leaking that need repairing.
And the power boxes on the sites need attention.
Staff in the office were very nice and helpful.
showerReviews.author: Lou Packer

showerReviews.reviewText:
Amazing location, especially in the ‚ÄúLakeview Villas‚Äù by the lagoon. Lovely views and easy access to the sandy lagoon shores and a short walk up towards Narrabeen Beach.

Villas themselves are fine, layout and amenities are as expected‚Ä¶but the furniture is badly worn and dirty. I hope they are replaced for the peak summer season when people will be paying an arm and a leg to stay here. BBQ area sill was also soiled badly with grease. Hilarious considering you are basically expected to do half the cleaning for them before you check out.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a beautiful holiday park in Narrabeen NSW. We stayed here for two nights during our road trip stopover from QLD to Melbourne.

The spacious, self contained cabin was clean tidy and comfortable, with full kitchen, good hot water and room heating etc.

This location is Ideal if you prefer peaceful and tranquil surroundings away from the city atmosphere.

From this holiday park, Sydney CBD, the Opera house, Sydney botanic Gardens etc are about 37 km and approximately 60 - 90 minutes drive,  depending on the time of the day & traffic congestion etc.

As such, whilst living in a peaceful quiet atmosphere here, you are not really too far from all the attractions and activities in Sydney either.

The staff here are good too.

Negatives: This beautiful cabin had strong mouldy smell, which perhaps could be attributed to the recent heavy rain & floodings etc. We used a can of Glen 20 which helped somewhat. Otherwise, everything was hunky-dory.
showerReviews.author: Malay Adhikari

showerReviews.reviewText:
I always stay at this hidden gem while in Sydney for work. The bush location means great views and quiet setting for the cabins, away from the noise of Sydney while still being right in the middle of it.
The Metro station a few hundred metres away means the restaurants in Chatswood are just minutes down the line.
The cabins are well priced, clean and self contained. The newer deluxe cabins and the glamping cabins are downright fancy and still very good value compared to a hotel in Chatswood or North Ryde. After hours check in is never a problem, and transport options include the nearby Metro, buses or there are always plenty of Uber drivers within minutes.
Good spot for keeping a hire car too, it's an easy area to drive around compared to much of the city.
The grounds has a laundry, several amenities blocks, swimming pool and there are plenty of bush walks in the national park. Caravan sites are well spaced and well above average if you pick your spot carefully.
showerReviews.author: Paul Golding

showerReviews.reviewText:
By far the rudest and most unprofessional staff we encountered during our lap of Australia. While the park itself is run down and poorly maintained, the dismissive and hostile attitudes of the reception staff and supervisor made an already poor experience significantly worse. The only real positive is the park‚Äôs proximity to the metro station.

We were allocated a caravan site directly beside an active construction zone and toilets that were out of order, with no warning given at check-in. The construction involved constant jackhammering, drilling, and heavy machinery operating from 6am through to 5pm. The noise was relentless, extremely loud, and completely unsuitable for anyone working remotely or travelling with children. I work remotely and homeschool my children, and the jackhammer noise made it impossible to hold work calls, concentrate, or complete online schooling. The Wi-Fi was also virtually nonexistent, compounding the disruption.

I went to reception first thing in the morning to politely request a move to a quieter site. Although the receptionist was superficially polite, she was unwilling to help in any meaningful way. She refused to check availability on the system, would not contact her supervisor, and insisted I return later‚Äîdespite me explaining that I had an imminent conference call and that the jackhammering had already begun. Her tone and attitude made it clear that our situation was not a priority.

As a direct result of being left beside an active jackhammer construction site, I was forced to cancel my conference call and lost income for the day, and my children were unable to attend their online tutoring. When I returned later to speak with the supervisor, her attitude was appalling. There was no greeting, no apology, and no acknowledgement of the impact of placing paying guests next to loud jackhammer construction. When I explained the disruption and financial losses incurred, she responded by abruptly flinging a site map across the counter and turning back to her computer screen, refusing to engage further or even make eye contact.

The same dismissive behaviour continued when I raised safety concerns about the showers, which fluctuated between dangerously hot and freezing cold. A receptionist repeatedly stated ‚Äúthere‚Äôs no issues‚Äù in a blunt, confrontational manner, showing zero concern even after I explained that my children had nearly been scalded.

Overall, the staff‚Äîparticularly the supervisor‚Äîdisplayed a complete lack of professionalism, empathy, or customer care. Being placed next to constant jackhammer noise without warning, combined with rude staff and poor maintenance, made our stay unnecessarily stressful.

Aside from the convenient location, this park is grossly overpriced. It appears the owner relies solely on location while tolerating unacceptable service standards and major disruptions to guests.
showerReviews.author: dawn bennett

We arrived and set up our caravan next to a toilet block which was closed for repairs and was woken up the next day by the sound of a kango which went on all day so we asked to be moved which wasn‚Äôt straight forward. I don‚Äôt know why I was put on this spot in the first place as there was plenty of spaces available. The tv room was dirty and like a sauna with the drinks machine making so much noise it was impossible to hear the tv and I noticed there were no smoke alarms in there on a couple of occasions I witnessed people smoking in the tv room and showers.The showers were hit  and miss but mainly cold even though they had plumbers there working on them.. All in in all good location for the train but way over priced for what it is.

showerReviews.reviewText: Park is pretty average and not visually appealing from the get go with stacks of shopping trolleys at the entry and rubbish and could use some TLC. Main things going for it are location, low cost and pet friendly. Need to book well in advance as 90% of the park is long term or permanent residents which are fairly rundown with some even partially demolished. Paid for a gas refill @ $30 and only got about 60% filled (based on our gas monitors) didn't dispute it as it's my word against theirs. Camp kitchen is super basic and amenities are an old shipping container, combined shower/tiolets, 3 female and 3 male, floors were always wet from the showers.
showerReviews.author: Steven Fox

Sydney Tourist Park staff are friendly and helpful, the amenities are cleaned daily, as is the camp kitchen. The grounds are also well maintained. The park has a mix of long term residents and caravaners and a fair amount of stored caravans.
It is quite peaceful considering it is located near two busy roads. Our caravan site had concrete pads for both the van and awning area. It accommodated our 21'van with ease. Larger vans were on nearby sites.
There is a mixture of small and large van sites.
We visited for just over a week and will use this park when we visit Sydney.

showerReviews.reviewText: During our camping, we decided to bring some takeout food to enjoy our first meal. Rose opted for pizza from Panago, while Alex and I went for takeout from Padmanadi. The campsite was peaceful and quiet, allowing us to enjoy our food while taking in the scenic surroundings. We also found the amenities to be clean and well maintained. Overall, it was a pleasant experience that we would recommend to others.

locations.title: Ingenia Holidays Sydney Hills
locations.address: ÓÉà269 New Line Rd, Dural NSW 2158

showerReviews.reviewText: This is the fourth time that my family and I plus our beloved large family dog, have stayed at Ingenia Sydney Hills - this year. Each time in a different cabin, all four cabins were maintained to the highest standards. On arrival, you will be greeted at reception by either the adorable Lily, or, the beautiful Louise. Anthea - Head of Housekeeping and Nadine, have consistently ensured our cabins have been serviced with efficiency, dedication and pride; keeping us with a plethora of white fluffy towels every few days. All of this was achieved with a continuous smile on each of their faces and an outstanding personalities to match their kind and welcoming hearts. Dave - Park Maintenance, planted the most beautiful plants outside KP10 Cabin, which boosted park morale significantly. Dave also promptly handled our ant issue (which is to expected due to park location), with ease and sincerity, which was greatly appreciated. Kylie - Park Manager, is singlehandedly the most hard-working manager I have ever had the pleasure of interacting with. Kylie's commitment to bettering the park and ensuring guest satisfaction is unparalleled and impressive. Her work ethic goes above and beyond what is expected, and she is an absolute delight to deal with and all of my family members look forward to interactions with Kylie on a daily basis. We have also stayed perviously at Ingenia - Avina (Vineyard), and by far Sydney Hills is superior in every aspect of the park. On behalf of myself and family I thank all staff for providing a welcoming, safe and happy environment.
showerReviews.author: Del Kirk

showerReviews.reviewText:
We are only rating this stay a 2 out of 5, solely because the beds were very comfortable and the reception staff were genuinely lovely and kind.

When we first checked into our room, it appeared tidy at a glance. However, upon closer inspection, there were several cleanliness issues. The windows were dirty, with visible mould on and around the window sills. Most surfaces were covered in dust, as though they hadn‚Äôt been properly cleaned in some time. The bathroom had mould on the ceiling and around the toilet, and the shower temperature was extremely inconsistent‚Äîconstantly switching between hot and ice cold with no stable temperature.

In the dining area, the sliding door was dirty with debris built up along the bottom, and there was an old, unpleasant smell. When we opened the cupboard to get the broom, there was a very strong and disturbing odour, as though something had died inside.

I raised these concerns with reception while we went out for a short time. The receptionist was very kind and helpful and notified the cleaning staff. However, when we returned, all the windows had been shut (I had intentionally left them open), and the mould was still present. I tested it with a baby wipe, and it came off very easily, indicating it had not been properly cleaned.

When I returned to reception to explain this, the cleaner was present. After showing them the dirty wipe and explaining that the mould had not been removed, the cleaner responded rudely and arrogantly, stating she had sprayed everything with bleach and shut the windows because dust was blowing in. I explained that dust does not cause mould and that I had taken photos before we left, which showed no change. She said she would come to the room so I could show her, which I did, but her attitude remained rude throughout the interaction.

We were also told to avoid the pool as its always having maitence done but never fixed (was green when we stay)

The room also had a lot of damage around, paint peeling from rail, slippery patio when it rained, paint peeling off wall, etc

We were extremely disappointed by both the cleanliness and the response, especially considering the price we paid and the fact that we had two young children staying in the room. The situation left us feeling upset, frustrated, and seriously considering leaving early.
showerReviews.author: Monique Shields

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had booked a powered ensuite site for two nights. It had not been cleaned very well. There were leaves strewn about near the entrance to the bathroom (which we swept on our own). The ensuite itself was showing its age with worn out fixtures, crumbling beams, and spider webs and dead insects stuck to the ceiling (a little cleaning with detergent could have prevented this).  The waste water drain was completely covered with leaf debris.  The grass next to our site had not been mowed for quite some time and was now full of weeds.  The access roads inside the park are quite narrow -- important when you're driving a 26ft motorhome. Unlike other Ingenia locations, park amenities for visitors are scarce -- one camp kitchen and a non-heated swimming pool.
We have really enjoyed our stays at other Ingenia RV parks such as Kingscliff and Bonny Hills.  Sadly, Sydney Hills was a huge disappointment. We will recommend our friends and family to avoid this location.
showerReviews.author: Darshan Jain

showerReviews.reviewText: As FT travelers we have stayed at many van parks across NSW, SA and Victoria. On the whole we find that parks located within cities are never very clean or amenable. We also find that the big van park chains are not that accommodating as there is always another customer rolling in. In saying that, however, our tight unattractive slot, and the atrociously dirty and unkempt amenities were on another level. I feel sorry for the families who come here seeking a ‚Äúholiday‚Äù.

locations.title: NRMA Ocean Beach Holiday Resort
locations.address: ÓÉà90 Sydney Ave, Umina Beach NSW 2257

showerReviews.reviewText:
As someone who grew up in South West Rocks for most of my life, I‚Äôve never had another place make me feel so at home.
This resort is absolutely gorgeous,the beach is breathtaking, the people are friendly and welcoming, and the whole atmosphere just feels comforting.

The only thing to note is the housekeeping: if you‚Äôre still in your room, they won‚Äôt clean or change your towels, so you do have to pick them up yourself. Apparently that‚Äôs just how their system works. Other than that, everything was amazing.

There‚Äôs a great local pub perfect for family dinners, and they even do buffets (we sadly missed it this time). There‚Äôs plenty for the kids the bouncing pillow was a huge hit and they practically lived on it. You can also rent bikes to ride together, and the park has plenty of space for caravans.
We stayed in a playground house, which was perfect for keeping an eye on the kids while cooking or relaxing.

They‚Äôve got electric BBQs that work well, plus the ones that come with the accommodation, though we couldn‚Äôt quite figure those out, the public one still did the job!

Overall, an easy 10/10. We‚Äôd definitely go again‚Ä¶ and again.
showerReviews.author: J G

showerReviews.reviewText:
We enjoyed a week here with our caravan.  It gets very busy on the weekends however there is plenty of space to relax in.
Our ensuite was a great choice, towels and shampoos supplied.
A short stroll and you are right on the sand and beautiful beach.  We didn't try the pool as it wasn't heated, we had a few cooler days.  The wifi is also very slow and difficult to pick up.
Staff in the office are really friendly and helpful.  The cafe is also really convenient with good coffee.
Overall we had an enjoyable stay.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We travelled up from Melbourne , first time staying at this park, the reason for the 3 overall star rating is because of the customer service we received (older woman, really lovely and helpful ),  room gets one star - the cabin was full of cockroaches and ants and extremely old, as a parent of 4 kids that are terrified of bugs this was extremely distressing for us after driving so far, the lovely lady mentioned above moved our cabin into one of the newer ones straight away.
Unfortunately this one also gets one star as there was a cockroach in that one too - we looked at other accommodation options in the area at that point but there was nothing available.
Location gets 5 star - close to all amenities, park is tidy and quiet. Kids were about to go on the jumping pillow and someone turned it off  (other children were already on there) , check in and checkout was a breeze.
showerReviews.author: Jazmin Saini

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed in a cabin, 2 adults and two older kids. It was compact but all we needed.
Great location for exploring the blue mountains with close access to the train line.
Staff were great, park is neat and the new camp kitchen is very nice. Probably the only free electric BBQ I have ever used that actually got up to a decent temperature.
I would definitely stay here again.

locations.title: Tandara
locations.address: ÓÉà13 Plassey Rd, Macquarie Park NSW 2113

showerReviews.reviewText: I was a bit worried after reading some of the other reviews but our stay was wonderful! The Tandara is gorgeous, especially the bathroom which has a bathtub and double shower. The bed is huge and extremely comfortable. We had lots of visitors from bush turkeys and a very friendly water dragon who sat with us on the deck. We didn't find any issue with noise or location like some of the other reviews mentioned, we could mainly just hear birds. Overall, a really relaxing stay and we will definitely come again!
showerReviews.author: AFC

showerReviews.author: AFC

showerReviews.reviewText:
Went here for 1 night with husband as a gift for his birthday.
The PROS:
- The bath and shower was nice, instant hot water
- Deck was nice to eat and sit outside with - not sure about views overlooking Lane Cove National Park but it was nice still
- Nice touch with the fake fireplace inside tent, good for cold evening
- Large fridge for storage
- Bed was soft and large
- Reasonably close to walking Riverside walking trail and picnic points

The CONS:
- We didn't know this, but the tent/area is directly under flight path. There were so many planes up until the late afternoon about 6pm, so it was quite noisy on the deck.
- At night still, you can still clearly hear traffic/main road sounds from tent
- The tent is weathered and tired-looking
- The tent strongly smelled like wet umbrella which is understandable being out against the elements for ages. You need to try ventilate as much as you can. The tent had mould, dust and webs along ceiling.
- Surfaces along bedhead, bedside tables, light shades needed wiping from dust
- Nowhere on site mentioned what type of cutlery would be provided  or not etc. Didn't know a microwave was provided. There was a kettle and toaster provided. I couldnt find, but there was no plates, no cutlery, any BBQ cooking utensils, dishwashing sponge/liquid, and no tissues. There was however 2 wine glasses, 3 mugs and 2 glass cups provided, with some tea/coffee + 1 milk. If you go, please bring those items to eat/clean with.
- Had a mouse in the tent which... freaked us out. Guess that's what you get #nature

Overall, it was OK the stay. Although you may feel physically you're out of Sydney being in the national park, the noise of traffic and planes made that impossible to completely take you there. You are literally next to the caravan park so just bear in mind you wont be secluded completely, you're pretty close to other people.  The tent needs a bit of a refurbishment and work and airing.
If you can, bring some mosquito repellent or coils as there is quite a number around or be mindful to close the tent net. And try not leave food scraps in bin outside next to BBQ as there was a possum that ransacked through it at night keeping us up and climbing on our tent. This review is trying to neutral and observant, if you decide to go just keep these pointer in mind for the visit.
showerReviews.author: Linda Ly

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked in for an anniversary treat. We are quite competent campers used to no amenities so when we found this we thought it would be the perfect compromise for a quiet weekend away with no tent pitching. What we actually discovered was that we would have been far more comfortable in our own tent and with our own gear.

The idea is lovely and probably well appointed when it was first built but unfortunately it has not been maintained.

The tent was shabby, the setting felt extremely over grown and scrubby with no view of the valley as described in the reviews. The powered  camp site next door was brighter and had a much nicer outlook. Perfect to pitch our tent. Had we brought it.

There was large mouldy patches on the tent and tears in the zips leaving large holes for any number of creepy crawlies to join us.

We were harassed by a family of brush turkeys who seemed far too comfortable for our liking and even hoped on the table to join us for dinner.

During he early evening we noticed a family of (bush) rats also making themselves at home near the large deck while we enjoyed our evening wine. Fair enough, we are in the bush. Can deal with wildlife...outside... I draw the line at the rats being inside nibbling on the soap left next to the sink and causing no end of disturbance. I would have happily, at this point relocated to the car to sleep had it not been for the warmth of the tent. THis was a positive as was the large single fridge inside and tv that we used to block out the road, air and rat noise.

At one point my husband and I discussed driving home it was that ridiculous.

Given the amount of weekends that are booked out for the coming year, I suggest some serious maintenance is done as it is certainly not the experience we were expecting. If you have a booking, please be aware it may not be as glamourous as the images... it was more Camping than Glamping

Would never recommend or stay again and will be asking for a refund at this point.
showerReviews.author: Alexandra O'Brien

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location is excellent restaurants , little cafes just a walk away, the rooms are old and dated , our sheets and towels changed once  in nearly two weeks, there is a little pool which you can cool off on the hotter days, and a large terrace area , but most of the chairs are broken. It's a shame this place been could be so much better, just needs to be refurbished.
One more thing if you haven't been to Bondi before its very hilly so take that into consideration.
Going down to the beach was lovely , back to the apartments was a different matter.

showerReviews.reviewText:
After a complete mess of a stay at the Paradox hotel, this was a breath of fresh air.
Reception led us through check-in, explaining all of our options. The rooms are nice, well laid out and the rain shower was an unexpected bonus.
Make sure to book into all of the available walks, morning and evening, strolling through the zoo after hours was a great and relaxing way to start and end your day.

locations.title: Checkers Resort & Conference Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà331 Mona Vale Rd, Terrey Hills NSW 2084

showerReviews.reviewText: Really happy with my stay.  Staff (Milan) were friendly and even at the end of his shift, he was smiling, wasn't watching the clock and helped to explain everything I needed to know (won't bore you with the details here).  The room was HUGE and clean and tidy.  I knew what to expect here so that is why the five stars; if you expect "Le Meridian" for these prices you are not being fair to the business.   It was great that the window was open when I arrived so I knew that it had fresh air.  Super hot water.  Plenty of towels.  Parking at the door (love old-school motels).  Will stay again for sure.
showerReviews.author: Mark McGuire

showerReviews.reviewText:
This has been our 2nd time with our children and grandchildren.  Its our home away from home. We love it here. Its not your 5star accommodation...but its still clean and the service is excellent.  Never had any issues...we stayed in the Pool Villa's and the beds are comfortable and rooms a re very spacious. The manager, omg...shes the bomb! John the Handyman is the BEST, always doing his best when you need something done! But, its also his people skills, very polite and considerate and very helpful. Also the receptionist she was so helpful and very inviting! When you have service like that, you always want to go back! My family and I will definitely be going there again hopefully soon.üòÄThankyou Avina staff for making our stay enjoyable.
Hopefully Avina will have more activities other than the games room and swimming pool. 10/10

showerReviews.reviewText:
Clean, comfortable and well equipped cabins. We were pleasantly surprised with how comfortable the bed was and quality toiletry provided. We have a small but adequate fridge, microwave and surprisingly an airfryer in the studio cabin, with sufficient cutlery and crockery for 4 (there were just the 2 of us).
Staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming.
Within 5 minutes drive to 2 shopping centres with Coles/Woolies/Aldi, takeaway shops and chemists.
Location was great for us, but we were there for work, which is 10 minutes from the park. It may be different for holiday makers, expecting easy access to Hawkesbury river, which is 15 to 20 minutes drive to the closest jetty.
In saying that, for the price it costed and good access to amenities, you cannot ask for anymore.
Thank you üôè

showerReviews.reviewText:
My wife booked this vacation through wot if, lack of air conditioning is NOT acceptable in the summer, took my 5 year old son and the air conditioning is great in the bedroom but he was meant to be in the bunk bed at the front, now I forfeit my sleep in a bed in the bedroom so he can sleep, its 40 degrees this is NOT acceptable at all. Had I known this i would not have booked this place.

The one she booked by accident is miles from anything I paid $1500 for a trip that was awful, no amenities, no room service and I had to clean my own dishes or else they would charge. When we came into our room the dishes were dirty and needed to be washed before we could use them i guess no one cleaned them before we came in? The floor is sticky and dirty and I was worried to walk around without shoes. The cabins are loud you can hear everything happening in the next room but need to be quiet past a certain time even walking around its loud.

The roads are crazy and broken very dangerous.

Since I've been here theres been a notice saying we have internet but no internet access at all, the photos on the site are a mixture of other places and misleading. I will be leaving early this place was a waste of money I could have spent the same amount and stayed at Novotel and had a better Christmas. Pool was filthy, sauna is broken i regret booking this place.

I will NOT be back!!
showerReviews.author: Steve Smith

showerReviews.reviewText:
We camped here recently. The staff were friendly, but that‚Äôs about the only positive.

The amenities block was extremely dirty ‚Äî clearly not being cleaned properly. There were old soap bars left behind, mud everywhere, filthy floors that looked like they hadn‚Äôt been mopped in ages, and spiders all over.

Our camp site was also dirty, with cigarette butts scattered around and a horrible sewerage smell that came and went all night. The kitchen was disgusting, and even the ensuite area was full of dust and cobwebs.

There‚Äôs not much for kids to do besides the pool, which thankfully was clean and nice. However, there were unsupervised children in the pool and some very rude older guests.

The road leading in is rough and not well maintained.
Laundry costs $6 per wash and $6 per dryer, but the dryer didn‚Äôt even dry the clothes properly.

Overall, we wish we had read the reviews before booking. I would not recommend staying here.
showerReviews.author: Manuela Scremin

showerReviews.reviewText: One of the best campgrounds there is!. Carrying the camping gear on the cruise is some additional effort, but all really worth it end of the day. Perfect swimming and Kayak spot for Summers, calm and picturesque back water lagoon !
showerReviews.author: Sunil Shivamurthy

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wonderful campsite with clean toilet and shower facilities. Fresh Lavazza coffee vending machine (very nice), ice creams, cold drinks and ice.
Very spacious grounds with no allocated areas.
Wonderful walking tracks, lots of good fishing spots for kids. Very safe unsupervised swimming areas for kid. Good and clean bbq facilities.
A wonderful spot for a 7 day camping trip. Highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Oliver Roths

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
We spent 2 nights camping at the basin. It was amazing. There is lagoon and beach to swim in. Free electric bbqs around to cook your food. Showers and toilets are clean. The Rangers onsite were very friendly and assisted us.

It does get quite busy as it is a popular spot. The ferry over was easy from palm beach.

Ice and bait are sold twice a day. There a few vending machines available that have coffee, water, icecream, snacks.
showerReviews.author: Lee

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful place to camp for the weekend and such a great getaway from Sydney!

Pros:
‚Ä¢	all the wallabies and birds  around (we even saw an echidna while hiking!).
‚Ä¢	 ferry to the campsite is convenient (only $10 AUD each way) and runs every hour.
‚Ä¢	the area is absolutely beautiful, with grass to camp on in designated spots
‚Ä¢	there‚Äôs one hot shower, but it‚Äôs coin-operated ($1 for  3minutes). I wish I had known this sooner!
‚Ä¢	The BBQs are super clean.
‚Ä¢	designated fire pits, but you need to book in advance.
‚Ä¢	the bay is gorgeous‚Äîtruly picturesque‚Äîand the water is lovely
‚Ä¢	 a great hike nearby

consider this:
‚Ä¢	pretty busy campground ( bring earplugs)
‚Ä¢	be aware of ticks

Other than that, it‚Äôs such a beautiful camping spot
showerReviews.author: Amanda C.

locations.title: Putty Beach Campground
locations.address: ÓÉàPutty Beach Rd, Killcare Heights NSW 2257

showerReviews.reviewText: very nice campground just an hour away from sydney. bookings are camping spots are limited so not very busy or empty. nice beach not far from the campground and a bushwalk. however beware of snakes lurking around in the bathrooms or in the bush. the shower has issues as the water is cold however despite that it's and nice go-to campground.
showerReviews.author: Shara Ahmed

showerReviews.reviewText: Great campground close to Sydney. Great facilities with clean flush toilets, shower, sink for washing, Barbie and picnic tables and a close access to the beach. Very lovely sunset we caught on the way in. Planning to do some walks tomorrow. Camp sites are a bit close to each other but separated by some trees and bushes. Was here Sun night and we were quite private.
showerReviews.author: Angelica Catalan

showerReviews.reviewText:
This campsite is very busy during the summer school holidays.

I really like it because there are a few tables and BBQs available for use if you don‚Äôt have your own table. All campsites have synthetic grass, making it easy to see the space allocated for your use. The toilets are clean, and there are plenty of garbage bins and recycling bins. The national park staff come every morning to clean the toilets and BBQs, and I even saw the garbage truck on Monday morning.

This campsite is located right next to the beach, where we were lucky enough to see a family of dolphins. There‚Äôs also a bushwalking track that starts nearby. The track is beautiful and easy to walk.

One downside is that there is only one outdoor shower. Additionally, the campsites are quite small and located very close to one another. While there‚Äôs a large parking area, you can‚Äôt reserve a parking spot when you book your campsite. On warm days, other visitors coming to the beach or walking track might take the spots near your site, meaning you may need to park further away from your tent.

Despite these minor drawbacks, I‚Äôm giving this campsite 5 stars because I would happily return again!
showerReviews.author: Tonya Boiko

showerReviews.reviewText: Cold water outdoor shower only. Lovely place though. Can highly recommend. Gas bbqs. Only 20 sites. Fake grass matting on each site. NP website shows dimensions of each site and max # of people per site. Lovely beach and walks very close.
showerReviews.author: Catriona Lamberton

showerReviews.reviewText: Cold water outdoor shower only. Lovely place though. Can highly recommend. Gas bbqs. Only 20 sites. Fake grass matting on each site. NP website shows dimensions of each site and max # of people per site. Lovely beach and walks very close.
showerReviews.author: Catriona Lamberton

showerReviews.reviewText:
Probably the fanciest campground I've stayed at! Flushing toilets with a visiting cleaner each morning, a cold shower and an outdoor sink, and an artificial turf site for dirt-free (ish) camping. Okay, the site costs as much as a hostel, but with a bunch of amenities and the sound of the ocean - it's worth it.

Spotty 4G reception, enough to message but you'll need to climb the hill for calls. Camped alone and felt totally safe, very family friendly and lots of locals around on the weekend.
showerReviews.author: Eliza Spencer

showerReviews.reviewText: Try to avoid this beach and campsite during Oct as there are millions of files here which totally ruined the otherwise very beautiful place  (near by little beach is not affected) Otherwise, the camp ground is nice and level ($34.85 for 2 people per night via online booking). Undercover BBQ areas, plenty of rubbish bins, Toilets with outdoor cold shower. 8 dollars parking which expired at midnight regardless of what time you pay for the ticket. So if you are staying for 2 days 1 night, technically you have to pay for 2 days parking. Now the parking machine accepts credit card and pay pass.
showerReviews.author: Phatara Tunhapong (Earth, Patrick)

showerReviews.reviewText: Very beautiful campsite. Less than 2 hours drive from Sydney. Plenty of things to do like trail hiking, fishing and swimming. Has a long stretch of beautiful beach and if you do the trail hike, there is a very beautiful private beach at the end. The campsite is near the town if ever you need to buy supplies and the bottemart and servo is just 7 minutes away. Theres plenty of covered picnic area with gas bbq tables. Clean toilets and an outdoor shower. A word of warning with local fauna. The birds will steal your food if you left it unattended and bring mosquito spray.
showerReviews.author: Hermes

locations.title: Bonnie Vale campground
locations.address: ÓÉà2 Seabreeze Lane, Royal Nat'l Park NSW 2232

showerReviews.reviewText: Bonnie Vale is a fantastic destination, especially suitable for school excursions and family trips. It is a family-friendly campground with guided kids‚Äô activities during school holidays, which makes it a great place for children to learn and have fun outdoors. The camping sites are comfortable and well-maintained, with flush toilets, hot showers, and drinking water available, ensuring a convenient stay. The location is also close to Jibbon Beach, where visitors can enjoy fishing, barbecues, and scenic hikes through the Royal National Park. With its safe environment, variety of facilities, and beautiful natural setting, Bonnie Vale is an excellent spot for both relaxation and adventure.‚Äù
showerReviews.author: Rasha Dwieb

showerReviews.reviewText:
Camping powered near water front $67.50
Parking $8 for 1 night $75.50 just to put a tent on the ground and charge you phone
Showers well I wanted a cold shower went to have a shower no cold water it's fixed water temp one nob so I thought il have a hot one then water stayed warm didn't get hot and pressure was bad I had to lay my head on the wall to get water on my head then after a 3 hour swarm of mossies at 6pm because there are stagnant ponds all around camp breeding the buggers I woke up next morning to recycle my beer and water bottles to see 2 small baskets at toilets overflowed with recyclables and the basket were that small not much bigger than 30ltr volume so I had to throw all my recyclables in the waste maybe the toilets at front of park mite be better this was the rear facilities luckily this time the gates were left open permanently and I didn't have to worry about being locked in like my last visit when I left at 10.02am and the code automatically disabled and I had to ring national parks to come down and let me out
showerReviews.author: Stephen Majchrzak

locations.title: Cattai Campground

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had such a great experience camping at Cattai Campground! The place is surrounded by beautiful nature and wildlife. We saw plenty of kangaroos, crows, lorikeets, and cockatoos during our stay. The facilities were clean and well-maintained, with toilets and hot showers available (a big plus). Electic BBQ is available. Campground is unmarked and unpowered.

There are lots of firepits around the campground, perfect for evening fires ‚Äî we made s‚Äômores under the stars, and it was absolutely perfect. ‚ú® The park rangers regularly go around to check bookings and make sure everything is in order, which made us feel safe and well looked after.

If you enjoy fishing, there‚Äôs also a nice spot nearby to cast a line.

We camped in late October, and the weather couldn‚Äôt have been better ‚Äî cool nights around 12¬∞C and warm afternoons at 24¬∞C. Couldn‚Äôt ask for a more relaxing weekend surrounded by nature. Highly recommend Cattai for families, couples, or anyone looking for a peaceful camping escape!
showerReviews.author: A Lobo

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cattai is a fantastic and well-maintained campground‚Äîdefinitely a step above many other national parks! Unlike others, this one offers great amenities including hot and cold showers (with a 5-minute timer), BBQ facilities, and a designated area for washing dishes.

The park is divided into two sections: a day-use area and a campground. Day-use entry is $8, while camping costs $39 per night for up to 3 people. A park ranger usually comes around 4:30 PM to check bookings, so make sure yours is confirmed.

Important to know: The park gate closes at 6 PM. To enter after that time, you'll need the access code provided in your booking confirmation‚Äîdon‚Äôt forget it!

One thing to note: this is one of the few parks where collecting fallen wood for fires is not allowed. Be sure to bring your own firewood if you plan on using the fire pit.

There‚Äôs plenty of space to spread out, and you'll likely spot lots of kangaroos roaming around. Overall, it‚Äôs a great camping spot‚Äîand I‚Äôll definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Thainara Neves

showerReviews.reviewText:
cattai campground is beautiful and very well maintained, the toilets, park (no litter), and bbq facilities are always clean. We were very unfortunate to have come during an electrical blackout which meant no hot water and no bbq faciliities, it was also a total fire ban so no way of cooking our food. The whole night was just plain boring and nothing like camping. They literally patrol the area every hour and go up to you to tell you to remind you its a total fire ban.

Please plan to when its not a fire ban. It‚Äôs right next to a large river, it shouldn‚Äôt be this helicoptered
showerReviews.author: Joseph D

It was a wonderful experience staying/camping here although on days when no fire allowed it could get a bit tricky as the electric burners take eternity to heat up or even cook anything.

There are clean toilets and washrooms. Bathing area available.

You can use kayaks or boats in the lake as well.

Lots of kangaroos can be seen roaming around in the mornings.

It‚Äôs a great idea to camp here if you want best of both worlds - Forrest and have toilets /bathing space too.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This would be a fantastic place to camp after the flood repairs are completed, it looks like it has been under repair for 3 years (based on the signs). Currently over half the grounds are fenced off, and this includes all access to the river and bush. The fences really ruin the scenery as they block the views of the river. Most of the bush at the back of the grounds is also closed which does not leave much to explore.

The good part is the rest of the campground is fantastic; showers are modern with hot water, and they are kept clean with daily cleaning. There is also a dedicated dish-washing sink.

The kangaroos are the highlight, they roam the campgrounds and picnic area, but watch out over night as they will inspect your camp site, so make sure you put away food.
showerReviews.author: Jason Munns

locations.title: Patonga Camping Ground

showerReviews.reviewText:
We arrived at night to camp and enjoy the day. The security guard at the gate was extremely kind and welcoming (even though that‚Äôs not his actual job ‚Äî which already says a lot about who is really fit to deal with guests).

The next day, after lunch, we went to pay for our stay and were met by Suzan at reception. She made the whole experience unnecessarily unpleasant, lecturing us that payment should have been done in the morning ‚Äî with a tone and attitude that felt more like disdain than customer service. She even seemed to take issue with my accent (I am Brazilian and speak English).

If this is how guests are treated in a tourist location, as if we‚Äôre inconveniencing the staff, perhaps it would be best to clearly display check-in and check-out rules on the website ‚Äî or better yet, offer online booking. That way, travelers who naturally arrive late on the road won‚Äôt be met with rudeness, and staff who don‚Äôt know how to deal with people can stay away from customers.

The location itself is beautiful ‚Äî the facilities are well maintained, with hot water and showers available. However, based on my experience (and looking at other reviews), the recurring issue seems to be the staff. And that can become a serious problem, especially considering this is a private campground where customer service should match the quality of the place.
showerReviews.author: Mayara Mayume

The next day, after lunch, we went to pay for our stay and were met by Suzan at reception. She made the whole experience unnecessarily unpleasant, lecturing us that payment should have been done in the morning ‚Äî with a tone and attitude that felt more like disdain than customer service. She even seemed to take issue with my accent (I am Brazilian and speak English).

If this is how guests are treated in a tourist location, as if we‚Äôre inconveniencing the staff, perhaps it would be best to clearly display check-in and check-out rules on the website ‚Äî or better yet, offer online booking. That way, travelers who naturally arrive late on the road won‚Äôt be met with rudeness, and staff who don‚Äôt know how to deal with people can stay away from customers.

The location itself is beautiful ‚Äî the facilities are well maintained, with hot water and showers available. However, based on my experience (and looking at other reviews), the recurring issue seems to be the staff. And that can become a serious problem, especially considering this is a private campground where customer service should match the quality of the place.
showerReviews.author: Mayara Mayume

showerReviews.reviewText:
Peaceful Riverside Escape at Patonga Camping Ground

I recently stayed at Patonga Camping Ground and had a fantastic experience. The location is absolutely stunning ‚Äì right on the river with easy access to the beach, making it perfect for kayaking, fishing, or just relaxing by the water.

The campsite itself is well-maintained, with clean amenities including toilets, showers, and BBQ areas. Sites are spacious, and there's a mix of powered and unpowered spots depending on your needs. The vibe is peaceful and family-friendly, which made for a relaxing stay.

It's also within walking distance to the Patonga Hotel, where you can enjoy a good view. The nearby walking trails through Brisbane Water National Park are a bonus if you‚Äôre up for some light hiking and amazing coastal views.

Highly recommend it for a weekend escape or a longer stay if you want to unwind surrounded by nature. Book ahead, as it can get busy during peak times!
showerReviews.author: falasik

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had an incredible time at Patonga Camping Site and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing getaway surrounded by nature.

First and foremost, the facilities were outstanding‚Äîthe toilets and showers were exceptionally clean and well-maintained, which made the stay very comfortable. Whether you‚Äôre in a caravan or a tent (like we were), you have the option of powered or unpowered sites, and water connections are conveniently located next to your setup.

The swimming area was a fantastic addition, perfect for cooling off and enjoying the natural beauty of the location. The views from the site were stunning, offering a peaceful and picturesque backdrop throughout our stay.

Another highlight was the Boat House Cafe, just a short walk from the camping site. The food quality was excellent, and it added a nice touch to our trip to have such a lovely dining option nearby.

The site is also incredibly well-equipped. Bins are provided everywhere, making it easy to keep the area clean, and the electric BBQs were a great convenience for preparing meals outdoors. It also has two tennis courts!

Overall, Patonga Camping Site is beautifully maintained, well-organized, and offers everything you need for a wonderful camping experience. We can‚Äôt wait to visit again!
showerReviews.author: Hadi Darvishi

locations.title: Bents Basin Campground

showerReviews.reviewText:
A family friendly campground complete with essential amenities, view, and nature exploration. We came here as a big group and didn't disappoint! We needed to book way before though so everyone would be able to get a booking. Were about 10 families. We booked the kitchen and dining area which had enough essentials for storing our foods and cooking. The dining had enough seating and tables for our group, though at night the dining lights didn't work. It wasn't that a big inconvenience though.

The campground itself had more than enough space not just for our group but for other families too to camp out. It was well-equipped with a barbecue and campfire pits. There's also trees that served as shade. It was our first time camping as a small family and we couldn't be happier of the experience. Our toddler was so happy roaming around with friends but we still felt that he was safe as the roads weren't too wide inside the campground and there were barriers to every part.

Restrooms were just enough for the place's capacity. I like the idea of timed hot water. Win win for both the guests and the environment!

We also loved the opportunity to hike by the lake. It was accessible if you're not used to hiking like our family and with little ones with you. The view going and by the lake was stunning!

It was a wonderful experience. We will surely be back as a family. For a very minimal price, it was surely worth it! Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: Jean Martelino

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellent place for novice campers like us. Full amenities available, hot showers (3 min limit), proper toilets and even a kitchen {must be booked).  With a basin to play in, the children will be happy too. Sadly, that means it's really popular and can get crowded in holidays.

The camp ground are nice and mowed but most are not terribly level, so a way to level your tables and kitchens will be necessary.

We saw a wombat and an echidna! Wake to the music of birds too!
showerReviews.author: Amos Hoe

showerReviews.reviewText:
Camped two nights at Bents Basin Campground with family friends. This location is roughly 40 minutes from Blacktown in Western Sydney, has a clean toilet and shower block and good amenities. This includes an electric BBQ (however I only spotted one electric BBQ), several open fire BBQ spots and a short drive to the basin. While we didn't partake in water activities (kayaking, swimming ans fishing), these can all be done here - conditions permitting. Overall, good campground to take yourself and your family for a slower pace.
Notes: You need to bring your own drinking water; there is a single powerpoint in the female bathroom where you can recharge your electronics.
showerReviews.author: Brian & Natasha Jusuf

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great campsite. Right next to the river. All the camping spots are great (they are not marked). There are fire pits installed all over the place. You can set up camp near one, just need to bring your firewood. No collection allowed.

Facilities are clean and well maintained. Hot showers are timed to 5mins. There are a couple of water taps across the campground so you don't have to go all the way to the facilities to get water if you need it.

Great for kids to play around. We saw a wombat roaming around near the camp at night.

The basin is walking distance from the camp. Beautiful views in the morning. Can get busy during the day on the weekends.

Rangers are always around and monitoring the place. There are still parts of the national park and tracks closed for repairs. You can still see the remains from the previous flood damage.

There is very limited phone coverage in the area. There can be a lot of flies during hot days.
showerReviews.author: Asanka Deshapriya

locations.title: Little Beach Campground

showerReviews.reviewText:
Little Beach, Bouddi
Total rating: 14/25 ‚õ∫

Location:‚õ∫‚õ∫‚õ∫‚õ∫
Solitude:‚õ∫
Amenities:‚õ∫‚õ∫‚õ∫‚õ∫
Wildlife:‚õ∫‚õ∫
Access:‚õ∫‚õ∫‚õ∫

Highlights: camping 100m from the beach
Lowlights: picking insects out of my tent

Located in Bouddi National Park, a quick drive from Sydney. Short ~10 minute walk in, but you need to carry everything or do multiple trips. Location so close to Sydney means it gets busy. At first I was a bit disappointed with how rocky the beach was but the rocks are covered in quite soft plant growth and the lack of sand means the water is really clear. Beach was only 100m from the campsite which was awesome. Campgrounds have toilets, electric BBQ and picnic tables. Saw a wallaby and some sort of bush turkey which rummaged through my neighbours tent, though a lot of insects (though limited mosquito's which is a win). Overall a good site, though you have to share.
showerReviews.author: Nicholas

locations.title: Mantra Parramatta
locations.address: ÓÉàAnd, Cnr Parkes St, Valentine Ave, Parramatta NSW 2150

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here twice in November. Both times the air-conditioning did not work. On the second occasion myself and others I was travelling with asked for room changes and we're advised there were no other rooms available. As it was 36¬∞ We then asked for a fan, it took about 5 hours and repeated asking for me to get one. Others still did not get one provided despite the hitel stating they were available and had to walk to kmart to purchase one themselves. The staff did not seem to overly care and just kept advising that either someone had looked and the air con worked or "there's people looking". It was not fixed in the 4 nights I stayed. When i used the bath and emptied it, it flooded the bathroom so had to let the water out bit by bit. There was an incident where the elevators power tripped and they ceased working. When we asked if we could use the fire stairs to get to our rooms, they said they didn't know where they were or if they could access them which was highly concerning should there be a fire. Amenities are ok with a small gym and pool. Dinners were nice and there is an adequate buffet breakfast. After the first night the sheets felt weird and like they were ill fitting, looked down and the bottom sheet only covered half the bed. Disappointingly this seems to be the standard the last few times I have stayed here.
It's a very good location (depsite hearing trains all night due to poor soundproofing) and convenient otherwise I think this place would have gone out of business by now.
showerReviews.author: TheTahnz6

showerReviews.reviewText:
Usually a great stay, this time however was in room. 221 and the bath/shower floods, the AC didn't work (it was 40 degrees) being warmer weather when the pool was being used outside it was not very peaceful in the room. The bed was very uncomfortable and the end corners were raise up as if curled due to the sheets being ill-fitting. No additional pillows in the room, just the two on the bed itself. The cleaning service did not empty bins or restock tea/coffee across my 3 day 2 night stay.

The buffet breakfast was adequate with a modest selection hot hot foods, Bacon, chicken sasuage, scrambled eggs, hashbrown, baked beans and salted mushrooms. There is a small selection of cereals and pasties and toast. Machine coffee, tea, juices (apple, orange and pineapple) available as part of the buffet and Barista coffee for purchase through the bar.

Overall it was not up to the same standard as previous visits based purely on the poor state of the room and no turn down service. I've stayed here a few times and hoping this was a once off poor experience as the location is great, near the train station and just a short work from work office, river and good food and shopping  precincts.
showerReviews.author: Samuel Tumes

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice place. Clean rooms, professional staff and they provide clean basic amenities like bedsheets and blankets. No other amenities are there. But that is fair as its a hostel. If you book private room I do believe you get more amenities. Kitchens are nice and they have adjoining restaurant/cafe which is decently priced. I enjoyed my stay here and booked more stays with YHA in two other cities based on experience here. Will be back soon!

locations.title: YHA Sydney Harbour - The Rocks
locations.address: ÓÉà110 Cumberland St, The Rocks NSW 2000

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great value. Visited Spring this year, family of three. This place is so family friendly and very impressed with facilities - they are not high end as it is a hostel however everything clean, simple and just made everything super convenient for our trip. We felt so comfortable during breakfast times with our preschooler because of the chill/unpretentious vibe.

Bathroom cleanliness however for our room was not great :/. It is the reason for not giving five stars, the issue was the black mould in nearly all the grout lines of the shower. I actually felt a bit upset when we got there the first night but my son loved sleeping in the bunk bed and we didn't know if we could get another room with bunk bed. We were at the end of the hall on the first level, and opposite us was a communal bathroom that was cleaner than ours with no mould. I mention this as I hope YHA take this on board to fix this issue/maybe need to regrout that particular shower? The bed was comfy and temperature was good otherwise. Shower pressure was also good.

I would like to thank the staff for making our stay sooo wonderful too  The music on the rooftop with dinner and the view..was a highlight of our trip. Would love to return to YHA Harbour if hopefully we can have a cleaner bathroom next time!
showerReviews.author: J T

showerReviews.reviewText: My stay wasn‚Äôt bad. The toilet and shower were big and clean, but the room was small and hot with no air-conditioning. No luggage storage. I booked a non refundable one through booking.com but something went wrong with my work unexpectedly, so I couldn‚Äôt make it on the day I scheduled to check in but still needed to pay the full price. So I politely explained the situation and asked her if there‚Äôs anything she could do for me and she said ‚ÄúIf you book a non refundable room that means you need to think before you book.‚Äù I‚Äôve been working in hospitality for quite a long time as well, can‚Äôt believe she spoke like that to her future customer.

locations.title: lyf Bondi Junction Sydney
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 5/11 Hollywood Ave, Bondi Junction NSW 2022

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed in lyf Bondi the first time for a weekend holiday and I was very happy with my stay. My room was quite spacious, comfy and had all the amenities I needed. The location was so convenient and located right next to Westfield mall, lots of shops, restos and public transportation. I was traveling alone and I felt very safe to go around even late at night. They also had few inhouse events in the propery at the time like taking photo with Santa and a band playing live music - such a vibe! A big shoutout to Christian, Timo and the whole team for a warm welcome! Happy holidays!
showerReviews.author: Hannah Meryl

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location is excellent, with easy access to the city centre and beaches like Bondi and Bronte. The hotel is right next to the shopping centre and close to Bondi Junction‚Äôs main area, which makes everything very convenient. The property itself is beautiful and offers useful facilities such as a shared kitchen, laundry room, and the option to store your luggage at reception if your room isn‚Äôt ready for check-in.

The room is small, but functional and cosy. I liked it! The shower is great as well; I just want to mention that due to the design of the shower screen, someone from outside can see the silhouette of the person showering. It didn‚Äôt bother me, but I think it‚Äôs worth noting for other guests. I also missed having basic utensils like plates and cutlery in the room, which would have made simple meals much easier.

Regarding the staff, my experience was mixed ‚Äî some team members were very attentive, while others were not as friendly or helpful.

A few aspects, however, were disappointing. Breakfast was one of the weakest I‚Äôve had in a hotel, with very few options and only sachet coffee available, with no machine or anything more substantial. The room cleanliness also fell short ‚Äî the shower had visible marks and the floor clearly hadn‚Äôt been vacuumed.

The biggest downside for me was the lack of housekeeping throughout the entire stay. I understand it may be part of an eco-friendly policy, but I believe there are other ways to support the environment without compromising guest comfort. I asked at reception if it would be possible to have at least the towels changed or the bins emptied; they told me yes, but it never happened.

Overall, unfortunately, it‚Äôs not a hotel I would return to anytime soon.
showerReviews.author: Maria Luiza
