showerReviews.reviewText:
We had two rooms booked as a family of four and this is definitely not suitable for staying as a family.  The showers have transparent glass on two sides that basically spotlights the person having a shower and gives no privacy whatsover.  The attention to detail was also lacking with the four of us given no extra toilet rolls for the three nights, and only two cups and one spoon across the two rooms (with two sticks of instant coffee and two stick of sugar) for a three night stay .  Basically you felt like you had to go hassle the reception staff for everything.  Also as room service is only two days a week, you end up using a wet towel and wet floor mat the whole time... Washing/drying is $8 ($4 for members).  The parking is $60 a day at a car park about 200m away.  I was able to find a car space so that was good.

There are three 15min parking spaces In front of the hotel for setting down your luggage and check-in.  Westfield shopping centre is just behind and has a lot of food options nearby.

This is a great option if your travelling alone, but if you're travelling as a family, look elsewhere.

They also don't do twin-bedding so one king size and if you're sleeping you have to hurdle over the other person.

On a positive side, the block out blinds are amazing and kept the sun out and it's close to good public transport options.
showerReviews.author: Scene by SS

locations.title: The Blue Hotel Bondi
locations.address: ÓÉà113-115 Hall St, Bondi Beach NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am clueless as to how this is a 4 star hotel, but perhaps it shouldn't be open while it is an active construction site. Maybe the joke is on me for staying here in the off season?
I am luckily an early bird, but from 7am onward there was hammering and loud drilling directly below or above me (difficult to discern considering how loud it was). It will probably be a quieter stay in a couple of months in the warmer season since it's a popular neighborhood for the beach, but this was not a positive experience overall. I tried to call to complain about the noise and the number provided didn't work, plus the lobby didn't open until 9am - so there wasn't much I could do... if i didn't have to pack to leave, I would've gone elsewhere.

Also the bathroom needed significant updating, lots of flooding from showering and using the sink (really), the handles in the shower were falling off. So if you just need a place to sleep, the bed is great. The rest needed some TLC.

Pictured is the ceiling in the hallway leading to my room, it is falling off.

I travel a lot for work and I‚Äôm generally not someone to write a review like this, but I cannot stress enough what a mistake staying here was. It really soured the end of a lovely three weeks in Australia, most of which was spent in Sydney.
showerReviews.author: Jess Lechtenberg

locations.title: Original Backpackers Hostel Sydney Australia
locations.address: ÓÉà162 Victoria St, Potts Point NSW 2011

showerReviews.reviewText:
We are two Canadians, stayed for 10 nights as we got settled for our working holiday in Australia. Leo at reception was a massive help in assisting us with extending our stay, thanks Leo!! The staff are all so helpful and friendly, shoutout to Lune and Henry as well.

Rooms:
First we stayed in a 6-bed dorm which was good, your typical dorm room. Bottom bunks have curtains, top bunks have access to the tops of the lockers to set your things, and there is a fan and mini fridge. We extended our stay and moved to a private + ensuite. The room was great, with a fan, mini fridge, and TV. We extended again and moved to a private with no ensuite, which still had the fan, fridge, and TV.

Bathrooms:
Showers and bathrooms are often busy but there are lots around the hostel, so something will usually be available. With high traffic they can sometimes get dirty, as with most hostels. The staff are visibly working hard to clean every day, and they stay on top of it. Towels are provided!

Kitchen:
Breakfast is provided every day from 8am to 10am (toast, peanut butter, jam, marmalade, butter, vegemite, and some cereal options with milk), and dinner is provided on Tues/Thurs/Sat at 8pm. Dinner rotates between pasta, rice/veggies, and BBQ. Thank you to Dave for cooking!

The kitchen is closed every day at 10am for about an hour so staff can clean, so be aware when you‚Äôre planning breakfast.

Staff are very good and making sure people leave the courtyard by 10pm so it‚Äôs quiet near the rooms. People usually move to the TV room or front porch to hang out past 10.

They offer daily activities on their WhatsApp channel, such as city walks, picnics, pub trivia, and basketball at a local outdoor court.

We will definitely stay here again!
showerReviews.author: Sara McEwan

showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff are friendly and helpful.
If you run into any trouble, even the other guests will jump in to help you out.
The showers and toilets are perfectly fine.
Of course, it‚Äôs not as spotless as a luxury hotel, but the staff clean thoroughly every morning and evening, which leaves a very good impression.

One time, I accidentally put coins for the dryer into the laundry machine. When I asked the staff about it, they kindly covered the cost without showing the slightest annoyance. The money I put into the laundry machine couldn‚Äôt be retrieved, but they just laughed and said, ‚ÄúWell, someone‚Äôs got a free laundry then,‚Äù which really made me feel relieved.

There are many female guests as well, so I‚Äôd recommend this place to anyone, regardless of gender.

locations.title: Nomads Sydney

showerReviews.reviewText:
The best part is the location. Unfortunately the remaining details are lacking. Metal bunk beds were very noisy and unstable. Sheets were clean and comfy. I slept on the top bunk bed and unfortunately had no power plug to charge my stuff. Couldn't find lockers in the room, but also didn't look for long after the first night before booking another place to stay. There were large metal drawers underneath the bottom bunk bed which I believe were supposed to hold out stuff, but I wouldn't keep my clothes or bags there as it was very rusty. Aircon worked fine and temperature was pleasant. There are no alternative lighting to the ceiling lights so at night if people are asleep you either use your phone (at this point with no batteries) or try your luck in the dark. That was the ok part, and now comes the not as good one.
I had trouble checking (11pm), the staff took a few 20 mins to fix the issue and after asking me the same questions 6-7 times (as they didn't know what to do) they had to ask another staff for help. The second person just wanted to enjoy the party next door (mee too!). Unfortunately bathrooms were dirty or lacked toilet paper on the night and morning I was there. I understand I didn't give the hostel much opportunity to change my mind before fleeing the place, but my friends continued there and didn't have much positive points to share. I understand the vibe of a party hostel is to just enjoy and relax and it is my mistake too for trying, but no toilet paper at 8am and the black mold and pee smell in the showers were a bit much for my hostel vibes. Cleanliness is the bare minimum, I believe. Unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend. But the linked bar next-door is very good.
showerReviews.author: Aline Campos

locations.title: Summer House Sydney City

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would like to start off and say that I have been to hostels over the world in Morocco, Madrid, Amsterdam, Cairns, etc. I have always found anything above an 8 star rating on Hostelworld to be very reliable which it typically is.

However, that is totally inaccurate for when it comes to this place. I will say that the location is unbeatable, the bed is nice and it is very affordable. With that being said, you get what you pay for.

I have never stayed in a hostel where the hallways consistently smell disgusting and the bathrooms are so disgusting. There‚Äôs approximately 30-35 people sharing two bathrooms on a floor. There‚Äôs no soap for the hostel shower and one night I witnessed a ball of pubes on the soap rack.

I completely avoided using the restrooms here and would use them whenever I go out to restaurants. I would HIGHLY recommend paying even up to $20AUD more a night to stay somewhere better. I wish I would have.
showerReviews.author: Riley Simonz

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would like to start off and say that I have been to hostels over the world in Morocco, Madrid, Amsterdam, Cairns, etc. I have always found anything above an 8 star rating on Hostelworld to be very reliable which it typically is.

However, that is totally inaccurate for when it comes to this place. I will say that the location is unbeatable, the bed is nice and it is very affordable. With that being said, you get what you pay for.

I have never stayed in a hostel where the hallways consistently smell disgusting and the bathrooms are so disgusting. There‚Äôs approximately 30-35 people sharing two bathrooms on a floor. There‚Äôs no soap for the hostel shower and one night I witnessed a ball of pubes on the soap rack.

I completely avoided using the restrooms here and would use them whenever I go out to restaurants. I would HIGHLY recommend paying even up to $20AUD more a night to stay somewhere better. I wish I would have.
showerReviews.author: Riley Simonz

showerReviews.reviewText: I had a great stay here! The hostel is really nice and it‚Äôs super easy to make friends thanks to the events they organize and the friendly, inclusive atmosphere. The bathrooms are clean most of the time, with several cleaning shifts during the day. They‚Äôre not very big and could use a bit more space to put your things, but it‚Äôs not a big issue. The beds are a little small but still comfortable, and the lockers offer plenty of storage space. Overall, a very good experience ‚Äî I would definitely stay here again!
showerReviews.author: Franco Bernardi

locations.title: Maze Backpackers

showerReviews.reviewText:
Room for two people was quite small. The room smelled bad and wasn‚Äôt properly clean; one of the duvets even had a blood stain. There are no power outlets near the bed , they‚Äôre on the opposite side of the room. The fan is placed very high up in a corner and only reaches the top bunk. Poor ventilation overall. You can hear a lot of noise from the street and also from inside the hostel. The bathrooms weren‚Äôt very clean either, and the cleaning in general was far from regular. The showers didn‚Äôt have good hot water. There is also no elevator, which makes it inconvenient if you have heavy luggage.
The only positives I can mention are the friendliness of the reception staff ,  the guys were really nice, I have to say , and the location is good too. But I wouldn‚Äôt stay here again. You can leave your luggage in a storage room whether you arrive early or after check-out if you still have time to spend in the city.
showerReviews.author: Aldana

I had a pretty bad experience here. The room was a lot smaller than in the pictures, and the place overall felt old and not very clean.
They do offer plenty of free activities, which is nice, but they seem to forget about the basics, cleaning and essential things for living, and we only got one towel for four days. When we asked for another, they said we‚Äôd have to pay for it.
On top of that, the staff were quite cold and unfriendly, which made the whole experience even worse. Sadly, we wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location , lots of restaurants nearby and the museum station is walkable. The staff were friendly and even offered us a twin room on the final two days honoring the same price as the 4 person dorm.

The hot water was scalding in the bathroom sinks and the cold water wouldn‚Äôt run. Additionally, it was quite difficult controlling the shower temperature - either too hot or cold.

The worst part of this hostel is the $20 per key they charge. Card payment (with 1% surcharge) was accepted but the money was returned back to us only as cash - which is absurdity. I‚Äôve stayed at hostels in Melbourne that charged me card deposit but the money was returned back on the card. I was left with $40 at the end of my Australia trip that I didn‚Äôt have an opportunity to use before boarding my international flight

The hostels in Australia don‚Äôt provide even shampoos, body gel or cooking oil , salt and basic condiments in the kitchen. I‚Äôve stayed at hostels in Canada this year that offered better services and value for money and the Aussie hospitality can be improved
showerReviews.author: Narayan Sidarth

locations.title: Tequila Sunrise Hostel Sydney

showerReviews.reviewText: The location of the hostel is excellent ‚Äî right in the middle of the city! It‚Äôs surrounded by so many nice restaurants where you can easily grab a bite. The beds are the cherry on top ‚Äî almost double-sized with curtains, your own light, and power plugs! It honestly felt magical. The staff are super nice and the bathrooms are really clean. The only thing I‚Äôd improve is the storage area ‚Äî the lockers or drawers for food are quite small. Other than that, it‚Äôs a great place to stay!

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hostel was great - I wish I could stay here longer!
It's located in the middle of the town, in the Chintown and Koreatown region. The service was perfect: shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, towel, breakfast and dinner provided!
The bed was comfortable and the pillow was amazing.
Stuff and people were very friendly.

Unfortunately, there is no lift, so if you have a large suitcase and a llt lf luggage, just ask for help :)

I would definitely come back!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Privileged location, affordable price. Other than that, the rooms have a huge number of beds, so what you‚Äôre really renting is just your bed and two boxes to store your belongings.

They didn‚Äôt give me a blanket, so I was cold all night, and when I got up to ask for one, they told me reception closed at 9.

Check-in was pretty strict; they didn‚Äôt even let us into the room a few seconds earlier.

The shower bathrooms are a bit odd since they aren‚Äôt separated from the regular toilet area, and you can‚Äôt lock the door. This means you have to start getting dressed inside the shower itself.

Super clean overall, quite calm and quiet for sleeping, though they turn the lights off a bit late.

locations.title: Pacific House Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà50-58 Sir John Young Cres, Woolloomooloo NSW 2011

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the nicest hostels I've stayed at. Clean rooms, communal areas showers and bathrooms. Most of the staff were really friendly and helpful. Lots of events on and it's in a great location.

The kitchen was a little bit small for so many people to cook and stire food in. In summer the rooms were a bit too hot without aircon.
showerReviews.author: Joe Henley

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the nicest hostels I've stayed at. Clean rooms, communal areas showers and bathrooms. Most of the staff were really friendly and helpful. Lots of events on and it's in a great location.

showerReviews.author: Joe Henley

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had been recommended to stay here by a family member and I am glad I did.

The location was fantastic. The showers and bathrooms were great and I did not have to wait in line for them. The free breakfast was yum.

I was most impressed by the excellent customer service I received when I asked to be moved rooms, after an unpleasant interaction with someone in my first room.
The Italian staff member who helped me was kind and understanding and helped me to quickly change rooms, where I was grateful to stay for the remaining two nights of my trip.

Thank you, Pacific House Hostel!
showerReviews.author: Veronica Lush

showerReviews.reviewText: This was a very good hostel for my stay in Sydney - centrally located and a twenty minute walk to the Opera House. The private room was very spacious and quiet at night. Bathrooms and showers were clean and always had hot water. A lot of social areas in the hostel, but it was very busy and the kitchen area was always packed. Breakfast was also very busy at 7:30am, but they did have gluten free bread and cereal which was excellent!
showerReviews.author: Amy S

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pacific House Hostel was my first home in Australia and the place where I found a family.
I never felt alone here. On my very first day, it was actually Stephanie from the staff who made me feel welcome and at ease.

The entire team is incredibly kind, friendly, and always available to help.
The hostel is super clean, with rooms and bathrooms cleaned multiple times a day.
There‚Äôs a large, cozy TV room with comfy sofas, plus other chill areas where you can relax or meet new people.

Honestly, it feels more like a hotel than a hostel, even the entrance hall has sofas where you can relax or wait for your check-in in comfort.

The rooms are spacious, with lockers and beds equipped with privacy curtains, which I really appreciated.
Every day there are different activities organized by the staff that you can join, making it easy to socialise and have fun.

Rating: 10/10. Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: Elios Pistis

some appliances were broken and bathrooms/showers need maintenance work. The owner seems to only be in it for the money.

showerReviews.reviewText: Dear public, positives are warm working shower and toilet. Decent cooking facilities. Kings Cross location is ok. Upstairs rooms away from street noise. Negatives, black mould, dirty stained floors furniture and mattresses. Broken slats on bunks, torn mattresses. Police are called to take care of situations rather than clever handling of all guests. Can't sleep.  Overbooking beds, drunkenness. Asked for a quieter room was denied an upgrade, while in the same room people were moved to quiet single rooms on the house. So I asked for refund, no such luck. Oh and then called the " complainer and argued with by staff who like to get drunk of an evening. So toughen up snowflakes, management likes to argue with customers.

locations.title: 790 on George Backpackers

showerReviews.reviewText:
790 George Hostel is the definition of ‚Äúit does the job and does not apologize for it‚Äù. My room looked like it had seen some things, definitely dated, but it was clean and the AC worked like a champion. That alone puts it above half the hostels on Earth.

The staff is the real MVP here. Super friendly, actually helpful, and they kept fixing the eternal problems with washers and dryers like they were running a mini superhero team. Seriously, they smile while doing laundry maintenance. That deserves a medal.

Breakfast is complimentary in the most literal sense. Cereal or a sandwich with chocolate spread or jam. Coffee and tea pretending to be enough to wake you up. It will not blow your mind, but it will keep you alive.

If you need a bed in the center of Sydney and you are traveling on a budget, this place is perfect. Nothing fancy, nothing fake, just a solid sleep with great people running the show.
showerReviews.author: Wade Wilson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Its a really solid hostel. Nothing flash, but very functional and meets your basic needs. Props to the young aussie lady and two dudes with cool hair styles for running a tight ship and been ultra helpful and friendly on the reception desk. Also the other woman with a dope playlist and good fashion sense. And props to the housekeeping team, its a thankless jobs but you guys look like you actually enjoy it and the cleanliness and team camaraderie didn't go amiss. (Sorry don't know names) Shout out to Magna too the in house magician with a paint brush.
The place has character and your not served my robots or zombies. Also unlike Azzuro Darling Harbour this place isn't falling apart and with foul smelling drains. Breakfast is cheap and cheerful, bed frames squeaky but beds nice and comfy, ample storage space in locker and decent showers designed in a way that doesn't flood the entire floor after only a few uses, unlike many other hostel I stayed in. Room always felt fresh and air con worked fine. Great central location a minutes walk from Central Station and Chinatown. With World Square Coles and Market City eateries and shops close by. And the light rail line running parallel to hostel. Would definitely recommend for short or medium term stays on a budget. :) Will stay again if I return to Sydney. Keep up the good work!
showerReviews.author: Luke Hartley

Breakfast is cheap and cheerful, bed frames squeaky but beds nice and comfy, ample storage space in locker and decent showers designed in a way that doesn't flood the entire floor after only a few uses, unlike many other hostel I stayed in. Room always felt fresh and air con worked fine. Great central location a minutes walk from Central Station and Chinatown. With World Square Coles and Market City eateries and shops close by. And the light rail line running parallel to hostel. Would definitely recommend for short or medium term stays on a budget. :) Will stay again if I return to Sydney. Keep up the good work!
showerReviews.author: Luke Hartley

locations.title: Hawkesbury Rest Area Northbound

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm giving this place 4 stars not because of quality of amenities or services available but for its minimalistic charm and beautiful location right on the banks of the Hawksbury River . Designed primarily for caravans , campervans and boats. It  boasts enough space to cater for all these. I've been there 4 times recently with my mobile home and never had a problem getting a parking space. If your staying for a night or more get stocked up with supplies because other than a mobile coffee van there is nothing else. There are rudimentary toilets . I think around 4 to 6. Using them is akin to using the toilets on a plane; always queues , unisex and void of any home comforts. If you use your imagination and pretend you are actually going on a plane trip to an exotic location its helps deal with it better . Oh, and be nice to your neighbours too. You never know when you'll need them. üòâü§£ I've already helped a guy jump start their car, such is the infectious sense of community there.
.
Finally , the views come straight from a postcard of Wales or Scotland or Norway. Truly stunning and act as a glorious buffer to the sound of traffic from the M1 motorway .
Thus far this place has not been commercialised.  Be greatful for small miracles. Let's hope that and it's charm stays preserved.
showerReviews.author: Patrick

showerReviews.reviewText:
The toilet facilities are a total disgrace we have travelled the highway for more than 30 years. We have used the rest stop on a number of occasions and generally were satisfactory but in the last number of years they have deteriorated to standard which is totally disgraceful in appearance , hygiene ,quality .
The toilet seats are cracked and the water to the basin‚Äôs were poor or not working.The cleaning if you call it that was unacceptable and embarrassing.
There a large number of people use the facilities and have a similar impression of the toilets.The facilities need a total facelift to make them a place travellers can stop and rest.
My last visit to Thailand and travelling on their highways and using their stop and rest areas they leave ours to shame .

showerReviews.reviewText:
I do a class here on Saturday mornings with Hoops Never Sleep. The court is always in excellent condition even at the end of the week. The floor is never too slippery and there is just enough light but the sun never comes in. It does get hot in summer so be prepared to sweat. The facilities also include change rooms (which are always clean) with toilets and free showers.

They have a cold water tap on the court and I've heard their gym is also very good quality. The playground looks great for children of all ages and has plenty of shade also.

Staff are super friendly also. One of the best sport courts in the city and 5m walk from wynyard. Highly recommended

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic indoor pool for both adults and kids. Perfectly allocated areas for lane swimming, wave pool, whirlpools, water slides, other water play equipment, another warm pool for swimming programs but kids can jump in when there‚Äôs no programs going on, spa, sauna and steam room.  This place has it all that 4 hours parking almost doesn‚Äôt seem enough.

They accept fitness passport so great value for anyone already with that membership.

There is also a canteen there with a wide selection of food. Can‚Äôt remember them all but there are pies, sandwiches, fried seafood and chips, muffins, donuts, ice cream and most importantly, coffee.   If there‚Äôs a swimming class on expect a long wait but there‚Äôs vending machines right next to them if you need a quick grab and go.

Outdoor parking is free and plentiful. It seems small cause it‚Äôs always packed but whenever we go and do a round we always seem to find a spot within a couple of minutes.

Ryde Aquatic and Sydney Olympic Aquatic are by far the two best pools in the area and a must visit.
showerReviews.author: Alwin Kuk

showerReviews.reviewText: Great facilities, really grateful for this place, but it have been about 3 weeks now with half of the shower cubicles shut, and only 4 shower cubicles are not enough for the massive crowds all the time, specially on weekends. Yesterday, Sunday, was about half hour wait. A lot of parents also have no common sense that there are people waiting,  and they leave their kids there forever in the shower while adults who need to shower and go back to work get stuck waiting. Seems like parents use the shower as day care facilities, to leave their kids there while they go out for a coffee or something. I dont know what they're doing, but they shouldn't let their kids there in the shower forever completely oblivious of other people waiting.

locations.title: The Y Ryde Community Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàELS Hall Park, Kent Rd, North Ryde NSW 2113

showerReviews.reviewText:
Comprehensive playground sports centre and Leisure centre ‚Äì YMCA Top Ryde. Whether you're looking to get fit, relax, or let the kids burn off some energy, this facility delivers.

The playground and kids‚Äô areas are new, modern, clean, and thoughtfully designed with flying Fox, swings, slides, bridges and rock climb making it a great place for both young and older kids. There's plenty of space for children to play safely while parents relax nearby.

The sports facilities are equally impressive ‚Äì from indoor courts for basketball and netball to well-maintained change rooms.

The leisure centre side includes an outdoor gym with a good range of cardio and strength equipment.

What really stands out is the community atmosphere. Staff are welcoming and genuinely helpful, and there‚Äôs a strong sense of inclusivity, making it comfortable for people of all ages and fitness levels.

Parking is convenient, and being located right outside the entrance of the indoor courts.

Overall, YMCA Top Ryde is a well-rounded, family-friendly facility that lives up to its reputation as a true community hub.
showerReviews.author: Michelle Chuang

The staff are friendly, approachable and always welcoming which just adds to the overall positive experience.

Still a great place to enjoy a swim.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Love this place and would love to give five stars, however one of the staff members in the gym makes my husband and I feel extremely uncomfortable (all other staff are so helpful and fabulous - especially those at the front desk who I love having a chat with on my way in!).
A few months ago I was working out and she was running a class, with all of the class members doing jumping and push ups right near the only rack where you can get heavy plates. I had to duck, weave and step over people in order to put back the heavy plates I was using (in returning my weights I am following their gym policy and etiquette by not leaving heavy weights on equipment I‚Äôve used). I felt awkward and you could tell the people in the class did too, but that was where they were instructed to train so they couldn‚Äôt move. My husband noticed this all happening and approached her kindly to let her know how dangerous this was for both myself and the people in the class. She didn‚Äôt care for his concern and was really abrasive in her response. Ever since, she has relentlessly targeted us. Other people in the gym can have no towel and she does nothing, however if my husband has no towel she will speak to him and tell him she‚Äôll kick him out next time. On one occasion, my husband walked in to the gym in his slides and sat down in the bags area to change his shoes. She kicked him out the door to change his shoes, yet on the same day a man was running in and out of the gym from the pool dripping wet with no shoes on at all.. she did nothing. This morning we were doing a quick warmup in the open area and she approached us to tell us we had to move within 20 minutes because a class was starting. We weren‚Äôt going to stand there for 20 minutes anyway. Another person was working out in the same area and wasn‚Äôt told to move. If the people in the class in the morning, which is run by another trainer, are near equipment that I‚Äôm using he will move them and is so respectful. He doesn‚Äôt prioritise the people in the class just because they‚Äôre in his class, he cares about everybody who is paying to use the space. This lady only cares about people in her class and has ruined our gym experience here. We feel awkward and targeted when she is around. I fear we‚Äôll need to look for a new gym, which is disappointing after finding somewhere to train that we really loved.
showerReviews.author: Georgia C

locations.title: The Y Ku-ring-gai Fitness and Aquatic Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàPrince of Wales Dr, West Pymble NSW 2073

showerReviews.reviewText:
The original West Pymble pool opened back in 1971, but this fully-blown aquatic centre revamp is less than 10 years old. And the Y Ku-ring-gai Fitness and Aquatic Centre has all the things!

Two heated indoor pools, a 50 metre outdoor pool and shaded outdoor kid‚Äôs pool, water play features, gym, cr√®che, indoor and outdoor showers, cafe and more, in a well-designed modern complex set amongst the beautiful bushland of the Bicentennial Park.

It‚Äôs very fancy, as you‚Äôd expect in the well-heeled enclave of privilege that is Pymble, with loads of free parking, brush turkeys wandering around poolside and the most North Shore language ever used in their signage‚Ä¶ skip to the last photo to see what we mean.
showerReviews.author: Jackie McMillan

Showers were easy to get into, no wait at all, but the water only stays on for a couple of seconds unless you hold the button in, which is a bit annoying. The showers just outside near the kids‚Äô pool are warm and stay on properly, so I had a quick rinse there before heading into the women‚Äôs change rooms.

The caf√© was open and looked like it had lots of options, though I didn‚Äôt try it this time. Overall, a smooth and relaxed swim with plenty of space and good staff. Just worth knowing about the shower quirk.

locations.title: Murray Rose Pool (Redleaf Pool)
locations.address: ÓÉà536 New South Head Rd, Double Bay NSW 2028

showerReviews.reviewText:
I used to take my kids here every chance we got. We started going to Redleaf Pool back in the early 1990's, when we lived there n Darlinghurst, as it was better than Bondi Beach as there was hardly any crowds - even on days with over 30¬∞ heat.
My kids learnt to swim here. It was great to teach them water safety in open water, as opposed to a swimming pool, where we had things like waves from the boats, currents, seaweed and fish around.
We moved to Auburn after my eldest started school, but would make the trip almost every single weekend, and holidays, just so the kids could swim in a safe environment, where we could watch them easily, and not like se them in a crowd.
I still swim here whenever it is possible. It's a great place for families, and you don't have the fear of losing sight of your children in a big crowd.
I highly recommend Murray Rose Pool for families with young children.
showerReviews.author: Samantha Fairweather

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful harbour side ocean pool, great to take the family,  love the 2 floating platoons spent a lot of time sun baking on the platoon, jumping off having a swim üèä‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è and back on the platoon
This harbourside tidal enclosure (previously known as Redleaf Pool) is popular with all age groups and proves busy on weekends in summer. The enclosure provides a swimming area of approximately 90m x 60m. The kiosk provides shaded seating and a spectacular outlook across Double Bay. No dog's allowed or fishing!Murray Rose Pool, Double Bay: A Harbourside Gem
‚ÄãMurray Rose Pool (formerly known as Redleaf Pool) is one of Sydney‚Äôs most picturesque harbourside swimming enclosures. Located in Double Bay‚Äôs exclusive Blackburn Cove, it offers a refreshing and uniquely Sydney swimming experience that feels a world away from the busy city.
‚Äã‚ú® The Best Features
‚ÄãStunning Harbourside Setting: The pool's biggest draw is its location right on Sydney Harbour. Swimmers are treated to gorgeous views of moored yachts, boats sailing past, and the sparkling water of Double Bay. The tranquil scenery makes it a perfect escape.
‚ÄãSafe Tidal Enclosure: This is less a traditional concrete pool and more a large, shark-net enclosed section of the harbour. It offers a safe swimming area of approximately 90m x 60m, ideal for casual dips and a different kind of "lap" swimming.
‚ÄãFloating Pontoons: A favourite feature for all ages! Two large floating pontoons sit within the enclosure, providing perfect spots for sunbathing, diving in, or simply relaxing and enjoying the gentle rocking of the water.
‚ÄãBoardwalk and Gardens: A scenic wrap-around boardwalk offers a lovely stroll and great vantage points for photos. Access is via the beautiful Blackburn Gardens, making the journey down to the water a pleasant experience in itself.
‚ÄãüèñÔ∏è Visitor Experience
‚ÄãMurray Rose Pool provides a relaxed, family-friendly atmosphere.
‚ÄãAmenities: Basic but essential facilities are provided, including change rooms, public toilets, and showers.
‚ÄãKiosk: There is an on-site kiosk, often located at the top of the stairs or adjacent to the enclosure, which offers coffee, snacks, and shaded seating with spectacular views over the pool and bay.
‚ÄãBeach Access: The pool adjoins a small strip of sand, Seven Shillings Beach, which is great for sunbathers and families. There are also grassy slopes nearby (part of Blackburn Gardens) with some shady spots.
‚ÄãAccessibility Note: Visitors should be aware that the pool is accessed by a series of stairs or winding paths through the gardens, and the boardwalk itself may be challenging for those with limited mobility as dedicated accessibility features like ramps are minimal.
‚ÄãThe Murray Rose Pool is a must-visit for anyone looking for a unique, serene, and quintessentially Sydney swimming spot. While it lacks the defined lanes and lifeguards of an Olympic pool (swimming is at your own risk), its breathtaking views and charming atmosphere more than make up for it. It‚Äôs perfect for a lazy summer afternoon, a safe swim for the kids, or a tranquil spot to read and sip a coffee.
showerReviews.author: John karmas

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful harbour side ocean pool, great to take the family,  love the 2 floating platoons spent a lot of time sun baking on the platoon, jumping off having a swim üèä‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è and back on the platoon

What a cool concept! Not necessarily a pool, per se, but an area of the harbor that has been sectioned off with a fence to keep out sharks (and boats?). Murray Rose Pool is definitely an interesting place to visit and worth the stop if you‚Äôre in the neighborhood. Named after the famous Australian Olympian, this pool/beach has a small sandy area, some shaded benches to sit on, a really pretty view, and a walkway on the fence surrounding the ‚Äúpool.‚Äù  There‚Äôs also an outdoor shower and a cafe up a flight of stairs.

Docking one point bc although it‚Äôs a nice place to visit, I can‚Äôt imagine the water would be that clean given all the boats nearby. Otherwise, highly recommend!

locations.title: Leichhardt Park Aquatic Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Leichhardt Aquatic Centre is a well-maintained, family-friendly facility that offers a great mix of pools and amenities for swimmers of all levels. The centre features multiple indoor and outdoor pools, including lap lanes, a dedicated teaching pool, and child-friendly splash areas, making it equally suitable for serious training and relaxed weekend visits. Water quality is consistently good, and the temperature across pools is comfortable year-round.

The layout is spacious and practical, with plenty of shaded seating and grassy spots outside for families to unwind. The gym and group fitness areas add a nice bonus for anyone wanting a more complete workout routine. Staff are approachable, attentive, and professional swim instructors in particular get strong praise from parents for their patience and clear teaching style.

While the centre can get busy during peak hours and swimming lessons, it remains efficiently managed, and facilities are kept clean despite high traffic. Change rooms and amenities are functional and regularly serviced. Overall, Leichhardt Aquatic Centre is a reliable, community-minded venue that delivers a great balance of recreation, fitness, and family appeal, making it a standout swimming option in the Inner West.

locations.title: True Float

showerReviews.reviewText: Very good place, privacy, space inside the rooms for your bags and to sit down. Lovely robes, showers and lighting is comfortable. Both couples infrared sauna and floating room were spot on. Much better than some other places around. We will be back.

showerReviews.reviewText: There are more and more businesses offering infrared, sauna and cold bath options, but so far, I haven‚Äôt found one that offers quite the same service as true float. The private rooms, which allow you to have the privacy that you crave, offering you an infrared sauna with a shower and a cold bath in one room, is exceptional. The layout is rather nice allowing you if you feel like it to sauna in the nude, as you would not normally be able to do this in another facility where there are too many common spaces. I would highly recommend you try this business. I hope more like it pop up. I have not yet used the float tank, but that‚Äôs my next ambition. The service offered by Byron and his other team members is also very welcoming and that can sometimes be the difference as some other places can be a little bit too cool for school and you don‚Äôt necessarily feel like you belong. There is no pretense with this business, which is what I like.
showerReviews.author: Nicholas Atgemis

locations.title: Orchard Day Spa & Massage

showerReviews.reviewText:
I purchased the Orchard Princess spa package for $229.30, which lasts 110 minutes. It includes a massage, facial, and foot bath/back scrub. Unfortunately, I feel that the service I received was not worth the price. I had requested a deep tissue massage, but instead, I got the GENTLEST massage I've ever experienced and I am a regular massage spa goer. It felt like the masseur was just applying oil to my back. I asked twice, with a significant gap in between, for the massage to be firmer, but there was no change. She predominantly used her palms, and the pressure was lacking. The back scrub consisted of applying soap and a hot towel, which was quite underwhelming. The facial was decent compared to the massage and back scrub. Overall, I won't be returning, and I can't recommend this spa. üò¢

Giving it 2 stars for the effort and the facial.
showerReviews.author: MC B.

showerReviews.reviewText:
My friends and I recently visited Alysium Spa at the Hilton for a girls‚Äô weekend and had booked spa services in advance. Unfortunately, our experience was disappointing and far below the standard we expected.
We had confirmed bookings for three people; however, upon arrival, only two appointments could be found. We were later informed that one of the staff members was unwell, but at no point prior to our arrival was this communicated to us. This lack of notice and the subsequent delay led us to cancel our treatments entirely.
We had also arrived early to enjoy the sauna facilities, but found the robes provided were far too snug, which made it uncomfortable and impractical to use the amenities.
Additionally, the state of the changerooms was unacceptable. The toilet cubicles were dirty with piles of toilet paper and trash, and the shower doors were broken and unable to close properly, compromising both hygiene and privacy.
This experience was incredibly disappointing, especially given the reputation and setting of the spa. I hope you take this feedback seriously to ensure future guests do not encounter similar issues
showerReviews.author: Rachelle Wolfe

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm not too comfortable posting a 2-star review but so many things went wrong and I never heard from management so here's my experience unfortunately.

I purchase Endota Spa vouchers as reward and recognition for team members over the years, purchasing with the trust that it's a premium, relaxing spa and put in good hands. My experience for my booking last Thursday was shockingly terrible, and will be my last at The Rocks.

I made a booking to treat myself for 5:30pm Thurs 10th July 2025 - Intense Radiance Facial and a remedial (?) massage. I've had a crazy few months and this was my downtime before another project run.

- I received a missed call on 7 July with no Voicemail or SMS so I assume it's a cold call. It's also courtesy to send a follow up written communication normally but I didn't receive one.

- the same number called again 9 July so I answer (screenshot of call history). Endota The Rocks receptionist asked me to come earlier but didn't specify what time. I let them know I'm driving up from Wollongong and 5:15pm is the earliest I could do, instead of 5:30pm. Receptionist pushed for 4:30pm and I compromised for 5pm which caused complications on my end with traffic and another errand I had to do after the meeting, hoping to be relaxed.

- the same receptionist calls at 4:53pm on the day of my booking whilst I'm parking underground in the nearby carpark to make sure I'm on time for a 5pm appt. I felt rushed. There was no 'thank you, how are you, see you soon'.

I arrive at the spa 4:57pm, the brunette receptionist didn't greet with 'hi, how are you etc' it was an abrupt 'I'll take you downstairs '. Which made no sense to me as I've never been there before, and I let her know that. The whole experience was just odd with so many things went wrong and I definitely didn't feel taken care of.

I felt very rushed, and I didn't feel settled in at any part of this. Amelia was a lovely therapist who tried her best but the receptionist was vacuuming in the last 20mins of my massage.

After my massage, the receptionist told me there's no showers available because I didn't tell her I needed one earlier (I didn't know I had to, there was no induction), and my entire body was slathered with thick body oil, including the soles of my feet and would have been a slipping hazard on the wooden floors of the massage room.

My hair was extremely oily and it made me feel very ick at how thick it was. In my initial phone call to this receptionist, I had let her know it's my first time, and I told her again when she rushed me downstairs to be waiting for 7mins with no one attending to me.

If I knew this was what to expect, I wouldn't have come here, nor would I have been buying vouchers for so many team members in the past!

I don't know if I had a bad luck of an experience, or this is the norm and regular customers have a lower standard, but there was nothing authentic nor relaxing here.

I explained my feedback to Amelia after the massage. She said she would notify the manager and it's been more than a week and I haven't heard anything back.

Amelia farewelled me and said the exit door is to the left.

The receptionist followed me up the stairs, didn't even ask how my massage was, but called out to me as I was about to leave 'you need to pay!'
It was so rude, so uncomfortable, and degrading. Someone with her lack of care shouldn't be in the front facing role.

I hadn't heard anything back from management so I'll send them a request through email however at this stage, Endota spa is removed from our rewards list in the company.

This was absolutely careless and I truly hope no one else goes through this. I paid almost $400 for this which is alot more than I've ever paid at my usual. Whilst the facial was good, I would have definitely preferred Nature's Energy bathhouse over this any day.
showerReviews.author: Yuki

locations.title: Nature's Energy Day Spa & Bathhouse in Balmain

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited the freshly renovated Balmain bath house to relax and reset following a particularly stressful period. From the moment I was greeted I felt an instant calm in my mind & body like I‚Äôd crossed over some threshold keeping the caps at bay behind me as I‚Äôm shown through the doors along a beautifully & tastefully decorated corridor past a very practical wet towel shoot, led further past a comfy couch in a tranquil zone & into the steamy haze of some Grecian oasis that is the bathouse. This area is organised into seven stations that can be used randomly or as recommended in an order of hat best utilises contrast therapy. First a shower is required & unique to Natures energy there‚Äôs an abundance of exfoliating sea salt to scrub down the body ahead of expelling some serious sweat beads in the traditional sauna. I limit my saunas to ten mins but it was well sufficient for evicting those toxins. I then trepidatiously slid into the most tolerable ice bath I‚Äôve ever encountered, which made me happy because I lasted longer than I had in ice baths elsewhere though I‚Äôm unsure of the actual temperature of the two baths installed here.
On to the mineral pool which isn‚Äôt vast in size comfortably fits maybe five or six people. I felt the temperature was perfect and 15 mins or so was completely invigorating. Then I showered, then steamed then infra red sauna, shower, dried off and did my last ten minutes standing in front of a medical grade Infra-red panel which I feel may have booted my immune system into a restorative state. Even well into the next day I‚Äôm feeling as light as a feather, my mood has lifted significantly.
I had previously only been in unisex bathhouses. I wasn‚Äôt uncomfortable at any stage sharing  the space but it was quite a different experience to segregated venues.
Honestly the most relaxing place I‚Äôve been to and their ritual makes complete sense so it is incredibly helpful to post it on signage for us forgetful peeps.
Another pleasant surprise was the lux products all are invited to use in when showering. My hair was left feeling clean, soft & detangled - a major feat & largely only achieved from using good quality shampoo & conditioner. I highly recommend you attend Natures Energy Balmain Bathouse to experience tranquility in the midst of any chaos you maybe experiencing in life.
As good as a holiday, and feeling just as refreshed, still vibing two days on‚Ä¶an incredible experience.
showerReviews.author: Kimberly

locations.title: BlueFit Swimming - Lambton Pool

showerReviews.reviewText: Lambton Pool might seem like a good spot to cool off, but it‚Äôs really not the place to go if you‚Äôre looking to have actual fun. One of the biggest letdowns is that bombing‚Äîone of the most classic and exciting pool moves‚Äîis strictly not allowed. Without being able to do bombs, flips, or even just let loose a bit, the whole vibe feels way too controlled and boring. It‚Äôs hard to enjoy yourself when you‚Äôre constantly being told to stop doing anything remotely fun. If you‚Äôre hoping for a lively, carefree swim or to hang out with friends in a place that actually lets you enjoy the water, you‚Äôd be better off skipping Lambton Pool altogether. There are definitely better spots that don‚Äôt take all the fun out of swimming.
showerReviews.author: Sam Geoghegan

locations.title: Newcastle Ocean Baths

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently visited the Newcastle Ocean Baths, and it was an amazing experience! The historic baths are a must-visit destination for anyone looking to enjoy the ocean views and refreshing seawater pools.

*Highlights:*

- *Iconic Art Deco Pavilion:* The baths feature a stunning Art Deco pavilion that's perfect for photography and adds to the overall charm of the place.
- *Spacious Pools:* The baths have multiple pools, including a large one for swimming laps and a smaller one for kids, making it an ideal spot for families.
- *Beautiful Views:* The ocean views from the baths are breathtaking, with waves crashing against the shore and sometimes even splashing into the pools.
- *Clean Facilities:* The change rooms and toilets are generally clean, although some visitors have noted that they could be improved.

*Tips:*

- *Visit during weekdays* to avoid crowds and make the most of your visit.
- *Keep an eye on children* when near the pool edges, especially during rough wave conditions.
- *Parking can be limited*, so consider parking in surrounding areas or arriving early to secure a spot.

*Overall Experience:*

The Newcastle Ocean Baths are a great spot for both locals and visitors to enjoy the ocean and get some exercise. The seawater pools are refreshing, and the views are stunning. While there are some minor issues with the facilities, the overall experience is well worth it.
showerReviews.author: Mandeep Singh Khalwara

The baths are well-maintained and offer ample space for both serious swimmers and families looking to relax. The nearby amenities, including changing rooms, showers, and a caf√©, enhance the convenience and enjoyment of the visit. It's a must-visit spot for locals and tourists seeking a memorable seaside experience in Newcastle.

showerReviews.reviewText: Merewether Ocean Baths earns 5 stars for its fantastic facilities and stunning location. As one of the largest ocean baths in the Southern Hemisphere, it provides a unique and refreshing swimming experience with crystal-clear waters and breathtaking ocean views. The baths are well-maintained and offer ample space for both serious swimmers and families looking to relax. The nearby amenities, including changing rooms, showers, and a caf√©, enhance the convenience and enjoyment of the visit. It's a must-visit spot for locals and tourists seeking a memorable seaside experience in Newcastle.
showerReviews.author: X X

showerReviews.reviewText: fantastic spot for a safe swim with a kids‚Äô pool, toilets, and changing rooms. Parking can be tight. If you want to have a coffee, there are several coffee shops. Weekdays parking is too easy
showerReviews.author: Damith Nuwan I.G

showerReviews.reviewText: Pretty good place if you like to swim in an open ocean baths. A bit crowded when I was there but really big ocean bath which is good for a long swimming. Don't forget to try out some food with a beer at the nearby restaurant with a great view of the ocean.
showerReviews.author: Tony Vu

showerReviews.reviewText: Pretty good place if you like to swim in an open ocean baths. A bit crowded when I was there but really big ocean bath which is good for a long swimming. Don't forget to try out some food with a beer at the nearby restaurant with a great view of the ocean.
showerReviews.author: Tony Vu

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of Australia's oldest ocean baths, It does have both male and female change rooms, I am certain that haven't been painted since the signing of  federation, could very well have been longer than that. If  that doesn't bother you then they are great for free baths and one of the only ones I know of with hot water and it is set just at the right temperature, X4 shower heads two hot two cold, and just like boarding school no dividers between them ü´£üòÇ

Besides that there are two very large pools a shallow one for the littles and one for the biggins that's deeper than the shallow oneü§îon one of the most beautiful beaches on this planet.
There is plenty of space bring the entire tribe along just not the mutt he has to stay at home or locked in the car, Newcastle council really don't appear to like man's most trusted companions, with a no dog policy on most beaches except for Horseshoe beach located opposite Nobbies beach, or the one the really big coal ship famously became washed up on the beach right in front of the surf club, back when milk still tasted like something, not milk though.

For any geology enthusiasts the cliff face on the opposite  end of Merewether beach tells an amazing story of destruction, a number of times over many many millions of years for me that's the biggest draw card.

There are no food venues at the baths them selves but there is plenty within a 1 minute walk along the beach front.
Id say a 6 / 10 is a fair score
showerReviews.author: K K

showerReviews.reviewText:
Merewether Ocean Baths have neatly solved the issue of lappies taking more than their fair share of public pools. Instead of letting them swim lengths of the biggest ocean pool in the Southern Hemisphere they make then swim 50 metres across the pool between concrete blocks down one end. This leaves the bulk of this 100 metre ocean pool for recreational swimmers to swim in any direction they want.

It‚Äôs also fully accessible with no steps between reserved accessible parking and the ramps into both the large pool and the wading pool (which is also a hundred metres long) with a soft sand entry on one side. With hand gliders cruising overhead, and waves crashing on three sides this is a beautiful pair of pools with plenty of amenity: concrete and wood benches spaced along the whole site, clean change rooms, outdoor showers, free off-street parking and lifeguards dispensing water-going wheelchairs to those who need them.
showerReviews.author: Jackie McMillan

locations.title: Newcastle Canoe Pool
locations.address: ÓÉà30 Shortland Esplanade, Newcastle East NSW 2300

showerReviews.reviewText:
As legend has it, there was once a cement map of the world in the pond, and children could row a canoe around the "world".
In a big storm, it was filled with sand, and in the process of clearing out the sand, the map got severely damaged.

Now it's just a sandy-bottom pool. Perfect for even the tiniest babies.
Not much shade. A few shady tables if you don't go at a busy time.
Full toilets and change rooms at the ocean baths next door, which are locked overnight.
There is an outdoor shower for use at any time.
showerReviews.author: Kathryn Lambkin

showerReviews.reviewText:
Arnold‚Äôs has always been wonderful for our family and children when learning to swim. The emphasis on quality swimming instruction really benefited our children particularly in those early years not relying on floatation aids. This really has made our children feel comfortable and confident in the water.
The staff have always been accomodating of any changes to classes if we required this and supportive of our children if they needed extra support when settling into their lesson. We have always appreciated the extra care.

showerReviews.reviewText: I took my water loving 2 year old here to begin swimming lessons. She was so confident and loved the first lesson. On the second lesson the young instructor dunked her head under the water without warning or build up after she had been in the water for less than a minute. I have since not been able to get her back in the pool even with me. I am extremely annoyed that her confidence has been taken away. This is not how you introduce children to be being submerged and I won‚Äôt be returning.

showerReviews.reviewText: Shout out to Arnold's Swim Centre for being so awesome, flexible and accommodating!  Today I had a brain fart and turned up 30min late for the kids swimming lessons and right when all lessons end.  This was no problem tho as Indigo and the staff quickly came up with a plan.  Indi ended up staying back to teach both of my kids, two different levels, a private lesson at no extra charge! What an amazing place to swim.  Indigo is an incredible teacher, so great with the kids, constant laughter and fun while still teaching skills for life.  I can not say thank you enough to Arnold‚Äôs Swim Centre and highly recommend them if you‚Äôre looking for the best swim centre in Newcastle!

showerReviews.reviewText: Sadly we had a terrible experience with Arnold‚Äôs. We were told to leave our 2 year old daughter for swimming lessons as she was distressed when we were there watching. They suggested this would last around 3-4 weeks while she adjusted. We returned one week before the class had ended to find her walking on the street by herself!! After the incident, it not only took Arnold‚Äôs a whole week to contact us (despite us trying to get in contact everyday until we heard from the owner) but they could not explain how this happened and why the instructor had let her go without any parent. We asked them to install a gate to prevent this happening to any other children but they refused. This situation could have ended much worse and I would hate for any other parent to have to experience it
showerReviews.author: Hollie Weekes

showerReviews.reviewText: This pool is fantastic. The staff are very friendly and there is a great car park. Good area for the kids as well and very large change rooms. It is a seasonal pool so only open in the warmer months.
showerReviews.author: Aaron Spiteri

showerReviews.reviewText: This pool is fantastic. The staff are very friendly and there is a great car park. Good area for the kids as well and very large change rooms. It is a seasonal pool so only open in the warmer months.
showerReviews.author: Aaron Spiteri

showerReviews.reviewText: Speers point pool is an old favourite with locals. Entry is affordable and also obtainable through fitness passport. For those with young ones and perhaps caught out without a swim nappy, these are available for purchase at admission and are a requirement.  There are two pools and a walk-through fun zone for the young ones where they can get wet without being in the pools whilst staying undercover and out if the sun. Both pools, one a 25m and the other a 50m have shelter over a decent portion of each for shaded swimming (the shallow end of the 50m). The 25m pool is single depth all the way across - good for kids or those not willing to tread water. You can swim laps in the 50m or swim casually. Lifeguards are always present and vigilant. There are change rooms, sheltered areas with picnic tables and plenty of grassy area to stretch out and catch some shade. There is a small kiosk for all your hot chips, drinks, etc. The pools are kept sparkling clean and for all the reasons above, our family will keep coming back. Keep up the good work!
showerReviews.author: Matt S

showerReviews.reviewText: Soldiers Baths earns 5 stars for its unique and historic charm. Nestled along the coastline, this natural rock pool offers a safe and serene swimming experience with stunning ocean views. The clear, refreshing waters and surrounding rocky landscape create a picturesque spot perfect for relaxing, swimming, and exploring marine life. Ideal for families and nature enthusiasts, Soldiers Baths provides a memorable and scenic coastal experience.

locations.title: Revolution Sports Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
went here with the kids 2nd week of January weekday (first time), being a school holiday period it was crowded for me. The place is huge! which can make it hard to keep track of your kids (mine was 7 & 12 so no biggie).
They serve food and drinks as well to cool down for the kids and coffee for us guardians, lots of seats but you might still find yourself sharing a table. prices from $11/hour- $45/3hours weekend.
I think they can still put some safety precautions in place, my son hit his foot on a wood at the end of foam pit, there are wooden corners as well that are exposed. It'd be cool if they can also add a shower or two.
Anyway, my kids had fun, they also think the place is really cool. Good place to get them tired and socialise.

locations.title: Balance Collective Mayfield
locations.address: ÓÉàCorner Industrial Drive &, William St, Mayfield NSW 2304

showerReviews.reviewText:
Be me:
Pay for a trial; as I have recently moved nearby. Receive no tour of the facilities, so had to figure out where everything was. Like, c'mon hey, pretty basic stuff...

And also zero explanation on how the lockers worked or what would be required to use them. (I had my own padlock and key with me)

Which lead to myself temporarily locking my bag in with no way to retrieve them; I then had to provide my wallet as collateral for a $2 coin to access said lockers...

Essentially get an "oh well" (not even hyperbole) when I remark that it would have been nice to be shown around as it took me awhile to figure out where everything was located for my circuit.

I honestly wanted my $7 back but I'm not that petty and any place that is that tight on a trial probably needs it more than I do.

There are heaps of gyms around Newcastle without the nonsense that provide a significantly better experience.
showerReviews.author: Levi Adler

showerReviews.reviewText: We have tried getting our 4 year old back into swimming twice in the last year with no success. Our lessons would consist of screaming , crying and just flat out refusal of getting in the water. After someone mentioned Trudy perhaps  being the right fit for our girl, we decided to give it one more go. By week 2 , Trudy has managed to get our daughter in the water without Dad or me in the pool, she was smiling , laughing and engaging in the lesson. After months of trying with multiple teachers and no success we are so glad that swimming is now an enjoyable part of our week rather than a stress. Cannot rate her enough üëçüèº
showerReviews.author: Haley Holland

locations.address: ÓÉà896 Hunter St, Newcastle West NSW 2302

showerReviews.reviewText:
All I can do is rave and sing praises about this gym! Visiting from Sydney for work and decided to try out this gym and WOW!! It was so clean, I saw not 1 but 2 cleaners there, vacuuming, wiping down all the equipment, even squigying the mirrors. The manager and another staff member was on the floor, putting equipment away, emptying bins, refilling wet wipes.

Even the members attending were attentive and putting away equipment they used. The gym has a great vibe where everyone respects each other.

I stopped to speak to the manager Vladimir, who was so pleasant and shared how impressed I was with the gym and its standard of cleanliness and visibly seeing the gym being taken care of during busying times around 5:30-7am.
Vladimir was so lovely, he even gave me a free towel for sharing my experience.

My gym at Moorebank could learn a lot from this place. Was an absolutely pleasure visiting this Anytime Fitness.
showerReviews.author: Dipta Tippins

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've got the scoop on Newcastle Beach, and it's a real gem. This stunning beach offers a mix of relaxation and activity, making it perfect for various types of visitors.

*Highlights:*

- *Beautiful Sand and Scenic Views*: The beach boasts golden sand and breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.
- *Clean and Well-Maintained*: Visitors praise the beach's cleanliness and well-maintained facilities.
- *Amenities and Activities*: You'll find cafes, restaurants, and shops nearby, as well as opportunities for swimming, sunbathing, and surfing.
- *Lifeguards on Duty*: The presence of lifeguards adds a sense of safety, especially for families with children.

*Tips:*

- *Visit Early or Later in the Day*: To avoid crowds, consider visiting during less peak hours.
- *Be Mindful of Swimming Conditions*: Check the current and tide conditions before swimming, as they can get rough.
- *Explore Nearby Attractions*: Newcastle Beach is close to other attractions like Nobbys Beach and Fort Scratchley, worth exploring.
showerReviews.author: Mandeep Singh Khalwara

showerReviews.reviewText:
Newcastle's beaches are a treasure trove of exciting experiences. Let's dive into the details of Newcastle Beach and Nobbys Beach.

Newcastle Beach
-Location*: Right in the heart of Newcastle, this beach is perfect for those who want to be close to the action
- *Amenities*: You'll find cafes, beach kiosks, and hotels nearby, making it an ideal spot to spend the day
- *Events*: Newcastle Beach hosts several water events, including The Australian Boardriders Battle National Final
- *Upgrades*: Recent upgrades include a promenade and skate park, as well as renovated ocean baths

# Nobbys Beach
- *Location*: Situated in Newcastle East, Nobbys Beach is easily accessible by Light Rail or car
- *Vibes*: This beach is popular with families, surfers, and even local dolphins
- *Amenities*: Enjoy barbecue facilities, a kiosk, picnic areas, and public toilets
- *Attractions*: Take a scenic walk along the breakwall, visit the historic Nobbys Lighthouse, and explore the nearby Soldiers Baths for snorkeling and macro marine life spotting
- *Safety*: The southern end of the beach is generally safer for swimming, marked by flags

Both beaches offer unique experiences, from surfing and swimming to relaxation and scenic walks. Whether you're looking for action-packed adventures or serene moments, Newcastle's beaches have got you covered.

Photo/ Video Courtesy : Amit Bhandari | AmitPhotography - Freelancer
showerReviews.author: MomentsBy AmitPhotography

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cave beaches offer a unique blend of adventure, serenity, and natural beauty that sets them apart from typical beaches. Here's a quick review:

Pros:

1. Seclusion: Often hidden and less crowded, making them perfect for a peaceful getaway.

2. Scenic Beauty: The interplay of light and shadows in the cave, combined with ocean views, creates a breathtaking atmosphere.

3. Adventure: Reaching a cave beach can feel like a mini-adventure, often requiring hiking, kayaking, or even snorkeling.

4. Photography Heaven: Dramatic rock formations and unique settings make for incredible photo opportunities.

Cons:

1. Accessibility: Many cave beaches are hard to reach, which can be a challenge for some travelers.

2. Tides: Timing your visit is crucial, as high tides can make the cave inaccessible or unsafe.

3. Limited Amenities: These secluded spots often lack facilities like restrooms or food vendors, so you need to come prepared.
showerReviews.author: Dhinesh

A sandy and vast beach with with breathtaking view. Beach is really big to have your own space for sunbathing or playing. Surfing is feasible. Sunscreen is highly recommended. The current is not that much strong when I visited and water is cold to touch.

The thing I liked most is seeing the waves coming from two different sides and clashing closer to the shore. This can be seen closer to Nobbys head side.
Parking is available close to the beach. Showers, toilets and drinking water fountains for humans and dogs available.
A Must visit place in Newcastle.
If you‚Äôre coming by bus, it‚Äôs less than 1km away from the bus stop.

showerReviews.reviewText: By far the best camp site we‚Äôve stayed in during our lap of Australia. The staff were super helpful and friendly. The sites were a good size. The toilets/showers were a little outdated but worked well and were always clean. We especially loved the huge camp kitchen which had everything in it that you would need. Even an air fryer! The adjoining TV room to the camp kitchen was an added bonus. Nice large room with board games, books, TV, comfortable sofas and tables and chairs. There was even an old school arcade machine which was free! Location is perfect.   Very close to the beautiful beach. The sunsets and sunrises were out of this world.

We travelled from Brisbane and had a fantastic stay at Stockton Beach Holiday Park. The staff were friendly and accommodating, the sites were clean and well-kept, and the amenities were spotless. The maintenance man was always cheerful and helpful, which really added to our stay.

The location is excellent, just a short walk to the beach and main street, with the ferry only about 15 minutes walk away. We enjoyed the amazing views, watching the big boats come in, the nearby caf√© was great, and the playgrounds the kids enjoyed.

We didn‚Äôt get to try the bowls club this time, but it‚Äôs on our list for next visit. Overall, a great holiday park and well worth the trip from Brisbane.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed for two nights in total two children and one adult, and unfortunately the experience was very disappointing.

We were told to check in at 3pm, but when we arrived at the office was unattended. We had to call, and when someone finally came over, he could barely say two words to us. When we got to the cabin, there was no bedding at all in the kids‚Äô room, and only two towels provided for all of us. There was no one available in the office to ask for additional bedding or towels, so we had to go without for the entire stay.

The cabin itself was extremely uncomfortable, the air conditioner was far too small and not powerful enough to cool the space, especially in the heat. The fire alarm was hanging from the ceiling, which is a safety concern. There was also nowhere in the park to dispose of rubbish, which made things even more inconvenient.

The pool was the only thing that kept us from leaving to find alternate accommodation, but even that was filthy, full of leaves and debris.

Overall, this stay fell well below expectations for the price we paid, and I hope management will address these issues, so other families don‚Äôt have the same experience.
showerReviews.author: Josh Diablo

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed for two nights in total two children and one adult, and unfortunately the experience was very disappointing.

We were told to check in at 3pm, but when we arrived at the office was unattended. We had to call, and when someone finally came over, he could barely say two words to us. When we got to the cabin, there was no bedding at all in the kids‚Äô room, and only two towels provided for all of us. There was no one available in the office to ask for additional bedding or towels, so we had to go without for the entire stay.

The cabin itself was extremely uncomfortable, the air conditioner was far too small and not powerful enough to cool the space, especially in the heat. The fire alarm was hanging from the ceiling, which is a safety concern. There was also nowhere in the park to dispose of rubbish, which made things even more inconvenient.

The pool was the only thing that kept us from leaving to find alternate accommodation, but even that was filthy, full of leaves and debris.

Overall, this stay fell well below expectations for the price we paid, and I hope management will address these issues, so other families don‚Äôt have the same experience.
showerReviews.author: Josh Diablo

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not luxury cabins by any means. Only 2 small bars soap for toiletries. Shower curtain only. floor in bathroom very uneven and dirty. Shower arm leaks. Pots rusty inside and out. Kitchen sink tap leaks. Paid for 3 adults and a dog by mistake, only main bed made up, given sheets and blanket at reception, if you could call it that ( more like a storeroom dump ) for single bed to make up ourselves, which was not needed. Furniture very out of date and shabby. Main double bed very soft sinks in the middle. No complimentary tea, coffee,sugar, milk.
Smoke detector open not working. Screen door broken.
Near train line.
Booked and paid for 2 nights
Left after one. After travelling up and down east coast twice a year we know what to expect from cabins in caravan parks and this one falls very short.

locations.title: Sails Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at this caravan park for two nights and it was absolutely awesome. The park is very well thought out, immaculately clean, and the grounds are beautifully maintained. The amenities were spotless, the sites were large and spacious, and there were plenty of shady areas throughout the park.

Waking up to birds chirping in the morning was just beautiful, and the park itself was incredibly quiet and peaceful. The location is perfect close to the lake and only minutes from nearby shopping centres and restaurants, which made everything so convenient.

We‚Äôve travelled around quite a bit and can honestly say this is one of the best parks we‚Äôve stayed at. We‚Äôre down in Newcastle nearly every month, and after staying here, this will definitely be our go to park from now on. We used to stay at the park on the other side of Newcastle, but we won‚Äôt be going back.

There‚Äôs honestly not one thing we can fault ‚Äî it was just perfect.  A hidden gem!
Highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Maryanne Skinner

locations.title: Camp Shortland

showerReviews.reviewText:
Camp Shortland is a public green space with free BBQS, hot showers, toilets and parking. Popular with families and exercise groups, the area has interesting historical monuments and plaques, commemorating European invasion and Aboriginal Ownership dating back 20,000 years. Situated between the Newcastle harbour and Nobbys beach, and horseshoe beach, there‚Äôs a patch of green grass to enjoy a picnic. Plenty of bird life exists here too.
Recommended 10/10

locations.title: Swansea Lakeside Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently spent three nights at Swansea Lakeside Holiday Park in our caravan, accompanied by my husband and our two young children (aged 2 and 3). The stay was thoroughly enjoyable and exceeded our expectations. The local wildlife‚Äîparticularly the ducks and possums‚Äîwas a delightful highlight, leaving the children absolutely captivated.

The park‚Äôs facilities were excellent, with the splash park, swimming pool, and playground all conveniently located nearby. The beach was only a short walk from the opposite end of the park, providing a perfect balance of activities for families. We stayed on sites 508 and 509 alongside friends, which worked well, though we have already earmarked another site for our next visit as it offers generous shade and is situated very close to the beach.

Although I had read some negative reviews prior to our trip, our own experience was entirely positive. The staff were welcoming and helpful, even going so far as to repair a pedal bike on the spot so we could enjoy riding it immediately.

Overall, we found Swansea Lakeside Holiday Park to be a wonderful destination for families, and we look forward to returning in the future.
showerReviews.author: Ruth Kardell

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a short trip away from Sydney with my family. This caravan park is nothing short of amazing, and I feel like pretty much everything to accommodate a person in a wheelchair like me has been though of, from on site hoists, height adjustable kitchen benches, even a ramp into the swimming pool, and a water safe wheelchair to take guests in. The really enjoyed the onsite sensory room- a calming, dimly lit room with soothing music and soft lighting, as well as fluffy cushions to sit on and patterns and textures to relax and rejuvenate the eyes and brain. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

There is an expectation that anything you use is to be washed, dried and put away etc to avoid a cleaning charge, however you are not supplied the tools. showerReviews.reviewText:
The reception being tucked behind a petrol station probably should‚Äôve been the first red flag. We booked a $125 non-refundable cabin, only to find ourselves in what looked and felt like the park from 8 Mile.

The woman at the front desk was friendly, which was one of the few positives, but the park itself was completely run down. Our cabin had a mouldy shower curtain, a bathroom drain full of hair, and an overall feeling of neglect.

If the price matched the quality, it would be easier to accept, but at $125, it felt like a bit of a scam. We ended up leaving at 4 a.m. after being repeatedly woken by people loitering near the front of our cabin.

Definitely wouldn‚Äôt return or recommend.

locations.title: Holiday Inn Express Newcastle by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉà514 King St, Newcastle West NSW 2302

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here for two nights using IHG points, which included breakfast each morning, and overall had a very enjoyable stay.

The reception staff were a real highlight. Everyone we dealt with was friendly, helpful, and efficient, which made check-in and general questions easy. Parking is available at $20 per day and can be paid for through the app, which was very convenient.

Our room was on the fifth floor and was very well designed and efficient. The bed was firm and comfortable, and the choice of one soft and one firm pillow was appreciated. The room included a small couch, table, fridge, and a well-thought-out bathroom. The bathroom door is multi-functional, closing in to create a shower enclosure or giving privacy when using the toilet. There were no issues with water leakage, drainage was excellent, and the shower pressure was fantastic.

Temperature control was another strong point. Both the room and hotel were easy to keep cool with the air-conditioning, which was especially welcome given the extreme heat outside during our stay. Coming back to a cool room and a refreshing shower was a relief.

Breakfast was fine and did the job. It‚Äôs a functional spread with cereals, scrambled eggs, bacon, beans, toast, and the basics. The buffet coffee isn‚Äôt great, but there is a proper coffee machine at reception where you can purchase a better coffee, or alternatively there‚Äôs a lovely caf√© about 300 metres down the road.

Overall, this is a clean, well-kept hotel that‚Äôs thoughtfully laid out and comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay and would happily stay here again.
showerReviews.author: Shilpa Thakker

showerReviews.reviewText:
I compared several hotels nearby, and Ibis was the only one with bright lighting in the room, which I really liked. The location is great. Although it‚Äôs close to the street, it‚Äôs not noisy at all. The view from the window was also nice, you can see the quiet neighborhood. The room seems to have been refurbished, though overall it‚Äôs still a bit dated, but not in a bad way.

What could be improved is the cleanliness. I noticed a small mold stain on the bed sheet. One of the small towels on the bathroom counter had a slight mark, and the large towel under the counter had some hair on it, so did the shower drain area. Considering the price of around $160 per night, I would expect a cleaner room.

Breakfast is $20.

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice camp site with reasonable facilities. Easy road access with ample parking. Bbq, toilets and cold water showers. Minimal mobile phone reception. Beach access via 5 minute walk. Clothing optional and birdie beach. When there check out Frazer Beach and camp site!
