showerReviews.reviewText: Nice camp site with reasonable facilities. Easy road access with ample parking. Bbq, toilets and cold water showers. Minimal mobile phone reception. Beach access via 5 minute walk. Clothing optional and birdie beach. When there check out Frazer Beach and camp site!

showerReviews.reviewText:
The campground is quiet and the nature beautiful but when do you clean the showers and toilets ?  We have been here 3 nights and no one came to clean, it's very dirty, then a group of 40 kids from outdoor ED took over the whole campground, making everything even dirtier and nosy.  I think it's great that teenagers get a chance to experience the outdoor but would be nice to do it elsewhere.
No hot water for that price is quiet a stretch.
We pay the campground and park fee !
showerReviews.author: lina loue

showerReviews.reviewText:
We camped at Freemans campground last weekend on Sunday we decided we wanted to stay another night. Ranger Kate was very helpful in explaining you can extend your booking only by ringing the 1800 number that's posted on the site signage. Kate then helped us out & rang the number to update our booking.
But due to the operator entering the wrong mobile we didn't get a pay text.
And due to poor service had to drive to get better service to recall getting through to try to pay. Due to other issues it took longer for the system to finally accept our extra night camp fee .
Thanks Kate for coming back later in the afternoon to check that we were able to finally confirm our extra night, thanks Kate for helping going above the average ranger requirements.
Though last night the mozzies were  out in force.
We will have to purchase  a mozzies  zapper next time. Wildlife kept us entertained, watch out bush turkeys pecked through our tent and got into our  bread rolls .
Cold showers , flush toilet, lights in the toilet/ shower block no electricity plugs.
BBQ shelters are great free. Pay station car fee , walking track to the beach .
showerReviews.author: K L

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a great spot for families who love camping near the beach. With a footpath leading to Birdie beach (about 700m walk), the little ones will be engaged. Lots of things to do in the water, from building sandcastles to surfing or boogie boarding. Just be aware that the other side of Birdie beach is a nudie beach.
The campground has designated sites reserved for you when you book. There‚Äôs an outdoor & indoor shower facilities although the water is cold (no hot water). Parking is $8/day & yearly pass is $23. I suggest buying yearly pass if you‚Äôre camping for more than 2 days.

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely campsite suitable for family. With good amenities such as covered area for electric bbq (fire bbq not allowed), showers (cold) with light during night time, washing area, place where kids can use bikes and scooters. Parking area is not that far from your tent (like camping beside the tent). There is a short walk to Birdie Beach as well. There is a nearby Woolies as well ( approx 5-10mins drive). Around midday, there is a ranger that roams around the site which is good. Trash bins are also situated in one area which I think is good and well organized. However, there is no power source. There is the option to camp over night for tents only, you have to book via the National Park website only 6 spot so plan ahead.

Nice walks, swimming and snorkelling also great waves. It‚Äôs a small beach and surf spot, respect the locals when visiting the place remains nice and friendly.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Love this place. I reside only 30 mins away in Newcastle Foreshore. I come camping here to escape all the current  high-rise developments going on in full speed in centre Newcastle. Great for employment I realise, and that's good - progress too. A short spell here at Bucketts Way, means I can study in nature surrounds, hear the different birds, enjoy the space, with true camping - fire pitt and all. And my dogs get to regularly experience the bushland - they love it!
I enjoy the fact that I can camp in simple nature, not far from home. Also a great place to unwind and study quietly in nature - if you're studying currently. For me, I find I achieve more with study and assignments being in this environment. And Newcastle has many students. The fees are cheap for students, and the amenities are excellent.
showerReviews.author: Lara

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a great 5 days staying at this great camping ground. The amenities are perfect  always clean, the camp kitchen is huge and has everything you would need. Brad is such a pleasant person to talk to and deal with, he's helpfulness goes beyond 5star. I had a great spot all areas are level, and easy access is great. Surrounded by huge gum trees. Visitors from the nature variety was great  and I've never seen so many garbage bins before, no excuse for people to leave any rubbish around. Will certainly return when able. Thank you for your hospitality.

showerReviews.reviewText: Louise is simply the kindest host. I arrived just before sunset and had to find an alternative spot to park my van for the night, as I was behind schedule. I only stayed one night, but consider coming back on my way down the East Coast, so it's a BIG recommendation from me.

locations.title: BIG4 Ingenia Holidays Soldiers Point
locations.address: ÓÉà122 Soldiers Point Rd, Soldiers Point NSW 2317

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've stayed at a lot of BIG4 parks with my young son, usually at least once a month, so I was a bit taken back at the price when booking here. But I figured I'd give it a go, and honestly, I'm 100% happy I did. The stay was well worth the premium compared to other parks.

There was so much to keep the kids entertained, way more than just the standard jump pad you get at most parks. The amenities were top notch too, each shower cubicle was basically its own 3m square private bathroom with an inbuilt bath, which made things so much easier with a little one.

The sites were really well maintained, and the park was full of young families, so my son had plenty of new friends to play with. It had a great atmosphere, safe and friendly.

All up, I think this is going to become our new default park. Worth every cent.
showerReviews.author: David Mann

locations.title: YHA Newcastle Beach
locations.address: ÓÉà30 Pacific Street, Cnr King St, Newcastle NSW 2300

showerReviews.reviewText: My friend and I stayed in YHA Newcastle for a few nights as a stop over during our east coast tour and it was the perfect 2nd location. The hostel was very homey and the staff were beyond friendly and helpful. The check in was super easy (especially as we arrived late and reception isn‚Äôt 24hrs), the hostel isn‚Äôt too big so we found our room easily and the rooms were spacious with showers close by. The kitchen was big and fully equipped, with lots of space for all our stuff and it was cleaned every morning. The male receptionists were especially kind and helped us sort out an issue we had with our payment as we booked through an external company and showed us how to use the washer and dryer. Unfortunately there is only one toilet on the downstairs floor and two showers but later learnt there were more upstairs. It is a very friendly hostel and on our last night they hosted a free BBQ. They also are very happy do you to use the facilities once you have checked out‚Äîwhich is the best news for any backpacker! They are also very knowledgable on things to do and happy to help. We couldn‚Äôt recommend this stay more. If you‚Äôre looking for a low key, homey hostel YHA Newcastle Beach is the pick for you.
showerReviews.author: amelia kent

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing experience at Backpackers New Castle

My five friends and I stayed at Backpackers New Castle and had an extremely frustrating experience. Just a few hours before our arrival, the front desk called us to say that the six beds we had booked and paid for in advance were no longer available. In the end, we were split into different rooms, which was not what we had reserved.

Additionally, the rooms we stayed in were dirty, with other guests‚Äô clothes lying around, a bad smell, and poor maintenance overall. It was clear that there was a lack of organization and hygiene.

I definitely would not recommend this hostel to anyone. The facilities and service were far below expectations.
showerReviews.author: Luis Ot√°vio de Araujo Martins

Very disappointing experience at Backpackers New Castle

My five friends and I stayed at Backpackers New Castle and had an extremely frustrating experience. Just a few hours before our arrival, the front desk called us to say that the six beds we had booked and paid for in advance were no longer available. In the end, we were split into different rooms, which was not what we had reserved.

Additionally, the rooms we stayed in were dirty, with other guests‚Äô clothes lying around, a bad smell, and poor maintenance overall. It was clear that there was a lack of organization and hygiene.

I definitely would not recommend this hostel to anyone. The facilities and service were far below expectations.
showerReviews.author: Luis Ot√°vio de Araujo Martins

I ended up leaving at 1am as it was not bearable.

locations.title: Towradgi Rock Pool

showerReviews.reviewText:
Towradgi Pool is one of the most beautiful and relaxing ocean pools in the Wollongong area. Located right next to the sea, it offers a refreshing swimming experience with stunning coastal views. The water is usually calm and clear, making it perfect for families, casual swimmers, and anyone who wants to enjoy a peaceful swim without strong waves.

The pool area is well-maintained, with easy access from the beach and plenty of open space around it for relaxing, sunbathing, or enjoying a picnic. The sound of the waves crashing nearby adds to the peaceful atmosphere. Early mornings and late afternoons are especially scenic with the sunrise or sunset reflecting over the water.

Overall, Towradgi Pool is a wonderful spot for a safe swim, beautiful ocean views, and a calming seaside experience. Highly recommended for locals and visitors alike.
showerReviews.author: Imran Khan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Woonona Rock Pool has a 50m pool with sky blue painted diving blocks, and an historic pavilion with viewing platform. Originally built as an even bigger pool by local volunteers in the 1920s, decades later it was rebuilt into this 8-lane Olympic pool. You can still see the vestiges of the original weathered into the surrounding rock shelf.

It has epic views in all directions, out from the headland between Bulli and Bellambi, outdoor and indoor showers, plenty of free parking and a nice locals vibe. This one‚Äôs a big yes and we would return.
showerReviews.author: Jackie McMillan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Three pools at this location with a plenty of shaded benches and a large open grass area with trees.

The 50m Olympic pool usually has several lanes roped off for lap swimming, with other areas for paddling and play.

There is a 25m kid‚Äôs pool as well as a separately fenced toddler pool. Both of the smaller pools have shade covering some of the pool area.

There are the usual amenities with bins, toilets, (cold) showers, and changing rooms.

Important to note that the pool is FREE entry.

We often stop here in an afternoon and note that swimmers are asked to leave the water 15 minutes prior to official closing time.
showerReviews.author: Phil Boardman

Showers are ok, some mould on the back wooden doors and you would be surprised but the shower water pressure is too high.  Why you might ask‚Ä¶ there are no hot taps so the hot water is at a constant 45c so to cool the water temperature you have to increase the cold water pressure‚Ä¶. Very unusual.  The staff are very nice.  There are more permanent residents in lovely accommodation than there are campers so the park is very quiet.  Overall very nice park and I would stay again

Pros: The pool is large with many lanes, clean, and heated. Entry is paid, but not expensive. You can sit and have a coffee. The yard is well-maintained.

Cons: The changing rooms are very inconvenient, there's absolutely no privacy ‚Äî you have to change in front of everyone. The doors on the changing rooms are torn off. It‚Äôs clear that people can be careless, but it‚Äôs also obvious that nothing has been repaired for at least five years. You have to shower in plain view, with no privacy at all. There are many damages in the pool, such as chipped tiles, etc.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Austinmer Rock Pools: Way down the southern end of Austinmer Beach, there are twin rock pools that nearly disappear around high tide. Head for the heritage change rooms near the surf club and you‚Äôll eventually see them, their outlines emerging between the crashing waves that surge over them with each set.

This makes it like swimming in a somewhat moderated version of the ocean, so time your visit closer to low tide if you want a more conventional ocean pool experience. We were undaunted though, enjoying the slightly less hectic version of what the beach swimmers were attempting on a big surf day.
showerReviews.author: Jackie McMillan

locations.title: Port Kembla Pool
locations.address: ÓÉàLOT 1 Olympic Blvd, Port Kembla NSW 2505

showerReviews.reviewText:
A Fantastic Family Spot ‚Äì Clean, Fun, and Well-Designed!

Port Kembla Pools is one of the cleanest seawater-treated pools I‚Äôve ever visited, making it a top spot for family outings.
With three pools to choose from, there's something for everyone. The baby pool is safely fenced, the medium-sized pool is perfect for smaller kids, and the beautifully designed 50m pool is simply awesome for swimming laps.

We visit regularly with family and friends, and these pools are always a hit with all ages. The grounds are kept tidy, and the toilets and change rooms are clean and well-maintained. The added bonus? A patrolled beach is just nearby, which is perfect for a relaxing day by the sea.

There‚Äôs also plenty of parking and shaded areas with tables and benches, making it convenient for a picnic. Whether you‚Äôre grabbing food from inside the pool area or from the beachside vendors, there are great options available.

Overall, it‚Äôs a well-rounded, fun place for everyone to enjoy!
showerReviews.author: Abid Iqbal

The bonus is the beach.
showerReviews.author: Jamie Grogan

showerReviews.reviewText: Also took a dip in Port Kembla pool. This seawater ‚ÄúContinental‚Äù baths overlooks Port Kembla Beach, from where it draws its water, showing off its 1937 construction date in some excellent yellow municipal architecture. It‚Äôs free entry, free parking, and free indoor and outdoor showers, with an impressive looking cafe‚ÄîOlympic Boulevard Eatery‚Äîcleverly accessible from both pool and beach. Only half the pool was roped off for lap swimming, which is a delightful pro-recreational swimming change from Sydney standards.
showerReviews.author: Jackie McMillan

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a little hidden treasure that many miss out on to see, explore, swim, relax and enjoy.
There is a sign on the main road but at 50km/hr it's hardly noticeable.
Exceptional views partly of the Illawarra Escarpment.
Maybe it was the timing. Very few people around.
It was great.
Practically having a large rock pool to yourself.
Not to choppy. Pool was great. Nice and refreshing.
Has toilet blocks but couldn't locate any showers.
Seen a few campers around.
Has magical views though today due to the current weather of smoke it did spoil the spectacular views.
Always see Ships from abroad but they were hard to see due to the weather . Slightly visible.
Great place to relax with a few fixed tables.
There is also a small kids park.
Will return whilst passing thru my ventures along the east coast line.
showerReviews.author: Andres Rojas

showerReviews.reviewText:
Walk through Leeder Park, past a small playground and amenities block to find the equally small but spectacularly located Coalcliff rockpool.

Just after WWI, legend has it, a group of local coalminers smuggled out enough dynamite from work to create this wonderful community resource and many continue to enjoy it a century later.

The waves pounding the surrounding rocks makes it wild and atmospheric, as does watching the surfers riding them from a parallel perspective. The views of the towering escarpment are magnificent, there‚Äôs outdoor showers, and although it is a bit small and shallow (at about 1.5 metres) it was, on balance, well worth a visit.
showerReviews.author: Jackie McMillan

locations.title: Five Islands Hotel
locations.address: ÓÉà87-93 Five Islands Rd, Cringila NSW 2502

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stopped in here as we were too tired to head home after what was meant to be just a day trip.
Pleasantly surprised by recent renovations. Rooms were all fresh with a whopping great flatscreen, "shared bathroom" not ata ll like the country pubs we stay in regularly, you get to lock the door and have the whole bathroom to yourself. It's better than what I have at home! Great shower with almost instant hot & strong water.

We ate downstairs in the pub and the serving sizes were very good. The other half had a boscaiola pasta dish and was very happy, I just had nachos and the ration of sour cream, guacamole etc was far better than the last time I had it up in Sydney.

Great tariff for the newly renovated accomodation, bistro good portions and pricing, we'll be back

showerReviews.reviewText:
Warehouse Gym and Fitness is hands down one of the best gyms I‚Äôve ever been to. The equipment is top-notch, well-maintained, and there‚Äôs something for everyone‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre into powerlifting, bodybuilding, or just getting a solid workout in. The atmosphere is super motivating, with a great mix of serious lifters and supportive staff who are always willing to help out or offer advice.

I also love the open layout and the raw, no-frills vibe‚Äîit really gets you in the zone. Clean facilities, flexible hours, and a great community vibe make this place a gem. Highly recommend to anyone serious about their fitness goals!

showerReviews.reviewText:
In response to the answer of my complaint below:

Why do you need my contact details. Just fix the problem !!! You don't need to write me personally, I do not need apologies. Just do what is right, fix your service, you can do better! Care about your business a little, or hire someone who cares.

Wollongong Club Lime member. Very disappointing with the toilet facilities and change rooms. They barely get cleaned, clothes hooks are broken. I have asked number of times to clean the sauna and showers it has black spots residue from usage, mouldy black areas in the shower on the tiles. However; nothing has been addressed. Also the Sauna breaks quite often. How is this business is still running, beyond my understanding. You have privilege to be in the prime location, lift your game up.

They do have good equipment, the staff is friendlish, clean exercises area.

Ironic to have wipes in the gym everywhere but the bathroom, toilets and change rooms are horrendous. You have to change your cleaners.

I am looking to join a different GYM.

locations.title: Goodlife Health Clubs Myaree

showerReviews.reviewText:
My issues with the gym are different and just about actually using it rather than payments.
It‚Äôs largely about the culture of not putting plates away, leaving equipment all over the place which includes in front of escape doors and the attitude of the members that is enabled there by the staff not enforcing return of equipment in any way at all.
It‚Äôs an ingrained culture and will not change.
It‚Äôs inconvenient and even dangerous in terms of trip hazards and manual handling.
These photos attached, were taken in just one visit.

1: Heavy plates go on the pegs highest on equipment. This should be obvious why and it‚Äôs marked on equipment any way.
2: Plates, bars, attachments are left al over the place. It‚Äôs like a naughty child‚Äôs play area and you better believe they cry when you tell them to put their toys away.
3: The pegs for the leg press don‚Äôt hold many plates so you‚Äôll have to spend like 10min finding plates unless you take them from the squat racks. Plus people just pile them next to the equipment.

So coupled with these numerous comments about payment ethics and inconsistent staff presence, Myaree is in need of making corrective actions as they clearly are attracting a low customer satisfaction score in these areas.

I‚Äôm not obliged to use the compliment sandwich model here however I will say in general I‚Äôve found the equipment to be adequate and or satisfactory.

The steam and sauna are in good condition considering their nature and age and the same goes with the men‚Äôs change room.
It is the aforementioned, culture and lack of effort in making corrections that I find unacceptable and contradictory to their own policies and I don‚Äôt need to be paying to be putting myself in that environment.
I don‚Äôt see these problems changing so my solution is to just go somewhere else.
showerReviews.author: shane hanson

It‚Äôs largely about the culture of not putting plates away, leaving equipment all over the place which includes in front of escape doors and the attitude of the members that is enabled there by the staff not enforcing return of equipment in any way at all.
It‚Äôs an ingrained culture and will not change.
It‚Äôs inconvenient and even dangerous in terms of trip hazards and manual handling.
These photos attached, were taken in just one visit.

1: Heavy plates go on the pegs highest on equipment. This should be obvious why and it‚Äôs marked on equipment any way.
2: Plates, bars, attachments are left al over the place. It‚Äôs like a naughty child‚Äôs play area and you better believe they cry when you tell them to put their toys away.
3: The pegs for the leg press don‚Äôt hold many plates so you‚Äôll have to spend like 10min finding plates unless you take them from the squat racks. Plus people just pile them next to the equipment.

So coupled with these numerous comments about payment ethics and inconsistent staff presence, Myaree is in need of making corrective actions as they clearly are attracting a low customer satisfaction score in these areas.

I‚Äôm not obliged to use the compliment sandwich model here however I will say in general I‚Äôve found the equipment to be adequate and or satisfactory.

The steam and sauna are in good condition considering their nature and age and the same goes with the men‚Äôs change room.
It is the aforementioned, culture and lack of effort in making corrections that I find unacceptable and contradictory to their own policies and I don‚Äôt need to be paying to be putting myself in that environment.
I don‚Äôt see these problems changing so my solution is to just go somewhere else.
showerReviews.author: shane hanson

showerReviews.reviewText: They might have been a change of management at this gym. Their customer service used to be good, but it has deteriorated since the front desk has been staffed with new faces. My credit card was cancelled due to unauthorised transactions. I informed the front desk of this a day before the scheduled deduction. The representative who took this information told me it is too late to stop any deduction now. She mailed me later in the day to ask an alternative account for deduction. I did not get a chance to read this email until it was too late.  I was then charge a $10 late fee. I called Goodlife to request for a fee waiver  as this was not the first time my card had to be cancelled due to unauthorised transaction. On the previous occasion, I wasn't charge da late fee as they were informed prior to deduction date. Not this time. The representative whom I spoke to  gave me a number  to call to make the  request. I found that weird. I did not have to do that the last time I had to cancel my credit card. I did anyway. I was told by the other company that since I had already informed  Goodlife of the cancellation a day prior to deduction date, I should get back to Goodlife to ask for waiver. He also let me know a day notice is sufficient to stop the deduction. This sound reasonable to me plus the membership contract was between Goodlife and me. Why do I have to call another company? I could be wrong, but isn't front desk all about customer service? Why did she has to lie that a day notice is insufficient to stop deduction? This club has zero customer service. The front desk is staffed by a lady that tried to weasel her way out of  making a phone call. The toilet and recreation zone (steam and sauna) need a good deep clean. the floor in the shower cubicle and the steam room is slimy and the floor drains in these area definitely needs a thorough clean. Our membership fee and the club's customer service and cleanliness seems to move in opposite direction. They are lots of other options which offer value for money, but I have been a member for close to 10 years now. I just need to get out of my comfort zone and explore other options. But, for those that are considering Goodlife, think twice
showerReviews.author: Janet C

locations.title: Goodlife Health Clubs Cannington

showerReviews.reviewText: I'm at odds what to rate this place. As a gym they would get 2 stars. Poorly maintained equipment, rusted pins, weights not reracked. Only saving grace is that it is very large open plan upstairs. But I didn't join for the gym. I am still very happy with my local gym at Plus Fitness Manning. I joined for the facilities which are worth the price of entry itself. I signed up to a minimum 3 month fixed term contract to use their swimming pool over summer. I do appreciate Peta's service in getting me the best deal possible. Brooke has  also been very helpful. I got charged my first payment today and I intend on using the pool every day along with the sauna. The rest of the bathrooms are kind of shit so adds to the lackluster care and attention the actual gym itself has. I wouldn't use the showers here compared to other gyms I've been to. But I will continue to use the pool and sauna every day over summer. The facilities themselves are very well maintained by the staff even if the door to the sauna is a bit ajar. As mentioned, staff like Peta and Brooke are wonderful so far and very friendly but I'd only recommend this as a private health club with a swimming pool and sauna and not a gym.
showerReviews.author: Scott Crawley

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am surprised at some of the negative comments. I cannot say much on the pricing and staff etc but I find this gym, pool and facilities etc to be very good. I have unlimited access to this gym during staffed hours. Staff appear friendly and have always greeted me with a smile. I dont really need much more help from them.

This gym is huge with a lot of equipment and machines. It has some good machines which are not present in other gyms. It is not crowded everytime I have visited but I do avoid peak hours. The swimming pool is very good and clean. Plenty of showers etc in the locker room. Some of the shower doors are broken etc but that can be easily fixed.  One or two machines may need some oiling or WD40 etc but thats not a deal breaker.

Overall a very good and big gym with plenty of equipment and good facilities.There is a big clean swimming pool to go with it. I will be coming here more often and will be bringing friends with me also.
showerReviews.author: M.A. Khan

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a member of Goodlife for almost a year, and my overall experience has been very positive. The team at the reception consistently provides excellent service ‚Äî they are professional, friendly, and always willing to assist. The gym facilities are well-maintained, clean, and equipped with everything needed for a great workout experience.

The only minor concern is that the sauna in the men‚Äôs section occasionally experiences technical issues. I trust this will be addressed, as it is a valued part of the gym‚Äôs amenities.

Overall, Goodlife offers a welcoming environment with a strong focus on member satisfaction. I am pleased to be part of the community and would highly recommend it to others.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is very good for a workout and offers plenty of equipment. It is a nice and spacious facility, and the machines are of good quality. Most of the equipment is not new, but it still works well.
The large swimming pool is definitely a highlight. There is also a sauna, although the times I could use it, it was under maintenance for at least a couple of weeks. I believe it has been fixed now. The bathrooms also need attention, as some shower doors were or are missing, and a few showers did not allow you to adjust the water temperature, which meant that out of six showers, only two were comfortable to use.

The gym is very good for a workout and offers plenty of equipment. It is a nice and spacious facility, and the machines are of good quality. Most of the equipment is not new, but it still works well.
The large swimming pool is definitely a highlight. There is also a sauna, although the times I could use it, it was under maintenance for at least a couple of weeks. I believe it has been fixed now. The bathrooms also need attention, as some shower doors were or are missing, and a few showers did not allow you to adjust the water temperature, which meant that out of six showers, only two were comfortable to use.
The gym has a generous amount of space and a welcoming atmosphere, which is great, but it would benefit from more frequent maintenance and care, as it has a lot of potential. Overall, the gym fulfils its main purpose for training. It offers a wide range of equipment and plenty of room.
However, with basic upkeep, it could feel more like the excellent gym it has the potential to be. For me, having working showers and a functioning sauna is the key difference that sets GoodLife apart from other gyms. I hope this review can help Goodlife members and also encourage the management to improve these amenities for all members.
showerReviews.author: Arthur Felipe Andrade

locations.title: Goodlife Health Clubs Cottesloe
locations.address: ÓÉà460 Stirling Hwy, Peppermint Grove WA 6011

showerReviews.reviewText: My wife and I used this club for almost 3 months while staying in nearby Mosman Park.  We were happy to be able to get daily workouts in in their Les Mills classes (Body Pump, Body Attack, Body Balance) and yoga.  The gym is relatively crowded with lots of cardio, stationary and free weight and machines.  You'll find people all over on the floor doing their workouts or working with a personal trainer.  The locker rooms are large but can get very steamy in hot weather.  The front desk staff is very friendly.  The only improvement I would suggest is class scheduling.  Most of the classes I attended started late, largely because they are scheduled pretty close to one another, making it difficult for one group to "clear out" before the next class starts.  There may have been other factors as well, not sure.  If they spaced out the classes a bit more or ensured they started and ended on time this would remove a petty annoyance from an otherwise very enjoyable gym experience.  We'll be back in January and plan to sign up again!
showerReviews.author: Ron Mele (ScubaNut2014)

locations.address: ÓÉà384 Scarborough Beach Rd, Innaloo WA 6018

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a member of Goodlife for quite some time and really enjoy the Innaloo branch. In my opinion, it is a very complete gym that offers everything you need for a good workout, even though there is always room for improvement.
The lower level has spacious changing rooms, a sauna, and a large area with plenty of cardio equipment. Upstairs, you will find machines for both upper and lower body training, a spin room, a large studio for group classes, and another smaller room next to it that I believe is used for Pilates sessions.
The gym is generally not too crowded during the day, although it gets busy during peak hours such as early mornings and late afternoons. Many machines are available in pairs, which helps a lot when one is already in use.
The atmosphere is well balanced, with people who are genuinely motivated to train, creating a positive and energetic environment.
showerReviews.author: Arthur Felipe Andrade

showerReviews.reviewText:
BUYERS BEWARE! Deciding between a few gyms to join as I am on the hunt for a new 24/7 gym as my local gym does not fit with my new schedule. Went in for a free 5 day trial as advertised on the website only to be told by a staff when I got there that it is only for friends of members and you can have the 5 day pass ONLY IF you are going to join. What is the point of trial then? The staff then proceeded to tell me about this deal they have going on now and wanted me to sign up immediately on my first visit without even a workout there. After asking a few more times and explaining that I would like to try first, he reluctantly gave me the 5 day pass. Started my pass on Monday, and on Wednesday once again he was asking me to join. On Thursday he gave me a call saying that I have to book an appointment to discuss membership options with him on Friday otherwise they have to charge me if I come in for a workout on Friday (despite it was still on a "5 day trial") as "you have no intention to join". The overly pushy and presumptuous attitude was definitely off-putting as they seem to want you to just buy hastily without consideration and I will not be joining Goodlife.

On the positive side, the lockers room is clean and spacious, there is a sauna too. The facilities are also new and with good varieties of equipments. However, it is quite crowded even during off-peak times like 2-3pm. Facilities wise I have no complaints, however the rude salesperson indicates that this place might not have the best training environment as staff is just as important as facilities when it comes to choosing a gym. I was told that I could not use the lockers as it's for members only by the staff however on my second visit the front receptionist who was nice and friendly gave me a temporary locker card to use without asking and just asked for a key or ID which was fair.

Based on my negative experience, for anyone who is thinking of joining beware of their AGGRESSIVE SALES TACTICS! Before you sign up please look carefully at the fine print of the contract as this gym seems so sus! With my current gym they only asked me once after my trial ended. This is by far the most pushy gym I've been to so far. I understand gym salesperson would obviously try to sell their gym to the best they can as that's how they make a living from but expecting someone to make a huge financial commitment without trying, persistently asking even before the trial finishes, terminating your trial early because THEY JUDGE YOU as uninterested is LUDICROUS.
showerReviews.author: Joy Er

showerReviews.reviewText:
Went on a day out with the family , great drive to get to the beach, straightforward, easy to park , wide space for a picnic, they‚Äôve got the little gazebos at the top by the lighthouse.
Plenty entertainment too , if you fancy surfing , we saw kids enjoying themselves .

The pink ice cream van parked in the main car park was a definite plus to our trip , it was a hot day , very nice ice cream ‚ò∫Ô∏è

A war memorial stands proud at the top of the garden , easy acces to all .

We had a good coffee down the beach, too , near the accesibile toilets and showers .

Fantastic views , the rocky side of the beach is simply wonderful , it is easier to access than it looks , slippery at times .

We will definitely come back .

locations.title: Public Toilets Lang Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's amusing how terribly designed these toilets are, I had this written up anyway just for a laugh with friends and family:

There's a button to open the door, and once you're inside, there's a button to close it. I couldn't see a way to lock it from the inside, but there was a light on the outside to show if it was vacant or not so I guess it should be detecting me being in there and auto-locking.

I double check if there's enough toilet paper left, you can't check, it's all hidden and you push a button for it to unroll a few squares of paper and there's a limit of like 2 button pushes every 10-15 seconds.

I wasn't finished wiping when someone outside pushed the button and the door simply opened....

But wait, there's more. There's no button to force-flush the toilet, a sign says you either wash your hands (sensor activates the sink) or leave the room. Ok so I wash hands, the toilet starts flushing, weakest flush I've seen in my life, almost none of the toilet paper goes down. I trigger the wash sensor again and the toilet doesn't flush, it's programmed to not flush too frequently because the 3rd time made it flush again.

That's about it. Enjoy. Whoever designed this got paid too much.
showerReviews.author: Josh

locations.title: Fairy Meadow Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fairy Meadow Beach is a charming and relaxed coastal destination just a short drive or bus ride from Wollongong‚Äôs city center. Nestled along the gentle curves of the Pacific shore, this family-friendly beach offers golden sands, calm surf, and plenty of space to unwind.

The shallow, sheltered waters make it ideal for swimming, paddleboarding, or simply wading in on a warm day. Lifeguards patrol certain areas during peak seasons, giving peace of mind to families with young children. There‚Äôs usually plenty of parking nearby, as well as clean public toilets and shaded areas‚Äîperfect for packing a picnic or setting up a beach umbrella.

Walking paths wind along the dunes and beachfront, connecting to nearby parks and cafes, making it a great spot for a peaceful shoreline stroll. The dunes and coastal grasslands beyond the sand are home to native vegetation and birdlife, offering a little natural oasis just steps from the water.

While not as busy as some of the bigger Wollongong beaches, Fairy Meadow Beach has enough amenities‚Äîincluding coffee shops, casual dining options, and takeaway stores‚Äîto support a relaxing day by the sea. The vibe is quietly attractive: understated and peaceful, with just enough activity to feel lively without being crowded.

Whether you‚Äôre after a gentle swim, family day out, or a serene spot to read a book overlooking the waves, Fairy Meadow Beach delivers a delightful coastal escape close to the city.
showerReviews.author: Farhan Tanvir

locations.title: The Palms Motel Wollongong

showerReviews.reviewText:
I love that the motor inn as a style of accommodation hasn‚Äôt died, and  is having a revival. Impressed by the fresh exterior, unfortunately that‚Äôs where the positives end.
I am easily pleased. All I need is a hot shower, a comfy bed and a tv. Quite pricey, I expected much more than this place offered.
At reception, I was told to shower with door closed as to not set fire alarm off, when it would be very easy to install an exhaust fan to the window.
Almost a nice view of the escarpment but three cranes are surrounding this place. A weeknight stay would be absolute hell as I‚Äôve no doubt how noisy all that construction would be from 7am.
The mattress was actually horrendous. Very very old spring mattress with a tatty old mattress cover. Lumpy pillows.
Room is small but that didn‚Äôt concern me too much.
It was also very noisy.  Constant noise from the highway, and drunks at 330am, a teenage football team up early stinking up the place with lynx Africa üòÆ‚Äçüí®
Please if you can do one thing to improve this place, get new mattresses. Having now read the reviews I know a 20 year old mattress got plenty of use ‚Äòby the hour‚Äô.
If I were to stay in the Illawarra again, I would take my chances at another motor inn or fork out the extra to stay at the mantra.
showerReviews.author: Cherry Lamingtons

locations.title: Bulli Beach Tourist Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic camping spot, clean large sites, great amenities and close to cafes. Beautiful beach amd two lovely swimming pools.
For a weekend get away this is perfect. Staff as super friendly and park is well maintained and quiet.
One of my favourite places to come and stay.

showerReviews.reviewText:

For a weekend get away this is perfect. Staff as super friendly and park is well maintained and quiet.
One of my favourite places to come and stay.
showerReviews.author: Alastair Hogbin

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently stayed at Bulli for a weekend camping trip, and while the location is undeniably stunning, the overall experience left me with mixed feelings. I‚Äôm giving it 3 stars not because it was bad, but because a few key frustrations held it back from being great.

Let‚Äôs start with the good stuff. Bulli Beach itself is absolutely beautiful. Waking up to the sound of waves crashing just beyond the dunes is something special. The coastal walk is lovely, and it‚Äôs a great spot for early morning strolls or catching the sunrise with a cup of coffee in hand. The ocean breeze helps keep things cool, and there‚Äôs a nice balance of open space and shady areas.

Facilities are pretty decent, too. The amenities block was clean and well-maintained during our stay. Showers had good water pressure and stayed warm a must after a day at the beach. There‚Äôs a playground for kids, BBQ areas, and a caf√© nearby if you‚Äôre not keen on cooking every meal yourself. The park staff were polite and checked us in quickly, though we didn‚Äôt see much of them after that.

Now for the not-so-great part: the tent setup. I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs under the surface at Bulli, but trying to peg down the tent was a nightmare. Honestly, it was like hammering into cement. We bent several pegs trying to get them in, even after soaking the ground a bit. Eventually, we gave up and used rocks and sandbags to weigh the corners down. I‚Äôve camped in a lot of places, but this was one of the most difficult setups I‚Äôve dealt with. If you‚Äôre bringing a tent to Bulli, make sure you have heavy-duty stakes and a rubber mallet or be ready for a serious arm workout and a lot of swearing.

Another issue was how close the campsites are to each other. There‚Äôs not much in the way of privacy, and noise travels easily. We had a group next to us with kids, but be aware that it‚Äôs not exactly peaceful if you're hoping for quiet evenings under the stars.

Also worth noting: the ground doesn‚Äôt drain well if it rains. We had a brief shower overnight, and even with a ground tarp, our tent ended up with a few damp patches.

All that said, the location is hard to beat. If you‚Äôve got a campervan or caravan, I imagine the experience would be much more comfortable. But for tent campers, it‚Äôs a bit of a challenge, especially if you‚Äôre not prepared for the unforgiving ground.

Final verdict: 3 stars. Bulli is beautiful, the beach is unbeatable, and the facilities are fine but unless they‚Äôve added jackhammers to the gear hire, pegging your tent here is going to test your patience (and your pegs).
showerReviews.author: Jude de Carle

Fairly average council-run park. Not bad, not good, just average.
Location is good, backing on to the surf beach out the back and the lake out the front, walk to some shops including a small supermarket, and walk to the Club Windang.
But, our site was mostly dirt (there were a few with grass), next to a rundown permanent with an old fibro annex. Not pretty.
The amenities looked nice, but they also looked like they weren't cleaned well or often. One urinal in the mens was blocked (yuk!) and the hand paper ran out and wasn't replaced while we were there.
It could have been much better.

locations.title: NRMA Shellharbour Beachside Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at Shellharbour NRMA for a few nights in our caravan. The location itself is great and we really enjoyed having beach access, but overall the park didn‚Äôt quite meet our expectations.

When we arrived it was fairly quiet, but it became very busy over the weekend. The park is currently undergoing renovations and adding new sites, though some of the layouts looked quite tight with poles and close proximity to other vans ‚Äî I‚Äôm not sure how easy it will be for larger setups to manoeuvre once it‚Äôs finished.

There wasn‚Äôt a lot for kids within the park, which wasn‚Äôt ideal, but it did encourage us to explore the surrounding area, which turned out to be a highlight. We loved being close to the beach, but our site became a bit of a thoroughfare for kids walking directly through to the sand. A designated walkway or clearer access point would really help improve privacy for those staying on the beachfront.

The main downside for us was the amenities. Unfortunately, the bathrooms didn‚Äôt appear to be cleaned during our stay, leaving toilet paper, sand, and water scattered around. This was disappointing compared to other parks we‚Äôve stayed at.

Overall, the location is beautiful, and with some improvements to the amenities and general upkeep, the park could become a much better experience for guests. We enjoyed the beach access, but we‚Äôd hope to see a few upgrades before considering a future stay.
showerReviews.author: Vee

showerReviews.reviewText: Can‚Äôt fault the location of the park, you are on the doorstep of the beach and a few minutes walk to the town centre. We are travelling in a caravan and have a 1.5 year old and it‚Äôs great to have a park, big bbq facilities and camp kitchen altogether and close by. Unfortunately the family bathroom is probably one of the worst we‚Äôve come across in a big 4 park. Basically unusable for families with babies, hot water on all occasions was not working, and nowhere to lay your child down to dry them and get them dressed. The room itself looks like it‚Äôs meant for more of a laundry type set up. We ended up showering our daughter in the main facilities where there was hot water and having to run her back to our caravan to get dry and dressed. Womens toilet overall was clean, hand dryer not working the 2 weeks we were there.
showerReviews.author: Erin Erin

locations.title: Shellharbour Holiday Village
locations.address: ÓÉà50 Junction Rd, Barrack Point NSW 2528

showerReviews.reviewText:
Camping Review of one night;
The check in process was super easy, especially as we were checking in after office hours. We were given info about where the key would be and where our pitch would be.

We were placed in a lovely camping area next to trees and river which was so peaceful. Luckily it was quiet so there was a good amount of space between us and our neighbours. We did have some noisy neighbours turn up about 11pm who were chatting for a few hours as well as someone in one of the static cabins working in their garage with what sounded like an angle grinder on metal followed by a lot of clanging around, from 11pm-12am.

The amenities were close by with plenty of toilets and showers  which were about 5/10 cleanliness and very dated. The shower doors were very low so you could easily look into the cubicles, so didn't feel very private.
showerReviews.author: Ellie Hughes

showerReviews.reviewText: Such a great location ! Massive downside are the facilities, no shower curtains, hot water or even a mirror in the bathroom was a huge disappointment for the price you pay for a non powered site. And I feel like they should close off public access considering there's a car park at the top, lots of cars parked for the day to go to the beach and on one night some kids being very loud ! Wouldn't stay again, lots of nicer cheaper spots further down at Bulli and Corrimal

showerReviews.reviewText:
Room 309.  Bedroom furnishings lovely, very clean room overall. Bathroom a decent size but sink has been pushed into a small space and very little surface space in the bathroom to rest things on.
Thankfully bedroom is spacious which almost makes up for it.
Shower head not really adjustable which is annoying.
Very good toiletries and complimentary water in the fridge.
Buffet breakfast not good; limited choice, cold toast left on the counter, eggs were like liquid and we arrived at 7.20am but breakfast was still only being set up.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Clean, updated amenities. Bathroom block recently rebuilt. Downfall is site are quite close together so you can hear conversation of your neighbours when you‚Äôre trying to sleep.

Most campsites have slope. We stayed on site 21 which is a corner site not too far from amenities.
The first row sites just off from the amenities will be very bright at night as the amenities block light stays on. Sites 31 and 32 look great for larger groups too at a lower price to booking the group sites.

Campground is part of Killalea Regional Park which is great to explore if first time.
Get up early and catch sunrise at The Farm.
showerReviews.author: Cecilia Truong

showerReviews.reviewText: Great spot for family camping. Great camp kitchen area with BBQ and covered eating space, beautiful beach 5min walk away, native wildlife including resident friendly owl & red bellies üêç üòÇ, Hot showers and good size grassy spaces for tents & campers. Many of the sites for tents/campers are on a slope, so if you have a camper bring a ramp to level it. Only lost a star due to no bench in showers to place your items and water pressure could be better, and the sloppy ground making it difficult to level campers and pitch tents.

showerReviews.author: Kelly Konemann

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location within Killalea Reserve is quite advantageous, being close to both shops and beach access. The provision of hot showers and flushing toilets adds a comfortable touch to the camping experience.

However, it's worth noting that the beach, although beautiful, requires about a 10-minute walk through a bush track and stone steps, making it less accessible for those requiring assistance.

A point to consider is that the majority of the sites are on a slope. This might pose a challenge for those sleeping in tents or trying to level trailers. Despite this, for those who appreciate a more rugged camping experience in a scenic reserve, it could still be a worthwhile choice.
showerReviews.author: James Mitchell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros: Decent campground with toilets, hot showers and a sheltered dining hall area with gas BBQs (a couple faulty), wash up sinks and benches. Good phone reception. Short walk to the beach nearby. Gated entrance with a pin to enter the campground.

Cons: No lights in the bathroom so you‚Äôll need to bring torches/lamps for nighttime. Some camp spots are on a slope and you can‚Äôt tell which ones when you book online. There‚Äôs not much room to park on the sites either. Unfortunately the site is not staffed, so the ‚Äútotal fire ban‚Äù is not respected - plenty of people lighting fires, and no one around to enforce the 10PM noise curfew. Both nights we had multiple groups of people nearby shouting and playing music over speakers until 2-3AM.
showerReviews.author: Tashi G

locations.title: Carrington Falls campground

showerReviews.reviewText:
My wife & I BOOKED 3 sites for 2025 Labour Day long weekend.
As are most NP‚Äôs, Carrington is a beautiful spot.
A short walk away from camp are Blue Pool & Nellies Glen fall swimming holes. The water was ü•∂ but refreshing.
There‚Äôs a long drop camp toilet off an adjacent carpark. Keep in mind that if you go during peak periods (long weekend/ holidays) that you may have to line up to use it due to the high amount of traffic for the swimming holes. This unfortunately seems to add to rubbish being left around the area.
Note that as there‚Äôs no firepit provided, charcoal fires are banned. But despite this and a quite windy day, it didn‚Äôt stop some pelicans at Nellie‚Äôs Glen from lighting a fire to cook, which had quite a large flame going, resulting in 2 Fire trucks and 2 Police Cars attending to douse the fire and hopefully charge the culprits.
This was a concern as we were expecting to have to evacuate.
Another issue during peak times are the amount of people arriving late attempting to find a camp spot that we had to turn away. Just imagine if any of these people were antagonistic, what then? ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
And of the 3 nights we stayed, we were woken up at 2am EVERY single night by people driving around the site, parking and then walking around with torches, talking loudly trying to decide where they were going to go üôÑ
This is ridiculous considering NPWS have an online booking process.
These experiences create anxiety, particularly for the 2 girls staying next to us as I had turned away cars of young men looking to camp despite all sites being booked and paid for.
On a positive note, our 2 ‚ÄòLatin dancing‚Äô neighbours on the 1 site we didn‚Äôt book were wonderful.
I would say during non peak times, we potentially would‚Äôve enjoyed more solitude.
The area is 4-5 star but this experience had too many negatives.
showerReviews.author: David Maigrot

showerReviews.reviewText:
My wife & I BOOKED 3 sites for 2025 Labour Day long weekend.
As are most NP‚Äôs, Carrington is a beautiful spot.
A short walk away from camp are Blue Pool & Nellies Glen fall swimming holes. The water was ü•∂ but refreshing.
There‚Äôs a long drop camp toilet off an adjacent carpark. Keep in mind that if you go during peak periods (long weekend/ holidays) that you may have to line up to use it due to the high amount of traffic for the swimming holes. This unfortunately seems to add to rubbish being left around the area.
Note that as there‚Äôs no firepit provided, charcoal fires are banned. But despite this and a quite windy day, it didn‚Äôt stop some pelicans at Nellie‚Äôs Glen from lighting a fire to cook, which had quite a large flame going, resulting in 2 Fire trucks and 2 Police Cars attending to douse the fire and hopefully charge the culprits.
This was a concern as we were expecting to have to evacuate.
Another issue during peak times are the amount of people arriving late attempting to find a camp spot that we had to turn away. Just imagine if any of these people were antagonistic, what then? ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
And of the 3 nights we stayed, we were woken up at 2am EVERY single night by people driving around the site, parking and then walking around with torches, talking loudly trying to decide where they were going to go üôÑ
This is ridiculous considering NPWS have an online booking process.
These experiences create anxiety, particularly for the 2 girls staying next to us as I had turned away cars of young men looking to camp despite all sites being booked and paid for.
On a positive note, our 2 ‚ÄòLatin dancing‚Äô neighbours on the 1 site we didn‚Äôt book were wonderful.
I would say during non peak times, we potentially would‚Äôve enjoyed more solitude.
The area is 4-5 star but this experience had too many negatives.
showerReviews.author: David Maigrot

locations.title: Killalea Regional Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Killalea‚ÄØRegional‚ÄØPark is a coastal sanctuary tucked between the beaches of‚ÄØShell Cove and Kiama on New South Wales‚Äô stunning South Coast. Spread across dramatic headlands, rolling hills, and pristine surf beaches, this park is a paradise for nature lovers, surfers, and families alike.

The star attraction is‚ÄØThe Farm‚Äîa world‚Äëclass left‚Äëhand point break revered by surfers nationwide. When the swell lines up, it creates long, clean rides that draw experienced wave riders seeking that classic South Coast barrel. Nearby‚ÄØKillalea Beach, also known as Mystics, offers gentler waves and safe swimming‚Äîperfect for less confident surfers, bodysurfers, or beachgoers wanting to soak up the sun without crowds.

Walking trails wind through coastal heathland and dunes, offering scenic loops that capture wide ocean views and vibrant native vegetation. Wildflowers and birdlife are abundant during spring and autumn, making these times especially rewarding for photographers and hikers.

Camping is available at Killalea‚Äôs camping ground, set amidst grassy paddocks shaded by native trees. Sites are generous and family‚Äëfriendly, with basic facilities including toilets, cold showers, and picnic shelter areas. Evenings are best spent gathering around a campfire while listening to ocean waves echoing in the distance.

Despite its natural beauty, the park remains relaxed and unpretentious‚Äîno theme park ride here, just unspoiled coast, friendly locals, and a laid‚Äëback atmosphere. Whether you‚Äôre chasing waves, pitching a tent for a night under the stars, or simply immersing yourself in coastal wilderness, Killalea Regional Park delivers a refreshing escape from city life.
showerReviews.author: Farhan Tanvir

showerReviews.reviewText:
Killalea State Park, also known as Killalea Regional Park, is a stunning 260-hectare natural gem located in Shellharbour, New South Wales, Australia. The park offers a diverse range of landscapes, including pristine beaches, a lagoon, estuary, wetlands, mangroves, and littoral rainforest. It's a haven for wildlife, with at least three rare and endangered species and hundreds of seabirds during breeding season. The lagoon teems with diverse species of fish, birds, frogs, and reptiles.
Killalea is a popular destination for surfers, with renowned surf breaks like 'The Farm' and 'Mystics', declared National Surfing Reserves in 2009. For those wanting to learn to surf or improve their skills, the Pines Surf School is an excellent choice. They offer lessons for all levels, from beginners to advanced surfers, with experienced and passionate instructors who prioritise safety and fun.
Access to 'The Farm' beach is a worthwhile walk from the carpark. The beach itself is stunning, with golden sand, clear blue water, and impressive waves. It's the perfect spot for a surf, swim, or simply relaxing and soaking up the sun.
The park also offers opportunities for other activities, such as swimming, fishing, kayaking, stand-up paddleboarding, and birdwatching. There are walking trails that wind through the park's diverse ecosystems, providing a chance to observe the local flora and fauna.
Killalea State Park is a true natural wonder, offering something for everyone. Whether you're a surfer, nature lover, or simply looking for a beautiful place to escape the hustle and bustle of city life, Killalea is sure to leave you feeling refreshed and rejuvenated.
showerReviews.author: James Narbutas

locations.title: Windang Foreshore Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Windang Foreshore Park is a scenic and family-friendly destination located in Windang, New South Wales. Situated at the entrance to Lake Illawarra, this park offers a blend of natural beauty and recreational amenities, making it a popular spot for both locals and visitors.

The park features expansive grassy areas perfect for picnics, as well as sheltered barbecue facilities and picnic tables for a comfortable outdoor dining experience. A children‚Äôs playground adds to the family appeal, providing a safe and fun environment for kids to play. For those interested in cycling or walking, a shared cycle path runs through the park, offering scenic views of the surrounding area.  Ôøº

Fishing enthusiasts will find Windang Beach and Lake Illawarra to be excellent spots for fishing, with opportunities to catch a variety of species. While dogs are not permitted on Windang Beach, an off-leash dog area is available further north, providing a space for pets to enjoy the outdoors.  Ôøº Ôøº

Whether you‚Äôre looking to relax by the water, enjoy a family outing, or engage in outdoor activities, Windang Foreshore Park offers a welcoming environment for all.
showerReviews.author: Farhan Tanvir

The TV wasn‚Äôt great. It had no apps to stream and took ages to connect to your own device.
The staff are relatively friendly but their customer service wasn‚Äôt great.
The only saving grace was the buffet breakfast at Basta. It was a small spread but nicely done. Fresh eggs and good coffee.
So much potential with this place, the outside and lobby are really cool but the rooms are really lacking.
Hope to return one day to see some changes! Wollongong needs some nice hotels!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Was told I could check in midday as I had arrived after a long flight but only got my room at 3pm and only after I asked reception.
I stayed 3 nights and housekeeping never cleaned my room or provided fresh towels. This was despite 3 reminders and constantly checking with reception. There was a cockroach in the bathroom on day 2 and I told reception but nothing was done. Beds not made and coffee sachets not replenished.
No cupboards or drawers in the room. Instead a metal grid on the wall where one is supposed to hang clothes? Very inconvenient and disappointing as I had come for an event and needed to hang clothes up.
I rang the hotel the day before arrival requesting an iron. Nothing was provided even after 2 requests and I ended up having to take an iron and ironing board I found in the hallway propped up against the wall.
Staff were friendly enough and the Negroni was one of the best I‚Äôve had and food was good too. However, the overall impression was dismal especially when the room rates were not cheap. Won‚Äôt be coming back to this place.
A friend‚Äôs shower barely worked and requests for toilet paper fell on deaf ears. Instead, she got free coffee and egg and bacon rolls. I don‚Äôt understand.

locations.title: Ibah Day Spa & Beauty Studio

showerReviews.reviewText:
I booked the $320 Deluxe Harmony package and took a day off work, planning for a relaxing experience, but was left really disappointed.

About 20 minutes in, I noticed the therapist might be unwell. She was constantly sniffling, blowing her nose, and then massaging me again without sanitising her hands. It took me about 40 minutes to work up to raising the issue, and when I asked if she was okay, her explanation shifted from ‚Äúmy hair got wet in the rain‚Äù to ‚Äúit‚Äôs the steam/scents in the room.‚Äù The inconsistent excuses and concerns around unhygienic practices made me too uncomfortable to continue, so I stopped the treatment before the facial. I explained that I have an immunocompromised friend and didn‚Äôt want to risk exposure if she was unwell. I tried to handle it with kindness, I understood if she was sick, but I wasn‚Äôt comfortable continuing.

When I raised this with the manager after I wrapped up early she told me they don't do refunds in any circumstances. I left after she said she‚Äôd follow up with the owner in this case, but that call never came. Instead, I had to chase them multiple times before finally getting an email that just insisted the therapist wasn‚Äôt sick. This did nothing to address the hygiene issue. Despite leaving after only an hour of a 2.5-hour package, I was refused a refund and offered only a credit.

Under Australian Consumer Law, ‚Äúno refund‚Äù policies don‚Äôt apply when services aren‚Äôt delivered with acceptable care and skill. Refusing a refund in this situation is, in my view, unlawful.

I also noticed they give incentives for reviews, which makes me question how genuine their ratings are. There are many local businesses that genuinely value their customers - I'd recommend supporting them instead.
showerReviews.author: Ashleigh Smith12333334

What an incredible experience from the minute you walk in to the minute you walk out. The aesthetic is like none other.

I walked in feeling embarrassed because my hair is always washed and put in a bun but at no stage did I feel uncomfortable.

The treatment was amazing, so relaxing and calm. They even blow dry your hair and straighten at the end so you walk out occasion ready. Josie was my therapist, she was so kind and the blow dry was amazing. She took such care the whole way through with every detail done to perfection.
10/10 would recommend, I will 100% requesting a voucher for every birthday and Christmas from now on.

locations.title: Toukley Aquatic Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
5 Star Swim Schools Tuggerah Swim Centre is far better for recreation.
There are far too many rules to using Toukley aquatic centre. The heated pool can only be used by certain age groups at certain times.  The outside pool is for only under 5s, why??? The indoor pool had lanes which could only be used by those doing laps which meant only one lane for recreation which was occupied by many families. We have been to many public pools with just the standard pool rules and things went smoothly (even with both under and over 5s swimming together). I also agree that some of the female staff need to be more polite.

On the other hand we tried 5 Star Swim Schools Tuggerah Swim Centre just for a fun swim- not lessons. The pools are bigger and cleaner, the staff are relaxed and kind and we swam in peace and enjoyed ourselves. We were also allowed to use any pool we wanted including the heated pool.
showerReviews.author: M Zaghloul

showerReviews.reviewText:
Toukley Aquatic Centre has good facilities but has very rude office staff. I came in on 02/11/22 at 4:25 pm. I took my kids to a swimming lesson and on entry, I asked about an activity that was happening on the weekend (inflatable on the pool), the lady won't look at me, and the answers were "Nope" or "I don't know"... zero interest to explain an activity that is helping in the facility that she's the receptionist. This is just unacceptable behaviour and horrible customer service!!!
That's a typical interaction from the staff at the reception here in my experience. I've been here for many months and every time the office staff act like they are doing you a favour by taking your cash and letting you enter.

Very sad people, unfortunately, spreading negative vibes around what is otherwise a nice facility.

On the other hand, swim instructors are amazing and do a great job, the kids are always excited about their lessons each week.
showerReviews.author: Chris Fernandes

showerReviews.reviewText: We love swimming here, but today was pretty busy. They had 4 lanes closed off for lap swimmers, (and when we arrived not one person using any if these 4 lanes)...actually we were there nearly 2 hours and that whole time only 2 people used these lanes.  This meant at least 20 recreational swimmers were all crowded into an area the size of 2 lanes. Why? There was no way to social distance and we were forced to basically stay in the same area until people started leaving. Give priority to the swimmers who are already there please, not the ones who might come.

I took my 4-year-old son there today for an assessment to determine which level he would start in for swimming lessons.

Unfortunately, I‚Äôve never felt so uncomfortable.
The person who conducted the test in the water, named Peter, was rolling his eyes from the moment my son entered the pool until he left, clearly showing frustration and impatience.

He said things like:
‚ÄúHe doesn‚Äôt stay still.
‚ÄúI‚Äôll keep him underwater, at least that way he stays quiet.

We‚Äôre talking about a 4-year-old child, and this instructor is supposedly trained to work with kids. If you choose to work with children, patience should be the bare minimum.

Conclusion: my son will definitely not be taking lessons there. I left feeling very disappointed and upset.

showerReviews.reviewText: Trying to cancel your child swimming lesson is a nightmare. They want a months notice even though my daughter is getting really upset about going. I have spent about 600 on missed lessons the last year due to thier strict 12hours notice policy. Originally I was told 2 weeks which I could have copped on the chin but 30 days notice? Thats 4/5 swimming lessons? That's close to 100 dollars for lessons we can't attend bumping thier free money up to 700. Not to mention if your direct debit doesn't go through then slug you 16.50 per child. No other option to pay any other way. People are struggling and this business sucks you dry. North wyong swimming centre is much more flexible and understanding. I have also be asked to give a reason why I want to cancel. Um, I want to cancel for personal reason. I didn't realise I entered into a contract that's hard to leave. Not to mention the time limit for makeups (why do you give a time limit then they expire? We paid for it) also the 12 hours notice is ludicrous and isnt practical at all. Alot can happen in that 12 hours. It would mean I would need to call at 3 in the morning to make that time frame, or the day before. So stupid
showerReviews.author: C.S.A.S

showerReviews.reviewText: Norah head beach and rock pool. My girls said: best rock pool ever!. You have to time it right as with low tide the pool is empty. High tide it can be a bit rough with waves but in between tides it's perfect. We've spend most of our day on the right side of the beach next to the rock pool. With low tide the rocks expose themselves and the kids love exploring all the little under sea aquariums that stay behind between the rocks. You can find sea urchins, little star fishes, anemones and little fish swimming around. Lots of shells too when it's low tide.
showerReviews.author: Tamara La Marca

showerReviews.reviewText: I've been visiting the pool for years and generally have a pleasant time. I've always supervising my children either when swimming in the big pool or the children's one. I had one situation recently when my son was training for his first swimming carnival. The pool was busy, the recreational area was full of kids bombing and playing rough so I took him to the slow lane to practice his swimming styles. I had my youngest together to observe and she was swimming close to the entry steps of the lane to keep cool. I was swimming slowly following my son and I got instructed  from  the lifeguard that we should move to recreational  area. I explained her that we're not playing but I'm supervising my son (who was on the other side starting his lap at the moment) but she insisted of all of us to move out from the slow lane and go practice in the area where the rest of the kids are. üôÑ letting me wondering how can you practice laps in a recreational area.  Was the problem my youngest? Should I have left her unsupervised at recreational area? Or a 10 year old practicing his swimming ? Are only adults allowed in the slow lane?
showerReviews.author: Angeliki Panagiotakopoulou

Lovely area, got shaded area for spectators.

There are life guards on duty.

Apparently can even bring flotation devices with you, or pool noodles.

We went at around 4pm in the afternoon and there were few people there.

So i would imagine it gets packed during the day.

There is a shaded toddlers pool area which is probably a god send in this heat.

There is a lovely lawn, so some people were having a bit of a picnic there.

The only thing that put me off - i wasn't swimming but still got charged a spectator fees.

A bit unfair i think...other than that it is a little gem.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wyong pool is an underrated gem. There's nothing like a classic outdoor Olympic pool, and this one is clean, in excellent condition and perfect for lap swimming in all weather,  but especially on a sunny day. The 11 foot 6 inch deep end, a throwback to the days of diving boards, means you can actually dive here outside race events, unlike most newer pools, which tend to be much shallower. This is a serious swimmer's pool, IF you can get unfettered access to it. The three lanes typically reserved for lap swimming lanes aren't really enough. Four would be better.

The only major problem I have with this pool is convenient access and availability. Bookings for carnivals, parties etc. are common. This is not a place at which you can simply turn up at any time and expect to actually have a swim, unless you get there very early. They probably need the revenue from bookings to keep the place open, but if you are a busy person with limited time for a swim, you may find many opportunities are lost owing to either half or all of the pool being booked out. Saturday mornings are often a write-off for several hours due to water polo, if you really need the full 50 metres like me. The 25 metre partitions are often put in place well before the time of the booking, too. February and March have a lot of bookings for school swimming carnivals. These lost opportunities eat into the value of using memberships/Fitness Passport etc. for regular access (I'm considering cancelling my FP for that reason). And soon after all the carnivals are over, the pool is closed again until October. It feels like it's over again before it even began.

In conclusion, while the pool itself is fantastic and one of the best 50 metre pools around, actually getting a swim in it can be challenging unless you can always rock up as soon as it opens in the morning.
showerReviews.author: T - Rex

locations.title: The Grant McBride Baths
locations.address: ÓÉà88 Ocean Parade, The Entrance NSW 2261

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently visited the ocean baths and was impressed by the natural beauty and serene atmosphere of the area. The baths are located on the picturesque Central Coast of New South Wales, and offer breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean. The water in the baths was crystal clear, and the temperature was just right for a refreshing swim.

The facility itself was well-maintained and clean, with plenty of amenities available for visitors. There were changing rooms and showers and a lifeguard station.

In addition there is  a viewing platform nearby where you can sit back, relax and take in the view of the ocean, an impressive sculptural public art work or even participate in an audio walking tour.

Overall, I highly recommend The Grant McBride Ocean Baths to anyone looking for a relaxing and rejuvenating experience in a stunning natural setting. Whether you're a seasoned swimmer or just looking for a place to cool off on a hot day, this ocean bath is definitely worth a visit.

showerReviews.author: Jennifer D

showerReviews.reviewText:
Thank you Fitness 1st at Erina Fair!
The staff are super friendly and the Centre is very convenient, with easy undercover parking with plenty of spaces. No wasted time looking for a parking.spot!
A very good atmosphere and Super Sparkling Clean - everywhere!.
Plus so much variety in the activities on offer that are guaranteed to suit every Body and every Need!
The change rooms are extremely convenient, with multiple lockers all keyed to your membership card - so there is no extra charge as in some facilities.
And when you bump into the staff in the shopping centre, they make you feel welcome and part of the team.

Being located within this very large shopping centre is such a bonus - as when I left my sauna thongs at home and only had to go up the escalators and purchase another pair at a very reasonable $8.00 - much better than travelling all the way home to get the others and then back again.
Plus there are plenty of good places to meet up with friends for lunch after a workout !

Thank you  to ALL the staff at Fitness First and especially to Layton who goes out of his way to be helpful and friendly!

A great place to stay fit!
showerReviews.author: lj kilroy

locations.title: Terrigal Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had such a beautiful time at Terrigal Beach,it's one of those places that instantly makes you feel relaxed and refreshed. The golden sand stretches wide and long, perfect for a peaceful walk or just lying back under the sun. The water was clean and calm, great for both swimming and just dipping your toes in.

What really made the visit special was the vibrant but laid-back vibe. The beachfront is lined with charming cafes, little shops, and restaurants where you can grab a coffee or enjoy fresh seafood with an ocean view. We also loved the Terrigal Haven, a short walk from the main beach, perfect spot for snorkeling or watching the sunset.

Parking was pretty easy to find, and the area felt safe and family-friendly. Whether you're going with friends, family, or on a solo getaway, Terrigal Beach has something for everyone. Can't wait to go back!
showerReviews.author: Shanuka Rathnayake

showerReviews.reviewText: A really beautiful beach. Can be crowded, especially on a weekend but it‚Äôs still a wonderful beach to come to. Terrigal Beach is one of the most popular beaches on the Central Coast . There is designated parking but that can get full very quickly especially when it‚Äôs busy. There is a small ocean rock pool tucked away into the cliff on the southern end of the pool and is patrolled all year for safe swimming. There‚Äôs good toilet and shower facilities and also handicapped toilets. The picnic areas include grassed areas and under cover picnic tables. There is also a fantastic walking path leading to the Terrigal Boardwalk. There‚Äôs plenty of cafes and restaurants around that you can grab something to eat. Unfortunately, the beach does not cater for people with accessibility needs. The view is stunning, so beautiful. Would definitely recommend a visit.
showerReviews.author: Nerine Cummins

locations.title: Putty Beach

showerReviews.reviewText: Putty Beach is a beautiful and expansive stretch of sand located at the southern end of the Bouddi National Park. It‚Äôs a favourite spot for both locals and visitors, offering calm waters ideal for swimming, and its gentle waves make it great for families. The beach is the starting point for the popular Bouddi Coastal Walk, which winds along the cliffs and offers stunning views of the coastline. Putty Beach is a fantastic spot for photography, offering expansive views from the point over Broken Bay, Lion Island, and the Northern Beaches.
showerReviews.author: R a Stanley

showerReviews.reviewText: This beach is a wonderful place for a day out. It's dog friendly too so it's really cute just to watch the dogs play. We will definitely come back with our dog. However some dog owners didn't pick up their dog's poo so just be ware. The walk is quite short from the car park but we still recommend to bring a beach trolley if you have young kids. There is no toilet around but there is fresh water to wash the sand off. There are also jelly fish in the sand so be sure to let the young ones know and advise them not to touch it. There is no shade so if you go with young children, make sure to dress them appropriately.
showerReviews.author: Han Le

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely outstanding stay at NRMA Canton Holiday Park. From the moment we arrived the service was warm, genuine and incredibly helpful. A special shout out to the amazing receptionist who checked me in and looked after me throughout our stay, she set the tone for the whole trip.

The facilities are excellent and the park is kept spotless. There was some construction underway, but it didn‚Äôt hinder my stay or take anything away from the atmosphere. The amenities are modern and well maintained, and the park has a relaxed, comfortable feel. The beach is only a short walk away, and having the Canton Sports Bar literally a step from the park was a great bonus.

Perfect for families, couples or anyone wanting a quiet coastal break with great service. I can‚Äôt wait to return.
showerReviews.author: Doug Hovi
