showerReviews.reviewText:
$60 powered en suite site good. Friendly staff. Supermarkets and shops a short drive. Quite a large park. There's a shore walk, don't go too far down the bush track end or you'll find yourself in the Everglades. Camp kitchen looked good though didn't use it. In fairness should be a 4-5 star place.

Unfortunately really didn't enjoy my time there as several cabins directly in front appeared occupied by an extended Urdu family with zero consideration for anyone else around them, and not very friendly at all. Noisiest site I've been on in six months of travelling, and was right under the Sydney Airport flight path a few days prior.

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
We had an amazing stay at Blue Lagoon in the 2-bedroom ocean view cabin (Cabin 34), and honestly, we couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better place to escape the stresses of day-to-day life.

The view of the beach was absolutely stunning. You could sit on the veranda and watch the waves crashing in, and being so close to the ocean meant you could even hear the waves while lying in bed ‚Äî the perfect sound to fall asleep to.

The cabin itself was fantastic (OMG üòç), and the water pressure in the shower was to die for! The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, which made the stay even better.

Highly recommend Blue Lagoon ‚Äî we‚Äôre already looking forward to booking again!

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely views across the inlet from the cabins. We really enjoyed sitting on the verandas each day. We had a family trip with 5 cabins between us. Clearly some of the cabins had been more recently renovated which were lovely. Others weee still quite dated. However I am assuming they will also be getting renovated soon. That being said, we had a very enjoyable stay. The camp kitchen is modern and tidy. The staff were helpful and friendly too.
showerReviews.author: Beck Dunn

showerReviews.reviewText: Not the best caravan park we have been to. I was here at this caravan park nearly 15 years ago and not much has changed. The bathrooms look like they have had a renovation but the shower heads were the old ones that were very poor so not sure why these were not upgraded with the rest of the bathroom Reno?? The park has a heap of permanent sites and it doesn‚Äôt compliment the park at all. The site fees for caravans is quite high and I am not sure why?? We‚Äôve stayed at other parks with better facilities and direct access to the beach or lake and the prices were no where near the price here. There were no rubbish bins in the caravan area or the cabins for that matter. They were located at the entry gate outside?? Not sure why?? But we weren‚Äôt to happy to have to walk to the front gate to empty our small caravan bin. The camp kitchen dining area was occupied all night by local residents and there was no other options. The camp kitchen lights turned off at 9:30pm even though the sign states 10:00pm. The water around the park was very swampy and had an odour to it?? Not the waterfront we were thinking?? The park overall was clean and tidy. There were some new cabins at the waterfront which looked really nice and cosy. We did notice that next door to the premium cabins were two tent sites?? And people in the tents were very noisy with loud music and loud voices. I wouldn‚Äôt be happy to pay premium dollar for a waterfront cabin and have people pay a fraction of the price for waterfront views in a powered tent site. Just saying. I‚Äôm not trying to be rude with my review only asking these questions?? I would stay here again if I was needing a caravan site overnight or short stay. Sometimes it‚Äôs the finishing touches that make the world of difference like the shower heads?? Charge premium but also give premium is my thought?? There was also limited access to the water as there were cabins or other sites that you needed to walk past in order to gain access. Felt uncomfortable walking past peoples cabins and or sites. Look forward to seeing some changes the next time we are in town. It‚Äôs a pity because it‚Äôs got a great location and it feels 2-3 star at the best.
showerReviews.author: Ali Turk (Alisturk)

showerReviews.reviewText:
Do not camp here.

The cars going past on the busy street kept us up all night. We requested to move campsites to what we thought would be a quieter part, and whilst we were told we were welcome to, we were also told that it probably won‚Äôt be much better as car hoons like to utilise that road at nighttime. There are other reviews outlining car noise as a major issue for campers.

As a business, if you are aware of an issue on one of your services, why would you continue to provide it as an option?

The sites were small, like a sandy, dirty parking spot.

Amenities were well maintained and clean. Good location and proximity to beach. Won‚Äôt be back though.

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed only one night for a funeral and it wasn‚Äôt a very pleasant experience. The cabins are so dusty and gross. There was a dead cockroach upon entering the cabin and had a horrible musty smell. You would think someone wouldn‚Äôt done another clean when expecting someone to stay in there. My allergies were horrible with the amount of dust. My feet were black after taking my shoes off and walking around. The shower doesn‚Äôt even turn off properly and keeps running even when I turned the taps off all the way. The main room downstairs is also extremely cold as the heater doesn't reach down the hall. Walls are so thin I can hear people stomping and running all night. Overall not a great experience. I bet one of the newer cabins would‚Äôve been nicer had it been available. The old cabins where the beach is need to be upgraded and cleaned properly.

locations.title: NRMA Budgewoi Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was a hard one to review......would I stay here again, probably as it was quiet and a good walk along the lake.

Compared to a few other coast NRMA parks we've stayed at which I rated highly across all aspects, Budgewoi is a lakeside park with easy access to Lakes Beach if needed.

The sites were large & level, heaps of birdlife and an easy walk to the pub & shops. Amenities were a bit dated in the section we were in, but I understand/saw evidence of upgrades underway.

The kids play area and pool were getting a lot of attention and the lady at reception was very friendly and helpful.
showerReviews.author: Scott James

There is a cafe onsite but also a cafe in the nearby park which has delicious home style muffins and coffee.

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you have to rely on the amenity showers, expect the water to go from cold to boiling hot, then back to cold, all the time you are showering.
The management told us that this is a holiday park and we couldn't stay even one day over our 28 days. Yet when we spoke to others, the management allowed over the 28 days. I suppose we aren't special. Very disappointed. Would never recommend this park, we have stayed at a few.
Don't take any notice of the cleaning times, which indicate approx 11:30. The cleaners turn up whenever they want.
The staff drive little buggies around, in excess of 8km/hr, more like 15km/hr.
Nice to be near the beach.
showerReviews.author: Janie ‚ÄúJanie‚Äù

showerReviews.reviewText:
Okay, but not great. Very conveniently located in the middle of the Central Coast, close to the Motorway.  Very scenic surrounds including a championship-quality golf course.  Excellent restaurant on site.

Staff were okay.

While the resort has some great features, the rooms aren't that great for what you pay for them.  Are quite large but lack many basic amenities: no mini-bar or snacks, no Netflix/Foxtel etc just some hotel-selected films to watch plus free-to-air TV channels and FoxSports.  There are Netflix etc apps on the TV menu but these don't work.  Casting your phone to the TV doesn't work either, even though the TVs have a 'Cast' option.

Bathroom is an accident and lawsuit waiting to happen: a bath-shower combo with no handrails or anything to grab onto when getting out of the shower-bath.
showerReviews.author: Grant Sansom-Sherwill

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location was convenient and the accommodation had good potential, however the property is in need of a revamp or renovation.

The kitchen induction cooktop only works one burner at a time and does not heat sufficiently. Cooking something simple like frying an egg took close to 30 minutes, which made self-catering very difficult.

Water pressure in one of the showers was extremely low, meaning showers took much longer than usual. The carpet in the room was noticeably worn, and there were spiders present on the balcony, which affected comfort.

With some upgrades and better maintenance, this could be a much more enjoyable stay. At its current state, the accommodation did not meet expectations for the price.
showerReviews.author: Alec Nathan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked a superior deluxe villa for my husbands birthday with our son daughter in law and grandson.
As check-in was 3pm I got there at 3 to decorate the villa for a surprise unfortunately I had to sit around for 50 minutes as the villa was not ready by this time my husband had arrived .
The staff were helpful and put our food into their office to keep it cool .
The staff were pleasant but so under staffed .

Then the dishwasher wasn‚Äôt working so the maintenance man was sent out .

Saturday night went for dinner but because we hadn‚Äôt booked and they were not doing walking ins due to have a wedding reception we had to eat in the bar this should have been communicated when we checked in . Once again because they didn‚Äôt have  the staff .

The spa though is amazing.

The resort really needs more staff and the villas need a tidy up .

Definitely not worth the money we paid and I definitely will not be going back .

The husband can just go for the day to play golf
showerReviews.author: Michaela Williamson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really disappointed with my experience during the weekend stay. I wish to provide a feedback on the following issues encountered by us:
1. Constant humming noise from the air conditioner throughout the time it was turned on
2.Power Point to which the aircon was connected was broken and there was risk of short circuit
3.No wardrobe, hangers, or anything else to hang clothes
4.No bin liner in the bins
5.Only 1 wine glass provided
6. No cleaning cloth or sponge provided
7. Sink not draining water properly and blocked
8.No soap for shower and as only (7) 15mls plastic tubes of shampoo/conditioner were provided. I had to buy soap for shower
9. Nobody in reception desk and when you ring the number it goes to voicemail. Poor customer service
10.Was supposed to get complimentary wine and chocolate. A verry poor quality $4 bottle of wine was provided and no chocolates were supplied despite requests
11.Drunken guests shouting and yelling at 1.00AM in the morning affecting sleep
12. No replacement fresh linen and towels were provided
13. The shower room very small and when you opened the bathroom door it got blocked by wash basin behind so door did not open properly
14 Plastic shower curtains so when we took shower water came on to the floor outside the shower
showerReviews.author: Sushmita Biswas

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would never stay here again. The website and the prices charged  are not an accurate representation of the quality of the rooms at all. Furnishings and fittings are very old, mismatched and in some cases not fit for purpose. Pans with  broken handles, no knives. The mattresses have completely collapsed and one of the beds was practically unusable - the side had completely sunken. Each bed had only one sheet and one blanket, pillow cases were dirty - not stained - literally soiled and clearly not replaced from previous stays and a couple of dead cockroaches laying around too! A used dishcloth was the only thing supplied in the kitchenette and we requested it be replaced - not done! The screen doors were off their runners, a blind had completely fallen off the window, and one bathroom practically flooded with every shower as there was no curtain or screen. The icing on the cake was the used condom under one of the beds.
Impossible to speak with anyone who works there as reception hours are very limited and I have since tried 4 times to call to discuss the issues and have either had a promise of a callback or no one answers. DO NOT BOOK THIS ACCOMODATION!
showerReviews.author: Amy Clare

locations.address: ÓÉà69 Cooks Rd, Glenworth Valley NSW 2250

showerReviews.reviewText:
A well equipped campground (paid) halfway between Sydney and Newcastle, catered for families and children with fun filled activities such as horse riding,quad biking etc just within the vicinity.
Glamping is also available.
Great toilet/shower facilities wit hot water.
Conveniently, 9-5 customer/food/beverages service kiosk as well.
What's more amazing, particularly for the kids, is the daily running of the horses that takes place around 4pm.
Probably not ideal for a real camping experience like in the bush.
showerReviews.author: S KC

showerReviews.reviewText:
The campground is situated in a beautiful valley and there are a lot of fun activities to enjoy.  All expensive.  People have fun and enjoy their experiences in the main as far as I could tell.
However:
The reason for my 1 star review is that the camping facilities you need are woefully inadequate, primitive, often filthy and totally unacceptable.

Bear in mind there can be 100s of campers in the area we stayed.

Want to wash your dishes? No kitchen type facilities exist. There are 2 sinks outside the toilets where people wash their hands, clean their teeth and spit out the debris etc and others try to wash up their stuff. If you wash your dishes at your campsite the only place to dump your waste water is the above 2 sinks which can be a good walk away, in use or dirty.

Want to use the toilet? The facilities are really very sub standard. Unacceptable.  There are ONLY 3 non gender toilets in the main block. For hundreds of people. Want to wash your hands. See above.

There are also 3 porta loo cabins that have a shower, a basin and a toilet. ALSO VERY PRIMITVE and unclean.

Need the toilet urgently? There are queues at every toilet during rush hours. Get in the wrong queue and keep your fingers crossed that the occupants ahead of you are quick, or don't take a 10 minute shower. I waited 20 minutes for a toilet.

I would be happy to stay there again ONLY  if I was in a self-contained caravan.

Finally, the prices they charge are totally excessive  given what they actually provide.
showerReviews.author: Denby Liddelow

locations.title: Bouddi National Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful coastal hike with amazing views!
Visited Bouddi National Park with friends on Saturday and had an awesome experience. The trail down to Maitland Bay is a bit steep with plenty of stairs, but totally worth it once you reach the beach ‚Äî it‚Äôs peaceful, clean, and surrounded by beautiful bushland.

From the lookout above, we were lucky enough to spot dolphins swimming near the shore, which made the hike even more memorable. The tracks are well marked, the scenery is stunning, and the mix of forest and coastal views is perfect for a weekend adventure.

Highly recommend for anyone looking for a rewarding walk in the Central Coast!
showerReviews.author: Pankaj Tiwari

locations.title: Sun Valley Tourist Park
locations.address: ÓÉà2 Bateau Bay Rd, Bateau Bay NSW 2261

showerReviews.reviewText: Great spot right on Shelly Beach on the Central Coast. Perfect location for a getaway for adults or families next to the surf club which has a cafe restaurant downstairs 7 days a week & a bar & bistro upstairs for lunch & dinner Fri, Sat & Sun. Also next door to the huge Bateau Bay Bowlo (aka Wyong Leagues) & on the other side is Shelly Beach Golf Club. Both clubs offer fantastic food & dining options. Shelly Beach Golf Course is also next door & offers 18 hole golf with golf buggy. Just up the road is the Bateau Bay Square, a mall as good as any with 100s of shops & Maccas etc. We rented an old style 2 bedroom villa & although it's a bit dated & the shower pressure a bit weak other than that no complaints for $100 a night on the weekend in March. There are also beachside cabins which cost a bit more but we were happy to be a few minutes walk away. The kiosk on site offers newspapers, groceries & food on weekends & school holidays. We googled cabins on the Central Coast & found this place & feel like we hit the jackpot because it's great value for the position it's in. Also $3.50 schooners at the Bowlo all day every day üëçüèº
showerReviews.author: Steve Mavin

There are also beachside cabins which cost a bit more but we were happy to be a few minutes walk away. The kiosk on site offers newspapers, groceries & food on weekends & school holidays. We googled cabins on the Central Coast & found this place & feel like we hit the jackpot because it's great value for the position it's in. Also $3.50 schooners at the Bowlo all day every day üëçüèº

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have booked for two nights ground level.
I had checked the room and left my bags then opened the bathroom door it smelt like sewage inside the bathroom facility.  I had close the bathroom door when leaving  and small cockroach was crawling on the wall. Next day I was in and out of room but I had left the bathroom door open this time thinking it would air it out and when I came back the whole apartment stunk like sewage that was coming from the bathroom facility was disgusting. Once I closed the door it had eliminated it so I can get Sleep that night. So I needed to get up early 230 in the morning going to have a shower and then I‚Äôve seen a cockroach those little tiny little brown little things again crawling around near the fridge I didn‚Äôt get a chance to kill it. Well, I‚Äôm sitting on the edge of the bed. I looked over and you could see behind the fridge that hasn‚Äôt been cleaned for a long time. It‚Äôs a lot of buildup of dust behind it. Fridge was NOT even cold.
I had drinks and food in there that I had to throw out because it was not cold. I was a bit annoyed about that. Frankly, I just did not have a good stay after seeing the cockroaches and smell that was so disgusting. I could not even think to even have breakfast that morning  set out  in the foyer area good thing was convenient having Maccas went and got coffee and breakfast there. No PowerPoint in the bathroom to use for hairdryer., very poor accommodation for the price$$.
I understand it was going to be a small compacted room with no high expectations. But cleanness very poor need to get pest control.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I booked the Ibis Budget Gosford knowing it would be basic and compact, which was perfectly fine for an overnight stay‚Äîespecially given its association with the Accor brand and standards. However, I was very disappointed to discover a noticeable urine stain on the bed sheet. Unfortunately, I didn‚Äôt see it until the morning, which was unpleasant knowing I had slept in it. Regardless of price or star rating, clean linens are a fundamental expectation for any accommodation.

On top of that, the shower was poorly maintained and fell below even budget expectations. To make matters worse, the roller blind on the window had squashed bugs on it; clearly, when the blind rolls up it crushes insects, and no one has bothered to clean it.

I don‚Äôt write reviews often, but I don‚Äôt want another guest to go through the same experience, and I hope management addresses these issues promptly.

I am also an employee of an Accor property myself, and I know the brand holds clear expectations for cleanliness and guest care. This experience does not reflect those standards.

The staff were polite and check-in was smooth, but housekeeping and maintenance clearly need much closer attention. At the very least, guests should be able to expect fresh, spotless sheets, a properly functioning shower, and clean window coverings.
showerReviews.author: Blake Martins

locations.title: endota spa Terrigal
locations.address: ÓÉàCrowne Plaza, Level/1 Pine Tree Ln, Terrigal NSW 2260

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited Endota Spa Terrigal on a Sunday morning and wanted to share a balanced reflection of my experience.

On a positive note, I was pleasantly surprised to find a parking spot right out the front, which is rare, especially on a weekend. As I walked into the spa, there was a subtle, pleasant scent that set an initially welcoming tone.

Having visited many high-end day spas over the years, I did notice a few things that fell short of what I‚Äôve come to expect. The atmosphere wasn‚Äôt as tranquil or peaceful as it could have been ‚Äî the lighting in the treatment room wasn‚Äôt particularly dim, and there was notable noise from hotel guests and traffic outside. These distractions made it difficult to fully relax.

In other spas, I‚Äôve been used to being gently ushered into a quiet space before treatment, offered a robe, slippers, a warm towel, and a calm area to sit with tea and light snacks. On this occasion, I was taken directly to the room and asked to undress and get straight onto the table. I also noticed that the face rest cover appeared to have make-up residue on it, which raised some questions about hygiene and attention to detail.

The massage itself was satisfactory ‚Äî it may suit some people‚Äôs preferences, though it wasn‚Äôt the best I‚Äôve had. The ambient noise and brightness also made it difficult to fully switch off. The face mask also wasn't what I was expecting. I thought it would be brushed on and left to set, but instead it was like one of the cheap paper ones you'd get from a pharmacy. It didn't feel indulgent at all.

When the treatment ended, I felt a little rushed as I was only halfway dressed when there was a knock at the door. Checking out was also less relaxing than expected, as the front desk staff seemed to be caught up in conversation about a colleague, which came across as unprofessional. It reminded me of the kind of workplace chatter most of us are trying to escape when we visit a spa.

Perhaps the biggest disappointment was finding out that access to the hotel facilities ‚Äî particularly the sauna, steam room, and pool ‚Äî is no longer offered on weekends with a spa booking. That amenity used to be a highlight and was one of the main reasons I booked. I was told pool access is now only available on weekdays.

While there were some positive touches, overall the experience fell short of what I‚Äôd hoped for. I don‚Äôt think I will return to Endota Spa Terrigal, but I will happily go back to the spa at Magenta Shores, which offers a more consistent sense of relaxation and care.
showerReviews.author: A M

showerReviews.reviewText:
24/072024 Edit: I'm not sure why the spa/sauna area is so highly regulated. If you pay extra, you get 30 minutes in the spa and the staff here really police the time limit.

I was really uncomfortable when a stranger in the spa with me was repeatedly asked to leave by a staff member in an aggressive tone. The man explained that he didn't know the rules and from my perspective, he wasn't offending or harming anyone.

There's no visible signage or information about the hot tub thing, so I don't blame this stranger for not knowing these ridiculous rules.

(First review) The gating has been designed by an over-ambitiously foolish team who didn't consider the needs of older members of our community or people with disabilities.

I'm in my 30s and entering as a casual swimmer is an ordeal of using my phone for a single-day visit. I'm unsure why I can't just pay by card? Maybe you can, but the queue of customers asking questions about how to enter is too long to bother standing behind.

It's unfortunate that front-end staff have to deal with complaints from swimmers who can't pay easily just to enter a local pool.

In what way is this productive or a community oriented enterprise?

Facilities are fine otherwise, like.. what else can you say about a new swimming centre? It's new. And it's annoying to get into, and it's definitely locking out older and disabled people from using it.
showerReviews.author: Francis Vivek

showerReviews.reviewText:
Top gym. Plenty floor space. Good views.  Very clean, modern and state of the art. The machines are digital and can track your reps, sets, weight and tempo.

showerReviews.reviewText:
In an earlier review, I had given Universal Fitness Group a 5/5 star rating because of the variety of the workout equipment geared for strength and bodybuilding, how clean and modern the entire space looks - especially the HIIT area and the sled corridor, the amenities (including sauna & steam room) and above all, how friendly, kind and incredibly helpful all the staff members are.

While all of that still stands today, my only recent gripe is how small the changerooms are. Understandably, UF Parramatta is a very popular gym, though the changerooms can genuinely get VERY packed, especially during peak time (at around 5-6pm) and often you'll have to bump shoulders with others to access your locker.

I anticipate sometime in the future, UF Parramatta will (hopefully) acquire a bigger space with a larger changeroom, or the opening of the UF Pemulwuy gym will hopefully take pressure from the number of people at UF Parramatta during peak hours.

A small nitpick - some of the equipment can be a bit redundant (i.e. there are 2x hack squat machines and 2x 45-degree leg presses. Maybe replacing these with some other machines like a T-Bar Row or a supine chest press machine would greatly increase equipment and exercise variety).

Also, the hip thrust machine specifically feels somewhat odd to use, would recommend replacing it with a belt-secured hip thrust machine (i.e. the Nautilus Glute Drive or similar).

Keep up the great work UFG - you're the best gym in Parramatta for a reason! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
showerReviews.author: Arjuna Jayasooriya (AJ)

locations.title: Fitness First Parramatta

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è 3/5 - Good gym with great people, but in serious need of maintenance and upgrades

I originally rated Fitness First Parramatta 4 stars, but after spending more time here, I‚Äôve noticed a few issues that really need to be addressed.

The cons:

‚ùå There‚Äôs a lot of broken or worn-down equipment. Some are minor cosmetic issues like faded dumbbell labels or cracked bench padding, but others are much more serious - a few benches are broken, and some of the weight pins on plate-loaded machines look like they‚Äôre on their last legs. There are some fantastic Matrix-brand machines here, but they‚Äôre too few and far between. Honestly, the whole gym is overdue for a massive equipment refurb.

‚ùå No towel hire available.

‚ùå Weights, especially dumbbells and barbells, are often missing or left scattered on the floor. This is something members and staff alike should manage better.

‚ùå For a gym of this size, it‚Äôs surprising that there‚Äôs no hack squat machine or glute drive machine.

The pros:

‚úÖ The Fitness First Parramatta community is wonderful, and the staff are always friendly and helpful.

‚úÖ The Matrix-branded equipment that is here is top-tier ‚Äî easily some of the best machines you can use.

‚úÖ There‚Äôs still a decent variety of machinery overall, with lots of flat and incline bench press stands.

‚úÖ The location is incredibly convenient ‚Äî right by the Parramatta Light Rail on Macquarie Street, so perfect for anyone commuting.

‚úÖ Much cheaper than some of the boutique gyms nearby\

Overall, there‚Äôs definitely room for improvement - especially in maintenance and equipment variety - but if you‚Äôre in Parramatta and want a no-frills gym with a great community at a fair price, it‚Äôs still worth checking out.
showerReviews.author: Arjuna Jayasooriya (AJ)

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è 3/5 - Good gym with great people, but in serious need of maintenance and upgrades

I originally rated Fitness First Parramatta 4 stars, but after spending more time here, I‚Äôve noticed a few issues that really need to be addressed.

The cons:

‚ùå There‚Äôs a lot of broken or worn-down equipment. Some are minor cosmetic issues like faded dumbbell labels or cracked bench padding, but others are much more serious - a few benches are broken, and some of the weight pins on plate-loaded machines look like they‚Äôre on their last legs. There are some fantastic Matrix-brand machines here, but they‚Äôre too few and far between. Honestly, the whole gym is overdue for a massive equipment refurb.

‚ùå No towel hire available.

‚ùå Weights, especially dumbbells and barbells, are often missing or left scattered on the floor. This is something members and staff alike should manage better.

‚ùå For a gym of this size, it‚Äôs surprising that there‚Äôs no hack squat machine or glute drive machine.

The pros:

‚úÖ The Fitness First Parramatta community is wonderful, and the staff are always friendly and helpful.

‚úÖ The Matrix-branded equipment that is here is top-tier ‚Äî easily some of the best machines you can use.

‚úÖ There‚Äôs still a decent variety of machinery overall, with lots of flat and incline bench press stands.

‚úÖ The location is incredibly convenient ‚Äî right by the Parramatta Light Rail on Macquarie Street, so perfect for anyone commuting.

‚úÖ Much cheaper than some of the boutique gyms nearby\

Overall, there‚Äôs definitely room for improvement - especially in maintenance and equipment variety - but if you‚Äôre in Parramatta and want a no-frills gym with a great community at a fair price, it‚Äôs still worth checking out.
showerReviews.author: Arjuna Jayasooriya (AJ)

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fitness First Parramatta is easily a 5-star gym! The layout is fantastic with dedicated spaces for boxing, cycling, cardio, and Zumba, plus a women-only room that provides privacy and comfort for those who prefer it.
The Zumba classes are a highlight‚Äîcool dance moves paired with modern music make them fun and fresh, not outdated or cringy. The instructors bring great energy and keep it exciting every time.
Staff are always friendly and helpful, especially Ann, who goes above and beyond. The gym itself feels spacious and airy thanks to its multi-level design‚Äînever crowded, stuffy, or smelly.
Extra details make the experience even better: the vending machine is always refilled, cold water is available, the change rooms are roomy, and even the soap smells great.
Overall, Fitness First Parramatta delivers excellent facilities, a welcoming atmosphere, and staff who genuinely care. Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: B J

locations.title: Fernwood Fitness

showerReviews.reviewText:
PROS*- YES! ONLY WOMENS gym in Parramatta. I actually get upset when people downplay Women's only Gym.¬† There has never been a successful women gym other than Fernwood in Australia for more than 35years that speaks volume in itself. Parramatta has been there for more than 18years & has come a long way as well is home for many women like myself which has been 10 years.

It being a "WOMEN ONLY" means..
*SAFETY-The amount of stories I've heard from mix gyms is insane. I feel nothing but safe, training along women of all ages & race who have alot of respect for each other.¬† My husband is less worried lol but as a mum, I'm so glad that there is a safe space that my daughter/loved ones can come to exercise without worries and seeing family generations of women (Grandmother to grandaughters) is so empowering.¬†The community at Parramatta is encouraging,full of joy and Inspiration. The women are very welcoming & supportive. The Staff/trainers are friendly & professional
I can happily Name & vouch for every single one. It's a shame people decided to Public shame specific staff discrediting ones work ethic & even admit fault-Read the Contract Ladies. Update ur Fernwood App/email regularly to receive up to date news/ Check notice boards.

*CRECHE- is available. Knowing that I can bring my child to the gym and (I'm not talking about leaving them in the pram on the fitness floor) but an actual designated space for them makes it possible for us to attend. Yes creche gets booked out fast but that is a given being an only women gym. Try Opt for different times, set alarm to book in advance. There is morning/evening sessions available as well. So thankful we have this option at Parramatta as some Fernwoods unfortunately don't. Let alone most mix gyms don't cater for us Mums so Love that we have creche & Yes it's Free.

*GROUPFITNESS CLASSES- There are so many classes to choose from that are Awesome! Les Mill Programs (pump, Combat, attack etc) to boxing, yoga, cycle the list goes on. Give all the classes a chance, y not u paid for it than if it's not for u then it's Not but I always encourage ladies to try for fun or u may need to switch ur routine to see a change. U can also do it Virtually(using tv).

*PAID PROGRAMS
*Reformer Pilates - The Reformer Classes are amazing! When I can't do Reformer Classes I take advantage of the Virtual option. Meaning u use the screen when there is No class. Prices I hear/see for 1 session in private studios are expensive. I happily pay the extra at my gym & do Unlimited.

*FIT30- Strength/Hit classes in a smaller group setting for 30mins. I've done Fit30 for almost 7 years now & this is where I've learnt most about Technique, Strength & my preferred training style. Yes there is a designated space but No! all the equipment in that space is not for Fit30 ONLY. We happily share the weights & equipment. As it is smaller group the trainer can be more attentive. IF ur busy & can't be bothered to fix your own workout, Fit30 is there to do it for you. The progress I've seen from fit30 is inspiring!

*Hypoxi -Is only available across all Fernwoods.I have not tried it but witnessing the body change of other women who do hypoxi, show great results.

The gym is
-Spacious, Awesome view of Parramatta - Comfy Kitchen area/ lounge
-Convinent Parking / Close to Public Transport
-Recovery space-Sauna/steam/cool room + moonsoon Shower
- Sister Pass-Visit any Fernwood Club in Aus
- Club Challenges & Personal Training
Honestly the list goes on..

Cons* Access on public holiday make it difficult by Westfields, I'm sure will improve. As women are getting stronger would like to see more weights & crossfit style training In fit30. Some machines do need upgrade.

Fernwood Parramatta is my personal playground/home/me time. It has educated me so much on how important it is to prioritise my health. I was always looking at the money side but 10 years later, It Really is YOU GET WHAT YOU PUT IN. If ur looking for a gym that's going to help you long term, I highly recommend Fernwood Parramatta. Hope to see u there.
showerReviews.author: Angelic K

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently had our wedding at the Washington Lounge, and it was truly the best day of our lives. From the very first contact with Nicole, she was incredibly helpful, always responding quickly and helping us with great recommendations. She made us feel welcome every time we visited the venue, and even on our wedding day, she was there to ensure everything was right.

If you're looking for a venue with a stunning ocean view, this is the perfect spot in Sydney! Our guests were all amazed by the beauty of the place, and the fairy lights at sunset made everything even more magical and special.
Thank you so much for making our day unforgettable!

locations.title: Salters Field

showerReviews.reviewText: This area of Parramatta Park is named after a former convict who moved to the area in 1796. 30 acres of land was granted to George Salter, allowing him to ‚Äòreside and cultivate the land.‚Äô Salter had been convicted of smuggling in England and given a sentence of transportation for 7 years, arriving in Sydney Cove on the Second Fleet in 1789. By 1800, he had successfully transformed Salter‚Äôs Farm, and was producing large crops of wheat and maize. You'll find wildlife in this area - They love the swimming in Domain Creek.
showerReviews.author: Brenden Wood

locations.title: Gladius Hotel & Suites

showerReviews.reviewText:
I booked a standard King room direct on Gladius website a week in advance and checked in at 2.30pm. I Joined Choice membership to receive free upgrade with our booking. We paid premium rate for room. Hotel is quite far from restaurants and bars so expect to pay around $30 for return Uber if you want to go anywhere
Room on level 2 was so small we could not open the bar fridge completely because the bed was in the way. To open doors and cuboards was a logistical nightmare
No bedside tables a desk and small chair that you couldn't pull out because again the bed was in the way
Two very small widows and a whole lot of unnecessary cabinetry taking up space ,enough for 5 people's belongings for weeks. No full length mirror. No air conditioning in common areas and it was 32 degrees. No instructions in room to call front desk so I had to go and find staff to get ice. Staff were sitting in tiny dining room next to front desk eating KFC when I approached
Person with children occupied room on floor and the noise transfer was really loud. All doors slammed loudly also.
After realising how loud our room was and finally getting the front desk number I called and asked if there was a more suitable room. They said we can not change rooms as we had been there longer than 3 hours. I said I can not possibly get any rest in this room he said if we paid an extra $50 we can get an up grade from our standard room. I said I thought we did receive our upgrade and he said no because of the festival. That's not my problem I explained he then asked if he could call back after speaking to his supervisor. Called back 5 minutes with same answer and offered to check out at 11 rather than 10 and free continental breakfast which I declined. I asked what was the supervisors name and said I can't tell you I will get into trouble. I don't think he bothered to even ask
Was awoken regularly through night due to noise and woken at 6am from guests in their rooms.
Partner and I was hoping to enjoy some quality quiet time instead we sat on a bed in a tiny claustrophobic box hearing the business of other guests. Very disappointed and not feeling rested at all. Basically ruined our stay. Save disappointment and book elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Sally-Jane Haggarty

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was our 2nd time staying at Skye Parramatta. Upon arriving, reception was very friendly and also gave our children candy since it was Halloween night.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. The apartment was beautiful. However, we did not appreciate such a small bathroom vanity (there was none - It was just a sink) for an apartment that sleeps up to 6 people. There was no space to put your basics like soap and toothbrush/paste. Other than that, the apartment is very comfortable and convenient with all essentials like a microwave, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, etc.

The hotel is also walking distance to Parramatta Westfield and Parramatta station.
showerReviews.author: Jessica Butler

locations.title: Bielany Polish Campground
locations.address: ÓÉà213 Upper Colo Rd, Colo NSW 2756

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantasic spot to disconnect and get your camping on. It wasn't busy so plenty of space and privacy. Walking around there was plenty of space between sites.

Alot of the camp spaces were fairly flat so made set up super easy. It was clean and the facilities also pretty good. Women's bathroom was well lit, clean and flushable (such a benefit when camping). Didn't have a shower but they also looked in good knick.

NSW has had a stupid amount of rain lately but the section we had was nice and pretty dry, a few puddles around just take it nice and slow in the car if you have low clearance (we were in a Hyundai Ionic and it was fine)

I believe Ricky checked us in and he was great.

Already starting to chat about our next visit and bringing the rest of the camping group for a few nights :)
showerReviews.author: A.M Golden

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really lovely spot. Cheap for the night, a lot of space for campers to choose from and spread out as well.
It's nifty having toilets and showers with hot water and drinkable water available.
The river is great, clean, cool and good for a swim here and there in the day.
Loved having a fire at night too.
I went camping for the night by myself with my swag and felt really comfortable and safe.
The care takers are really wonderful, friendly and helpful.
Definitely a place to return to.
showerReviews.author: Erin McIntosh

showerReviews.reviewText:
Update:  weve been coming here for about 18 months and it's the only place we stay at. The rooms are always clean and fresh. Nathan who manages is absolutely amazing. He goes over and beyond to make sure he accommodates your every need.  The beds are so comfortable and we've have been in every room almost!  We love staying here,  this is our Gunnedah Go-to.

Thanks Nathan for being the best motelier.

We needed emergency accommodation due to a sudden death in our family. We booked 3 rooms, all different but extremely comfortable and well equipped.  The shower was amazing!! FIONA who was in charge was an AMAZING person. She was so beautiful,  friendly and she was so compassionate when she found out our story. We stayed for 2 nights and we will be back again
This lady cleaned all day long and I must say our rooms were immaculate.  Fiona is a true asset to this motel. We were all in awe at how hard she was working here from dawn till dusk, still smiling as the sun went down. Fiona, you should be really proud of the person you are. It was a pleasure to stay with you.
Thank you. See you again soon.
showerReviews.author: Mum of 4

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hotel was great for the value. Anywhere else in Sydney would cost you a fortune.
This is likely a wonderful option for you. Do be advised rooms are only accessible by stairs. Food just downstairs, along with games, TV and free water!!!!

Pros and cons;
Pros, right above the bar where there's an atm, gaming room, drinks and food, staff are super friendly and helpful, very kind too! FREE WATER!!! Shockley enough, the rooms are SHOCKINGLY quiet, youd think it'd be loud with the bar downstairs, but even on a busy footy day it's shockingly quiet, could easily sleep. The beds are so comfy, too!

Cons; shared bathroom, although it's cleaned regularly! Washing machine and dryer use $1 coins for a total of $4 for a wash, but the staff are happy to exchange notes for coins so you can use it!
Lastly, if you have accessibility issues, the rooms are likely not for you as it's only accessible by a flight of stairs.
showerReviews.author: Snow Hawk

locations.title: Home Backpackers

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hostel was easy to find. When I arrived the staff was very friendly and polite. He showed us too our room and had a tour of the hostel.

The room is clean and with clean linen and blankets. The room had fans, and windows that was easy to open and close. The beds are comfortable and nice to sleep in.

The kitchen is fully equipped and it‚Äôs big enough for a lot of people to comfortably eat and cook.

The shower is clean, and it‚Äôs washed every day.
The toilets is small but it‚Äôs clean.

Overall I would really recommend this hostel!! It‚Äôs suuuuper central. It‚Äôs bus stops along the road, and it‚Äôs a 4 min walk to the train and metro station called central. It‚Äôs a lot of nice cafes and restaurants within 500m of walking and also a lot of bars.

The hostel is quiet, no noise complaints!!
showerReviews.author: Linne Jensen

showerReviews.reviewText: I booked this hostel during New Year‚Äôs Eve. It was the cheapest hostel I could find, and the reasons are as follows. The floors, bathrooms, kitchens, showers and rooms are quite musty and unsettling. During my stay I saw plenty of cockroaches, and one dead mouse. There is one washer and dryer. You can go to the nearby laundermat, but the one here is cheaper. The roof is good to see the sky, but nothing more than that. With that being said I‚Äôd like to note that the staff is kind and helpful, friendly as well. And the people I met here are very kind and I‚Äôm grateful to have met them. I‚Äôd suggest this place for those not in search of Luxury, but instead trying to save money and maybe make friends in the mean time. Myself? I‚Äôd consider my stay work while.
showerReviews.author: Charles Maciel

showerReviews.reviewText:
DO NOT STAY HERE
We stayed for 3 nights, it was unbearable. The corridors stunk of urine and cigarettes and the walls and carpets were stained everywhere.
We saw countless cockroaches and rats, the rooms have no AC, just a fan or two to blow hot air around.

The mattress I slept on felt like sleeping on a metal fence, the springs in the mattress had failed and tangled, causing great discomfort during my stay here. Sheets were not clean and the ‚Äúduvet sheet‚Äù was just a dirty blanket

Many of the ‚Äúbackpackers‚Äù staying here were not travelling, but semi permanent residents, this gave a very uncomfortable feel.
The showers were freezing cold, and covered in what looked like facial or pubic hair, most of the showers were also missing doors.

The kitchen was filthy and not enough space for more than 1 person at a time to cook, there were 2 mugs and one glass for the whole hostel

However, the staff seemed friendly enough and made sure to check on us to make sure everything was ok during our stay

This hostel was the cheapest we could find in Sydney, HOWEVER, for this type of experience I would expect to be paying around $10 a night, not $40
showerReviews.author: Wadaiyatalkinabeet

We stayed for 3 nights, it was unbearable. The corridors stunk of urine and cigarettes and the walls and carpets were stained everywhere.
We saw countless cockroaches and rats, the rooms have no AC, just a fan or two to blow hot air around.

The mattress I slept on felt like sleeping on a metal fence, the springs in the mattress had failed and tangled, causing great discomfort during my stay here. Sheets were not clean and the ‚Äúduvet sheet‚Äù was just a dirty blanket

Many of the ‚Äúbackpackers‚Äù staying here were not travelling, but semi permanent residents, this gave a very uncomfortable feel.
The showers were freezing cold, and covered in what looked like facial or pubic hair, most of the showers were also missing doors.

The kitchen was filthy and not enough space for more than 1 person at a time to cook, there were 2 mugs and one glass for the whole hostel

However, the staff seemed friendly enough and made sure to check on us to make sure everything was ok during our stay

This hostel was the cheapest we could find in Sydney, HOWEVER, for this type of experience I would expect to be paying around $10 a night, not $40
showerReviews.author: Wadaiyatalkinabeet

showerReviews.reviewText:

locations.title: Western Sydney University Village Parramatta

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not a good experience at all. This term I live with two students who constantly smoking, vaping and drinking, also making loud noise and being rude to the other mates. I have reported this issue to the management team several times and none action has been done. It's seems like the management team just care about their revenues rather than make sure students' health or wellbeing.

The process of changing room also complicated and when I ask the team, they always say that the village is fully booked although I can see there is some spare room on the booking website (same type of room with mine).

Additionally, the shuttle bus system is not working well, if you learn at Parramatta City campus, it's should take like an hour to travel there despite 2km apart. The bus driver can stop his journey whenever he want, regardless of the long line of students wait to commute.

About the room, only Premium room would have air conditioner and newer facilities. When I come to my friend's standard room, it kinda dirty and old, with no air conditioner.

So if you are a parent who consider to send your child to live in the village, please take full consideration. The village living is not safe and as secured as you think!
showerReviews.author: Linh Nguyen

showerReviews.reviewText:
I lived at WSU Parramatta accommodation for three years before finally moving out ‚Äî and honestly, it‚Äôs not worth the money.

To anyone looking at this place, especially international students: I know it might seem like the safest and easiest option, but trust me, it‚Äôs not what it looks like in the photos or on the website.

You‚Äôll be moving into a mattress that has been used by multiple people, probably for over a decade. The carpets in the rooms are never deep cleaned ‚Äî they‚Äôre full of years-old stains, including vomit and urine. Hygiene is a serious issue, and the overall condition of the apartments is pretty bad.

Roommates are hit or miss. You might get lucky, or you might be stuck with people who are extremely unhygienic ‚Äî some leave trash and food rotting around the apartment for days. Management won‚Äôt help. You can report issues as much as you want, and nothing will change. They don‚Äôt enforce cleanliness or shared living standards at all.

If you still decide to move in, DO NOT sign a full-year contract. It might look slightly cheaper, but if you ever lose your job or have to move out early, you‚Äôll get slammed with a cancellation fee equal to your rent and then have to keep paying rent for six more weeks after you move out. This makes it nearly impossible to move somewhere else unless you can afford double rent.

As for those ‚Äúfree dinners‚Äù and ‚Äúcommunity breakfasts‚Äù? Bland, cold, and honestly worse than nursing home food.

There are better, safer, and cheaper options out there. This place is not only a financial trap but also a genuine health concern.
showerReviews.author: Black Crimson

locations.title: Ultimate Family Entertainment Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
We went to this place on a recommendation,  not very pleased with the outcome, though.
There is a carpark space and plenty of parking spaces.
The staff were pretty helpful in the tickets and the food. They have party rooms up the stairs and some in the main area. There are four play areas, one for kids 0-5 and one for kids 5-12 and two trampoline areas and one foam pit. They also have bumper cars, and there are 5 cars, each for $6 per ride, but the rink is pretty small. They also have arcade games, mostly $2 or $3 each.
The main problem was the hygiene and cleanness of the place.
Most equipment was broken, and there was dust and grime on the fans. The foam pit foams were ripped, and the trampoline linings were falling off.
So the hygiene is a big problem, but the rest is alright for younger kids.
P.S.
The password for the free WiFi is Ultimate1
showerReviews.author: Oz Khan

locations.title: Face Body Day Spa & Beauty Salon

showerReviews.reviewText:
Save your money and don't come here. Service wasn't the best and didn't start on time.I felt I have been ripped off. I wanted my 90min massage and 10 minute into the session she expressed 1 hour will be good as she wanted to concentrate on a facial treatment. I was hesitant but trusted her opinion. And when i was getting the facial she kept leaving the room and left me there for like 3 minutes each time. The machine was outdated, and was surprised to see face towel in the rice cooker. Lol. And I'm pretty sure my therapist¬† was the owner. Will not be coming back.

Update as of 02/07/25 6:10pm
Hi Sukhi,
Thank you for your reply.

To clarify I had not been late, I had arrived on time for my appointment and had been waiting for you. If I was smiling and looked happy it was because I was relieved to leave your business after the bad experience. When you had called me after reading my review I had advised you that it wasn't a good time to talk due to being the end of the financial year and I was at work. However you had come across as pushy and insisted to try and justify your actions without bothering to understand my unhappiness with the experience, at no time during the call did you offer any empathy or apology. For the record I am not happy with the service in store, the phone call and your response here. I feel I have been ripped off and with bad service to match.

I am happy to move on, so please don't contact me again. I hope you take the feedback on board and wish you and your business all the best. Thanks Junalyn
showerReviews.author: Junalyn

locations.title: Nepean Aquatic Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
My nearly 3-year-old started lessons here in late September. On one of his first classes, he was left unattended on the step while the instructor was at the other end of the pool. He fell in and was floating face-down when I had to jump in and pull him out. There was no lifeguard or supervisor, and I was told they only provide one ‚Äúwhen staffing allows.‚Äù

Over the two months we stayed, there was no consistency with instructors, constant make-up students added into classes, and teachers who didn‚Äôt know the kids‚Äô abilities. My son went from loving swimming to clinging to me and refusing to get in. He gained no new skills and has become fearful which is the exact opposite of what we paid for. Overall, a stressful and disappointing experience and a waste of money.
showerReviews.author: Cherokee Quirke

locations.title: Dive In Swimming Academy

showerReviews.reviewText:
We‚Äôve been coming to Dive In Swimming School for over three months now, and I couldn‚Äôt be happier. The teachers are absolutely lovely‚Äîso warm, patient, and passionate about what they do. Their professional approach and the way they teach the kids is fantastic, and you can really see the progress.

One of the things I really appreciate is how flexible and understanding they are. If your child is sick, they provide a token so you can make up the session later‚Äîsuch a thoughtful approach that makes families feel truly supported.

What I love most is that this isn‚Äôt just a swimming class‚Äîit feels like being part of a family. Every trainer we‚Äôve had has been wonderful, and you can really see how much they care about the kids. It‚Äôs not just about teaching swimming skills; it‚Äôs about creating a positive, fun, and caring environment.

Thank you to the whole team at Dive In Swimming School for giving our children not only great classes and skills, but also beautiful memories. We are so grateful!
showerReviews.author: Sarvin Rodd

showerReviews.reviewText:
Dive In have been amazing for my 2 youngest sons since moving to the area in 2021. As a parent, it's obvious that the swim instructors strive to do the very best for each child. All staff are approachable, supportive and helpful. It's a lovely family run academy that go the extra mile. Their make-up lesson system is the best & fairest I've seen as they understand how life can get between commitments and illness etc.
My additional needs son has had wonderful, nurturing and highly skilled instructors helping him through. My older middle son has had so much support and encouragement which has seen him achieve wonderful achievements in his school swimming carnivals and now making it to Zone level.
It's truly a lovely, safe and welcoming environment and a great place for children to learn vital skills. We will always appreciate our sons' years at Dive In.

locations.title: Club Lime Penrith - Mulgoa Road

showerReviews.reviewText:
The unique qualities I enjoy most about Club Lime on Mulgoa Road are as follows
- Communal change rooms, ample individual lockers
- Sauna
- Opportunity to watch the senior Panthers squad training every Monday morning

I also appreciate the well appointed cardio, weight yoga, cryo suite and martial arts equipment in their own specific areas.

I generally find the staff helpful and knowledgeable in all matters health and fitness.  I especially enjoy the purchasing a protein smoothy at their small Cafe.

I highly recommend this 24 hour value for money gym.

locations.title: Cables Wake Park & Aqua Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Aqua Park is a fun place for a day out, especially for families and kids who enjoy water activities. The staff were friendly and the overall setup was decent. However, a few things could definitely be improved.

The shower rooms really need clothes hangers‚Äîthere‚Äôs nowhere to hang your dry clothes or towel, which makes it inconvenient. Also, the 5-minute time limit for showering after activities is far too short, especially for families with kids. Extending this to 20‚Äì30 minutes would make the experience much more relaxed and enjoyable.

Lastly, some of the inflatables were noticeably low on air, making them less safe and harder to play on. Regular checks and refills would help maintain both safety and fun.

Overall, it‚Äôs a good place but with a few adjustments, it could be great.
showerReviews.author: Dinesh Shah

showerReviews.reviewText: Very quiet over winter with short hours; no lifesavers in colder months. The building looks tired -- but someone has a fun sense of humour here. There's a pay bbq, toilets (open in winter), and outdoor shower.  Easy sand track to the beach; waves good here. Beach very clean with only rare plastic wash-ins; rough weather sees dislodged seaweed on the beach.
showerReviews.author: Alan Walmsley

Taboo is a fast lefthand reef break, only for the experienced surfer...3 barrel sections!
Cudmirrah Beaach Surfclub has had a full makeover.
No lifeguards on duty during off season.
Be careful swimming, a man drowned on the southern end of beach- mid March 2023.
Grazing Gals are running the kiosk/kitchen, good food.... eat in or take away.

showerReviews.reviewText: Friendly staff and free parking. Reasonable price. They upgraded my room for free because I asked for a downstairs room due to my heavy luggage. The room was huge for one person, and there was a wide desk, a chair, and a diffuser. Plus shampoo, conditioner and body wash. There was also a beautiful view with jacaranda trees. However, the bathroom had a mouldy smell, so it seems like it needs better ventilation. But overall, I was really satisfied with my stay.

showerReviews.reviewText:
A rare stay in a hotel these days (because we own a camper trailer), a great time was had by all.
Can't say a bad thing about this place.
Although on a busy road, near a pub and a train line, it was pleasantly quiet.
Great staff, so helpful abd happy to do anything for you (including warming baby bottles for us between open office hours of 8 am - 8 pm, because there's no microwave in the rooms).
Spacious rooms with plenty of cabinetry room, double beds and our travel portacot - our 4yo was ecstatic that she had a big double all to herself.
Our 4yo also loved that she had a desk for all her colourings, so many hidey holes for all her toys in the bedsides for all her toys.
Decent bathroom with a great shower.
The little coffee nook is always good when you're up with the sparrows and children.
And although the parking was not allocated, we were lucky to almost have the spot right outside our room every time we'd been out.
Can't wait for future stays.

Thanks for having us.
showerReviews.author: Sheridan Hawkins

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is pure magic. A peaceful retreat surrounded by stunning nature, it‚Äôs the perfect spot to unwind, relax, and fully immerse in the beauty of the outdoors. The property hosts are incredibly kind and helpful, making every stay feel effortless and welcoming.

The beds are super comfortable, the showers are warm, and the space has everything you could possibly need, including a beautiful indoor fireplace, which is such a treat in winter. Every single corner of the property has something special, and I find myself discovering new little details every time I visit.

I‚Äôve stayed here multiple times and always leave feeling refreshed. In winter, I love doing the bushwalks and cozying up by the fire, and in summer, nothing beats swimming in the creek. The best part? It‚Äôs so close to Sydney that I don‚Äôt need to plan a long trip - just a couple of nights here is enough to reset and recharge.

This place never disappoints, and I can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough!
showerReviews.author: Fern Reschke

Cabins are spacious with their own bathroom and shower and a corner wood fired heater and couch.

locations.title: Euroka Campground
locations.address: ÓÉàFern Glen Walking Track, Blue Mountains National Park NSW 2787

showerReviews.reviewText: It's a great place to get away from it all while still being, well, not that far away from it all. The campsite is open and spacious, and it never feels cramped. There's lots of cool swimming holes nearby; like Kanuka Brook, Blue Pool, and Jellybean Pool, and you can swim at the causeway beach too, which is good for small kids. Glenbrook is like a 15-minute drive away, so you can get a coffee and food fix if you need it. There's a bunch of walks nearby, including the famous Red hands Cave walk. But I rate the Kanuka Brook and other walks above Red hands. The mountain biking includes the infamous Woodford to Glenbrook run, which ends with a cool single track at the Glenbrook end. There another rides too, which circle through Euroka, and there's a short single track down into the camp-site too. Oh, and there's lots of wildlife!
showerReviews.author: Dallas Rogers

showerReviews.reviewText: Great value. Room was basic but clean and the shower had water pressure like a fire hydrant. It was awesome after a hot day riding. The two bottles of cold water was much appreciated too. Clean pool looked inviting but the comfortable bed and a/c was too good. As a regular traveller to n from the coast from Broken Hill i will definitely stay at Copper City Motel. Great value at $50 cheaper than any alternatives in Cobar. Close to the Great Western Pub and the IGA.
showerReviews.author: Steve Lewis

showerReviews.reviewText: I gave 5 stars because it was my first time staying at Copper City Motel. I live in an old truck converted to a motorhome that has no insulation and am staying at the van park. I ran away for the day on an extremely hot day to stay at CCM. It was exactly what I needed. Small, secure, plenty of parking and most of all - dog friendly. Aircon worked, room clean, nicely stocked, hot shower if needed. Nothing at all to complain about and very friendly and accommodating staff. I will be back in the next heatwave you can be sure of that!
showerReviews.author: Joanne Houghton (The Artful Maverick)

locations.title: Sunshine Gardens Bourke Resort

showerReviews.reviewText: Alan and Patrick stayed past closing to welcome us at the gate "airport ground crew-style" with a light-up baton showing us the way in the dark. Alan was very responsive via text and answered our questions regarding restaurants where we could still get supper despite our late arrival. The room was clean, the bed enormous, the shower hot and delightful after days in the bush. We felt good knowing that our ute and all our gear in the tray was safe in their locked compound. I highly recommend Sunshine Garden Bourke Resort for your next stay in Bourke!
showerReviews.author: Charlie Bailey

showerReviews.reviewText: Great place to stay rooms are clean and new it had everything we needed jug toaster microwave etc. hot shower with good pressure and the beds are comfortable, clean linen plenty of soaps and tea sugar coffee the area and motel very quiet and safe. Alan has done a great job he answered phone when I rung at lunch to let him know I would be there at dark. I rung as I came into town he greeted us at the gates showed us the room asked if we needed anything more gave us a key so I could exit early in the morning he was very professional and cares about the guests I believe. I would definitely recommend staying here and will continue to stay here whenever I'm in town.

locations.title: Windsor Heritage Motel

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am absolutely livid about my stay at this so-called ‚Äúhotel.‚Äù I cannot believe I wasted my time, money, and patience on a place that ‚Äî in my experience ‚Äî shouldn‚Äôt even be allowed to operate.

The room was an utter disgrace. It looked like someone tried to hide mold with cheap paint instead of actually fixing it. The toilet felt like it was hanging on by a thread every time it was touched, and the shower didn‚Äôt even work ‚Äî we were literally told to use a different room just to wash ourselves. That is beyond ridiculous. The sheets looked filthy, the room felt dirty and neglected, and I honestly felt uncomfortable being in there at all.

And the staff? Absolutely infuriating. The service was shockingly unprofessional. When I tried to calmly explain the issues, the manager reacted like a child throwing a tantrum ‚Äî banging on the table, raising their voice, and acting like I was the problem for daring to point out how unacceptable everything was. I‚Äôve never seen anything like it. I walked in expecting a hotel and instead got chaos, disrespect, and zero accountability.

In my strongest possible opinion, this place is a complete disaster and should be thoroughly investigated or shut down until it can meet even the most basic standards of cleanliness, safety, and professionalism. I am furious that I ever stepped foot here. Do not stay here. Ever. Save your money, your sanity, and your dignity.
showerReviews.author: Rita Deng

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing, to say the very least.

We booked a pet friendly room for one night. What a mistake. When the room was booked over the phone, we were assured that the room had a queen bed and it was added that there was also a single. That was only a half truth, the bed was a queen base with a double mattress.

The room had carpet tiles in the main area and very obvious stains were evident in most areas.

The bathroom was something else all together. The door could not be closed as the skirting tiles had been laid on top of the door jam, the proprietor denied any knowledge of this when we were checking out. Something I find a little bit hard to believe. The glass on the shower screen was dirty and had obviously not been cleaned inside and out since the previous occupation.

I highly recommend that you not stay here!
showerReviews.author: Gavin Bevins

showerReviews.reviewText:
Would never recommend to anyone.
The room itself stinks, bathroom is a mess (broken shower head barely being held together with electrical tape and still leaking, large cracks in the shower screen) and has its own funk, the bar fridge smelled like it had rotten meat in it previously and hadn't been cleaned properly. The entire room needed a thorough cleaning.

They also do not refund the joke that is their $100 security bond upon checking out.
Oh, and somehow, the transaction of that $100 charged to your card that they say will be returned to you immediately, will disappear completely from you bank statement within a couple days.

All of that as well as the man that checked me and out being less than welcoming,  and this place isn't worth the dirt it sits on.

Go a little further out, and stay at a different place entirely. I'd rather pay the extra $35 and get a significantly better service overall from a different establishment just 10 minutes away.
showerReviews.author: Jacqui Smith

locations.title: Penrith Hotel Motel

showerReviews.reviewText:
My partner and myself travelled here from Victoria on Friday 21st of November to see family we booked to stay here for 3 nights all was well until we stepped foot into the motel room where we were met with a bed that had blood on it and some other brown marks, the bench where you made coffees was sticky and disgusting not to mention the jug had other peoples coffee over it. The bathroom was absolutely not up to health standards for any human to be in there it had poo on the sides of the toilet and the shower was covered in grime and slime the cups that were in the little fridge had mould growing from them.
The staff did give us a refund which we were grateful for but we would never ever ever book here AGAIN ! Worst experience of our lives

locations.title: Sydney International Regatta Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàGate A, Old Castlereagh Rd, Castlereagh NSW 2749

showerReviews.reviewText: The Sydney International Regatta Center  located in Penrith, NSW Australia. It's the best rowing and kayaking course center in the world, built for the purpose of 2000 Sydney Olympics and Paralympic. The beautiful scenic views of the Regatta river bank there is a 1100 seat Spector Pavilion with multiple meeting and function rooms. This is a well maintained center open to public for various activities including Dragon Boat Race. Also a 5 km path there you can enjoy walking, cycling or running around the picturesque lake.  Large toilet facilities and showers available. Spacious parking area and a coffee shop.

Therapist only wiped the oil off my back and nowhere else - as a client, leaving the premises covered in oil is a huge hazard. This voucher was a gift and I wish I had used it at another location.

locations.title: Bondi Icebergs POOL
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Notts Ave, Bondi Beach NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bondi Icebergs Pool is visually arresting in the most elemental way, where the clean geometry of the ocean pool meets the raw movement of the sea. The contrast is what makes it special: still, chlorinated water framed by concrete on one side, and the restless, crashing Pacific just beyond it. Swimming or even standing poolside, you‚Äôre constantly aware of the ocean‚Äôs presence, close enough to feel dramatic but safely held at a distance.

The views are undeniably beautiful, especially as waves spill over the pool‚Äôs edge, blurring the boundary between human design and nature. Light shifts across the water, the horizon stretches endlessly, and the entire setting feels both grounding and invigorating. Bondi Icebergs isn‚Äôt just a place to swim‚Äîit‚Äôs a place to see, where the visual dialogue between pool and ocean turns a simple dip into something quietly memorable.
showerReviews.author: Paul Leong

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely worth the hype! Visiting Bondi Icebergs feels like checking off a bucket list item. The iconic pool sits right on the edge of Bondi Beach, and the view is just breathtaking‚Äîocean meets infinity pool vibes.

There are two pools, and the smaller one is perfect for beginners or kids (deepest is about 1.5m). It‚Äôs a surreal experience when the waves splash into the pool!

The facilities provide hot showers, locker & towel hire (additional cost), and even a sauna are available. After your swim, head upstairs to the caf√© for a coffee with a view. Nothing beats sitting there, soaking in the sea breeze after a dip.

It can get a bit crowded, but honestly, that‚Äôs part of the vibe. I visited on a rainy day and got some amazing photos of the pool with barely anyone in it.

Overall, it‚Äôs not just a pool; it‚Äôs a full-on Bondi experience. Whether you swim or not, it‚Äôs worth the visit just to take in the atmosphere. Would 100% recommend to anyone visiting Sydney!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bondi Icebergs is one of those places that makes you feel brave before you have even touched the water. The ocean pool sits right on the edge of the headland, white rails against turquoise, and waves occasionally lift a veil of spray over the lap lanes. It looks like a postcard from the promenade, but the real fun starts when you pay the small entry and step down to the deck. Lifeguards keep a casual but watchful eye, lane ropes are set for steady laps, and the thud of the surf becomes a metronome. On a calm day the pool is glassy and blue. When the swell is up you get a salty slap across your shoulders and a quick grin at the person in the next lane.

Facilities are exactly what you want for a swim with a side of scenery. Change rooms are tidy, hot showers take the edge off the wind, and there are benches where you can wrap up in a towel and watch the horizon. Bring goggles and a cap if you plan to put in some distance, and throw a dry layer in your bag because the breeze can turn suddenly. The adjoining sauna is a welcome thaw after a few cold laps, and grabbing a coffee from the kiosk before or after adds to the ritual. If you are not swimming, the clifftop terrace is a brilliant spot to watch the light shift across the bay and to take a few photos without getting splashed.

Weekday mornings feel almost meditative, while weekends buzz with families, visiting swimmers and locals getting their fix. Entry is open to everyone, no membership required, which keeps the vibe welcoming. Respect the whistle if conditions kick up, rinse the salt from the deck when you are done, and give yourself time to sit and take it all in. Few places wrap exercise, sea air and a front row Bondi view into one simple experience quite as neatly as Icebergs.
showerReviews.author: Le Hoang Giap

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well I've always wanted to come to Bondi Iceberg Swimming Club now I can take it off my bucket list. I wasn't disappointed, spectacular views, great food a rather busy swimming pool - I wasn't tempted in any way to join the swimmers... lol!

Special gathering for my mum's 90th birthday gathering. The views are stunning the menu supplements the view. We were in the bistro on the middle floor. Because I was so late to arrive, I missed the main lunch and I ended up only having a bowl of chips. The chips were pretty good but the massive fantastic selection of condiments blew my mind blue... Lol. I have taken a photo but I really want to tell you in person about the condiments. There is horseradish, hot english mustard, there is a bottle that says hot hot hot, I'm assuming that is hot sauce. There is malt vinegar, HP sauce, Sriracha Sauce which is Thai. Plus where would be with out good old fashioned tomato sauce or ketchup as some like to call it.

After a day that was a tad stressful too me, I rather enjoyed the refreshing Elderberry Spritzer it was so good, that I had a second . Because I was so rushed and running late, enjoy the pictures so you can have a look at the lovely fantastic choices that I didn't have a chance to try.

I'm told that the snapper pie was awesome.
showerReviews.author: Robert B

showerReviews.reviewText:
For what was labelled as a swim tour of the majestic Whitsundays region, it was so, so much more.
When you combine the vessel, the crew, the location and the amazing band of people, that are all like minded and love swimming in whatever form it's presented, you just cannot go wrong!

Andre and his crew at Oceanfit have put together a masterpiece of a trip that has to be ventured to fully understand just how magical and beautiful ocean swimming can be.

If you love the tropics, sailing, a glass or two of wine and having a ball while also letting the buildup of the corporate life just melt away, do yourself a favour and book this trip as soon as you can.

It's the best trip I've taken in a long long time ‚ù§Ô∏è

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just back home from an amazing 4 days on the Solway Lass doing Ocean Fit's Swim the Whitsundays tour. Despite very windy and overcast weather, we had a brilliant time. Incredible swims each day, a couple of gentle hikes, daily whale encounters, dolphins, manta rays, sting rays and more.... Swam more in 3 days than I'd usually do in month but the sites were so well chosen, with great consideration for weather, tides and currents, that it was completely achievable. Plus having the support boats nearby gave me the confidence to push on when I was tired, knowing all I had to do was raise my hand if I was done and I would be plucked from the ocean.

Absolutely unforgettable trip with generous food, drinks and service throughout. A big enough group to be great fun and a broad mix of swimming buddies but also small enough to be intimate and familiar.

Loved every minute of it and will definitely consider doing it (or another location) again in the future.

I've also done 2 ocean swimming clinics with Andre at the Noosa Summer Swim and learnt heaps both times. And I highly recommend his online training videos to anyone who is starting to ocean swim or wanting to improve their skills - an amazing wealth of knowledge in bite-size chunks!

Thanks to everyone involved in making this trip so marvelous ‚ù§Ô∏è
showerReviews.author: Jacqueline O'Donnell

showerReviews.reviewText:
2025 - Swim Sydney Tour
I attended the Inaugural Swim Sydney Tour in May 2025 with my swimming buddy from Melbourne.
We were excited to swim at iconic Australian beaches and landmarks, as well as check out some of the NSW coastline.
The tour did not disappoint. üòä
Although the weather was not in our favour for the first day and half, üåäüåäüåßÔ∏è
Andre and Katja were very knowledgeable and flexible with the itinerary to ensure that we still got to see and swim the sights.  üåà
It was a wonderful experience to swim some secluded coves within Sydney Harbour, as well as the excitement of the ocean swims at Bondi and Coogee.
And of course a swim trip to Sydney would not be complete without a few laps at the Icebergs Pool! üèä‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
I thoroughly enjoyed by trip üëçüòä

showerReviews.reviewText:
On Sunday May 19th at 9:30 am, I took my son Christian Massa who is turtle level for swimming lesson at your premises in North Bondi.

Christian was doing well until towards the end of the class around 10 am when he was placed in the middle of the pool hanging on the edge by his instructor Ting.

Christian somehow ended up in the middle of the pool almost drowning while his instructor was busy with another student. Luckily, I was there and spotted him. I started screaming to have the attention of the instructor to grab him immediately.

Seriously, kids should NOT be placed in the middle of the pool hanging on the edge when they don‚Äôt know how to swim. I almost lost my son for irresponsible decisions from your staff. By the way, this is the second time that happens but the first time it was in a shallower part of the pool. But still why can‚Äôt they have blocks under water all the time for kids who can‚Äôt swim yet?
This is unacceptable!

I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS SWIMMING SCHOOL TO ANYONE. BE AWARE!!!
showerReviews.author: Sandra

It was very challenging to have my niece to take the swimming lessons. She has been complaining about the water being too cold. She was using a proper swimming gear and I did my best for her to enjoy.
The 1st and 2nd class she didn't even complete the sessions. As a family member perspective, I do not want to see my niece feeling uncomfortable.

Her mother requested to discontinue the classes and asked for reimbursement for the remaining classes and that was denied.

Instructors are very young and they have this culture of basically forcing young children into cold waters until they settle in. I don't believe in that!
showerReviews.author: Tatiana Araujo

Instructors are very young and they have this culture of basically forcing young children into cold waters until they settle in. I don't believe in that!
