showerReviews.reviewText:
Giles Baths, Coogee Beach: A Natural Sydney Gem
‚ÄãGiles Baths, tucked away at the northern headland of Coogee Beach, is a stunning natural rock pool that offers a unique blend of history, tranquility, and wild ocean excitement. It's less of a manicured pool and more of a "bogey hole" carved out by nature and early human construction, making it a true local favourite.
‚Äã‚≠ê The Vibe: Hidden Ocean Escape
‚ÄãOften quieter than the main beach, Giles Baths feels like a secret, rugged sanctuary. As you descend the stairs (passing through the poignant memorial portico‚Äîthe only remnant of the old Giles Gym and Baths), you are greeted with a spectacular view of the pool against the open ocean.
‚ÄãNatural Beauty: The pool is surrounded by dramatic sandstone and offers breathtaking coastal views, perfect for watching the sunrise.
‚ÄãThe Experience: It's an invigorating swim. The pool is open to the ocean, meaning clear, fresh water constantly washes in, creating a fun, wavy environment, especially at mid to high tide. Bring a snorkel‚Äîvisitors frequently report seeing small fish and other marine life!
‚ÄãHistorical Charm: The site was originally known as the Gentlemen's Baths in the 19th century and has a fascinating history involving hydrotherapy, hot sea baths, and even an old gymnasium.
‚Äãüèä Top Tips for Your Visit.Feature Details & Review Caution
Swimming Beautifully clear water. A good length (around 55m) for a proper swim, but you'll be swimming with the waves. Depth varies greatly with the tide. The water can be deep.
Accessibility Access is via steep stairs from Dunningham Reserve (near the Bali Memorial archway). Not wheelchair or pram accessible. Uneven, sometimes slippery rocks make entry and exit challenging for those with mobility issues or small children.
Best Tide Mid to High Tide is best for a deep, fun swim with crashing waves. Low tide can be a little shallow. Strong swells can make conditions tricky and potentially dangerous. Use caution and assess the conditions before entering. No lifeguard on duty.
Facilities Very basic. There are no changerooms or toilets directly at the pool. Use the public facilities available further along Coogee Beach or in the nearby park.üéØ Who is it for?
‚ÄãGiles Baths is an ideal spot for:
‚ÄãExperienced ocean swimmers who enjoy a more natural, exhilarating environment.
‚ÄãSnorkellers looking for a calm spot to spot aquatic life.
‚ÄãAnyone seeking a peaceful, scenic spot away from the main beach crowds.
‚ÄãIn summary: Giles Baths is a must-visit for anyone who loves Sydney's ocean pools. Its raw, natural beauty and lively water conditions make it an unforgettable experience, provided you are confident in the water and mindful of the conditions and tricky access.
showerReviews.author: John karmas

locations.address: ÓÉà180 Campbell Parade, Bondi Beach NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText:
If I have to suffer through squats and pushups, I might as well do it with a view of Bondi Beach ‚Äî and BEACHOUSE absolutely delivers. It‚Äôs the only place where I can question all my life choices on a rowing machine while watching surfers actually enjoy theirs. The vibe? Equal parts fitness temple and holiday postcard. The staff? Super friendly and professional. And the post-workout feeling, with that sea breeze rolling in? Chef‚Äôs kiss.
If you want to get stronger, sweat with a smile, and occasionally forget you‚Äôre working out because the view is that good ‚Äî BEACHOUSE is your happy place.

locations.title: Fitness First Bondi Spring St Platinum
locations.address: ÓÉà110 Spring St, Bondi Junction NSW 2022

showerReviews.reviewText: I went to FF Spring St and Westfield for years but have left the city. I‚Äôm back in town so thought I‚Äôd see if it‚Äôs improved. It has not. If I had to describe this gym with an Australian rock band, it would be Crowded House. It‚Äôs more overcrowded than ever and the change rooms are still filthy. The equipment has improved but that‚Äôs no use if I have to wait ages to use it. I went at 3pm on a Sunday, which is normally pretty quiet but it was bedlam. I can only imagine what it‚Äôs like during peak hours and I do not wish to find out. It‚Äôs a nightmare getting benches, racks or machines. The clientele is like the cast of Love Island if it was just blokes. Despite the overcrowding, these guys just hog machines while scrolling on their phones doing three sets of Instagram. Terrible gym culture and etiquette. If I still lived in the area, I would avoid it like the plague - if a plague doesn‚Äôt spread from the men‚Äôs change room first. Probably better off going to Anytime or Virgin in Bondi Junction. Pilates is actually decent value but is constantly booked out. Have had better luck going to George and Park St in the city. Have also had bad experiences trying to cancel my membership with them before. They said I‚Äôd have to fly from Melbourne to Sydney to cancel my it, like some sort of business trip to cancel my gym membership üíÄYou also have to give four weeks notice to cancel your membership. That‚Äôs a longer notice period than for quitting my job. Fitness First, I don‚Äôt work for you champ, I am your customer. Only reason I‚Äôm still with them is because there are a couple of decent ones near me in Melb. Hope they turn the Bondi establishment around because it‚Äôs in shambles.
showerReviews.author: Shive Prema

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is vile!!!!!! . The second you walk in, the stench hits you ‚Äî sweat, body odor, damp towels, and whatever else is festering in the hallways specifically the staircase too. It‚Äôs enough to make you feel sick. I genuinely had to hold my breath walking through.

Everywhere you look, people are dripping in sweat, leaving sweat all over the equipment, and no one wipes anything down. The machines are sticky, the mats are filthy, and the whole place feels like it hasn‚Äôt been properly cleaned in months.

I don‚Äôt know how this place is still open. This place needs to be shut down at this point, It‚Äôs unhygienic, overcrowded, and completely neglected. Every visit makes me feel dirtier than before I went in. And to top it all off, the staff were unbelievably rude ‚Äî completely dismissive, uninterested, and downright disgusting in the way they spoke to me. Don‚Äôt waste your money here when there are so many other gyms that will provide you a quality environment.

I also saw people walking in without even tapping their cards where is the regulations to ensure people are members??
showerReviews.author: Emily

showerReviews.reviewText:
Will miss the gorgeous view from the gym‚Äôs balcony and the convenience of parking at Westfield
Everything else I will not miss at all. The unfriendly reception team, the filthy change rooms and toilet paper everywhere in the toilets. I won‚Äôt miss the steam room that has been out of order for almost a year or people that leave their trash in lockers.  I also won‚Äôt miss the entitled personal trainers that think it is OK to block multiple pieces of equipment and their passive agressive behaviour.  This could have been the best  gym in town with world class views and perfect location. Instead, through poor management and upkeep, it is an absolute disappointment.
PS. Added a couple of photos to illustrate not just how insufficient the cleaning is, but mostly the indifference of management (if such management exists)

showerReviews.reviewText:
[Updated in Nov-23] Cleaning is non-existent, notably in the change rooms. Bugs infested the shower areas, drains were uncovered, covered in dust and/or rusted through, some showers also weren't in operation. Locker area was filthy, rubbish across the floor, locker doors broken and mirrors cracked and/or damaged. The toilets were abhorrent with toilet paper all throughout, walls peeling off and toilet bowls not cleaned. The steam room was horrid with a rotten smell and lukewarm temperature.

Contact with the club several months ago has led to no improvement at all and customer service from the club manager was well below average on all occasions. Avoid this club at all costs.

UPDATE - Added additional photos from Nov-23 (spoiler alert - it's still just as bad)

showerReviews.reviewText:
A beautiful beach. The water is really blue and the sand is fine, so you can happily stand for a while and enjoy the shore. I really loved this place. It's a must visit. Bondi fests are held in July at this place.

There are many cafes and eat stores nearby. There are open stalls where you can purchase anklets, bands, etc as a memory.

It has a garden area, and beach together, where kids can enjoy a lot.

There are showers, taps, to clean up from the sand. It's a very good facility for all.

It's a pet friendly place. There are also benches installed so elders can also have seating arrangements.

showerReviews.reviewText:
South Bondi Beach ‚Äì A Relaxing and Scenic Escape with Stunning Views

South Bondi Beach offers a perfect blend of natural beauty, vibrant culture, and a more relaxed atmosphere compared to the busy north. As someone visiting from Vancouver, Canada, where the ocean is calm and clear, I was instantly captivated by the dynamic energy of Bondi Beach. The south end, in particular, stands out for its quieter, more peaceful vibe, making it a fantastic spot to unwind while still being close to the action.

One of the standout features of South Bondi is the Bondi Pavilion, a heritage-listed building that has recently undergone a beautiful restoration. Situated just a short walk from the southern end of the beach, it offers incredible views of the ocean while also serving as a cultural hub with cafes, galleries, and event spaces. The Pavilion‚Äôs modern amenities combined with its rich history make it a must-visit for anyone coming to the area.

A true gem of South Bondi is the iconic Icebergs Pool and Bar. Perched at the southernmost tip of Bondi Beach, this world-famous saltwater pool is set right on the edge of the ocean, offering swimmers an unmatched experience. It‚Äôs a place where you can enjoy a refreshing swim while taking in panoramic views of the rugged coastline and the vast Pacific Ocean. After your swim, head to the Icebergs Bar for a well-deserved drink. The bar has a laid-back, stylish vibe with a great selection of cocktails and snacks, making it the perfect spot to relax and enjoy the stunning surroundings. It's a true Bondi institution and offers a memorable experience for both locals and visitors alike.

Beyond the Icebergs, the Wally Weekes Ocean Pool is another serene tidal rock pool located near the southern section of the beach. It‚Äôs an ideal spot for a quiet swim, offering a more peaceful alternative to the bustling surf of Bondi. The nearby North Bondi Children‚Äôs Pool provides shallow, safe waters for families, making it perfect for young children to enjoy the sea.

For those looking for a bit of green space, the Biddigal Reserve is a lovely park near the southern end of the beach, offering sweeping views of the coastline. It‚Äôs a peaceful place to relax and enjoy the natural surroundings, away from the crowds of the main beach area.

South Bondi Beach is also a great place to embrace the active, sporty atmosphere that defines Bondi. You‚Äôll find people out jogging along the coastline, practicing yoga on the grass, and of course, surfers catching the waves. The local community here truly embodies an outdoor lifestyle, with a healthy focus on fitness and the environment. Watching people embrace the ocean, whether for a morning run, a swim, or a surf session, is inspiring. It‚Äôs also common to see visitors waking up early to catch the breathtaking sunrise or later in the day for a sunset walk along the beach.

Additionally, the south end of Bondi is lined with a range of cafes, bars, and shops, making it a great spot to grab a refreshing drink or snack. The area‚Äôs more relaxed vibe compared to the north provides a peaceful setting where you can enjoy the natural beauty of Bondi while having access to all the amenities you need.

Overall, South Bondi Beach is the perfect spot for anyone looking to experience Bondi‚Äôs natural beauty, culture, and active coastal lifestyle, without the intense crowds of the main beach area. Whether you‚Äôre here for a peaceful swim in the Icebergs Pool, a quiet stroll through the reserve, or simply to enjoy the views, South Bondi offers a welcoming and laid-back escape with a touch of Bondi‚Äôs unique charm.
showerReviews.author: Julio Yanes

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bondi Beach is one of the most iconic and popular beaches in Australia, located in the eastern suburbs of Sydney. It is known for its golden sands, clear turquoise waters, and vibrant atmosphere. Here's some information about Bondi Beach:

The beach itself stretches approximately 1 kilometer in length and is surrounded by picturesque cliffs and stunning coastal views. Bondi Beach is known for its reliable surf breaks, attracting surfers from around the world.

At the southern end of Bondi Beach, you'll find the Bondi Icebergs Club and Pool, a famous ocean pool that overlooks the beach. The pool is open to the public, and swimming there offers a unique experience with beautiful views of the ocean.

Bondi Beach is a starting point for the breathtaking Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk, which spans about 6 kilometers along the coastline. This scenic walk takes you past several other stunning beaches, rock pools, and stunning viewpoints.

Bondi Beach has a vibrant and energetic atmosphere. The beachfront promenade, Campbell Parade, is lined with cafes, restaurants, bars, and boutique shops, offering a wide range of dining and shopping options.

Overall, Bondi Beach is not only a beautiful and picturesque destination, but also a vibrant and lively hub that attracts locals and visitors alike. It is an excellent place to relax, swim, surf, or simply enjoy the coastal scenery while immersing yourself in the unique beach culture of Australia.
showerReviews.author: Ich Bin Gnade - Michelle Astorga

locations.title: Marks Park
locations.address: ÓÉàMarks Lane/ Kenneth St Bondi, Fletcher St, Tamarama NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nestled on a stunning headland between the iconic Bondi and Tamarama beaches, Marks Park is a coastal gem that offers far more than just a place to sit on the grass. It‚Äôs a multi-faceted destination perfect for tourists and locals alike, boasting breathtaking views, a dedicated kids' play area, and a dog-friendly space.
Breathtaking Views: A Photographer's Paradise
The panoramic vistas from Marks Park are, without a doubt, the main event. Perched high above the Pacific Ocean, the park offers uninterrupted, sweeping views that stretch from Bondi in the north all the way to Maroubra Beach and beyond in the south. The dramatic sandstone cliffs, the crashing waves below, and the endless blue of the ocean create a spectacular backdrop for a picnic, a walk, or simply a moment of quiet contemplation. It's a key vantage point along the famous Bondi to Bronte coastal walk, making it a popular rest stop for walkers and photographers. Whether you're capturing the sunrise over the water or the vibrant colors of a sunset, the scenery is truly unforgettable.
Whale Watching: An Unforgettable Seasonal Spectacle
Marks Park is renowned as one of Sydney's premier land-based whale-watching spots. From May to November each year, thousands of humpback whales migrate along the coast, and the park's elevated position provides a front-row seat to their incredible journey. You'll often see them breaching, slapping their tails, or simply spouting water from their blowholes as they pass by. The park even has dedicated whale-watching platforms and informative signs to help you identify the whales and their behaviors. Bring a pair of binoculars and a camera with a good zoom lens to get the best views. The period from late June to early July is a peak time for the northern migration, while September to November is an excellent time to spot mothers and their new calves on the return journey south.
Kids' Play Area: Fun for the Little Ones
For families, Marks Park is a fantastic choice, thanks to its well-maintained kids' play area. Located near the amenities, the playground offers a safe and engaging space for children to burn off some energy. It's a great spot to let the kids play while you enjoy the magnificent coastal scenery. The playground's proximity to the main park areas means you can keep an eye on the children without sacrificing the stunning views.
Dog Park: A Place for Pups and Their People
Marks Park is a great spot for dog owners, offering a designated off-leash area for furry friends. While not fully fenced, a section of the park is "timeshare" for dogs, meaning they are allowed off-leash daily between 4:30 pm and 8:30 am. This makes it an ideal place for a morning or evening run with your pet. The open, grassy space allows dogs of all sizes to socialize and play, and you'll often find a friendly community of fellow dog lovers. The park provides bins and bags for waste, making it easy to keep the area clean. Just be sure to keep your dog on a leash when walking on the coastal path that runs through the park.
Amenities and Practicalities
The park has well-maintained public amenities, including toilets that have recently been refurbished to a high standard. There is some parking available nearby, but it can be busy, especially during peak times and popular events like the annual "Sculpture by the Sea" exhibition, which uses the park as a key part of its display route. With its stunning views, diverse amenities, and prime location, Marks Park is a must-visit destination that beautifully encapsulates the unique spirit of Sydney's eastern coastline.
showerReviews.author: Gaumzi

locations.title: Hotel Bondi
locations.address: ÓÉà178 Campbell Parade, Bondi Beach NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText:
Room and bathroom were dirty, not as advertised at all online, alot of maintenance issues with the building itself that clearly haven‚Äôt been fixed or acknowledged judging from other reviews too. I had the same issues which I didn‚Äôt look honestly until after my trip.

e.g. windows banging against old frame all day that had warped due to heat or wear and tear over time, bathroom fan cannot be turned off, so constant buzzing next to your bedroom. Uneven flooring with hotspots due to I assume electrical cabling underneath, feel like you‚Äôre gonna fall through the hallway floors with uneven squeaky wood covered by dirty carpet to mask it, lifts make scraping noises constantly. Walls are paper thin, so can hear your neighbours as if they were in your room even in the day time.

Pub downstairs is decent for the price, but if you‚Äôre staying at the hotel itself. Pick anywhere else. Place is a dump honestly that clearly lives off its location more than its service and accommodation. The money is made downstairs along with the pokies machines clearly so there‚Äôs no incentive to fix the hotel itself. Don‚Äôt give this place your money.

Outside noise can be understood to a degree, as you‚Äôre given earplugs for your stay which should be warning enough to leave, but you‚Äôll be annoyed with the noises internally more than outside on the strip. That‚Äôs if you can get past the dirty bathroom and stained towel upon your arrival.

e.g. windows banging against old frame all day that had warped due to heat or wear and tear over time, bathroom fan cannot be turned off, so constant buzzing next to your bedroom. Uneven flooring with hotspots due to I assume electrical cabling underneath, feel like you‚Äôre gonna fall through the hallway floors with uneven squeaky wood covered by dirty carpet to mask it, lifts make scraping noises constantly. Walls are paper thin, so can hear your neighbours as if they were in your room even in the day time.

Pub downstairs is decent for the price, but if you‚Äôre staying at the hotel itself. Pick anywhere else. Place is a dump honestly that clearly lives off its location more than its service and accommodation. The money is made downstairs along with the pokies machines clearly so there‚Äôs no incentive to fix the hotel itself. Don‚Äôt give this place your money.

Outside noise can be understood to a degree, as you‚Äôre given earplugs for your stay which should be warning enough to leave, but you‚Äôll be annoyed with the noises internally more than outside on the strip. That‚Äôs if you can get past the dirty bathroom and stained towel upon your arrival.
showerReviews.author: Ross

locations.title: QT Bondi
locations.address: ÓÉà6 Beach Rd, Bondi Beach NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText: My sister and I visited Sydney for the first time recently. We went a week in advance of the Sydney Marathon, for we were both running it. It was a long haul to get there, but worth every mile traveled to get there. We were greeted with so much joy and hospitality by Laura at the front desk. She was incredibly welcoming and helpful in guiding us on what to do and how to get around the city. We were able to check in early, which was great, considering our travels. I cannot say enough great things about Laura, her thoughtfulness, enthusiasm, guidance and her assistance. Since we were preparing for the race, she helped secure a reservation for a larger group in Sydney. The hotel itself is perfectly located in Bondi Beach with easy access to the beach and plenty of restaurants. Additionally, there is a bus stop across the street that got us into Sydney very easily and conveniently. The layout of the room was perfect! The room had a balcony, couch, desk, nice bathroom, cooking surface and washer/dryer combo. Upon our return to Australia, I will stay there again! Cheers!

showerReviews.reviewText:
staying here for 2 days and i must say this was one of my best decision to stay here!

from the very start, i should express my gratitude to Ms Wendy. she is so kind and responsive to my needs. she even give me extra 2 hours to use the room.

the place definetely has superb value: because it is very comfortable, spacious and homey. Decoration is very beautiful, like a zen principle applied.  They provide sufficient courtesy breakfast, even giving a ton of premium T2 tea!

Bed is comfortable. furniture is premium antiques. Bathroom is clean and water pressure of the shower is strong.

the place is very near to public bus stop (no 333 bus), Bondi Iceberg and Bondi Beach are within walking distance.

bonus point: it has beautiful mini garden in the front.

locations.title: InterContinental Sydney Double Bay by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉà33 Cross St, Double Bay NSW 2028

showerReviews.reviewText:
I really, really, really wanted to love this hotel. The location is genuinely unbeatable, right in the heart of Double Bay, surrounded by amazing shops, restaurants, and bars. It was meant to be a special birthday weekend for me, and my best friend even flew out from California for two kid-free nights.

Unfortunately, the experience was disappointing from the moment we arrived. The hotel is extremely dated, and the cleanliness was well below standard. We had to request room cleaning several times, and even then, the tables weren‚Äôt wiped properly. The bathroom still had a used bar of soap from the previous guest, and there was hair stuck to the shower walls.

The biggest letdown was the pool. It was shut down, the main reason we booked this hotel for a hot weekend and then we were asked to leave at 4 p.m. due to a private event, something we were never informed about. Had I known, I definitely wouldn‚Äôt have spent $800 a night.

While the hotel did offer some IHG points and deducted part of our bar tab as compensation, the stay overall fell far short of expectations. It feels like the property relies solely on its prime location and doesn‚Äôt make the effort to deliver a quality experience.

Sadly, I won‚Äôt be staying here again. There are definitely much better hotel options in Sydney
showerReviews.author: Kamila Chandler

showerReviews.reviewText: First stay here and found it outstanding - one of the last remaining classic, luxury, properly & professionally-run five-star hotels in the world. Each and every staff member is fantastic. My room had a lovely marble bathroom and the shower, bathtub and toilet were all separate, including everything you could ever need in the amenities provided. The view of the bay was spectacular, especially at night. The location is great being steps from all Double Bay restaurants and pubs. The buffet breakfast is outstanding, where you get an amazing array of fruit and veg to juice yourself according to how much of each fruit and veg you like. The concierge is world-class (Vanessa). Anytime you ring up to get anything from any other area of the hotel (such as housekeeping) is attended to quickly. Yet the price of the rooms is surprisingly low considering the quality you get. It‚Äôs also really peaceful and quiet here. This is the hotel which all other hotels should be taking the lead from. Hope to be back in Sydney just to come back and stay here.
showerReviews.author: Kate Australia

showerReviews.reviewText: I had the pleasure of an exceptional stay at InterContinental Sydney Double Bay, where every detail was meticulously curated to create a truly unforgettable experience. The hotel's prime location, surrounded by an array of charming cafes, allowed for effortless exploration and relaxation. Dinner at the hotel was a culinary delight, with exquisite cuisine and impeccable service that exceeded my expectations. The bar offered an impressive selection of cocktails, enjoyed in a lively yet refined atmosphere. The staff were attentive, knowledgeable, and courteous, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable stay. My room was a serene retreat, boasting breathtaking views and elegant decor that epitomized luxury. The rooftop pool was a tranquil oasis, with stunning vistas and a peaceful ambiance that invited relaxation. The hotel's subtle yet distinctive signature scent added a touch of sophistication to the overall ambiance. Given the exceptional service, luxurious amenities, and memorable experience, I would wholeheartedly recommend InterContinental Sydney Double Bay. 5/5 stars üåü"

locations.title: Wake Up! Bondi Beach
locations.address: ÓÉà110 Campbell Parade, Bondi Beach NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful location, walk out the door, cross the road and you are on the world famous Bondi beach. You seriously can‚Äôt beat it. There was nothing better than waking up and going straight into the surf. Location alone is 5 stars.

Hostel is pretty basic for the most part. The dorm beds had no curtains. They did have power and a light tho. You could hear music playing at night but it was alright, I slept really well.

For the floor I think they had 3 showers, 3 toilets and 2 sinks so it can be a little crowded.

Staff were all very friendly. After check out they let me store my bags and still use the facilities so thank you!

Hostel was full of travellers of all types and they have a lot of events on.

All up a great stay, location is absolutely stunning and so many cute little cafes and places to eat around the area. You can‚Äôt beat it.
showerReviews.author: Caleb VanderJagt

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bunk was comfy, good access to power points and personal light however i found a stranger's underwear underneath the mattress that slid out as the mattress moved around (gross). I stayed in a female only dorm but there were still males ‚Äúvisiting‚Äù the room at times which made me uncomfortable. There is no space to open up a suitcase on the floor without getting in everyone‚Äôs way. Aircon dripped water. Roommates came back late being loud and then talking very early, with people yelling down the hallways on a Tuesday/Wednesday night was really inconsiderate and there was no intervention from staff. One corner of my bedding was ripped completely

Female bathroom was mid, access to 3 toilets and 4 showers. Good hot water, felt mostly clean except bathroom floors could be cleaner. Both sinks were leaking causing the entire floor to be wet.

Personally I would not stay here again due to the lack of respect from other people staying, limited space to access my things and shared wet bathroom situation. There was also a lot of tradies in and out working on things on the third floor, with some parts of the hostel feeling like a building site. Great location, close to the beach, walking distance to restaurants, convenience stores etc. I was glad to leave at the end of my stay...
showerReviews.author: Georgia Walker

showerReviews.reviewText: 28yo F Canadian. Rooms had enough space for storing belongings. Lockers are a good size was able to fit my bag and a small bag inside. Bathrooms were clean and there was alway one available. Shower caddy in the shower stalls was really helpful as well as the hooks. LOTS of stairs. Rooftop was a great place to lounge when wanting to relex but get out of the room. Wifi doesnt quite reach up there though. Location was perfect. Right in the center of the action and lots to do and see in walking distance. Great events options available. Free pancakes were great. Staff went above and beyond to take care of guests and their belongings. Sunscreen available in lobby. Comfortable beds although the duvet was too hot in the room at times. I really felt comfortable and enjoyed this stay. Thank you!

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you identify as Female then Wake Up! Is actually much better than the rating given. That's because there's just much better utilities offered compared to the utilities offered for men.

Men have a separate bathroom from the shower room and there's sinks outside in the hallway. This can be an issue for men who prefer to have the toilet, shower and sink all combined in the same room (it's also a little awkward to shave in the middle of the hallway).

Women have all utilities combined in the same room which is much better.

There's a TON of stairs and no elevator access. In order to even get to reception you need to climb a flight of stairs.

Other than that, reception closes fairly early so if you have issues with the room, like how my bedside lamp is flickering, I'm not really able to contact reception and have something done about it (they close at 10pm and I only just turned the lamp on at around the same time).

Those are the only negatives I've found in my short stay, but keep in mind this is not a high quality hotel. You get what you pay for so other issues that I otherwise would mention will be ignored for this review.

Some positives: While I'm writing this review in the middle of my single night stay, there's an events board and while I haven't had the chance to try any,  there seems to b a good mix of events so that there's something for everyone.

The staff are also super cool and friendly, while they're not as accommodating as I'd like for people with disabilities,  they're also not terrible like those at Little Bigots down the road.

They're positioned in such an amazing location, literally opposite Bondi Beach. I really don't think you find anywhere as affordable in such a great location as Wake Up.

So while Wake Up does have some pros and cons and while I personally don't see myself checking in here ever again (unless structural changes are made), I would still highly recommend Wake Up to women looking for an affordable stay in a prime location.
showerReviews.author: Whoa Yeah

locations.title: Little Drifter Bondi Beach
locations.address: ÓÉà19 Lamrock Ave, Bondi Beach NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very unpleasant stay. I stayed at little drifter hostel for 8 nights, 4 female room superior. the location is great 2 min walking from the beach, but that‚Äôs it.
The hostel is not accessible for someone with disabilities, there isn‚Äôt a lift so you have to carry all your bags up and down the stairs. The common areas are all underground with no natural light and they close at 11pm, which is absurd to me you can‚Äôt access your own food or have a glass of water. Also half of the kitchen doesn‚Äôt work, 4/8 stove top are broken.
The room was a decent size but it was a superior, the en-suite bathroom is so small when you sit on the toilet your knees touch the wall in front of you. It‚Äôs like a plane bathroom.
The staff is always in bad mood, I had to ask for multiple times for 2 days for a clean rug for the shower, and they tried to gaslight me telling me ‚Äúthey always clean the room every day and change the rug‚Äù, I don‚Äôt know maybe they think they clean the room just emptying the trash can.
Therefore I had 3 English roommates who came in late at night drunk, loud and eating crappy and smelly food on the floor at 3 am. I called the night reception because I couldn‚Äôt sleep, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry, but we can‚Äôt do anything right now‚Äù, so I had to stay in that situation.
Not to mention there isn‚Äôt enough storage space inside the room, the ‚Äúcloset‚Äù is so small and without shelfs you can‚Äôt really use it.
The hostel is quite expensive compared to others, it‚Äôs definitely not worth it.
showerReviews.author: Scheil Maglio

Not to mention there isn‚Äôt enough storage space inside the room, the ‚Äúcloset‚Äù is so small and without shelfs you can‚Äôt really use it.
The hostel is quite expensive compared to others, it‚Äôs definitely not worth it.
showerReviews.author: Scheil Maglio

showerReviews.reviewText: You are mostly paying for the location as the beach is very close.  The staff was friendly and accommodating. The lounge/dining spots are limited and the kitchen is cramped.  The private rooms sleep 2 but barely have storage for 1, while the washroom is like showering in a phone booth where you can accidentally step in a toilet.  There were some cool group activities.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The room i was in was shockingly small, as for the "ensuite" bathroom OMG you could sit on the toilet and shower at the same time!! The staff were pleasant enough and the cafe on the corner was nice. I noticed the name of the place has changed. It was Village Bondi when i was there 2024/25. Are they dodging taxes or something lol. Bondi is nice but I wouldnt go back. I have had absolutely fantastic holidays in Oz but i had a better time in Benidorm. The weather was phenominal in both Benidorm and Sydney but Benidorm was cheaper and I was able to swim in the sea. The water was warmer and no waves, it was nice n calm and relaxing.

Lesley from Glasgow UK :)

showerReviews.reviewText: Definitely the best hostel I stayed in, in Sydney. Couldn't fault the staff at all, very helpful and lovely as most stayed there too! They encourage you to join in and make friends. Such a brilliant hostel for solo travellers. The rooms were very clean and there was plenty of place to put luggage, lockers are a little small and you have to supply your own lock. The destination was great, the roof top terrace allowed you to look over Tamarama Beach and also Bondi Beach. It was only a 5-10 minute walk to all amenities. Also had a very good laundry service opposite to wash, dry and iron your clothes for cheap!

locations.title: Noahs Bondi Backpackers
locations.address: ÓÉà2 Campbell Parade, Bondi Beach NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good backpacker. For your short stay in Bondi.
Spend 2 nights in the private room with the beach view.
Good : It‚Äôs pretty decent for the room at this price. And the location for accessing the beach is great. Bus stop is right in front of the hostel which runs regularly.
Poor : the bathroom needs an upgrade... only curtain for the shower (which I don‚Äôt mind but some do) and some of the toilet door doesn‚Äôt close. The kitchen (cooking area) is pretty crowded during afternoon peak hour.

PS : towels, cutlery and keys required deposit. So you might need to prepare some cash for them if you needed.
showerReviews.author: Joe Lan

showerReviews.reviewText: It's a lovely place, the staff are very friendly and were happy to help where we asked. However, the room is very small and very much what you pay for - but has good views and is actually pretty good considering it's location near the beach and bus stop. Some other guests weren't very considerate of others either, meaning you might be woken up by some stampeding kids running to their room or the bathroom after a rough night but you're still able to get a pretty good sleep in the beds if you're not a light sleeper. Wi-Fi was free, slow but workable and nothing really to complain about. The only real issue that I encountered was the girls bathrooms which didn't have proper privacy, the showers either had a flimsy curtain that could be easily peeked through or a see-through door that offered no protection from unwanted eyes. This can be fixed easily so I'm sure it won't be that big of an issue for others who were prepared and brought swimmers they'd be happy to shower in. Other than that, as I said the views are great and the location is amazing since it is so close to the beach and shops as well as the public transport, staff are friendly and Noahs comes off as a place that would be great to stay in if you're looking for a good budget place to stay.
showerReviews.author: Always Tired

locations.title: Bondi Shores Accommodation

showerReviews.reviewText: Only putting one star because there's not another option. If you like showering with friends (the cockroaches, everyone's hair etc) then this place is excellent for you!! We couldn't even touch the walls in the shower because nothing looked to be cleaned in months. Our bed was filled with dust. We checked out half an hour late and was charged $25 even still with the horrible cleanliness. I would never go back, I dreaded even going back to the hostel the 2 nights we stayed there. We dared not eat in the hostel in case any of our shower friends joined us. The toilets had wet toilet paper in a pile beside them with water and pee everywhere, and some were pissing toilet paper and door locks. If we went to the bathroom, we couldn't sit on the seat because of the mess. When we arrived, there were 15+ garbage bags piled up at the bottom of the stairs that smelt worse than the stench pouring out of the men's bathroom (which was bad enough). We paid $35 each night for a twin room. Trust me, even if it's more expensive, spend your money elsewhere!!!
showerReviews.author: Jordan Pertile

showerReviews.reviewText:
Terrible accommodation...NEVER stay here!

Firstly the ladies on check-in were quite nice but unfortunately that's were the positives end...
Admittedly, this is my fault to choosing to stay here however still don't want people to make the same mistake I did.

This hostel is dirty, unhygienic and old. The room was very basic, as mentioned very dirty and unacceptable for $70/ night for a private room. I don't expect hostels to be immaculate however some standard of basic hygiene and cleanliness would be expected.
This hostel is VERY noisy, again I expect hostels to be a little noisy however they take it to a whole new level. There is a pub downstairs and I realise they are separate businesses however when there is live music downstairs tell your guests so they are aware and can make plans to avoid it (especially at 9:30pm on a Sunday night). Wasn't mentioned to us on check in nor did they tell us that it would be noisy from 9-11pm as we could of made plans to avoid this.
Our room was above where the band was playing and it was vibrating, rattling and shaking the floorboards. We were in there for 5 mins and both me and my partner had a headache. So we decided to leave as the noisy was unbearable especially for the next 2 hrs!!!
So had to pay for this room plus another hostel...not happy!!! They have refused to refund that 1 nights accommodation for providing an inadequate level of service.

Do all yourselves a favour and avoid at all costs. This place is a joke and its embarrassing.
showerReviews.author: Daniel Badewitz

showerReviews.reviewText:
Only acceptable things were the nice staff and the tv. The rest was a TOTAL DISASTER. Definitely wouldn't recommend you to be in a cheap hostel in Sydney, put in more money or check out what's on couchsurfing, you'll just end up disappointed with those cheap dirty hostels.
The hostel was unacceptably DIRTY. From the toilets, to the bedsheets, to the floors...WHAT THE HELL did we pay this service for!?!? So unprofessional!!!! Shower was broken, and the worst part was if someone was emptying their colons next to you when you were showering (there is no separation so try keep your nose shut) or flushing the toilet (expect a wave of gelid water)...INTERNET and WIFI had a VERY POOR signal!!!
Breakfast had toast and jam but no butter... and its coffee is the worst powdered quality you can find to ruin your health...

Basically a horrible experience.
showerReviews.author: Laura Giorgi

locations.title: PodBed Coogee Beachside
locations.address: ÓÉà178 Coogee Bay Rd, Coogee NSW 2034

showerReviews.reviewText:
Typical case of "you get what you pay for".
Staff was sometimes a bit hard to get a hold of, the bell next to the office didn't work, but they were very friendly.
I'd recommend noise cancelling headphones because you can hear everything though the door. Also the door lock was kinda buggy, sometimes I had to enter the PIN 3 or 4 times until it worked.
Also shower sandals are a good idea because the bathrooms aren't really clean at all. I didn't use the kitchen because it also looked kinda gross.
The company in the backyard during evening usually is kinda nice.
The fridge in the private room was an awesome feature (but it wasn't clean as well of course).
showerReviews.author: Lenny Bool

showerReviews.reviewText: This hostel could be a lovely place due to its amazing locating with just a 3 minutes walk to coogee beach but unfortunately it has been the worst hostel we‚Äôve stayed in during our Australia travels. The bathrooms and showers are very unkept, constant smell or urine and floors are always wet in the bathroom from the showers bad draining system. There is no safety measures at all, the front door has electric wires hanging out of it and we were given codes for the gate and front door however both were just left open all night for anyone to wander in.  I got up at 2am and had to lock both myself on one occasion for our own safety.  Although the usual signs everywhere to keep quiet after 10pm which is basic hostel etiquette, there are no staff to ensure this is followed so unfortunately during our stay we were kept awake until all hours by a group of boys screaming and shouting all around the hostel until 5am and smoking marajuana and treating it as there own party house. On our information sheet it said night staff on duty from 7am-7pm but it did not exist and no staff were there to ensure the hostel was quiet or locked up and safe at night. Staff were all very nice during the day however they seemed aware of the loud evenings but nothing was done and the guests were still allowed to stay and continued to make excessive noise during our 4 night stay. Overall I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it  needs a serious review of staff and management structure to make guests feel more comfortable and safe.
showerReviews.author: Anouschka Flanagan

locations.title: Pad Hostel

showerReviews.reviewText:
Came from Brisbane, booked via Hostelworld app for $102 per night.

Spent 2 nights in one of their deluxe private rooms, which included a basic bed, power outlets and fan. Very bare bones, which was fine by me. Shower and toilet facilities were shared, which was a slight disappointment as I've stayed at hostel private rooms with private ensuites before, but that's just a minor inconvenience compared to the many pros.

Room, bathrooms and common areas were all very clean, exceptional work there!

Decent location as well, with lots of good food options nearby with just a short walk to public transport

The social aspect of the hostel was also a major highlight, with the common lounge and rooftop terrace being great places to meet foreign backpackers, with some of the longer staying residents making me feel welcome during my brief stay

All in all, I definitely enjoyed my stay and highly recommend as a short term, budget accomodations option.
showerReviews.author: Daniel Farley

showerReviews.reviewText:
Came from Brisbane, booked via Hostelworld app for $102 per night.

Spent 2 nights in one of their deluxe private rooms, which included a basic bed, power outlets and fan. Very bare bones, which was fine by me. Shower and toilet facilities were shared, which was a slight disappointment as I've stayed at hostel private rooms with private ensuites before, but that's just a minor inconvenience compared to the many pros.

Room, bathrooms and common areas were all very clean, exceptional work there!

Decent location as well, with lots of good food options nearby with just a short walk to public transport

The social aspect of the hostel was also a major highlight, with the common lounge and rooftop terrace being great places to meet foreign backpackers, with some of the longer staying residents making me feel welcome during my brief stay

All in all, I definitely enjoyed my stay and highly recommend as a short term, budget accomodations option.
showerReviews.author: Daniel Farley

showerReviews.reviewText: The place is only good for location and the staff were friendly. The charging point in the bedroom was bad and insufficient, the kitchen is so small, there aren't enough seats at night, we had to eat on the floor. I wouldn't come back again. For the price there are better hostels.

locations.title: 38¬∞ THE BATHHOUSE
locations.address: ÓÉàThe Pacific Building, LEVEL B1/180 Campbell Parade, Bondi Beach NSW 2026

showerReviews.reviewText:
Slow House Bondi is just what I was looking for in a bathhouse. Calm, serene and relaxing.

We went during a weekday at 11am. This was during both the live sounds session and silent session (no talking) - both of which are a fantastic touch. The 90 mins cost us $49 each. Pretty damn good value for money considering you get a hot pool, hot spa, plunge pool, ice baths, steam and sauna included. Other features include still/sparkling water, private bathrooms and coded lockers.

There were around 15 other people during our session which felt a tad busy, but it is a shared bathhouse after all and everyone was generally respectful of the silent session.

Parking is a bit difficult. We had to pay $30 in the downstairs carpark for our 1.5 hour session, with street parking scarce or not long enough.
showerReviews.author: Matthew Yong-O'Gorman

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been to Slow House more than twenty times, so this review is well overdue and deserved.

Why 5 Stars? Many very good reasons.

Expansiveness - The facility is very large, with lots of different bathhouse services (sauna, steam, ice bath, cold plunge, different spas), so even when it is busy you still feel like you have plenty of space.

Cleanliness - This is obviously a place where you would want high standards of hygiene and cleanliness, and the team are constantly walking around cleaning and tidying which makes it feel very clean.

Value - For the price, having 90 minutes is really good value compared to many other similar locations.

Effectiveness - The variety and routine always makes me feel amazing when I leave, which is essentially why I go there.

The only room for improvement is larger change room space, but I know they are working on that and it is entirely manageable as it is.
showerReviews.author: Joe Ruggero

locations.title: Manly Andrew 'Boy' Charlton Aquatic Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Kenneth Rd, North Manly NSW 2095

showerReviews.reviewText:
Manly Aquatic Centre truly stands out as a top-tier facility for swimmers, fitness enthusiasts, and families. The centre boasts an impressive array of amenities, including both indoor and outdoor pools that cater to every need‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre after serious lap swimming, rehabilitation, or just fun in the water with the kids.
Outdoors, you‚Äôll find a spacious 50-metre pool perfect for training or leisurely swims, alongside a 25-metre pool and a fantastic splash area for children. Indoors, the centre features a heated 25-metre pool, a small but super-warm rehabilitation pool, and a brilliant indoor kids‚Äô splash pool complete with sprayers and a slippery slide, making it a year-round destination no matter the weather.
Beyond the pools, the wellness options are exceptional. The sauna is notably hot‚Äîideal for those who love a serious sweat‚Äîand there‚Äôs also a spa and steam room to help you relax after a workout. The gym is modern and well-equipped, available at an extra cost, adding great value for fitness buffs. Classes such as yoga, Pilates, boxing, and aqua aerobics are also on offer, ensuring there‚Äôs something for everyone.
Parking is straightforward if you don‚Äôt mind a short walk up the road, and there‚Äôs plenty of space for both cars and bikes. The centre is clean, well-maintained, and staff are friendly and professional. Whether you‚Äôre a local or a visitor, Manly Aquatic Centre offers a premium experience with facilities that are hard to beat. Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: Daniel Ryken

showerReviews.reviewText:
Review related to swim school only. The pool itself is great and so is the kids section with water sprinklers etc.

The swim school staff particularly the coordinator is rude and they‚Äôre not inclusive of kids needs. Private classes are advertised but not actually offered as it‚Äôs in their best interest to have group lessons, rather than looking out for the interests and needs of the child. They lack flexibility and have zero phone or email customer service skills. The coordinator acts like they‚Äôre doing you a favour by trying to give your kid swimming lessons, rather than treat it as the important Australian skills needed to keep kids safe.
showerReviews.author: Shopping Account

showerReviews.reviewText:
(3.5 stars)
This is the second swimming complex in Sydney named after the legendary Andrew ‚ÄòBoy‚Äô Charlton and it dwarfs its Woolloomooloo namesake. With seven pools for various purposes and audiences - four outdoors and three indoors- plus a large spa, it‚Äôs epic.

You can see how it has grown and been added to over many decades, from a simple 1m deep 25m outdoor pool to the very modern indoor pools with water play features, but our preferred swim here was the 50m outdoor Olympic pool.

The water temperature was perfect, it‚Äôs salt water chlorinated (yay!) making for a buoyant and pleasant water experience. Unfortunately on a hot Sunday there was only one lane of it devoted to recreational swimmers.

This particular pool has history too, having had big names like Michael Phelps train in it‚Ä¶ but he probably would‚Äôve been appalled by our languid paddling and floating around on a hot Summer‚Äôs day.

The historical accretion of facilities means there are two entire sets of change rooms to choose from, plus an indoor cafe, with plenty of free parking in the car park or on the street.
showerReviews.author: Jackie McMillan

showerReviews.reviewText:
An incredible swim coach who has transformed my daughter‚Äôs confidence!

Linda at Good Swim Manly has been absolutely amazing with my daughter, Betsy. Over the past few months, she‚Äôs taken Betsy out swimming from Manly to Shelly Beach on weekends (whenever we‚Äôve been able to make it), and the transformation has been remarkable.

Not only has Betsy‚Äôs swimming improved, but her confidence in the ocean has skyrocketed, and so has her genuine love for the water. Linda brings a calm, encouraging presence that makes kids feel safe, seen, and empowered to push themselves just that little bit further each time.

We‚Äôre so grateful for the care and enthusiasm Linda brings to every swim. Her approach has had a lasting impact not just on Betsy‚Äôs skills, but on how she feels about herself in the water. Highly recommend Good Swim Manly to any family wanting their child to gain both technique and joy in the ocean!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Linda is an amazing coach. My first stroke correction session at the rock pool in Queenscliff, I have instantly improved my strokes and am now not easily exhausted everytime I swim laps.
She explains very clearly and easy for me to understand, she also has techniques that I have not learned from my other swimming lessons from previous instructors. She has simple ways of teaching and I have also always felt at ease and calm knowing that I could trust and learn from her.
Last Sunday I had my first ocean session with Linda, I instantly felt how much I have improved - I do have a long way to go for learning but happy to feel that I am getting better at it. I am confident she can guide me into getting my Bronze medallion in future and I have now been much more excited in swimming at the ocean knowing that I can fully support myself out there all thanks to her.

locations.title: Stoke Beach House, Manly

showerReviews.reviewText: This hostel is amazing! I loved staying here can‚Äôt recommend it enough. It‚Äôs good value for money and all round clean and comfortable. Perfect location literally a street away from everything beach, shops, pubs, gyms, restaurants, ferry wharf. Clean rooms we booked a private twin room it was spacious and beds really comfortable. Women‚Äôs showers and bathroom facilities were modern and clean and had a really good hair dryer free to use. Nice extra touches in this hostel make it feel more homely. Free continental breakfast of yoghurt, pastries, fruit, breads, cereals, coffee, was good quality. Communal area and kitchen was modern and closes at 11pm so not noisy in the hostel at night. Would definitely stay here again.

locations.title: The Sebel Sydney Manly Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed as part of Club Wyndham. My ONE & ONLY complaint is the $40/night parking. It was unexpected and felt excessive, especially as I was staying 4 nights.

Other than that, the room was older style but spacious and clean. The location is fantastic - right across Manly beach, easy walk to Shelley beach, wharf and restaurants.

The reception & cleaning staff were great! We immediately got fresh towels when requested and being across from the beach - everyone trudged in with sand, but the staff kept the premises exceptionally clean & presentable.

The pool in Sebel building was cold but we were allowed access to the warm pool in Peppers building. We had free Wifi and TV streaming services in room. Our stay was comfortable and enjoyable.
showerReviews.author: Ashwina Pratap

showerReviews.reviewText:
Location, Location, Location...
Wonderful short-term 3 bedroom apartment/condo rental for an extended business trip we decided to bring our kids on. Amazing views of Manley Beach from our patio.  The building is located directly across the street from the Manley Surf School adjacent to the beach.  Large living room and a decent kitchen stocked with enough china, utensils, & cookware to warrant eating "in" most of the time.  Small washer/dryer allowed us to keep up with laundry & return home with mostly clean clothes.  Everything was within walking distance, although the grocery store is a 2K round trip, so make a list!  Lots of shops, restaurants, etc, along the beach road and especially around the pedestrian Corso.
showerReviews.author: Sarge Sarge

locations.title: The Albert Hotel

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a fabulous stay at the Albert hotel. The rooms are pristine clean with amazing amenities including luxurious toiletries, espresso coffee machine, milk frother and high quality teas. The highlight is the hospitality of the girls at the reception - Jusi and Sanisha, they went out of their way to make me feel comfortable!! This was my first trip to Australia and I highly recommend this hotel for this part of Sydney!! Also recommend the breakfast at the cafe!! It was lovely ü•∞

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is our second time staying at The Albert Hotel, and our experience has been just as memorable as the first.

The first time we booked, it was only for an overnight stay. We just wanted a quick weekend getaway and to check the place out. We chose this hotel because it‚Äôs less than 30 minutes from Manly. We didn‚Äôt want to book directly in the Manly area as it was more expensive and crowded due to the holiday break.

The Albert Hotel gave us exactly what we needed: peaceful relaxation away from the city and the busy beachside area.

I especially love their comfortable beds and soft bathrobes. This time, we stayed for 3 days and 2 nights, and my husband surprised me by booking a heritage deluxe suite with a balcony view.

We truly appreciated the warm and helpful customer service, and the included breakfast was very filling, and the chef was so friendly, even taking the time to chat with us and ensure we were delighted with our meal.

The room was clean and spacious, equipped with an iron and a hairdryer in the bathroom. We also enjoyed the bathtub, and were surprised by the complimentary champagne they offered.

We highly recommend this place!

Ratings:
Cleanliness ‚Äì 5/5
Customer Service ‚Äì 5/5
Meals ‚Äì 5/5
showerReviews.author: Lovely Baradillo

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was one of the worst experiences I‚Äôve had.
The service was extremely poor and the hygiene standards were unacceptable. I saw the staff use the same cloth that was wiping tables to clean the lid of a coffee cup, which is completely unhygienic. She just drop off the coffee on the table without calling my name and eye contact.

My order was also made incorrectly, and the service attitude was very disappointing. There was no communication at all throughout the process.

I understand Christmas is busy period but basis manner , hygiene standards and professional is still needed, right?

Overall, very poor service and cleanliness. I would not recommend this place.

Date:26/12/2025, time: 10:40- 11:20

showerReviews.reviewText:
This spot makes an easy getaway for families with small kids or couples.
Lots of wildlife that you can get quite close to (keep your food secure) a short walk on to a nice beach, good facilities including powered dites BBQ, Wood BBQs, toilets, laundry, and Hot Showers (coin op)
Not all spots have a fire pit chose carefully
Sites with fire pits are 2-4,6-7,12,14-18,21,23-24,36,39,41-44,46,49,52,55,57,59-60 some pits are inconveniently positioned in the spots.
The on-site office has local info fire wood and ice available at good prices.
Locally there are a few good cafes a bottle shop and an IGA so you'll never be stuck for much.
Well worth a stay
showerReviews.author: Ryan ‚ÄúThingsthatkeepmebusy‚Äù B

Can stay at cabins or camp.
Great spot to venture to.

showerReviews.reviewText: Great site with bbqs, cold showers or ($1 for hot shower), rain water (recommend to treat), and fire pits at some sites. Stayed two nights and it was great for access to hikes/fishing/swimming. Only to note- campsites very close together in the middle spots (outer spots and tent spots more spread out), not all showers went hot despite putting in money and sites a bit difficult to tell the boundaries due to number placement (maybe our fault or just the specific site but we accidently were in the wrong site despite seeing the number and boundaries), luckily neighbors nice!

showerReviews.reviewText: Nestled within the picturesque Murramarang National Park, Pretty Beach Campground offers a serene escape into nature surrounded by Kangaroos, Wallabies, Yellow tailed Black Cockatoos, King Parrots and more. The proximity to stunning beaches adds to the allure of Pretty Beach Campground, allowing campers to easily access the pristine shores and enjoy the rhythmic sounds of the ocean. The well-equipped facilities, including clean amenities and some great bbq cooking areas, enhance the overall camping experience.

locations.title: Manly Bunkhouse

showerReviews.reviewText:
The bunkhouse is probably the best hostel I ever stayed at. I‚Äôve been there two times now, each time for 1-2 months. It is the perfect hostel especially for longer stays. Compared to the other hostels in that area it is a lot more calm and chill and has a lot of long term guests. The vibe in the hostel is like a big family and it‚Äôs pretty easy to make good friends there especially as a solo traveler. The rooms are nothing special but cleaned regularly and with their own bathroom and shower. The kitchen has basically everything you would need, gas stove, big oven, toaster and microwave, etc. The staff is also really nice and helpful, especially Alex, she is the best :)
I can only recommend to stay here if u come to Sydney, especially if u want to enjoy the beach and surf!

The vibe in the hostel is like a big family and it‚Äôs pretty easy to make good friends there especially as a solo traveler. The rooms are nothing special but cleaned regularly and with their own bathroom and shower. I can only recommend to stay here if u come to Sydney, especially if u want to enjoy the beach and surf!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cheap stay so don't expect much.

Pros:
- Location: close to the beach and cafes.

Cons:
- There is no dinnerware for everybody. I could count 3 cups/mugs and often there were none available to use.
- The place is not very clean. The cleaner come 2x a week to clean the common areas. I was willing to clean my room and was unable to. Speak to her in English asking for a broom ad she didn't get a single word. Last day I stayed there I found a cockroach in the bedroom.
- There‚Äôs no one around, no manager, nobody. So at one point people didn't have toilet paper, and no means to get toilet paper. There was no paper towel in the kitchen at some point and suddenly we were using toilet paper in the kitchen.
- Maintenance. Some beds are just springs, justs springs ad you an barely sleep well. The bath didn't have a door so whenever we take a shower the bathroom would get all wet.

locations.title: Siamese Thai Massage

showerReviews.reviewText:
My partner and I both have monthly deep tissue massages, due to the physical nature of our respective jobs, by a therapist who comes to our home.

During a recent visit to Sydney, we impulsively decided to have a more relaxing treatment but specifically wanted a Reflexology Foot Massage. Being joined by fellow travellers meant that the place we originally booked couldn't accommodate the four of us together so decided to go to Manly as planned and 'see how the day takes us'.

On our wonder around Manly we came across Siamese Thai Massage and went in to negotiate how the needs of four patrons travelling together could best be met.

Wanting two treatments each my partner and I went in first. We asked for an oil body massage and asked if the foot massage was a reflexology foot massage. They confirmed that it was so paid for both treatments.

We were shown to two adjoining rooms downstairs with an open sliding door to facilitate access between them. The rooms appeared well equipped and clean.

There was therapeutic value in the massage but left with some concerns.

Having not experienced a Reflexology Foot Massage before, I didn't know what to expect. I heard my partner asking questions during this treatment and the answers made it readily apparent that neither therapist even knew what Reflexology was let alone action an effective treatment. So we were cleared duped into paying for a treatment that wasn't as requested. We do not tolerate such deception from any kind of business.

My other concerns were with borderline or questionable inappropriate bodily contact.

Areas of the body were massaged that aren't usually massaged by our own therapist. So, after our treatments, we both compared notes. We both received 'therapy' on our 'gluteus maximus' so accepted that as valid. However, my partner didn't receive an over concentration of the top of the leg area. Only I received that 'treatment'. My top inner thigh was 'extensively' massaged. The therapist also did things like caressing my ear and face (not in a massage sense).

My partner also noted that the sliding door had been pushed shut during our session. We were, on occassion, conversing through the open door and we're clearly together so the there was no reason to shut the door for 'privacy' reasons, especially given that it remained open while we undressed in preparation for our treatments. I heard my partner ask to remove the towel from over her eyes. Mine remained in place so was oblivious to the door being shut.

I don't consider myself to be a naive person. I'm fully aware of the kind of things that go on in some massage venues, especially in the Sydney area.

So I've drawn two possible explanations to the questionable bodily contact as described above.

1. The therapist genuinely took a shine to me (unprofessional at best) or,

2. It was attempt to get me in a state of arousal so that 'other' services couldn't be offered.

Having never engaged the services of a sex worker or massage therapist who performs such duties, I couldn't comment on which were true but will say this, the 'professional' relationship between a therapist and client was breached (at best).

The number of stars given in this review is based on the therapeutic value of the treatments and the cleanliness of the premises based on what I witnessed viruses the deliberate deception regarding the Reflexology treatment (or lack thereof).

The text above are facts as I know them but acknowledge that my opinions and interpretations on what I experienced are based on some assumptions and the comparison between two people receiving the same treatment at the same time by two different therapists.

I make no accusations of any kind and I'll allow you to draw your own conclusions.

UPDATE: As requested, we visited at approximately 1330 on Monday 10 Nov 25. Two people initially.
showerReviews.author: Adrian Eades (Ady E)

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently attended a Jiu-Jitsu tournament at this sports center, and while the competition itself was well-organized with many skilled competitors, there were several disappointing aspects that marred the experience.

Firstly, there were no showers available for competitors  which is a basic facility for any sports event. Competing in such a physically demanding sport, athletes were left without a way to freshen up. This was uncomfortable for everyone, and it felt quite unhygienic, especially considering the large number of participants.

Additionally, charging fees for spectators to watch felt excessive. It‚Äôs understandable to have some entry fee, but the combination of lacking facilities and spectator charges made it feel like the focus was more on profit than providing a quality experience for athletes and fans.

With better facilities and a more thoughtful approach to fees, this could have been a great event. I hope the organizers take this feedback seriously for future tournaments.
showerReviews.author: Mark√©ta Hrube≈°ova

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Great Towel Debacle at the Gym

Introduction

So today at the gym, I got hit with a bit of a shock. They turned me away for not having a towel, even though I told the staff member it would take me 45 minutes to go grab one‚Ä¶ knowing full well they have them. I get it to a degree with members, but if you‚Äôre paying for a one off session‚Ä¶ c‚Äômon!!!!

The Towel Situation

Honestly, this might be the first high end gym I‚Äôve ever been to that doesn‚Äôt just hand out towels. I got told no, they wouldn‚Äôt lend me one because then they‚Äôd have to wash it. Like‚Ä¶ really?

And if it‚Äôs a hygiene thing, surely you‚Äôd rather have clean towels in your gym than let someone bring in one that maybe got sand on it at the beach yesterday. I‚Äôm all about setting rules, but chill out a little‚Ä¶ none step regulations!!!

Conclusion

Not to sound like a broken record lol, but man the towels really got to me. I‚Äôve been contemplating all day whether to be a Karen and write this review, and as you can see‚Ä¶ I thought it was a good idea.

For the price, just give out the towels.

Would I come back again I hear you ask? Yes I would (with a sandy towel), although after reading this I may be blacklisted lmao.

Other Stuff

Outside of, you know, what happened with the towels, had a pleasant to good time. Great equipment. Although I did then get told to put my shoes on, which I guess is fair.
showerReviews.author: Luke Sutcliffe

showerReviews.reviewText:
Couldn't use the gym as I didn't have a towel. Don't have one as I don't live here.

EDIT - the following is not part of my original review but a reply to the response from Surfit.

I was staying at The Surf House.
Yes I showered while I was here but using the hotel towel in the gym after I've showered seems more unhygienic than not using a towel.
Buying a new towel to use once didn't make sense economically.
Borrowing someone else's towel would also be unhygienic.
What I suggest would be keeping a supply of towels and handing them out to potential customers at no extra cost at the start of their workout then having a box/bin/bag etc to put them in at the end of the session for washing and repeat that process.

locations.title: Social Remedy
locations.address: ÓÉà23/1A Banksia Dr, Byron Bay NSW 2481

showerReviews.reviewText:
Byron & Brunswick Heads (B3)

I recently spent two weeks between Byron and Brunswick and wanted to share my experience, especially for anyone who loves training and recovery as I couldn‚Äôt decide where to train.

Pros:
‚Ä¢ Great value with the holiday pass and easy access to both B3 Brunswick and Byron.
‚Ä¢ Conditioning classes were relatively challenging with friendly, supportive teachers.
‚Ä¢ The caf√© smoothies are honestly next level ‚Äî highly recommend grabbing one post-session.
‚Ä¢ Fantastic recovery zone: spacious sauna, multiple ice baths, hot steam room, and very clean showers.
‚Ä¢ Social, welcoming vibe in the recovery area.

Cons:
‚Ä¢ Pricing feels off ‚Äî a 3-day holiday pass costs the same as a full week pass, which doesn‚Äôt make much sense.
‚Ä¢ Facilities in Byron are larger, but overall I found the Brunswick gym newer, better equipped, and a bit sharper in feel.
‚Ä¢ The booking system is outdated and clunky, which can be frustrating to use.

Overall:
If you‚Äôre in Byron or Brunswick and into both training and recovery, B3 is a great spot to check out. Brunswick edges out for me in terms of gym quality, but Byron has the bigger recovery facilities and a fun, social atmosphere.
showerReviews.author: Taylor Brown

locations.title: The Yard Gym Byron Bay
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Porter St, Byron Bay NSW 2481

showerReviews.reviewText:
Incredible gym - Incredible experience!

Summary:
Trainers - 5/5
Equipment - 5/5
Energy - 5/5
Workout Content - 5/5
Space - 4/5
Extras - 5/5

My sister and I visited this gym for it's Open Week on vacation and WOW, what a find! If we were locals, we would be here daily.

My body is sore, but in a very evenly spread, productive way. I know that I would grow muscle/fitness very quickly with The Yard's well rounded workout itineraries.

The equipment feels brand new, with zero wear and tear. While the space is smaller than most gyms, this is offset by a wealth of equipment and great utilisation. I observed the space stress tested earlier in the week and was impressed by how the team navigated it so that all participants had the same experience.

We were trained by Sam, Bianca, Katie and Courtney - They were all consistently professional, approachable, observant and encouraging. Although... I feel like Sam may push you to the limit a little more often üòÖ

Extra niceties include: Provided towels, stocked consumables, fruit, infused filtered water, plenty of nearby cafe choices, broad age range, great sound system and bonus exercises to always keep you moving.

Thanks so much for having us guys, we are stoked!
showerReviews.author: Harrison James

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had an amazing private boxing session at Gaya Centre Byron Bay‚Äîone of the best boxing gyms in town. David is an incredible coach, and the space features a full-size official boxing ring, plenty of heavy bags, and a top-tier cardio section that really pushes your limits.

The recovery facilities are next level, with access to a full infrared sauna and cold plunge‚Äîperfect for winding down after training. One thing I really appreciated was the private shower setup. It‚Äôs clean, spacious, and offers complete privacy, which is rare and really valuable.

I‚Äôll be trying out the yoga classes at Gaya Centre soon, and based on everything else I‚Äôve experienced, I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll be just as impressive.

Highly recommend Gaya Centre Byron Bay to anyone looking for high-quality boxing, fitness, yoga, and recovery all in one place.

locations.title: Arts Factory by Nomads
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Skinners Shoot Rd, Byron Bay NSW 2481

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here with our friends in a 10-bed dormitory for one night. The hostel is huge and well-decorated with various areas to relax, including hammocks, couches and lots of dining tables. The staff members were nice and the overall vibe was very chill.
The dorm had a tin roof and no sound-proofing. The beds were dusty and the pillows flat and badly stained. The lockers were also made of rusty metal with creaky hinges, so definitely bring eye masks and ear plugs if you want some quality sleep.
The kitchen was absolutely disgusting with dirty dishes everywhere, no dishwashing liquid and overflowing rubbish bins. On the bright side, the showers were pleasantly clean.
The parking lot is huge as well so parking was no an issue. As some others have mentioned, it can be a fair walk into town especially with the summer heat.
showerReviews.author: Jean Bean

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here with our friends in a 10-bed dormitory for one night. The hostel is huge and well-decorated with various areas to relax, including hammocks, couches and lots of dining tables. The staff members were nice and the overall vibe was very chill.
The dorm had a tin roof and no sound-proofing. The beds were dusty and the pillows flat and badly stained. The lockers were also made of rusty metal with creaky hinges, so definitely bring eye masks and ear plugs if you want some quality sleep.

showerReviews.author: Jean Bean

showerReviews.reviewText:
Let‚Äôs start with the good stuff:
The community is pretty incredible. People from every country, every walk of life could be found, and can come together to bond. It‚Äôs a very welcoming place where socializing is at the forefront.
Customer service from the staff was good, easy check-ins, check-outs, and I saw the manager interacting with a few guests and it was always very pleasant.
The amenities of having a pool and volleyball court, outdoor and indoor seating, decent WiFi, chargers in the social areas, and hammocks were a nice touch.
I‚Äôd come to hangout, but I wouldn‚Äôt spend money and stay the night here again‚Ä¶ Now for the not-so-great stuff.
Cleanliness 2/10 unfortunately very poor maintenance. It all feels broken down, abused, and grimy. I think there‚Äôs a general lack of respect because of how gross things are, that nobody bothers to be the Good Samaritan if everyone else is gross. This goes for the bathrooms, the kitchens, common areas for dining, the pool, and of course the dorm rooms themselves. It‚Äôs over-priced for how dirty you feel while staying here. I‚Äôd probably prefer to stay in my own pitched tent over the dorm rooms, in the dry season.
It is quite a ways away from town, around a 15-20 minute walk doesn‚Äôt seem like much but without shade, in direct sun and humid heat during the summer, it‚Äôs rough. Especially if you‚Äôre backpacking, plan to take an uber or taxi from the bus stop. I wish they offered a bus to/from town like the other hostels in the area do. Bring a bike AND A LOCK if you don‚Äôt have a car/ van for transport.
Randoms are fine, but it does feel a bit odd that anyone from anywhere can come and go, without having a room reserved. I bet many people take advantage of that, which probably adds to how unclean it feels. I didn‚Äôt have any bad interactions, but many people are using some form of *medication* so limit your expectations on community behavior.
The rooms do not have AC, and I found it to be pretty hard to sleep in with only a ceiling fan and a floor fan while it was so hot and humid at night. Again, the general lack of accountability leads to very dirty rooms.
If this place was cleaned from top to bottom, sterilized of grime and given some real TLC, it has the potential to be a much better space. Either more volunteers, more cleaning staff, or more strict security needs to come into play if the prices are to remain what they are.
I hope to come back and have a better experience, for now it just has memories of some good people ‚ù§Ô∏è
showerReviews.author: Rayven Libre-Veritas

showerReviews.reviewText:
Let‚Äôs start with the good stuff:
The community is pretty incredible. People from every country, every walk of life could be found, and can come together to bond. It‚Äôs a very welcoming place where socializing is at the forefront.
Customer service from the staff was good, easy check-ins, check-outs, and I saw the manager interacting with a few guests and it was always very pleasant.
The amenities of having a pool and volleyball court, outdoor and indoor seating, decent WiFi, chargers in the social areas, and hammocks were a nice touch.
I‚Äôd come to hangout, but I wouldn‚Äôt spend money and stay the night here again‚Ä¶ Now for the not-so-great stuff.
Cleanliness 2/10 unfortunately very poor maintenance. It all feels broken down, abused, and grimy. I think there‚Äôs a general lack of respect because of how gross things are, that nobody bothers to be the Good Samaritan if everyone else is gross. This goes for the bathrooms, the kitchens, common areas for dining, the pool, and of course the dorm rooms themselves. It‚Äôs over-priced for how dirty you feel while staying here. I‚Äôd probably prefer to stay in my own pitched tent over the dorm rooms, in the dry season.
It is quite a ways away from town, around a 15-20 minute walk doesn‚Äôt seem like much but without shade, in direct sun and humid heat during the summer, it‚Äôs rough. Especially if you‚Äôre backpacking, plan to take an uber or taxi from the bus stop. I wish they offered a bus to/from town like the other hostels in the area do. Bring a bike AND A LOCK if you don‚Äôt have a car/ van for transport.
Randoms are fine, but it does feel a bit odd that anyone from anywhere can come and go, without having a room reserved. I bet many people take advantage of that, which probably adds to how unclean it feels. I didn‚Äôt have any bad interactions, but many people are using some form of *medication* so limit your expectations on community behavior.
The rooms do not have AC, and I found it to be pretty hard to sleep in with only a ceiling fan and a floor fan while it was so hot and humid at night. Again, the general lack of accountability leads to very dirty rooms.
If this place was cleaned from top to bottom, sterilized of grime and given some real TLC, it has the potential to be a much better space. Either more volunteers, more cleaning staff, or more strict security needs to come into play if the prices are to remain what they are.
I hope to come back and have a better experience, for now it just has memories of some good people ‚ù§Ô∏è
showerReviews.author: Rayven Libre-Veritas
