showerReviews.reviewText: Glen Villa Resort  is always my preferred choice in Byron Bay accomodation.As a regular visitor to the resort for the past 15+ years , I have always been impressed with the way the management and staff look after their guests needs and also the way they care for  the villas, campgrounds and amenities.I love the the pool area too , its great to be able to have a swim when staying there.The Resort is central walking distance to the beach all the fabulous highlights of the main town.Also I am impressed  with appropriate  guidelines in place   ensuring its mostly a very quiet and relaxed stay for guests.A special mention goes to the current manager, Dice.He is so helpful and pleasant both on the phone and in person, making our frequent bookings easy and streamlined and my stays wonderful. .Thank You Dice and Thank you to all of the GVR team! See you at Christmas :) Karen

locations.title: Reflections Byron Bay - Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Lighthouse Rd, Byron Bay NSW 2481

showerReviews.reviewText:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS.‚Ä®We only stayed here because we had no choice after a long drive and desperately needed somewhere to rest. This place is nothing short of daylight robbery. Charging $128 for a single night on a powered RV site is absolutely outrageous.
You might expect immaculate facilities or top-tier amenities at that price - instead, you get filthy toilets and showers, overpriced laundry, and a constant garbage stench drifting through the campsite. It‚Äôs genuinely disgusting and completely unacceptable.
This campground is well below average in every possible way, and the only reason they get away with these prices is because of their proximity to Byron Bay. They clearly exploit travellers who have limited options. It‚Äôs greedy, predatory, and frankly infuriating.
Save yourself the money, the frustration, and the disgust - do not stay here.
showerReviews.author: Monika48197

showerReviews.reviewText: A very well-maintained and well-managed campground offering plenty of options for every type of traveler ‚Äì from powered and unpowered sites to comfortable rooms and tent spaces. The facilities are clean and tidy, with toilets and showers that are regularly serviced, though a few more would be great during busy times. The campground has lots of nice extras such as a pizza van, bike rentals, and even skate sessions for kids, which makes the atmosphere lively and fun. The location is perfect ‚Äì right by the beach, only about 10 minutes by bike to the city center, and a Woolworths just around the corner for all your supplies. The camp kitchen is spacious and well equipped, ideal for cooking together or meeting other travelers. Overall, a great place to stay with a relaxed vibe, friendly management, and everything you need for a comfortable beachside camping experience! Price was average but absolutely worth it.
showerReviews.author: Marco Seifert

showerReviews.reviewText:
Extremely disappointing experience at Suffolk Beachfront Holiday Park. The amenities were in terrible condition ‚Äî showers had visible mould, toilets were dirty, and the general hygiene throughout the facilities was unacceptable. Campsites were poorly maintained with uneven ground and overgrown areas, making setup difficult and uncomfortable.

What made it worse was the attitude of the staff ‚Äî they were unhelpful and seemed completely indifferent to guest concerns or the condition of the park. It‚Äôs clear that maintenance and customer service are not a priority here.

Would strongly recommend avoiding this park until major improvements are made. There are plenty of other options nearby that actually care about cleanliness and their guests‚Äô experience.

locations.title: Birdcage @ Byron Bay

showerReviews.reviewText: This was my first experience staying in a caravan. I rented the "Huey" caravan. I really wanted to enjoy the experience, but was a little turned off by the lack of respect of the caravan from previous tenants. The renovations were obviously done some time ago, and numerous occupants have not cared about the property. The mesh screens have seen better days as they were peeling off the windows. This increased my fear of bugs attacking me at night time and we had to buy bug spray. There were ants everywhere. I know the site owners can't help this, they did leave any bait in the cupboard for occupants to use. We cleaned them up, but by the next morning they had started to make their way back inside. The aluminum blinds are all damaged. Especially the one by the bed. It was hanging by a thread. The bed sheets had a little bit of debris near the bottom which I am hoping is just from the wall chipping off when the bed was made. There was only a large singular pillow, which makes sleeping with 2 people rather difficult to share. The bed was actually extremely comfortable, especially with the fan on during the night. We had a portable stove and water to our caravan which made cooking and cleaning up pleasant. However, I expected that there might be a communal kitchen on site, but there wasn't. The hose to the caravan was leaking a lot too. Might need a new washer. There were a few strings of fairy lights around the caravan, but all of them had flat batteries. The ladies toilet was tidy, but the men's was a mess. There was puke on the footpath in the morning. Again I understand that the camp ground is not responsible for other campers behavior, but keep this in mind when booking.
showerReviews.author: helen trethewey

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed here for two nights, the owner is very kind and felt very welcomed, great that there is aircon, tv and the linen was very clean, eco friendly, I love that outside our cabin we had fly screen to protect from mosquitoes, it was quiet and relaxing. However I think it was quite gross to not get fresh body wash for each new stay  as the option was to reuse a broken pump bottle of body wash and handwash that who knows how many other people have used, the dishes weren‚Äôt clean, and the scrubber to do the dishes was filthy, the kitchenette and bathroom was quite ‚Äúold‚Äù and needs a revamp, and for the duty of care for guests there shouldn‚Äôt have been mould on the shower curtain or in the vanity. There were cobwebs everywhere and the toilet was leaking. The communal kitchen and lounge area was great but again it needs a deep clean. You can be eco friendly and still hygienic. We enjoyed our stay but it was a bit pricy for the condition of it. Thank you for having us.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good place to stay while passing through. Relaxed campground. Pet friendly. Good price for location and in comparison to others around Byron (it was $30 for us in a van per night - in peak period). It‚Äôs about a 30minute walk from Byron and a 6minute drive. Nothing else close by, however there is a lovely little cafe a few minutes walk. Toilets were clean. Showers aren‚Äôt the nicest but that didn‚Äôt bother us. There is also a camp kitchen. Caretaker was lovely. There are permanents living there - but they were friendly and didn‚Äôt bother us. Nothing overally special but great place to stay if you‚Äôre wanting to check out Byron for a decent price.
Thank you!!

showerReviews.reviewText: Arrived recently from the East coast road trip and this was far the worst experience for my overnight stay with roof top tent.Its not typical campsite,its just rugby field with side set up for camping.I arrived late evening, didnt use their ‚Äúfacilities‚Äù that night and was planning to pay next morning when someone on site.Next morning older guy woke me up to collect money and I was expecting something around $15-$25 considering the quality of the place and ‚Äúfacilities ‚Äú but he charged me $50!! which was far most expensive stay during my road trip considering I stayed only myself in my roof top rent on unpowered site.He said its Xmas rate but I was there 11 JanuaryüòÖ shower facilities were in dirty,smelly and rusty rugby team changing room , which nobody really looking after at all.Kitchen in disgusting mess so I couldn‚Äôt use it as well.On top of that, after 8am morning, one of their staff member was working and using bulldozer (dozer) on dusty unsealed road right in front of tents and cars so everything was covered by dust within minute and I even couldn‚Äôt finish preparing my breakfast next to my car.So I quickly packed my stuff and left asap from this greedy place.I don‚Äôt recommend you to stay in this place,there are better and very friendly options for $10-20 along the way.They just think they are in Byron bay so they can charge you whatever they want.They don‚Äôt care about your comfort just get your $! Unfortunately Byron bay is nothing like 10-15 years ago,its overcrowded,overpriced and unfriendly so better to stay somewhere else, definitely not in this placeüëé I spoke with 2 campers on this site with same opinion who were unhappy as well and left after first night as well.
showerReviews.author: R Kedar

locations.title: Drifter Byron Bay
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Lateen Ln, Byron Bay NSW 2481

showerReviews.reviewText:
Drifter Byron Bay ‚Äì A Bougie Hostel That Feels Like a Boutique Hotel

Drifter is a very bougie ‚Äúhostel‚Äù; it honestly feels more like a boutique hotel. The rooms are beautifully designed, and the d√©cor throughout the social spaces gives off serious Hamptons energy. If you‚Äôre a little extra and want somewhere stylish and comfortable to stay in Byron, look no further.

Everything feels fresh, new, and well-organised. The bathrooms and showers are spotless and plentiful, and the beds even have curtains! That‚Äôs such a rare touch in Australian hostels, and it makes a world of difference for privacy and comfort.

My only small gripe would be that the floors in the rooms could use a quick sweep during the day with everyone coming in from the beach, a bit of sand tends to build up. It‚Äôs not a big deal, just something to watch out for so your bed doesn‚Äôt get sandy. I didn‚Äôt mention it to staff because they were already so lovely and helpful, and I didn‚Äôt want to be a bother.

The pool area is super chill, a perfect spot to unwind after a day exploring or doing activities before the Byron nightlife kicks off.
All in all, what a place. I highly recommend staying here if you want the perfect mix of comfort, style, and good vibes.
showerReviews.author: Ross Macphail

locations.title: Walgun Cape Byron State Conservation Area

showerReviews.reviewText:
At the top of the hill  are breathtaking 360d views of your surroundings. The walk along the coast was invigorating and fascinating with a wide variety of  interesting flora and fauna along the way. Quite a steep climb in some places but great exercise.  Loved the rugged beauty of the landscape and the calming views of the ocean. There is a cafe where you can take time to drink your coffee while soaking in  on the glorious views. Can get really busy and crowded though.

There is a free 30 minutes guided tour at the lighthouse. It was fantastic and informative. At the top of the lighthouse,  the views are just stunning and humbling. I did wish i can look at these beautiful  sights forever.  There is also a telescope for a closer look of the whales and dolphins which were swimming close by. Big crowd when we visited and it took  forever to find parking  so probably best to walk  up there if you're fit.  Just a few k from the town centre. üòä
showerReviews.author: Cynthia G

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful landscape with sweeping views of the Northern Rivers caldera, that play into a thousand views in different weather, light, and time of day. The surf can get a rolling sweep across the bay for a long ride or come in pretty scalloped waves perfect for beginners. A day on a long board or a sunset surf session will give you special photos and memories. A lookout provides great views and The Pass Cafe is open for breakfast in season. Full amenities here plus limited National Park parking - but a turning circle zone will help you drop off and pick up. Picture postcard Byron magic.
showerReviews.author: Terese Hayward

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the nicer rest spots however mobile reception is or was horrible. Using a Samsung note 9 the network service was woeful. Unfortunately I was broken down in sleepy hollow rest stop and was desperately trying to call NRMA and it was a rather stressful time.
I did notice that there was a drinking water tap for caravaners and traveler's to fill their drinking water supplies on the side of the Toilet shed.
Toilets were clean and I did see a council guy checking the amenities whilst I spent time there. Nice table n chairs for eating and resting although I noticed only 1 setting.
Sleepy hollow rest stop although a nice Lil spot, it is rather noisy if I could fault it in anyway.
Oh by the way.......
Look out for the headless horsemen. Lols

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently visited Osprey Spa at Elements of Byron for a 1-hour Signature Massage and a 1-hour Essential Facial, and I can honestly say that after many years of trying different spas, this was one of the best experiences I‚Äôve had.

My therapist, Selena, was outstanding. She was professional, attentive and created a calm, comfortable environment from start to finish. The warm towels, warm oil and subtle, refreshing aromas all added to a genuinely soothing and stress-relieving treatment.

I left feeling reset and completely refreshed.
I would highly recommend Osprey Spa ‚Äî and especially Selena ‚Äî to anyone looking for a high-quality, relaxing experience.

Thank you.

showerReviews.reviewText: Location absolutely zen, but that was it. Room was old, broken, unloved and no attention to anything. This included broken shower head, tiles missing, holes in wooden floors that were mould hidden by trip mat. They said daily service of room didn‚Äôt happen at all in 3 days, no breakfasts available all stay, provide your own toilet paper if you run out, zero hospitality, cold hot tub, dirty pool. Very disappointed but can‚Äôt complain about service as there was none! Wished we hadn‚Äôt booked this place the minute we walked in as it‚Äôs nothing other than the seclusion to offer.  Has a lot of potential if some love and money was spent and owners were present ever!

locations.address: ÓÉà50 Park Beach Rd, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText: Patient teachers, clean centre, my girls love going to swimming lessons here!
showerReviews.author: Skye Kohn

showerReviews.reviewText: Patient teachers, clean centre, my girls love going to swimming lessons here!
showerReviews.author: Skye Kohn

showerReviews.reviewText:
We came here to take a shower, but when we arrived, no one was at the counter. There are instructions on how to proceed if this happens tho, so we followed those and paid our entry fee to take a shower. To our surprise, you need to pay an additional 20c per 2 minutes, if you want to take a hot shower. We did not have any cash on us, so we basically paid 3$ each to take an ice cold shower, which we could have taken for free at a beach shower.
20c for 2 minutes of hot water isn't too much, but the lack of information is disappointing. And what's the point of paying 3$ for a shower if the water isn't even hot. What exactly am I paying for?
Overall the facilities itself also looked rather dirty.
showerReviews.author: marcoskatecoe

Big thumbs up!

showerReviews.reviewText: I went to the pool with my family earlier today, we have a two and a half year old and a three month old baby. When we had finished swimming, we all waited for about 20 minutes to use the change room (which was fine). Eventually, we all went in to have a rinse and get changed. We were in there for no more than seven minutes, when a member of the staff aggressively knocked on the door and told us we had been in there too long. We are a family of four, with two small children, who had only been in there for a short time after waiting so much longer. I was honestly disgusted. If the staff want to create an environment supportive of families, then they need to be as well. I won't be returning.
showerReviews.author: Caitlin

locations.title: The Big Banana Fun Park
locations.address: ÓÉà351 Pacific Hwy, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText: Stopped here for a break on our way back to Sydney. There's so much to do here for all ages, you could spend the whole day here! It's one giant fun park! The souvenir shop is packed with all sorts of goodies ranging from hats, soft toys, cups, pens, stickers, key rings, fridge magnets, t-shirts, stationary items, tea towels etc. Cafe has a good variety of hot and cold food, drinks, milkshakes, and snacks. Plenty of parking.

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you are visiting Coffs harbour and travelling with kids... this is where you want to be!

There is a plethora of fun activities and games especially for the kids here. Of course, if you are enthusiastic about banana trees/plantation etc then there's plenty here for adults too.

We stopped by here for a short visit during our road trip from QLD to Melbourne.

It was amazing to see the kids enjoying themselves especially in the gaming arcade area.

Souvenir shop, cafe and clean wash rooms are also available here along with plenty of free parking.
showerReviews.author: Malay Adhikari

locations.title: Metaqua Water Fitness Program
locations.address: ÓÉà26 Redwood St, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText: I spent 3 years as a very regular attender of these classes. Increasing care of my aging Mother has made it difficult to attend formal classes, but the beauty of the Metaqua system is that I can proceed with my practice when I  can with my trusty waterproof book of the exercises, my little board and flippers. I can do these exercises in open water or a swimming pool. The warmth, kindness and care that Sally brings to our training makes these water exercises available to everyone no matter your body shape or fitness. Depending on the day you can move slowly or get your heart rate pumping. Wonderful results, good muscle tone and inner peace are the rewards.
showerReviews.author: Julia Nolan

locations.title: Jetty Beach

showerReviews.reviewText: We caught Bus 365 from Wollies to Jetty Beach to kill some time whilst our car was being serviced.  Good choice.  This cute little beach is lovely and safe to swim in.  School kids were having surfing lessons and swimming from jetty to shore, there were elderly enjoying an easy swim, people speed walking, biking & rollerblading on the boardwalk.  There were cafes and restaurants nearby and a fantistic fresh seafood co-op beside the marina.  We enjoyed our little visit here and totally recommend it.
showerReviews.author: aussirose travels

showerReviews.reviewText:
WORTH THE STOP, WORTH THE SWIM, WORTH THE DAY! ü•∞

This beach is a must-visit if you‚Äôre looking for a calm, crystal-clear spot with gentle waves perfect for bodyboarding. The water temperature is surprisingly not as cold compared to other Aussie beaches and is very kid-friendly! Shower and toilet facilities are clean and well-maintained üíØ.

We spotted several adorable sea turtles from the jetty ‚Äì too cute! An early morning stroll along the harbour was magical, with stingrays and other fish clearly visible. Absolutely mesmerizing!

Nearby, you‚Äôll find several cafes and delicious takeaway fish & chips. Plus, there‚Äôs a Sunday Market right by the beach entrance.

Highly recommend this spot to all travelers! üôå
showerReviews.author: Lufi Rowley

showerReviews.reviewText: Best place to swim year round. Dolphins, sea turtles and a nearby walk on Muttonbird Island. But don't go there because if everyone shows up it will get crowded. If you do visit, please leave nothing but your footprints. Out of town visitors have been known to leave garbage behind on this otherwise pristine beach. Nearby showers on both ends of the beach, and good coffee and snack kiosks make it a great place to hang out.
showerReviews.author: James Donnelly

showerReviews.reviewText:
We sat at 1 of the 2 tables overlooking the ocean. There are 2 bench seats on a platform with toys for kids to play with. There are also 2 other benches to the side with no view. There is a kiosk- with their own tables n chairs, loos, showers, space to lay your picnic blanket and surf lifesavers.
We did see a whale, but it was too far for the camera to pick it up. The bush turkey was more persistent than the seagulls!

showerReviews.reviewText: We travel frequently for our work and have stayed in many different motels, hotels and resorts over the years and Pacific Palms Motel was a thorough surprise and delight to have had the pleasure of visiting. It genuinely exceeded our expectations by far, given the amazing ‚Äòvalue-for-money‚Äô nightly rates and availability, the friendliest and most efficient check-in I‚Äôve ever experienced, the cleanliness of the rooms and the seriously comfortable bed! I have to make a special mention of the absolutely glorious shower and beautifully refurbished rooms. This motel is a little gem that will very pleasantly surprise anyone who is fortunate enough to stay here! We will be making this our company‚Äôs go-to for accommodation in Coffs Harbour from now on and I look forward to returning! Thank you for making our stay so comfortable!  10/10 ‚≠êÔ∏è‚Äôs from us!!

locations.title: BIG4 Park Beach Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Ocean Parade, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recently stayed here on our way back down from qld,
Gorgeously kept park with a great cafe and plenty of entertainment for the kids, incredibly clean and manicured gardens and areas.
Pool and slides plus all other facilities are amazing.
Fabulous for kids and not over crowded.

Stayed in 2 different cabins and a powered site. Cabins were clean and great, large and reasonably priced, second cabin didn‚Äôt have a toaster or kettle and when we informed them before leaving were given credit for the next 12 months which is very nice.

Powered site had 2 concrete slabs that were well maintained and not overcrowded at all, amenities were good also.

Reception is busy and they don‚Äôt answer phones which sucks but will call back, had one incredibly lovely staff and one who was quite rude! Despite this I Would still  highly recommend this place and will happily come back.
showerReviews.author: Bekka B

showerReviews.reviewText: 4.5 stars. This is an excellent park. It is large, our site was a good size. It‚Äôs close to the beach, the pool is huge and the camp kitchen has an oven. The toilets are newly refurbished, but cheap partitions between the shower stalls rather than tiled walls. The partition between the changing are is too small, so the floor where you change is wet.the cleaning of the amenities seems to be just spray the floor with the hose, as the food is wet for most of the day, causing an unsafe slip hazard. The toilet paper gets wet, the sanitary bins are wet. Your pants get wet when you sit down to use the toilet. The floor needs to be mopped properly, not just sprayed with water. The shower pressure is poor, and the showers are not hot. This is the worst temperature in over 30 caravan parks. The pool has several different depths and a tipping bucket, but on a sunny 25 degree day, it was cold. Money needs to be spent on heating this pool.
showerReviews.author: Nancy Allan

locations.title: Reflections Coffs Harbour - Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉà123 Pacific Hwy, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText: Ok so the truth! Forget other reviews. It is 5/5 for caravans, vans, motorhomes and it is quiet with some shaded areas or open areas which are back from the highway, hence its quiet. The bad reviews are from people renting cabins right on the highway, so yes it's noisy if in a cabin on the highway, who knew lol. So don't get the cheapest cabins, get the ones back from the highway.for me it was great in a campervan for 4 nights, 3 toilets, 3 showers in amenities block and clean, lots of washing machines and dryers in laundry area and two big outdoor kitchens with gas hotplates or gas cooktop with 4 burners. Walk to centre of town, walk to botanic gardens in 10 minutes. Price is lots more than usual showgrounds at $54 night for powered site but it is the normal going rate in Coffs Harbour with other van parks. I had an excellent stay and will definitely go back again. 5 out of 5 stars.
showerReviews.author: Matthew M

showerReviews.reviewText:
Extremely disappointed with the state of our cabin.
We booked a short stay for a sporting tournament expecting clean, comfortable accommodation, but on arrival we found mould embedded in the blinds, mould in the shower, and the bunk area covered in dust and someones false eyelashes. The linen had dog hair all over it, which was very unhygienic and clearly not properly cleaned between guests.

I tried to address these issues by email email, but received a satisfactory response. For the price we paid, this was well below standard and a real health concern especially with the mould.
showerReviews.author: Amanda

Walking distance to some excellent eating places.
Staff very friendly and good amenities at the park.

showerReviews.reviewText: During our stay, there were two instances where our accommodations were threatened due to minor issues, which was concerning. The owner had a tendency to assert his authority and even lied to prevent my boyfriend from staying longer. To make matters worse, there were disturbances with domestic arguments and police involvement, making it difficult to get a restful night's sleep. We were falsely accused of being loud and obnoxious when it was actually the residents of the neighboring cabin who were causing disturbances. Lastly, I noted a security concern in the female bathroom. A hole in the mesh screen, which could pose a serious risk to safety and privacy. The layout of the men's bathroom was also problematic, as the shower area is located directly across from the reception office, again creating an uncomfortable feeling of being monitored while using the facilities. This design flaw negatively impacts the overall experience and undermines our expectations of privacy in a shared bathroom setting. The conditions of the bathroom were unsanitary, with stains on the doors and walls, which was disappointing given the price of the stay. Overall it was a very disappointing experience for the both of us.
showerReviews.author: Vermillion

Short trip to the bowls club for a Chinese meal. The main street of Sawtell was.only a minute down the road if you cashing cafes, the hotel or the RSL

You definitely book again

locations.title: BreakFree Aanuka Beach Resort
locations.address: ÓÉà11 Firman Dr, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed at Aanuka for 3 days in a cabin, spent $700 and for what you actually get I wasn‚Äôt overly impressed. No house keeping to give you fresh towels or restock toilet paper etc. I can‚Äôt imagine staying there for weeks. Had to pay for wifi (not included), beach towels and the parking lot is atrocious. If you are staying near main reception, you share the carpark with in and out visitors at all hours from events at Aanuka beach house and the other bar there. It‚Äôs tiny, narrow spots, worried about if someone is going to hit your car with the amount of tourists there. One night we had to park on the street in the rain, as a guest because it was full. Definitely overpriced and over rated online. It wasn‚Äôt all bad, we had a great time, however definitely spent way too much for what you get. Tried the breakfast buffet and that wasn‚Äôt included, $40 per person per day so went elsewhere. Our cabin had a glass roof in the bathroom that hadn‚Äôt been cleaned for a good while either. It was so busy and wasn‚Äôt even school holidays or Christmas time. I would avoid during the holiday period!! Cabin was also down the back right next to the road but we were told it was nice and quiet.
showerReviews.author: Naomi

showerReviews.reviewText:
People with young kids - don't stay here.

Rooms are not safe for toddlers - bedroom has a "fire door" that isn't lockable from the inside.

Similar to many other negative reviews - stepping into Aanuka is like stepping 20-30 years back in time.

Imagine an older home with a bad DIY reno job.

No servicing rooms (3 night stay), 1 roll of toilet paper, no bin bag replacements. One of our original towels had stains on it.

None of that bothers me enough to leave a bad review... however when asking for clean towels (at 8.30pm) - I was told there's a $2 charge per towel (not to own - to merely use!). Ours were soaked from the pool. They offered me washing powder to wash our wet towels... Had a choice of either drying my 2 year old with a wet towel that night - or spending $2. So here I am with a dry toddler, a bad review and without $2.
showerReviews.author: Shalm Harold

locations.address: ÓÉàCnr Pacific Hwy and, Bay Dr, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve stayed here maybe 20 times for work over many years. I don‚Äôt get an option of where to stay, hence I have had to come back over and over again.

Rooms are all miss matched - you never quite know what you‚Äôll get. Some are better than others, every room is different. All rooms with renovations are done on the cheap. The furniture in the one bedroom apartment I‚Äôm currently staying in is beyond belief in terms of the level of uncleanliness and need for update. All rooms are musty and stale smelling. Bathrooms amenities are cheap. Everything is in the room is cheap but the price tag to stay isn‚Äôt. Photos show a lot.

Heater smells like vomit once it‚Äôs turned it on.

Food is mediocre.

They are good at hosting conferences which is why we often stay here, and the service from staff is decent and friendly and professional when it comes to events.

Venue is far from town, nothing nearby, but some like the appeal of that and being close to beach. There is however much better accommodation available close to the beach.

Would not recommend to stay.
showerReviews.author: Shaida Jaber

showerReviews.reviewText: We are staying 2 nights here at the Pacific's Bay Resort and really happy with the room we chose. We on the 6th floor in the 1 bedroom apartment overlooking the Golf Course. Check in at the reception desk was easy and gave us a map of where to park and how to get to our room. Ok parking was an issue underneath as there was a conference on so many cars, but we did get a park underneath luckily, otherwise there is an outside car park further up and abit of a walk back down to the lifts. Our room is lovely and clean, with a lovely view over the the water and Golf Course. Huge balcony and is very spacious inside. The apartment has a spacious bedroom with ensuite thats seperate to the lounge, dining and kitchen. The bedroom has plenty of storage with built in wardrobes with glass sliding mirrored doors, also has a safe. There is also a large TV mounted on the wall, as well as 1 in the lounge room. Also has its own laundry with washing machine and dryer too which is handy for the longer stays. There is good Airconditioning in both rooms too. Has a King bed, which is so comfortable, we both had a fabulous night sleep and there was no noise from the highway at all. Kitchen is modern and has everything, has a stove with oven, microwave, has a normal size fridge, kettle, toaster, cups, saucers, plates, cutlery, wine glasses etc, just look and you will find. Love this apartment but our only gripe was for us seniors with bad knees and ankles was that the shower is in the bath tub, and its quite a big step over, we  didn't realise this when we booked. So for those of you who are not as agile anymore this could be a safety issue  getting in and out this bath  especially when your wet. Now it does have a large handle on the wall to hold on too which is very handy, so I suggest sit on the edge of the bath and swing your legs around. The resort itself has a couple of swimming pools by the looks and is only a short 5 to 7 minute drive into town. We have really loved this apartment and yes we would definitely stay here again but maybe for abit longer next time to explore more of this lovely Resort ( will bring our Golf Clubs next time too ) plus to explore more of the Coffs Harbour area and its surrounding regions like Sawtell, which is only a 15 minute drive up the road and what a lovely little town it is. Just loved our time here, would recommend to anyone
showerReviews.author: Lee Wieden

Check in at the reception desk was easy and gave us a map of where to park and how to get to our room. Ok parking was an issue underneath as there was a conference on so many cars, but we did get a park underneath luckily, otherwise there is an outside car park further up and abit of a walk back down to the lifts. Our room is lovely and clean, with a lovely view over the the water and Golf Course. Huge balcony and is very spacious inside. The apartment has a spacious bedroom with ensuite thats seperate to the lounge, dining and kitchen. The bedroom has plenty of storage with built in wardrobes with glass sliding mirrored doors, also has a safe. There is also a large TV mounted on the wall, as well as 1 in the lounge room. Also has its own laundry with washing machine and dryer too which is handy for the longer stays. There is good Airconditioning in both rooms too. Has a King bed, which is so comfortable, we both had a fabulous night sleep and there was no noise from the highway at all. Kitchen is modern and has everything, has a stove with oven, microwave, has a normal size fridge, kettle, toaster, cups, saucers, plates, cutlery, wine glasses etc, just look and you will find. Love this apartment but our only gripe was for us seniors with bad knees and ankles was that the shower is in the bath tub, and its quite a big step over, we  didn't realise this when we booked. So for those of you who are not as agile anymore this could be a safety issue  getting in and out this bath  especially when your wet. Now it does have a large handle on the wall to hold on too which is very handy, so I suggest sit on the edge of the bath and swing your legs around. The resort itself has a couple of swimming pools by the looks and is only a short 5 to 7 minute drive into town. We have really loved this apartment and yes we would definitely stay here again but maybe for abit longer next time to explore more of this lovely Resort ( will bring our Golf Clubs next time too ) plus to explore more of the Coffs Harbour area and its surrounding regions like Sawtell, which is only a 15 minute drive up the road and what a lovely little town it is. Just loved our time here, would recommend to anyone
showerReviews.author: Lee Wieden

showerReviews.reviewText: We went for a weekend family vacation. The name is deceptive. We arrived in the evening and reception was closed. We never received any information about how to collect keys. I had to call the number after arriving to get instructions. Apart from a public bbq and a pool nothing else is available. It should be an airbnb. Rooms didn‚Äôt have enough towels or tissues. All electronics are very old and A/c didn‚Äôt work to keep the room warm. Upon check out you have to remove used linens from all rooms to keep in the laundry nook which didn‚Äôt have enough space. I will not recommend. The only plus is all attractions are within 15min drive.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really professional and friendly receptionists. The place was immaculate and they let us check in early after a long drive from Sydney. Location awesome, right near the jetty and the pool was well taken care of. Will definitely be back.
Room was fantastic. Impeccably cleaned and with a large lounge room and quite spacious. I would have liked a washing machine and dishwasher, but they offered to do laundry and sometimes it‚Äôs nice to get your hands dirty and was up after yourself.
I would definitely return to this location and stay in the same place if I ever head back to Coffs!

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the second time I have stayed at the observatory and it definitely is home.
From the moment you arrive, it feels homey and the rooms are really big and comfortable, and just have a feel that you are home and not staying at a hotel or an airbnb or in an apartment. Simply put, it‚Äôs home, with great room amenities.

Special thank you to Vanessa and Amanda as they are both very friendly and super helpful. You both are very special and make the stay that little bit more special.

Location is great as it‚Äôs nearby some delicious restaurants and all the major attractions are a 10 minute drive in any direction.

It definitely is my go to and will continue to stay at the observatory every time I head up to Coffs, and my daughter is absolutely in love with this place too.

Thank you for all the memories Observatory and thank you Vanessa and Amanda.
See you again soon.

locations.title: Charlesworth Bay Beach Resort
locations.address: ÓÉà2 Resort Dr, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText:
When you‚Äôve been counting down the days to your holiday, the last thing you want is to end up in a nightmare hotel. I spent so long carefully choosing a place‚Ä¶ but unfortunately, I still picked the worst hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in ‚Äî by far.

The room condition and facilities were honestly worse than a roadside motel. Please, please read this if you‚Äôre looking for accommodation in Coffs Harbour ‚Äî you MUST avoid this hotel. It was terrible.

What I experienced:
‚Ä¢	Front desk staff (female receptionist) had a completely dismissive and impatient attitude ‚Äî asking anything felt like a bother.
‚Ä¢	As soon as I entered the room, a strong musty, mouldy smell hit me. There was even a large used tissue with blood sitting visibly on the floor near the bed.
‚Ä¢	The facilities are extremely old, run-down and dirty.
‚Ä¢	No room card ‚Äî just a basic key and a very insecure lock.
‚Ä¢	The shower products were tiny sample bottles with extremely poor quality.
‚Ä¢	Bathroom towels had clear old blood stains (two of them!).
‚Ä¢	The hair dryer was so greasy and filthy that the smell alone made me feel sick.

If you‚Äôre planning to visit Coffs Harbour ‚Äî trust me ‚Äî do NOT book this hotel.
I‚Äôve travelled a lot, and this is truly the dirtiest, oldest, most disappointing accommodation I‚Äôve ever stayed in.
showerReviews.author: Milla Li

showerReviews.reviewText:
We are staying here for almost 2 weeks.
Rooms serviced once a week, bit poor for a resort.
Golf course not well maintained.
Water ways dirty water.
Footpaths are good, rooms are good but a bit small and not enough power points.
Not alot to do... we like the beach which we could access no towels or umbrellas or lifesaver there tho.
Tennis court, kids area,basketball available at an extra cost.
On site bar and grill ... watch the fish and lizards whilst eating, good food reasonable prices, busy on fri and sat night. Does breakfast but at $28 per person it's a bit extravagant each day. They make a great coffee tho

showerReviews.reviewText: The environment of the resort it‚Äôs beautiful, it‚Äôs immersed in nature and there is a beautiful beach just at 5 minutes walk, but honestly all this is not worth it. The room smelled like mould and there was mould in the corners of the bathrooms, no room cleaning service, on the blankets of the bed there were some spots that looked like old blood, no room phone to call and ask for new sheets etc‚Ä¶ in the fridge of the room there was just a tiny milk that had expired  3 months ago, fortunately I checked the date, in the shower there are holes in the pavement and the smoke detectors have been wrapped in latex gloves??? (Previous stayer / resort itself?) but it doesn‚Äôt matter, as the rooms should be inspected before and after. I don‚Äôt understand why?? Inside the microwave there are brown spots probably of old food or drinks idk it‚Äôs gross. The tv has no remote and when we asked for one they couldn‚Äôt provide to give us a damn remote. The food at the restaurant it‚Äôs ok, not a lot of choice honestly they could put a bit more effort but I have to say that it‚Äôs really pretty the inside with a beautiful view, the waitresses are kind. Overall honestly I don‚Äôt think I would come back tho‚Ä¶ and it‚Äôs a shame because the outside it‚Äôs stunning!
showerReviews.author: Tabata

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed in the older section, Bayswater 2 as we wanted something less expensive and just for a night.

Upon check-in the staff made it clear its an older part of the hotel, not so flash. I laughed when I saw the room, yes it was older and had imperfections but it was fine. The room was clean, comfortable furnishings, and a lovely verandah overlooking a little rainforest area. We still had access to all the amenities and beach. I can only imagine the complaints they get to have to warn people before going to the room.

We went to eat at the shared restaurant.  Food was nice. Although the night we went there was an issue with staffing so they made it pizza night. There were a couple of other options for those that don't eat pizza. Perfectly fine. The bar served all the usual stuff.

We had a lovely relaxing stay. If I wasn't so keen to get home we would've extended our stay.
showerReviews.author: Vickie ROBINSON

showerReviews.reviewText: My best friend and I checked in for a couple of days to celebrate my birthday, and as I'm in a wheelchair we arranged for an accessible room. In terms of accessability the room was a bit small for a wheelchair, having said that it was conveniently located near the elevators. They did arrange a shower chair for me, there were grab rails located all around the bathroom. The reason for the poor review is around the lack of house keeping, we went out for the day and when we returned the room had not been made up. When we enquired about it we were told, we don't have house keeping for stays under 15 days, they'll come and change the sheets in 8 days. Very dissapointing service for a "Resort", there are no phones in thr room and mobile service is patchy to say the best.
showerReviews.author: Deb Manning

showerReviews.reviewText:
üëë A Sanctuary of Style, Service, and Surprise Dragonflies: Read This Before You Book!

WARNING: Don't miss out by skipping your homework! We arrived with open minds after seeing mixed reviews, and we are so glad we did! If you take a moment to read the resort's clear descriptions (especially regarding room types and the natural setting), you are truly in for a magnificent treat. We found that managing expectations is key, and if you do encounter a minor hiccup, the staff are solution-oriented and incredibly responsive‚Äîjust speak up nicely!

üè° The Apartment & The Unplugged Vibe (5/5)

Our apartment was absolute bliss and a beautiful sanctuary! It was stylishly decorated and fully equipped with everything needed. Though there were two lovely large TVs, we happily neglected them in favor of the view‚Äîthis is definitely the place to unplug and enjoy the peace.

Thoughtful Service: They perfectly accommodated our request for a room near the elevator due to health needs. When we realized our initial room lacked the requested spa bath, the team was incredible, moving us to the perfect new room on the same floor in less than five minutes!

Modern Communication: There are no room phones, which we loved for the disconnect, but the SMS system is secure, modern, and efficient for check-in and quick queries.

ü¶Å Wildlife & Immaculate Grounds

Welcome to your real-life nature documentary! The grounds are beautifully kept and brimming with charming wildlife:

Local Residents: The water dragons are curious but respectful neighbors (truly, they are more scared of you!). We enjoyed watching the cheeky seagulls and the massive, beautiful koi in the pond.

Nature Drama: We heard the hilarious (if slightly tragic) tale that the koi population shrank recently thanks to a local pelican who decided on an impromptu sushi diet‚Äînature at its boldest!

üçΩÔ∏è The Dining Experience: A Tale of Two Chefs üçï

The restaurant setting is undeniably gorgeous, boasting fantastic views just a short walk away. However, we found the dining experience to be a bit of a rollercoaster:

The Highs: Our first breakfast was superb‚Äîfresh fruit, fluffy pancakes, and perfectly cooked eggs.

The Lows: Later in the week, it felt like a completely different kitchen team. The breakfast quality dipped significantly (rubbery eggs and "vintage" fruit). We survived happily on the tasty, if slightly smaller, pikelets from the pancake machine!

The "Pizza Surprise": This was our only true letdown. We were dressed up for a special mother-daughter Friday night, expecting the full menu as advertised. Instead, we were told upon arrival that it was strictly Pizza Only. This communication hiccup meant we had to scramble to find a fine-dining alternative late on a Friday evening.

üèä‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è The Pool Circuit & Fun-ctionality!

Three Pools, One Favourite: We loved having a "Pool Circuit" to explore. Our favourite was the Golf Kiosk Pool‚Äîa large, peaceful social hub complete with a bar/kiosk.

The Staff's Secret Superpower: The team doubled as a rescue service! My daughter had a magical experience with saving a dragonfly and earlier, saved over thirty tiny lady beetles near the Hillside Pool (great for lap swimming!). We also loved hearing about the staff saving a baby bird.

üéæ Active Fun & Pampering

Sports & Games: The resort offers an excellent golf course, ample tennis/basketball courts, and a Games Deck with a pool table for some competitive fun.

Wellness: Skip the standard gym (onsite) and embrace the scenic running paths that wind along the beachfront. Best of all, the on-site, separately-owned Day Spa is a slice of heaven‚Äîwe fell asleep during our hot stone massages!

Final Word: If you are seeking a sterile city hotel, look elsewhere. But if you desire a truly relaxing, nature-immersed getaway with a team that goes above and beyond (and maybe a little animal rescue on the side!), then book here! We'll certainly be back when we can steal some time away again!
showerReviews.author: Amanda

showerReviews.reviewText:
Samoa Tag's M20 team had a great stay at Zebra Hotel. The very friendly and professional hosts provided clear, helpful communication throughout our stay, making everything easy for our team.

The facilities were super clean, and the location was perfect‚Äîclose to the Coffs Harbour shopping precinct, the local gym, and the local Catholic parish for those of the Catholic faith. Rooms included a microwave, regular linen changes, there is a washing machine and dryer on site.  Zebra Motel offered a safe, comfortable environment for our players.

We couldn‚Äôt have asked for better hospitality‚Äîhighly recommended for visiting sports teams!

‚Äî Team Samoa Tag's M20 team

locations.title: Coffs Harbour Camping & Farmstay

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately, this was the worst camping experience my family and I have ever had even though we only stayed one night.
I should have lessened to the other reviewers and not booked here.

The host was extremely unfriendly and confrontational from the start. More concerning was the lack of basic hygiene facilities. The toilet hand-washing water had been deliberately blocked, and when we asked why there was no water, the host told us it was because refilling the tank was ‚Äúhard work‚Äù and instead instructed us to walk around 150 metres to wash our hands after using the toilet. This affected many campers, not just us.

Providing functioning toilets with water for handwashing is a basic responsibility, especially when guests have paid in full. Blaming campers for issues caused by poor maintenance is unfair and unacceptable. Sealed the water pump with cover so it shouldn‚Äôt create work for them to refill the water

On top of this, the host was disrespectful toward my family, and comments were made that felt discriminatory and deeply offensive. This completely ruined what was meant to be the start of our holiday.

We also later faced false accusations about damage and guest numbers, despite having paid correctly for everyone on our booking.

I would strongly caution families, particularly those from diverse backgrounds, before booking here. A campground should feel welcoming and safe unfortunately, this one did not.
showerReviews.author: Jeff Ibr

showerReviews.reviewText:
Didn‚Äôt have a great stay here unfortunately.

There appears to be some un-eligible bachelor bro types that live here. A couple of them stayed up till just before midnight talking and laughing which made getting to sleep difficult. Then another said bro was up at 4am for work. When he left his dog started yapping for at least 15 after. There goes any chance you might have of getting a good nights rest.

When I was setting up my tent yesterday, another bro decided to fly past on his dirt bike and gun the throttle right where I was. Why? Nonsense like this totally detracts from the camp experience.

Further, the owner sends you a lengthy sms with all the rules when you book. One such rule is noise after 10pm. Cool story I guess. If he can‚Äôt enforce the rules with the long stayers, what‚Äôs the point exactly?

Apart from the above, the shower was decent. However the kitchen was a mess and the fridge! Jesus, don‚Äôt look in there. Looked to be rotten fruit and veg in the chiller section.

Hope this helps anybody thinking about staying here! Cheers
showerReviews.author: Bill Palmer

Great camp ground, $10 p/p a night. Only staying 1 night but ended up staying 4nights. Close to Coffs Harbour (15min) Coramba Hotel 5 minutes up the road, good food and swimming across the road. Camp kitchen offered great facilities, toilet, oven fridge, microwave, kettle, toaster, hot water to wash dishes. Quite clean and tidy. Will definitely be back again. Be respectful and clean up after yourself so this affordable camping area continuesüëç
PS, this was an old quarry area and extremely difficult to put tent pegs in the groundüôà

Bellinger River Tourist Park is an absolute gem! The location is stunning, offering beautiful river views and a serene environment that‚Äôs perfect for relaxing. The evenings were especially pleasant, with a calm and peaceful vibe that made our stay so enjoyable.

The amenities were spotlessly clean and very well-maintained, which added to the overall comfort of our visit. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of care goes into keeping this family-run campsite in excellent condition.

We highly recommend this beautiful spot for anyone looking for a relaxing and well-kept place to stay. It‚Äôs perfect for families and anyone who appreciates a peaceful, welcoming atmosphere.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a good location, right on the banks of the Bellinger river. It was quiet and relaxing and their amenities are excellent.
The thing that would make it great would be if it were closer to town. It's eleven (11) kms from Bellingen township, but dont let that deter you as you have most likely travelled hundred of km to get there anyway and it seems to take no time at all to get to anywhere you want from that location.
But most of all, as the say in the Castle " Enjoy the serenity " we did and we probably will again, in the not too distant future.
Take care on the roads, safe travels and do yourself and Bellinger river tourist  park a favour  by making it a plase to stay when your in that great part of NSW, you won't regret it.

locations.title: Reflections Boambee - Reserve

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a very nice area for a full day with picnic, kayaking, paddle boarding and a safe swim for kids. Dogs allowed on leash, but if you cross over the bridge you can leave them off leash and in the water.
There is a kiosk open until 4pm, for your basics. There is also a table tennis set and a playground, BBQ, showers and very clean toilets.
From there you can take the coastal walk for very gorgeous views.
We visited on a partly cloudy day and it wasn‚Äôt crowded at all. I guess it could get much busier in warmer weather.

Would not recommend.
Ive had better options in much cheaper motels.
Not a cycle friendly option at all, Upon arrival i was asked are you on a Bicycle, stated the obvious - YES.  Madam at reception said i will give you a chain and lock to lock your bike, I discussed its a very expensive bike and I wouldn't be leaving it outside. Madam stated that we have just had the carpets replaced, "is the bike clean" I responded yes, although i will wipe it over to ensure it is.
Upon entering the room, the stains and burn hole in the carpet would suggest the carpet was replaced 20 years ago.
Then to top it off, there was NO hot water in the shower.
Not worth the amount charged.
Definitely wont be back and I will tell everyone I know about the poor experience had.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed in cabin 4 for the night on our way to Queensland.
Great self contained cabin.
The room was perfect for what we paid.
Extremely clean, had all amenities and accomodating. Coffee tea and even some
Biscuits there for us (thank you). The beds were extremely comfortable. The place looked like a wonderful kid friendly spot, shame we couldn‚Äôt stay longer but would definitely stay again.
Bathroom was spotless.
Service was wonderful with them allowing us to check in late and upgrade last minute to a cabin to ensure we could park the truck near where we slept.
5 stars! Highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: G B

locations.title: Woopi Backpackers

showerReviews.reviewText:
The worst hostel I have ever been to, I cannot understand how they got so many good reviews.
- The rooms and hallways smells like damp & sweat.
- We found the blood and cockroaches in the showers.
- the sleeping room had no AC and no air circulation making it unbearable to sleep.
- Dirty linens and super dusty in the pods.

Me & my partner had booked for 4 nights but only managed to stay one. Would not recommend staying here.
showerReviews.author: Eric Brun

showerReviews.reviewText:
First hostel I am truly sad to be leaving. Only there for a few days but the vibe is amazing and definitely will be coming back for longer some time! The rooms have private cubicles unlike many hostels I've stayed in, which means staying here long term feels so much more doable than most. The rooms are pretty warm -- I don't know how comfortable it would be in the summer -- but the bathrooms are clean, the kitchen is spacious, and huge common areas.
Mostly the people are just amazing, super welcoming if you are social & say hi.
&& book direct! Cheaper that way and the owner & staff are great.
showerReviews.author: Helen Ross

locations.title: Base Backpackers
locations.address: ÓÉà84 Ocean Parade, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you have any other option, take it somewhere else. Not worthed if not for 1 night only if you need party at Hoey Moey.
Been treated as stupid to ask for basic and try to be honest and not to demanding, but you need to be tough, otherwise your experience gonna be worst then mine.
You possibly gonna be assigned in a room so messy and so dirty, but your will pass in front of many empty ones, if room as not be occupied, as every motel hostel or other, same category, you can be allocated there, it is so simple (over a decade of working in it, and been told was the first backpacker that has something to said, very rude).
Don‚Äôt know if Frank that unfortunately was working when I arrive is the manager or else, but for my opinion and the other guest we encounter in him, been the worst receptionist in all the travelling.
Also, the only bathroom is in the room, that could be nice if you are the only person, but if you share the room, can be a trouble, as if need to take a shower and other need to use the toilet, you could be waiting hours, and the noise and smell just go true the room.
Open place, so anyone at anytime can enter the premises, and if your door is unlocked, or someone forget to close well, good luck.
showerReviews.author: Marco

showerReviews.reviewText: Friendly helpful staff. Fun activities to join if you like. Some plumbing issues in the kitchen & ladies showers but the staff seemed to be on top of it. Tea, coffee & sugar provided but sadly/oddly, not milk. I stayed in one of the two private rooms which was comfortable and had the added bonus of a TV. Other guests were friendly & respectful and surprisingly & blessedly quiet after midnight Friday & Saturday. I felt safe and comfortable. Would highly recommend and will stay again.
showerReviews.author: Julie Fry

locations.title: ibis budget Coffs Harbour
locations.address: ÓÉà1A Mclean Street Corner, Pacific Hwy, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely dark skinned lady @ check in is 5 star for service, enthusiasm and personality. Light skinned Lady @ check out is lovely too, but seemed a little stressed. The rooms were very bare. Clean sheets, comfy bed. Air conditioning and TV (we didn‚Äôt use them).
Peaceful night sleep.

Would never recommend the breakfast as we are so used to the other breakfasts, but some children would be fine with it as how the pancakes come out would be a novelty to them. Ok with the muesli and Greek yoghurt. Partner refused to touch the brekkie even though we paid for it.

The bathrooms were cleaned, but the ever present issue of ventilation and maybe MOULD might be Sth the management will HAVE to look into‚Ä¶ probably our first and last stay or stay of last resort‚Ä¶  wouldn‚Äôt stay for the rooms, would happily return if that were improved because the staff were nice. If you are used to YHA, this is a step up.. sort of‚Ä¶ only detergent for hair available. 1 teaspoon, two cups and two glasses. One hanger. No soap nor tissues. Plenty of toilet paper. Two towels and one bathmat. This is very budget. We are fine with that as we bring our own toiletries. :)
showerReviews.author: Y Ling

showerReviews.reviewText:
I booked this motel for 2 nights and had a very bad experience. The bed was just a mattress with no proper support, and it kept slipping all night, so I could not sleep properly. The room did not have a fridge, which was very inconvenient.

The washroom was poorly maintained and not clean. Overall, the room quality was very low for the price they charge. This motel is very expensive for what it offers, and it did not meet basic comfort standards. I would not recommend staying here.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately, I wouldn‚Äôt stay here again. I was woken several times around 2 a.m. by police knocking on a neighbouring door, which made the stay feel quite unsafe. Our room wasn‚Äôt properly cleaned  there was hair in the bathroom and shower before we had even used them, and bugs were crawling around the bathroom. A lot of mould in the bathroom. The room itself felt very outdated.
Loose screw on the bunk bed which is worrying!
There‚Äôs no lift access, which makes carrying luggage up the stairs inconvenient. The bed was extremely uncomfortable as well.

Breakfast was average. The Greek yogurt was out of date, and the pancakes had an odd taste with no date indicating when the bag was opened  a clear food safety concern.

The only positive was the location. Other than that, the experience was disappointing.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hotel is situated just off the main road, which is super convenient for walking to bars/ restaurants and shops in the town.
Apart from this, that‚Äôs where the good ends. The rooms are very very basic, even for an Ibis Budget.
Two very thin pillows and couldn‚Äôt get anymore. Bed is comfortable at least.
TV is functional, but I‚Äôd say only for the news in the morning, you wouldn‚Äôt want to watch anything on it.
Plug sockets are in one place only and not near the bed. You do not get a hair dryer, nor will they give you one.
Shower is okay, pressure fine but very basic. Ours didn‚Äôt even have the all in one shower gel as it was empty.
Room was clean, but who knows when it was cleaned judging by the lack of soap.
Breakfast was cold and basic, but functional id you just need calories before hitting the road.

If you‚Äôre looking for a place to put your head down for the night and nothing more than this and have zero expectation, then this hotel is fine, especially for the ¬£60/$120AUD we paid.

Otherwise I‚Äôd avoid and go somewhere else in the town. The pub next door does decent food, looked nice and had rooms.
showerReviews.author: Dominic Buswell

This skate park has an amazing skating facility open to the public. It has public toilets, handwash station, a filter water bubbler, and has a covered bench area and has rubbish bins some other facilities for the kids to play in the play area; has a barbecue place. And a very nice lush green garden with lots of trees and beautification maintained very well.

Also has parking spaces for the cars open to the public. Next to the roadside opposite Genesis fitness centre.
showerReviews.author: Divesh

locations.title: City Cave Coffs Harbour
locations.address: ÓÉàShop 61B/253 Pacific Hwy, Coffs Harbour NSW 2450

showerReviews.reviewText: My wife & I had a couples infra red sauna, float & massage package & everything about it was amazing from start to finish. The guy who welcomed us & booked us in (forgot to get his name unfortunately) was friendly, polite & helpful. He explained everything & put us at ease. The sauna was great with bluetooth for our music & the different light colours therapy was awesome. The shower was good too. The float tank was awesome & having the darkness option was a good, surprising extra  It was a very nice touch having the relaxing tea breaks in between sessions. My wife loved the creams & lotions & especially the hair-dryer. Even having deodorant for afterwards was great. Finally the couples massage was amazing,  both our masseuses Hakan & Megan were incredible & we left feeling pain free & completely relaxed.
showerReviews.author: Ross Finn

locations.title: Figtree Dayspa

showerReviews.reviewText: Knowledgeable, professional, kind and considerate. Warm towels on massage table were magic. I felt safe and cosy. Only essential talk was made throughout my treatment, which allowed me to relax and enjoy being pampered. Music was excellent, temperature of the room was perfect. Dimming the lights towards the end of my appointment (lash lift and tint) was a nice touch. So I didn't open my eyes to bright lighting. Very thoughtful. Completely happy with lashes and colour of brows too. Helpful tips at the end for longevity of colour and a delicious chai tea to finish. Perfectly chilled, thank you
showerReviews.author: Zoe Angel
